comment: I always go there with my husband for special occasions and its the best Indian food they have and i love everything about this restaurant from staff to service and free parking, its all great. i would recommend this restaurant which is in the hotel to all the couples and family also. 100/100 ! the best thing is we can have drinks by the pool before we eat dinner.

title: Good choice for dining near Heathrow
comment: This is a nice indian restaurant close to many hotels just outside the airport. It has simple but elegant settings, great service and good Indian food. The menu contains the usual fare but everything we has was well prepared and presented. Decent wine list.

title: Madhu's - Restaurant Review (Not Hotel)
comment: This review is for the Madhu's restaurant only and not for the hotel. I did not stay at the hotel, but had dinner at Madhu's The restaurant is fairly spacious and a good setting for a business meeting or a leisure dinner with friends or family. The staff could definitely be more attentive. Since I was there on a Saturday night, it was quite full (as expected). The staff seemed to be walking around a lot, but without paying attention to the patrons. We needed a second round of drinks and starters, but to catch somebody's eye was a real task. Finally I had to get up and ask one of the waiters to stop by our table. Food was okay. There is another place called Anayu in the Raddison Blu a few paces down the road. In my opinion, Anayu dishes taste much better.

title: Lunch time snack
comment: As we were in the area we popped in for a lunch time snack. We were warmly welcomed on entering and the place seemed fresh, clean and inviting. Staff were excellent, thank you.  Food was extremely good. Fresh and tasty with a wide varied choice of food, hot and cold.  I wish was closer to me as I’m not from the area but would definitely go again.

title: Best breakfast
comment: I want to rendezvous coffee in Beckinham for lunch The food It was excellent I was heaven Masha avocado poached egg on sourdough bread . Lovely staff very friendly definitely I come back

title: Great staff
comment: I had lunch here with my 4 year old daughter. The staff was really helpful and really friendly staff. It was nice to see that they had baby changing facilities in the toilets which were clean. The food was amazing I had the sweet american pancakes and fresh juice and I would defo go back again. The best Cafe I have been to

title: Very nice food
comment: I went with my mate zak on thuresday to rendez vous cafe for lunch, it was a nice experience , we had a good Welcome from the stuff, when we entered ,for the food i had scumpy and chips for myself and berger and chips for zak, the service was Fast and the food was fantastic', Its really nice brasserie and i am sure we will comeback again , and i do recommend it to anyone likes testy food And good compliment to the chef as well Well! Done.

title: My little escape to India
comment: Take a mouthful of saag paneer and close your eyes. The trip to India starts right away . It’s full of flavors, generous and perfectly cooked. The trip is even more pleasant and memorable thanks to the kindness of Punam who comments on the meals that are being served and shares her knowledge of the Indian cuisine. Her service was excellent. She was present without being overwhelming. Coming just at the right time and suggesting generously what could go best with my order. Namaste. The restaurant is a place I like to go every so often as I always feel acknowledged and respected.  It’s worth paying a bit more that any other restaurants around Heathrow.

title: Lovely food but poor service
comment: The food menu is varied, lovely and delicious. We had a good mix of chicken and lamb dishes. Service is slow and we were ignored a few times. It also took a long time to get the bill. What annoyed me the most was that we had a lot of food left over and they would not let us pack it and take it home. I absolutely hate food wastage but felt that the guys were too arrogant about this.  So where did it go? Did you just throw it away? I hope you made good use of it but would be good to know.

title: greati indian food
comment: great, lovely and delicious food and great service by waitress Punam :) I am looking forward for coming back

title: Work Dinner
comment: We visited the restaurant for a work dinner, there was a group of 6 of us.  the food was lovely, menu explains well what you are ordering and the staff could not have waited on us anymore if we asked them too. They are very friendly.  We had 2 course each and a couple of bottles of wine on the table and the bill came to £350.00, very reasonable for the amount of food we had.  Would definitely recommend and return!

title: “Always a pleasure to visit”
comment: This little gem of a place is now under new management. I used to go to the owners previous cafe in SE London and was so pleased when I found out he was taking over in Beckenam where I live. The menu is varied accommodating a variety of tastes and food is always fresh, well cooked and presented - not to mention very tasty! The table service is extremely polite and friendly and atmosphere relaxed - a place where you can gather your thoughts over a fantastic cup of coffee. I would highly recommend a visit to this cafe to experience the delights it has to offer.

title: Wonderful brunch and great service
comment: I have been going to this little cafe for years. The owner is a wonderfully friendly chap who does everything to ensure his customers are happy with their food. A great place to catch a filling brunch on a lazy weekend morning.

title: Lovely staff and excellent food 👌🏼 Will definitely be going back.
comment: We had the best Omlete chips and salad there with a gorgeous fresh Carrot, Apple & orange Juice

title: Brilliant
comment: Great service, lovely coffee and good food offering too. And freshly squeezed orange juice, brilliant.

title: This lovely friendly cafe never disappointments me...
comment: This time I had their delicious pot of fresh fruit & yoghurt Granola... will definitely be having it again

title: Best Coffee for miles
comment: Great coffee, great service and great price! If you are looking for a friendly cafe with great service then this is the cafe for you.

title: Exceptional food and staff
comment: This establishment is immaculately clean, an excellent variety off food and drinks on the menu..  The food is definitely high quality and I would recommend this cafe for an exceptional breakfast, lunch or late tea. The staff are polite helpful and always have a smile. This is the best cafe in Beckenham that I have been in.

title: Excellent Flat White
comment: During my first visit I asked for a flat white and I was pleased to see that the actual size of the drink was what the original recipe says: 6fl oz. I have been to other cafes in the area and unfortunately I have been served huge drinks that that were mistakenly sold as flat white! I also would like to stress the freshness of the food ingredients that make Rendez Vous the place to try if you want to have a pleasant experience for your palate. Nice indipendent cafe worth a visit.

title: Excellent Sunday brunch
comment: Visited this place late morning on Sunday. Great location and cosy atmosphere. Very busy with various types of families, couples and singles. Great menu selection and everywhere was very clean and tidy. Service was very good and friendly. Food came quickly, fresh and piping hot. Cannot fault the food. Eggs Royale was gorgeous and will return for sure!!! Excellent place overall.

title: Best place for breakfast in beckenham.
comment: Came here for breakfast with friends. It was such a friendly atmosphere and the staff were lovely. Really comfortable place to come for breakfast or lunch or just a coffee and a chat with the staff. I took the avocado with eggs on toast and it was cooked perfectly by the chef! Really relaxed place with updated decor.

title: Just lovely
comment: Great food, fresh and tasty. Service was one of the best we've had from a Heathrow airport hotel restaurant. Great job. Was fairly spicy, but full of flavour. Franco gave great table service. We'll done Madhu's!

title: Great food, great staff - what more do you need?
comment: Rendezvous is our go to place for when we can't be bothered to make lunch for ourselves. The food is great, a good variety on the menu. Service is prompt and the staff friendly, even at peak times. Prices are very good for the quality and portion sizes.

title: The Best Cafe In Town
comment: The service is always excellent and the staff very friendly and welcoming. I love the food which is always quality and recommend The Express Breakfast. There is a warm friendly atmosphere that allows you to feel comfortable and enjoy your meal. Overall, my experience was 10/10 and i will continue to use this hospitable place.

title: Breakfast!
comment: Wow..what I can I say..the breakfast here is amazing and always freshly cooked and great value for money. I used to ho to other places in Beckenham but not anymore.. really recommend and the staff and aervice is always fantastic.

title: Best cafe
comment: Best breakfast in beckenham , amazing service from friendly and welcoming staff, great menu choices and visit here minimum once or twice a week.

title: Nice relaxing cafe
comment: Myself and my family had lunch while on holiday in Beckenham and found the staff and owner very helpful and friendly the food was 2nd to none and would strongly recommend a visit if in the area

title: Super friendly staff and delicious smoothies
comment: Such a nice environment, the staff is so friendly and caring and the food is so nicely prepared and served. I asked for a Spanish omelette once, and although it isn’t on the menu, the chef made it for me.  The smoothies are so delicious.  Highly recommended

title: A great night with great food and service
comment: Well, we have stayed in a few hotels in Bath Road, but have absolutely loved the food, service and atmosphere. We were served by a great guy called Franco who could not have done more if he tried. Food was excellent. Will be back. Stay at the Skyline if you want a great pre trip hotel with brilliant service, deals and food.

title: Brunch 17/6/18
comment: You cant have real bacon here so if you that is something you are expecting on a full English do not come here. All Eggs over cooked all taste missing. Will not be back

title: Fantastic place to eat..👌
comment: Delicious food and kind, friendly staff create a lovely atmosphere for breakfast or lunch. If you want to be healthy or a little naughty, all options are super tasty. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: We had a great time, totally unexpected for an airport restaurant!
comment: The food was good, just what we needed, but the best thing about Madhus was our waiter Franco. He did everything possible to make our experience a happy one. And after a long, tiring trek around Cornwall, his attention to detail made a rewarding conclusion to our time in England. Another plus was Emmanuella, the manager, who contributed greatly to our experience at Madhus.

title: A very nice meal as always
comment: Again we were overnighting at the Heathrow Sheraton Skyline, and dined at the Madhu’s Restaurant. A very pleasant atmosphere, and an extensive menu with delicious Indian dishes. We have always enjoyed our dining experience here, and this time was no exception. The chicken tica was excellent, and the portions large.  It is obviously popular with the local population, as several parties were taking place as well. We will return when we are transiting there again.

title: Okay
comment: Went to restaurant 2nd visit first was a 50th birthday this was just 2 of us, tried booking on line, table was not available till 9pm called direct and got a table at time we wanted. Ambience is lovely, menu choice is limited and higher than average prices. Starters were small portions we had prawns and very small lamb chops never the less very tasty Main course was a disappointment , chicken curry was very runny and probably better with rice, and we had a lot of food left over, being in a hotel they don't allow takeaway bag which was a shame but I can understand their reasons. We did ask if we could request something not on menu, being a Friday this was not possible but be interesting to know what they can do during week. Average meal for what we paid.

title: Excellent cappuccino
comment: Popped in after a shopping trip for a relaxing coffee whilst I wrote up some birthday cards. Staff very friendly and coffee really good and not too expensive. Food looked great, although I didn't eat that day I look forward to returning for some breakfast.

title: Beckenham High Street
comment: Rendezvous coffee in Beckenham I was having Beef burger salad and chips delicious nice testy very nice place clean and all the staff friendly

title: Nice cafe with lovely food
comment: We had Rendezvous and Vegetarian breakfast, the food is lovely and coffee very good. Staff is very friendly and accommodating of our needs, especially as we have a toddler. Also wi-fi password available on request, which was great to entertain our little one. I would recommend this café to a friend.

title: excellent food, friendly service, reasonable price
comment: Delicious vegetarian breakfast with fresh cooked mushrooms and tomatoes; perfectly poached eggs on toast. All served hot, promptly and with a smile

title: Lovely local cafe with excellent coffee and homemade food
comment: We are very impressed with the food and service at Rendezvous Caffe and it is now one of our favourite local cafes for English breakfast or lunch. Despite its size, it offers a lot of choices that are affordable and of quality. I like the English breakfast there because it is a generous portion. My husband likes to order the vegetarian option and seems happy enough with it. The coffee is one of the best in the area. And all that for just £7. A good deal. Staff is very friendly and caring. We have a 2-year-old child and they are always very caring, offering her a high chair etc. There are also a few kids meals options to choose from, mainly English food e.g. chips, omnlettes, fish fingers, burgers etc. A good homely place for a cuppa and a breakfast.

title: Amazing
comment: Good place with delicious food All this for 5 pounds it's cheap. Good attention i don't speak English as well but they was patient with me :)  Lovely place

title: Mrs Jeffrey
comment: We travel from Orpington to come here, absolutely love the Eggs Florentine and the chocolate milkshake is perfect. Staff are so friendly, I’d recommend to anyone xx

title: Friendly and very tasty
comment: Had a lovely lunch with husband and kids, huge variety of food and drinks. Very friendly staff. Look forward to the next trip which I hope will be soon.

title: Beat breakfast in Beckenham!
comment: We visit here on average once every week or two. The waitresses always remember our drinks order and are very friendly.  The omelettes are delicious and have plenty of filling, the hashbrowns are my absolute favourite (and I am a hashbrown conisseur!) and the eggs royale is also great. Can't complain about anything and 100% think this is the best cafe in Beckenham.

title: Indian food with a difference, absolutely great
comment: We were staying at the hotel so this was an ideal venue to catch up with friends who lived locally. Probably the best service ever encountered in an Indian restaurant, particularly from young Franco who went out of his way to be helpful with choices from the wonderful menu. The food itself was excellent, very different from the usual. Every dish was thoroughly enjoyed. Mid to high priced but value for money for this quality. Ambience is great, unhurried and great to see so many Asians as this is always a good sign. We would definitely come back.

title: Ok curry
comment: I’m not sure what others rave about. I eat curry a lot and don’t think the curry here is that great, it’s ok but nothing special.

title: Excellent place for a relaxing lunch.
comment: Have been a regular ever since taking my mother there for a nice coffee. The staff are really nice and a pleasure to talk to. They do their upmost to accommodate your order. My Cappuccino of the morning only comes from this place as its among the best. The sandwiches/baps have a wide selection of fillings and I never get tired of having one. There are always enough seats and everything is clean.

title: I won't be back
comment: The place looks nice and clean, the staff are friendly and polite, but when I ask for an English Breakfast that has 2 eggs 2 bacon, beans, toast and tea, I kind of expect to firstly get "bacon" but instead I got turkey bacon or a reformed pretend bacon of some sort. Next was the beans, they where just cheap horrible beans! There is no need to scrimp on beans, how much do you really save in the end? Also the sausage was not nice! I can't be specific why, just not nice. I don't mind paying £6 for a breakfast but they should at least inform people that they are not getting real bacon and give them the choice to go elsewhere.

title: Great value for money and service
comment: We're regulars here, especially for lazy weekend breakfasts.  The staff are both professional and efficient, the food is glorious. There are lots of similar cafes in Beckenham but this is easily our favourite.

title: Best in Beckenham
comment: Best food and service in hole Beckenham. Friendly staff always to serve fresh and tasty food. Highly recommend!!!!!

title: Chris
comment: We have visited a number of times and never been dissappointed with the food or the welcome we get from the staff. Kalid has always given great service and is very friendly to his customers .

title: Perfect brunch best eggs royale ever, they do cooked breakfast and lunches
comment: Great food and drinks for breakfast and lunch friendly staff and management  Come for a relaxed meal today

title: Lunch
comment: I was there yesterday and I had pesto pasta it was delicious..the place is really nice and clean and staff is great,friendly and helpful...im sure I will be back and I will recommend this place...thank you

title: Amazing experience
comment: Very friendly owner and staff, one of the best espresso in South east London, the food is amazing, fresh and very tasty  I recommend it to anyone -;)

title: Killer Omelette
comment: Could not doubt the food one bit, 100% be returning and I can honestly say its the best Omelette i have had. if you want a quick and satisfying lunch you know where to go.

title: so so
comment: Stayed at de hotel next to Madhus so thought why not give a try!! Cnt fault the service but food was jus average overrated/overpriced!! Music was too loud which made de experience very uncomfortable as people had to talk really loud to communicate :s

title: As good as ever
comment: Haven't been in for a while but popped in earlier, great service, great coffee, great food!! Without a doubt I will be in more often.

title: Middle of the road Indian food
comment: This restaurant has middle of the road Indian food , no surprises here Except for the high prices . I would visit again the food was fine

title: Averagely good or goodly average?
comment: Located in the Sheraton - just a stone's throw from other local hotels - Marriott & Holiday Inn Ariel. Unusual menu- good. Chutneys and mini-popadums came on the house. A pleasant surprise. Really tasty collection. They talked me into the fish as a “starter” - but a whole sea bass is a bit too substantial as a starter so you’d better be hungry. It was barbequed, with crispy skin on the top but strangely soft and moist on the underside. The signature lamb main, a generous portion, contained some bones with marrow. Rich but not outstanding –somewhat salty rather than spicy. Very popular with Indians which I assume is a very positive sign of quality and authenticity.

title: Birthday party
comment: I hosted my husband’s surprise bday party here. Vinod was very helpful throughout the booking process and was flexible with our requirements. Having never been here before and inviting around 35-40 guests for this party, I was a bit apprehensive to start with. But have to say the arrangements were perfect on the day. They reserved the section in front of the bar as requested for us.  On the day, we had limited time 5-8pm but things didn’t seem rushed. Food was delicious. The only criticism would be that the portions served were small and service was slow. Starters didn’t come all together but in splits and had to ask them again and again to refill the dishes. But Ali was very useful and professional and made every effort to run things smoothly. Overall we all had fun and a delicious meal! Strongly recommend this place for good authentic Indian food!

title: Mum and Dad 30th Anniversary
comment: overall it was a pleasant and amazing experience for myself and parents. Franco who was serving us was so helpful and received one of the best services to date

title: Great service, good food and even better coffee
comment: Admittedly this is my local, located just across the road from my flat. But out of all the cafes in Beckenham this is the best, hands down. Friendly and efficient staff and the best soya latte this side of Kent. Well worth a visit if you are in the vicinity.

title: Mrs
comment: We visited rendezvous caffe for breakfast and were very impressed with our food. I had poached eggs and smoked salmon on brown toast and my husband had scrambled eggs and smoked salmon on toast. Coffee was nice and my smooth I was made with fresh fruit. We highly recommend this place and definitely come back to try their cakes on display ; they looked delicious.

title: The Best in Beckenham.
comment: Would highly recommend a visit to this lovely establishment. Simple, tasty food, presented well by Carl and his friendly staff. The desserts are hard to resist!

title: Great little cafe!
comment: Unlike Fee & Brown and Nene, you can hear yourself think in Rendezvous. Welcoming staff and good food. A perfect place to enjoy an espresso, relax and contemplate life.

title: Great Food and Service
comment: This is the second time I have eaten here and like before the food was very good. Great service from a knowledgeable waiter called Franco and a good atmosphere.

title: Happy birthday Jin!
comment: This was a family birthday that also happened to co-incide with Diwali so a good choice of restaurant. Due to the size of group we were, we had a set menu and this restaurant is a great room where you are not sat on top of another group. The food was delicious and they also bought out an alternative option to the standard dessert to allow for a nut allergy. If I went back, I would order the majority of starters, a selection of breads and a few Daal's to go with it as there was so much food! All delicious though but the highlights were definitely the lamb chops and the prawns. Will definitely go back.

title: Ate here while staying at the Sheraton - a good find
comment: Stayed at the Sheraton overnight and expected typical hotel good but discovered Madhu's and was pleasantly surprised. Food good and different from many Indian restaurants. Staff very friendly and prices reasonable.

title: Victoria
comment: I visited this coffee shop with my friends during our lunch Break. I had chicken and bacon salad and my friend had toasted Tuna Melt Ciabatta .The food was delicious and reasonable . Their fruit smoothies and cake were very tasty. I would highly recommend .

title: Good food & friendly staff - must visit
comment: Had a lovely lunch with some friends, loved my salad (chicken and avocado) and my friends loved theirs. A wide range of choice and lovely staff to help with suggestions. Would definitely return.

title: A Very Pleasant Cafe
comment: I visited on a Saturday lunch time for brunch with my daughter and the café was busy, which is always a good sign. As well as the traditional Full English breakfast there were many other favorites on the menu and my daughter had Egg's Benedict. A selection of pastries, sandwiches and pastas is also available. The service was courteous and efficient and the overall experience was good.

title: Lovely cafe
comment: really nice café in Beckenham. The food seems quite clean too as there's never any grease left behind on the plate like in most cafés

title: Lovely cafe
comment: Lovely cafe. It has a nice relaxed feel. Perfect for coffee, breakfast or lunch. The food and service is excellent. Highly recommend a visit.

title: Thomas
comment: Absolutely fabulous place to go!!! Great food and friendly service.100 % rec. My first choice. Got to be one of the best in Beckenham.

title: Great smoothies
comment: Nice atmosphere, friendly staff  Had a lovely green smoothie very fresh followed by a Mexican tuna jacket potato very tasty. Will definitely be popping in again

title: New customers
comment: We had a fantastic breakfast,It was delicious!.The place is clean and the staff are friendly.it has the perfect ambience too

title: Great Food
comment: Fantastic Food, Great Customer Service. - I usually go for the Spicy Chicken Pasta and Mixed Berry Smoothie. It's always my go to cafe whenever I'm on my lunch break in Beckenham! Highly recommend.

title: Best cafe in Beckenham
comment: Lovely staff, great value for money and a wide variety of your local favourite dishes. Will definitely be going back again soon..

title: Wow!
comment: Fantastic restaurant we didn't know was here. You do need to book in advance though. A great dining option.

title: Lovely
comment: This is a very nice restaurant. The food was beautifully served & tasted just as good as it looked. It’s quite expensive but it is all freshly cooked & you can see the kitchen area. I would definitely come here again

title: If you love Indian food and you are near Heathrow - stop in here
comment: I had dinner here on Sept 6th on my brief business trip from Toronto to London. They have real authentic Indian cuisine. I ate there about 4 years ago on a previous trip and was really looking forward to my meal. If you like Indian food - this place is for you.

title: Great Location and Indian Food as you would expect
comment: Madhus - Sheraton Skyline - Heathrow Date of Visit: 08.10.17 Time: 6.00pm Review: Arriving early and taking a drink in the hotel pool sky bar just on the ground floor courtyard takes you away and so you feel like you are on holiday, drink selection a mixture of a full bar including a few mocktails and cocktails. I had the strawberry kiss, a nice way to start the evening and this bar is open from 4pm. Very good and friendly staff both at the sky bar and restaurant. The restaurant has a nice feel and has two private dinning rooms which is a bonus and an area to also cater for birthday parties. You get a view of the open kitchen which is always a nice feature and pleasant decor. A nice place to eat but the food is as you would expect and no real surprises, which is not necessarily a bad thing. You are also given complimentary mini popadoms and three sauces.  Booking Process: I could not book by calling the main branch and seems like you just have to pop in or maybe call the hotel.  Location: Located within the Sheraton Skyline hotel, London Heathrow, Hayes UB3 5BP, England. Tel: +44 20 8564 3380 Parking: Hotel has its own car park and if you spend over £20.00 either the restaurant or hotel reception will validate your parking for 3 hour stay. You need not pay at the meter just remember to get your car reg validated before you leave the restaurant. Decor & Lighting: Not too bright or dull and heavy on the red but its done tastefully and a pleasant surprise.  Ambience & Acoustics: I did not take a DB value on the phone but the level of music is just right and you can have an easy and pleasant conversation without the need to raise your voice. We had the following Food:  Sheekh Kebab - A large portion of 4 with a subtle spice and served with a little salad and mint sauce.  Achri Gobi & Malai Broccoli - A large starter and served with a little salad. Had a good taste and remained crunchy but very subtle in taste so maybe a little bland for some.  Khasta Veg Samosa - A portion of two and really enjoyed this and served with a little salad Murg Makni and Rice and Garlic Naan (Main) - A nice dish with a big portion of rice and main portion big enough to share. Well cooked and consistent with other places i have eaten so you won’t be disappointed.  Bill / Cost: £55.00 for two of us without any alcohol Conclusion: Good Service and fresh food but nothing out of the ordinary but a safe bet for an Indian. The menu is not the largest but covers all the main options and enough selection for all. One really big negative point to bear in mind is that they don’t do doggy bags so no take away and stating a silly excuse that its the hotel policy. Having eaten at nearly all hotel chains and many restaurants this is a disgrace and I would say that it should be mentioned when you are seated. I would suggest you order less then order more only after you finish what you ordered. I would still however be happy to go again if in the area as its a pleasant and relaxing environment.  Rating: 7.0 out of 10.0

title: Best breakfast in Beckenham!
comment: I travel a lot with work but always make my way to Rendezvous when I arrive back in London for a great cooked breakfast, good coffee and a chat with the extremely friendly staff.

title: Fantastic food with great service!! What more can you ask for...
comment: I went there for lunch with my son and 2 of my nieces.The food was fantastic, very fresh and tasty.The kids loved it!!! Prompt and very friendly service. I strongly recommend this place for a quality food.I will definitely be back.

title: Breakfast in Beckenham
comment: A revisited review! I maintain my previous viewpoint that this is the BEST breakfast ever. I have now sampled a wider range of the very flexible and comprehensive menu... I even have my eggs cooked to a personal specification how amazing is that! Above all the vibe is chilled and relaxed. The staff like personal friends.

title: Good place for a quick sandwich lunch
comment: I dropped in for a quick sandwich and cappuchino and was pleased with the efficient service. I had an Italian chicken sandwich with rocket salad which tasted fresh and delicious. The staff were attentive and friendly and the tables spotless. I will definitely be back!

title: a great little cafe, good for a quick snack, fresh food and excellent coffee
comment: There was nothing to dislike food was good and served fast, coffee excellent with enough choice to satisfy.

title: Always great
comment: Just wished they open on a Sunday. Takeout always ready quick, nice to sit in on weekdays for a quiet lunch.

title: Best place for breakfast in Beckenham.
comment: Been coming here for years. Always consistent quality, nice friendly owners and staff. Recommend highly.

title: Birthday dinner could have been better
comment: This place has a lovely atmosphere but the service from our waiter was very poor. We were waiting for some time to get just a bottle of water to have with our food. The waiter kept disappearing. The starters we ordered they had got it wrong and instead of taking it back and giving us the dish we wanted, we were told they could not change it once it's on the table. Food was Ok but to rich for us and over priced. After the meal sometimes sweets or a savoury snack is offered but this time we did not receive anything. Overall it was Ok but the service let us down.

title: Fabulous!
comment: We stayed at the hotel last night and booked dinner at Madhu's. This is not your typical Indian takeaway food. This is a beautiful setting, fantastic servers and staff (thank you Franco for the excellent service you gave us!) and the food was beautiful. We had the grilled lamb chops, the Chicken tandori, chicken biryani, and vegetable samosas. Everything was superb! We will stay at the Sheraton again, just to go to Madhu's! We loved it.

title: Nothing Special for an Occasion Celebration
comment: Went for my birthday and spent about £150.00 still not satisfied, reasons:- in-spite of knowing we were celebrating my birthday no wishes no reactions. food was good, but since we could not eat all when we asked if we could take it away they denied and said come back next time and eat again, if you liked it, but we do not do take away. When someone is spending an amount of £150.00 atleast expected something better. Last time I celebrated in Brilliant, the entire team there wished and sang for me and made me feel really special. Do not expect free stuff but a good gesture and a little personalized service will be good for the value you pay. Could only see Asian staff from Goa working.

title: Dinner
comment: Our last night in London before heading home back to Australia! Food was amazing and equally complimented by outstanding service by "Clyde" our waiter!

title: Great Friendly Local Cafe
comment: I eat at the Rendezvous regularly, the staff are always friendly and attentive, the food is dependably good with a great range to choose from. Cant recommend it enough.

title: One of a kind
comment: Out of all cafes in Beckenham The Rendezvous cafe stands out of the crowd. Very friendly staff, wide variety of choices and the best cappuccino in the neighbourhood . Definitely worthy popping in anytime for Lunch as well.

title: Friendly
comment: A personal and friendly welcome. Know their customers by name. Happy to cater for special dietary needs. Needing a strict gluten free diet, I bring my gluten free bread... they cook with it.... Fab!

title: Simply "the best"!
comment: In the heart of Beckenham Village the Rendezvous Café provides a welcome break to catch up with friends, find a quiet corner to unwind, or to simply enjoy the atmosphere of a friendly well run establishment. Nothing is ever too much trouble for the staff whose menu provides a variety of food and drink. Always willing to go that extra mile to give their customers what they want - what more could you ask for! Excellent. Lynn L

title: Best in beckenham
comment: A great place, just had smoked salmon eggs Benedict, the best I've ever had. Very friendly waitresses a nice clean seating area and clean kitchens, I always like to see the kitchen where my food is prepared and they were more than happy to show me, I will be coming back weekly to my new favourite place to eat in beckenham. Paul

title: Pink sausage...
comment: I had a large fried breakfast at Rendeavous cafe this morning to get half way through eating a sausage to find that it was pink inside.... not good. The waitress however was very apologetic and did offer me a free drink but who wants a free drink when you have just eaten half a raw sausage? ? I went up to pay expecting to get a discount at least, no such luck.. I had to pay the full price!!

title: Very nice indeed
comment: What a wonderful place to eat. I went to Rendezvous Cafe with a friend for some lunch & a catch up. There was plenty to choose from on the menu. The choice was hard. We finally settled for omelette with salad & chips & a deliciously filled toasted Ciabatta with side salad. With our meal we had very tasty freshly squeezed juices...... carrot, orange & apple we chose ..... but there were several combinations to choose from ...... Followed by excellent coffee & yummy cake. The staff were very friendly & simply a lovely ambience. Had a great experience & will must definitely be visiting again. Highly recommend for all.

title: The best breakfast in Beckenham
comment: fab food , quieter than other local cafe but regular clientele. Stunning breakfast omelettes. Great service with a smile

title: Excellent Indian Cuisine
comment: The best baigan that I've had. Naan (w/sesame) was very good. Dahl was also very good. We started with the ribs - great spice.

title: Madhus Restaurant
comment: Good food superb service. Butter chicken is absolutely yummy . Kebabs and chicken tikka also very tasty good atmosphere to enjoy the delicious food.

title: Great 20 years ago and even better today!
comment: You wouldn't think there would be high quality food at a hotel, but this place is excellent. Great quality ingredients. Excellent preparation. Very nice space and excellent service. Loved every dish!

title: Excellent
comment: I stay at the Skyline Heathrow quite frequently - but this was the first visit to this Indian restaurant - which I believe only opens at night in the morning the same premise serves the hotel breakfast. Upon entry - it felt good - not the typical Indian restaurant ambience. Quite open, comfortable, neat, and doesn't have that constant smell of spices - afterall this is only a part time Indian restaurant. Ordered the murg tikka and murg makhni, plus some papadums. Tikka was the best I have had. Makhni came with a huge portion of rice. Also done to a very high standard.  If anything - I would have preferred the dishes a little more spicy. Service was outstanding. Didn't have to wait for a table. The waiters were attentive- food came quickly. Food recommendation also spot on. All in all - very nice dinner- very nice experience . Will re-visit. Maybe during my stay next week.

title: Wonderful dinner before flight
comment: Delicious Indian food with so much flavor; not too spicy. Everything we tried was delicious. Franco provided fabulous service along with the rest of the staff. Will definitely come back when in town!

title: Excellent Indian Food- right in the hotel
comment: We wandered into Madhu's for a quiet, relaxing dinner while staying at the Sheraton. The first thing that we noticed was the great ambience and atmosphere for a nice dinner.  Our server, Franco, did an excellent job of supporting our decisions on the menu, advising us of the right combinations to put together a balanced Indian meal. Worked with us on quantities, spice levels and combinations. His attentive and helpful advice made it the perfect meal.

title: Everything was far too spicy
comment: I only had 3 mouthfuls and then had to find a fire extinguisher to put out the fire. Lots of people like hot food but this was far to much. Shame because we like the occasional indian but maybe they could offer something for those of us with more delicate tastebuds.

title: Amazing!
comment: Best indian food me and my friend ever had. The service is great, from the greeting on the door to leaving. The staff are friendly, really helpful if someone is not sure what to have. We had different chicken dishes and everything was delicious, portions are perfect and you are really well taken care of. I do really recommend the place

title: Dinner
comment: Aston and Denis were both excellent customer service and knowledge of the Indian cuisine. I highly recommend their calibre.

title: Long wait for food
comment: Waited extremely long for the main course, so was slightly disappointed because I found the food amazing. I was staying at the Sofitel at Heathrow and went here for dinner. Would not risk going if you have a flight to catch due to long wait. But as I said the food is amazing!

title: Top class Indian cuisine
comment: This is the best Indian food in the area, even considering it's proximity to Southall and London. The Salmon is fantastic, as is the lamb and vegetables. 3 hours free parking at the hotel is useful and I will certainly recommend. However, probably best to book a table in advance!

title: Great hotel restaurant
comment: Sophisticated restaurant in the Sheraton skyline hotel. Was staying at the hotel and was so pleased to see a great alternative to bar food. The restaurant was busy and had a short wait for a table. We ordered prawns in a masala sauce (excellent big prawns in a spicy sauce), saag paneer (I must admit there was not much cheese and I've had better) and pilau rice. Was a tasty meal with good service. Had some complementary mini poppadoms and dips (seemed homemade) to start which was a nice touch. Recommended and would return.

title: Ok overpriced for what it is.
comment: lovely ambience and decor. Food is ok lovely presentation but very expensive. It's not authentic Indian and quite dissapointing portion size. No mint or sweet with the bill.which was about 300 for 8 of us. When we Said this to the hostess she just shrugged it off. She didnt care No personal touch just a job for her

title: Very good food
comment: The food at a this madhu's did not disappoint. Very authentic and amongst few restaurants to serve good rumali roti However I was disappointed that they did not let us take the remaining food home from our order as it is the

title: Fantastic food!
comment: Really nice to have different dishes. Lamb biryani really tasty, hubby had a fish dish which he said was amazing! Waiter Franco was very efficient and friendly. Nice atmosphere.

title: First visit
comment: An excellent meal with great service.  Lighting was a little odd and made reading the menu difficult.

title: Very good
comment: The best restaurant in Heathrow if you're onto Indian food. Great staff, location is very beautiful it looks and tastes amazing

title: Surprisingly good Indian restaurant in an undistinguished hotel
comment: How to choose a hotel near Heathrow, if your flight connections require you to spend the night near the airport? Well, if you like Indian food, stay at the Sheraton Skyline. It's as good as some of the really good places in London itself.  They have an open grill there, a robata, and you should try something from it. The menu was not overly long, but plenty of choice, including vegetarian options. I got chatting to the waiter and he suggested the grilled lamb chop; it was delicious. Well flavored with Indian spices (just enough coriander and cumin - my own view is that Indian chefs can often go overboard on the cumin) and cooked just right. The naan was also excellent. Almost all the folks in the airport were travelers, (presumably, like me, staying at the hotel), but there was one local Indian family having a celebration and I took this as a good sign.

title: Let down
comment: Will not visit again due to careless and inattentive service from the waiters. Food itself is geared towards an international fusion palette and not authentic Indian Appears to be the kind of place where you have to be non-Indian to receive the best attention. Our waiters were poorly trained , disinterested in feedback and arrogant. Only plus points were convenient location & parking and decent ambience.

title: Excellent food
comment: Exeellent Indian restaurant and nice setting in the dinning room with the long table, service good too

title: Very good Indian food
comment: Atmosphere is upscale. Service was a bit slow. Food was good, far from the best Indian food I've had but quite tasty and well presented. Drinks were good.

title: Lovely food, private dining room
comment: We came to Madhu's for a business dinner and the food was lovely. Very tasty. I think we over ordered on the starters because we could hardly finish our mains. Highy recommend. It's rare to find a 'fine dining' indian restaurant, so that was nice. I didn't find the food to be any better necessarily than a normal indian restaurant though.

title: no hesitations - a great all round well balanced restaurant
comment: excellent food can be tailored to your dietary requirements. Parking on site for 3 hours free, good service, good atmosphere - smart without being stuffy. A great all round restaurant with a reasonable price tag for the excellent food you get. Would not hesitate in recommending and would travel a long way to get to this!

title: Excellent service, tasty food
comment: Having visited Madhu's Heathrow a few times before I felt it high time I wrote a review and left a recommendation. Every time I've visited I've received consistently great service. Tonight we were welcomed warmly by Nishita, who had helped us with our booking earlier on in the evening. Claudio, one of the managers, has always looked after us very well and is a credit to the restaurant. Our waiter this evening was very attentive and equally knowledgable, listening well to our requests and giving specific (and great) recommendations according to our tastes. Whatever you choose from the menu, if you like Indian food, you will love the food here. I'll give a special recommendation though of the rumali roti, so so soft! You have to try this! We will be back and next time with the family as well. If you're thinking of visiting Madhu's, stop thinking and start booking- you will not regret it. Thank you to the whole team at Madhu's Heathrow for another excellent meal.

title: Great Indian meal
comment: Stayed at Sheriton, booked a meal at Madhu's, was certainly not disappointed. Meal was excellent as was the service. Sometimes a meal at some of the major chains can be disappointed but not this one, would seriously recommend this place.

title: Terrible Place
comment: I stayed at the local Sheraton that this restaurant is attached to and went downstairs for some food at 7.30pm. The host completely ignored me and asked the Asian's in the line behind me if she could help them instead. Then I ask for a table for 1 and even though 80% of the tables were emptied she stated that she was full and couldn't accommodate me until after 8.30pm. I responded that there were plenty of free tables and she said they were all reserved. When I asked how the empty tables were going to be filled and then emptied in time for 8.30pm when it was "suggested" I come back she just ignored me and walked away. Such rude service ensures I'll never eat at this restaurant again. I stay at this hotel twice a year and I'd rather eat a burger at the sports bar than give the ignorant staff here my money. I've eaten there before, it's overpriced and as far as Indian cuisine in the U.K. goes, it's definitely not anything to write home about.

title: Great food, great service.
comment: Rendezvous is a lovely little cafe with excellent food and service and the staff a very helpful and always polite. I have lunch most days here for work and its always top quality and best of all i'm vegan which can be tricky but they have catered to my needs with lovely vegan alternatives for me to have. I highly recommend anyone to give them a try.

title: Late night surprise
comment: Worked late into the night and missed my booking at the pheasant inn Heathrow behind the Sheraton skyline(quality, Quantity and not overpriced). Got into the Sheraton about 10.30pm hoping for a bite to eat. They recommended the indian restaurant in the hotel and boy, what a pleasant surprise, fab service, courteous, quick and fairly priced and above all great food. My waiter Clyde has outstanding customer service skills. Many thanks Madhus, see you soon.

title: Great option if you at an airport hotel
comment: If you are at one the many Heathrow airport hotels on Bath Road consider making this your dinner destination. Very solid Indian food and our waiter Franeo was very nice and attentive. In fact, many staff checked on us frequently to see if we needed anything. We were very pleased with the prawns and eggplant dishes. All in all a great airport meal!

title: Great for breakfast!
comment: I really appreciated the Madhu´s breakfast experience. Both the food and the service was excellent overall. There was a wide selection of breakfast cereals, juices, hot foods, breads and pastries.

title: Return Visit
comment: Our second visit to Madhu's prior to flying from Heathrow and parking at the Skyline Hotel and it is still as good as before. Amazing for a restaurant in a hotel at an airport, actually just amazing as a restaurant, full stop. It isn't cheap but the food, service and décor all justify it.  A range of different and 'unique' dishes with several for vegetarians. Special mention to Caetano for his service and looking after us. If you are at the hotel or just

title: Brilliant
comment: First time eating here &.......wow! What beautiful food, a gorgeous restaurant & amazing staff- in particular Caetano. Made us feel so welcome & catered for our every need. Loved every second & every bite

title: Amazing
comment: This is the best Indian food we have ever tasted. Staff were so friendly and professional! We would highly recommend

title: Delicious! We'll be back
comment: As a returning customer of this hotel my family and I decided to try Mandu's for our evening meal.  I had a reservation for opening at 6pm and we were the first customers.  As with the rest of the hotel, the service was excellent and extremely welcoming. Franco, our waiter made us all feel very welcome - it's not often you get such personable service. He made the children laugh and made us all feel very welcome. He was also very good at helping us to select the correct portions, which was appreciated.  We ordered a murg tikka from the robata grill and murg makhni, rice and naan. The rice portions are large, one rice would easily feed two adults. I would also recommend the naan breads - the Peshwari was lovely and sweet.  A good drinks menu with Cobra on draught.

title: Delhi Cuisine in London
comment: Authentic Indian food served in a friendly atmosphere. Traditional Delhi favourites such as Butter Chicken and Daal Makhani are comparable with best Delhi has to offer.

title: Wonderful food and service
comment: Yesterday we had a family get together at Madhus. The food and drink were wonderful. The taste and the hotel ambience are top notch. Above all the service by Franco was not only very friendly but also was very knowledgable about each and every item. He was a major difference between an excellant dinner and an unforgetable dinner. I would strongly recommend it and would definitely go again.

title: Great birthday meal
comment: We came here for a 60th birthday meal with 8 adults and 3 kids. We were staying in the Sheraton hotel.  The food was amazing. We regularly eat at Indian restaurants and this was top notch.  Special mention for our waiter Franco. He went out of the way to do a mild Vegetarian Biriani for my son.

title: Always great food
comment: We have been many times. I always get a Full-English Breakfast and my wife gets the amazing omelettes. We will always return for more.

title: Great dinner!
comment: We had a great dinner at Madhu's last night! Our waiter was Caetano and he was friendly and efficient...very helpful with the menu too!

title: Tasty food
comment: The food was delicious and service was very prompt. Highlight of the dining experience was Mr. Caetano (sorry if i misspelled the name). ambience was also good .

title: Awful food and service - avoid
comment: Nice ambience and decor but the most awful food and service. We were 8 people (Indians) who regularly dine out. Unbelievable that they can actually serve up this stuff - The jhinga was hard and rubbery, the Nalli gosht and chicken karahi were a few sad pieces of meat in a heap of grainy oversalted masala - and we left over 2/3 of it. When the waiter Jerry told us rudely we can't take it away we had to clarify it was just the peshawari nan we wanted and wouldn't dream of taking the food home. The service is extremely poor and we had to keep calling the waiter to remind him what we had requested. They all seemed unhappy and no care for customers - a sad reflection on the owners.

title: exceptional
comment: Had a really beautiful meal here, the Masala fish was exceptional. The setting is very comfortable and elegant, and the service friendly and attentive. If you are staying on the Bath Road it's definitely worth a visit. I will be back for sure

title: Upper end Indian restaurant
comment: This restaurant is in a Heathrow hotel. Cut above the normal curry house and one would say more pricey, superior ingredients and a general feel of exclusivity. A varied but small menu with not your normal vast array of dishes. They appear to specialise in vegetarian, as well as some kind of special appetiser menu. Probably have a larger wine menu than the food. That all said, our dishes were delicious and well enjoyed. I had lamb biryani which was cooked to perfection. Service was A class. We had Clyde. Full of smiles and happy to attend to our every need with a bit of panache.  It's not necessarily value for money or cheap but you get a great meal, great service in a fantastic setting. Definitely recommended if staying in the same hotel.

title: great little find
comment: Stumbled across this place via top table. Short wait before being seated despite not being busy. Lovely setting, nice, fresh, open and inviting. Drinks order wrong, but quickly rectified by our bar server. Hostess super welcoming and helpful. Super disjointed trying to figure out what to do with car registration for parking. Submit after you eat, not on arrival as signage and other staff suggest. Caetano was our server, efficient, happy, helpful, quick and eager to help upon dropping a spoon I didn't actually need replacing. Shows good staff training in place however, service was streamlined and efficient. Would recommend the Murg Malai and Tikka, nice vegetarian options. Not too sure the Robata grill is adding anything to the experience? Personally would prefer a real Tandoor. Makes the difference for Indian cuisine I feel. Suggest Robata is a gimic well worth dropping. Also, suggest getting away from these awful slates to serve food on. Understand somebody somewhere thought it was trendy and edgy and different 10 years ago. Now it seems somewhat dated, detracting from the food on the platter. This isn't Shoreditch, so not sure why these are preferred. All in all, some great selections. Wouldn't suggest £5 for some steamed rice was at any time reasonable. Mayfair prices if you ask me. Or maybe just T5 vicinity prices. Would definitely recommend a meal here, cocktails looked good albeit never tried. Always like a place that pulls a good pint of Cobra however, so easy to get wrong. Stop by for sure, ask for my man Caetano and he'll hook you right up with anything you need.

title: Great food and service
comment: We went here for a birthday meal, having incorrectly booked a table at the Madhu's Southall myself the staff were great at easily and quickly changing it to this restaurant.l and getting the deposit paid at the other restaurant refunded Food was good, service was on point. I would recommend trying this place if you are in the area and this for me was the highlight of the hotel

title: Class Indian Restaurant
comment: Madhu's Restaurant Heathrow is located in the Sheraton Skyline Hotel. This is a fine dining Indian Restaurant with top dishes & ingredients used the menu is not massif but the food is exceptional & is defiantly upper end Indian cuisine with very attentive staff

title: Great food Friendly service
comment: Just a short walk from Premier Inn and almost all the airport hotels on the Bath Road, is this terrific Indian restaurant. It's in the Sheraton hotel but it's not an average hotel restaurant. Interesting menus with excellent vegetarian dishes and a delicious meat grill. Boys had spicy lamb ribs, we had an excellent dhal, some vegetarian dumplings in a mustard/chilli sauce and a char grilled aubergine dish. Friendly service too - thanks Clyde!

title: Great find in Hotel
comment: I am sure this place is visited by locals too. While in the Sheraton Skyline, it was a great find. The food was excellent and the service from Ashton was great.  The traditional selections were very tasty and service was timely.

title: Great place
comment: Love this place ...... Great place to have food and coffee. New shop looks amazing. Plus open Sunday's. Great news. Will pop in soon for breakfast. Great food great service and reasonably priced.
Great service and awesome food. The table service by Jerry was exceptional. Food was as we expected and the wine range was interesting enough. Definitely recommended.

title: Very disappointing food contrasting to a good level of service
comment: Went to Madhus for my Wife's 60th birthday party, And found all the vegetarian dishes , specifically, methi Gobi to be tasteless.  Furthermore the butter chicken was not as tasty as it should have been.  This is shocking as they only have a limited number of dishes and therefore I would expect each dish to be of the highest quality.  I am definitely not returning to Madhus.  I would suggest they try the dishes out in Mehfil, Southall.

title: Grieve's Wedding
comment: Service and food excellent. Waitress I think she is called Nikita was great. Would recommend to everyone. Thank you.

title: Excellent meal
comment: We so enjoyed our dinner in this busy restaurant. We had booked in advance which I'm glad we had!  Service was good, food and wine excellent. We will definitely visit again when we stay at the Sheraton again.

title: Amazing Indian Food
comment: What a wonderful surprise to go the the Sheraton Skyline Hotel - chosen because it was near Heathrow Airport - and have one of the best meals I have ever had. My mother and sister agreed - the food was sublime. We had a lovely waiter named Aston who could not have been nicer. My family and I agreed it was the perfect way to spend our last night in the UK.

title: Disappointing not to be allowed to take away your food , and no Veg Side dishes
comment: We were looking forward to going to Madu's for a while now. The staff were polite. The Salmon starter in Bannan leaf was delicious. My main course of veg biryani was lovely. The problem started when we wanted some veg side dishes. They said they do not do any veg side dishes and we have to order it as the Main dishes. We ordered too much food. So we requested can we please take the extra food away as we did not want to waste it. The biggest shock came, when they said RESTURANT POLICY IS NOT TO ALLOW ANY ONE TO TAKE AWAY FOOD! As they said sorry it is the Resturant and Sheraton Hotel policy (Some thing to do with their Health policy, what BS as 99% of restaurants around the world do not have this problem). We were disgusted, to know the food we have paid for will be disposed of. I have dined in the most humble restaurants to some of the finest Michelin star restaurants in almost 70 different countries. I have never heard of a restaurant not allowing a guest to take away their food. I will not be returning to this restaurant because of this ridiculous policy.

title: An excellant Indian meal
comment: This Indian restaurant is located inside the Shereton Skyline Hotel (Heathrow), where I was overnighting before flying to Vancouver. This is one of the best Indian meals I have ever had - not only is this restaurant several levels above the average high street Indian restaurant, but the staff attentiveness and their dress is exceptional. Well worth a visit.

title: Madhu's Restaurant
comment: Booked a table for two. Arrived at Madhu's Restaurant. A lady wearing a long flowing black dress escorted us to our table. The surroundings were nice, dimmed lights and nice decor. A gently spoken man (Clyde) took our order. The food came within 10 minutes. Ummm - it was lovely.... Clyde was very helpful throughout our meal. Asked for the bill... It wasn't too bad.  Paid the bill. Left a tip for Clyde (not for the company). - The end -

title: Good food, stylish interior, great service!
comment: Madhu's Heathrow offer a simple but very well delivered Indian menu in very stylish surroundings. I dined there two nights in a row - once with a friend and once with a group of 9 for a birthday function. On both occasions the restaurant was lively with good atmosphere, you can see some of the Chef's working which provides great theatre and the service on both occasions was first class. The staff were efficient, friendly and could not do enough to make us welcome. The food also was of a very high standard both in taste and presentation. All in you, if you want to impress someone or just enjoy a good curry in a nice place, Madhu's do it very well so thank you and well done to the team!

title: Family meal whilst staying at the hotel
comment: An amazing experience from start to finish. We were staying at the Sheraton Skyline so it was only a given to visit this 5* restaurant and it lived up to all the expectations.  Reserving a table was swift and, Nishita at front of shop went out of her way to arrange a beautiful personalised dessert for my partner which simply melted in the mouth.  Starters were fresh, delicately spiced and moorish. Mains were very tasty and a great follow on to the starters. We had the roomali roti which was a nice light change to the usual butter naans and great for us as we prefer lower carb food during the evenings.  Our waiter Franco was a gem! He made our evening really special with so much care and attention, we were made to feel valued and honoured to be guests at the restaurant. He even made sure that our parking was taken care of so that we wouldn't get charged and was very light hearted and entertaining.

title: Indian food @the airport
comment: Very good Indian restaurant at Sheraton hotel. It’s often full, so think to make a reservation. A lot of Indian people eating there, giving you a tip on how good it is. Food is very tasty sometimes a bit spicy for a French guy but very good. Service is ok and can be fast if you want.

title: Very good customer service and food
comment: I visited here with work for conference of around 50 people. The food was pre ordered as a buffet style on our table is consisted of a selection of delicious different Indian starters, mains and a delightful desert. The staff was always willing to help with what each dish was and even ensured all the starters where finished to avoid waste. Each dish was delicious couldn't fault it! Fantastic customer service, food and atmosphere! Traditional Indian dishes great experience!

title: Excellent Dinner!
comment: My husband and I stayed in the Sheraton Skyline Hotel, and we decided to eat in one of the hotel restaurants. We were very impressed with the ambiance, menu, service, and the taste and quality of the food. If we find ourselves near Heathrow and need dinner, we would definitely return to this restaurant. We highly recommend it.

title: Excellent service by Franco waiter
comment: One of the best resturant in the town and One of the best waiter in the town his name is FRANCO guys if u are their watch out ... FRANCO is the top waiter five star service and five star on madhus shoulder shashi take care of him

title: Excellent customer service and food
comment: Visited on Saturday 17th June and took my parents for the first time. Friendly, good customer services, excellent food and a fine evening. Special mention to Franco who gave of his time and introduced us to a chef, it was nice to meet the chefs who prepared our food. The staff gave that special attention - thank you Franco, Clyde and Ali. Well done.

title: Lovely Indian restaurant at the Sheraton Skyline Hotel
comment: This was a lovely restaurant--with food far better than the usual hotel restaurant. The service is very attentive and a bit old school--but in a good way. Your napkin is placed in your lap, you have an abundance of cutlery, waitstaff is very solicitous.Roycn was particularly friendly. The prices, however, are very reasonable, and the guests ranged from fashionably dressed to wearing shorts. The menu is not extensive, but it certainly has a reasonable selection of chicken, lamb, seafood and vegetarian options. Some of it is a bit spicy, so make sure you ask if you are sensitive to spices. The fresh naan was great! We left quite satisfied.

title: Fabulous
comment: We were staying locally and wanted to find an Indian but settled for this restaurant.  We were so glad we did the service and food was superb. We really enjoyed the night great service really superb food. We would visit again.

title: Superb - arguably the best "Indian" cuisine ever
comment: So, having sampled superb food in Delhi, Mumbai, Goa and others the food we had tonight in Madhu's restaurant in the Sheraton Skyline Heathrow was arguably the best I've ever had! Way better than any other similar restaurant in the U.K. A fairly extensive menu best described as a mix of Goan and Kenyan dishes - we had lamb, prawns and cauliflower - totally fresh and pungent spices without being artificially "hot" - just flavour and taste. A reasonable wine list (nice Rioja at £33). Total cost for 3 with drinks and service was £90 which for food of this quality in London is a snip. Can't recommend highly enough. A previous poor TA review moaning about "no take away" totally misses the point - Doh! You don't have to be a hotel guest/resident to dine here but pre-booking is a must as it gets very busy - and with good reason. Highly recommended by us 6 *

title: Absolutley Terrible
comment: I went to Madhu's Bath Rd. On Friday 23th June 2017, for my auntie's birthday, the setting there was beautiful but the food there was nice at the rime until i experienced food poisoming the following day. I had a stomach ache for 2 days n was vommiting continuously, i thought i'd be alright but i wasnt. Other family memebers had a slight stomach ache but soon dissolved after a few hours, this was a terrible expedience and I wouldn't be going there again.

title: Amazing food, attentive service.
comment: Pleased to report second time at Madhu's as good as the first. I was looking forward to the chicken tikka cooked on the bbq grill right in front of you all the way to heathrow and I was not disappointed. Everything we had was very good. Lovely Roti, must have. Most tender chicken ever. The waiter tried particularly hard to keep the kids happy, too. They ate everything he put in front of them.  My only negative is the space seems loud. Could hardly hear my wife across the table. Think its all the marble. It did not seem to matter after the first Cobra - pint of on draught - though.  Thanks for a lovely start to our holiday.  Matthew

title: Nice meal
comment: A good meal with good service from staff, nice easy menu, food beautifully cooked served nice hot, alcohol selection good. No complaints at all.

title: Start of holiday
comment: Had a meal at this restaurant before a holiday and it was fantastic. My wife had a fish masala which was absolutely amazing the fish was perfectly spiced and really delicate. I had a nalli sagg which was amongst the best curries I have ever had . Staff were wonderfully attentive and really friendly. Would recommend this restaurant to enyone.

title: Outstanding Food, Mixed Service
comment: What an unlikely place to find such a good Indian restaurant. Tucked in the back of an airport hotel near LHR, Madhu's is a fine Indian dining at its best. Food is outstanding -- among the very best I've had in the London area. Grilled meats are a specialty and come without being buried in sauce. The true taste comes out. Curies are outstanding too. Overall the food is very, very good. Service is very mixed. Some waitstaff are incredibly attentive and really want you to have a great meal. Bar staff seemed extremely inexperienced. Took three asks and half an hour to get a check. Finally, the restaurant is typically (I've been several times) very busy and hosts many very large parties. So not unexpected that it is very, very noisy.

title: Top Indian Restaurant
comment: The Madhu's Indian Restaurant Heathrow situated in the Sheraton Skyline Hotel and is a top Indian restaurant the Decor is top quality and the food is top notch slightly different than the normal Indian food you get from most places a little expensive but worth it

title: Fabulous
comment: Fabulous food, especially from the robata grill, if you enjoy seafood, the king prawns and sea bass are a must! Upon planning our wedding reception at the Sheraton Skyline we discovered Madhus Restaurant and have since eaten here a number of times. This establishment must be commended for its consistently good food, service and great ambiance.

title: Fantastic Indian Food
comment: What a find in such an unexpected place. surrounded by airport hotels Madhu's has created a simply fantastic restaurant. Whilst the surroundings can fool you the actual restaurant is well decorated and serves top quality Indian food. The lamb chops are succulent and the lamb Biryani one of the best i have tasted in a long time. I was worried about the service based on other reviews but i have to say they were very attentive and made us feel very welcome. Will definitely be back.

title: Great Food and Excellent Service
comment: Madhu's Heathrow is at the Sheraton Skyline on Bath Road. It is Indian fine dining - tastefully served and presented quality food, delicately spiced supported by excellence service. Crab cakes, tandoori chicken and wonderfully spiced lamb chops with rice, salads and bread. Our server - Franco - was attentive, funny and very helpful. I would strongly recommend this place as a Michelin star quality place to eat (for comparison, we ate at Benares in Mayfair, which is an Indian Michelin Star restuarant - the food at Madhu's is just as good).

title: One of THE best restaurants, Indian or otherwise!
comment: Let me start off by saying I stayed at that hotel for 5 nights, 4 of which I ate at that restaurant. The food is absolutely delicious.. even the starters could serve as a main dish - they're big and delicious ! Jerry was an awesome waiter, but Clyde was on a while other level with his constant smile and awesome recommendations along with courteous service! Bottom line: COME HERE... it's worth the bus\train ride

title: No Takeaway No Comment
comment: I was meeting someone staying near Heathrow for dinner so Madhu's at the Sheraton was recommended to me. I read the reviews on TA and they seemed ok so off I went. The restaurant seemed nice and was busy with hotel guests and people like us who are staying nearby. Our table of 3 was by a glass partition which was fine until you realised that one person would be sitting right opposite the table on the other side of the partition - basically staring at them. It was quite off putting as I would not want people staring at my table. The restaurant either needs to put something on the glass partition to obscure the view or rethink their seating arrangements. Where we were it was also dimly lit so that made reading the menu difficult. So onto the food. The food was ok nothing to shout about. The staff were ok. My biggest issue with this place is there is no takeaway policy. I just don't understand! Their portions are big yet they are happy to throw left over food away rather then let patrons take it home. Upon enquiry I was given 2 different reasons. One - it was hotel policy hence no takeaway; two - we have nothing to do with the hotel. Make your mind up which one is it? In this world where people are starving to death, to throw food away because of a silly policy - shame on you! There are much better Indian restaurants to go to. I would give this one a miss.

title: Amazing!
comment: Often, staying in airport hotels, it's a compromise over convenience vs quality, especially when it comes to eating. BUT THIS IS ABSOLUTELY NOT THE CASE AT MADHU'S. The quality of the ingredients is especially impressive. I am meat mad, especially lamb and so my husband and I shared starters of the lamb chops and lamb ribs. Distinctive and delicious each dish was succulent and cooked to perfection, without a single piece of fat of gristle, how do they achieve that? I had the slow cooked lamb main dish (did I mention I was lamb mad?) which just melted in the mouth. My husband had the chicken biriani, which somehow the name doesn't do it justice, as this was unlike any biriani I've ever tasted. It wasn't overwhelmed with a thick stodgy vegetable curry but instead was paired with thick raita, DELICIOUS! The service was impeccable, attentive but discreet. Absolutely understand the loyal local following, the place was packed! We are returning from our holiday in a couple of weeks and have already made our reservation. For me, instead of trying to kill an evening before my flight tomorrow, my holiday started tonight.

title: Exceed expectation
comment: I had heard abt Madhu's from family n friends and so decided to have dinner with my brother. As we enter there is a warm welcome from a hostess who guides us to the table. The ambience is very pleasant, We decided on ordering Jhinga achari and seekh kebab fr starters and nalli gosht and dal makhni for main course. The food tastes yummy especially bcoz it was cooked to the perfect texture, perfect mixture of spices and just well cooked having the perfect taste. The presentation is eye appealing and u cant wait to enjoy the food. Compliment to the team of chefs who put in all their efforts for the lovely meal and last but not the least the service staff is friendly, hospitable and excellent in their timing and efficiency to attend to u and make sure u enjoy the food in comfort. Thanks to the entire team of madhu's for an awesome experience. Shall surely be visiting again n again and try all the delicacies on the menu.

title: Unexpected Great Food Near Heathrow in a Hotel, No Less
comment: When we travel our expectations for a good meal within a Hotel Restaurant are generally low. In fact, we tend to pass on any Hotel Restaurant unless we are too tired to go out after a long day or arrive from a long flight and are simply famished. So we were greatly and pleasantly surprised on our last night in London where we stayed at the Sheraton Skyline near Heathrow. Their internal Restaurant was Mudhu's. The Indian food served here was excellent. I ordered the Nalli Gosht and my wife ordered the Masala Fish. Being Eastern fare, each dish was brought to be shared. Both dishes, including the accompanying sides, were superb and had a spice element rarely found in Hotel chain restaurants. The wine selection was also good and we enjoyed an very good Red Wine (can't remember the name now or the country, sorry). But the Wine List was good, again nothing like the norm in Hotel eateries. To top it off the service was excellent. All servers are very attentive and you don't need to wait for water or to have your wine poured. The next time we are in the UK we will seek out Mudhu's outside of the Airport. If you are staying at the Hotel near Heathrow (if it's not the Sheraton Skyline), find your way to Madhu's. It will be a meal you will enjoy wether it's your first night of your holiday in the UK or your last before leaving for home.

title: Booked an anniversary meal for my parents - disappointed
comment: Had booked online for my parents anniversary meal, mentioned it's a special occasion in the comments box. Also called up a few hours before they were due to arrive to explain it is their anniversary and I'd like something special done for them and was happy to pay for it. The person I spoke to said that was fine and they would do a special something. However my parents went and they didn't do anything special or even acknowledge it was their anniversary. Quite disappointing as I wrote it down as as called them

title: Delicious & Festive
comment: After a long trip across the pond our family arrived at the Sheraton Skyline Hotel tired and hungry. We were delighted to find an Indian restaurant inside of our hotel and we were not disappointed. From the lovely atmosphere to the authentic, delectable cuisine we settled in and enjoyed ourselves. Our main waiter, Franco, and server Royson were warm and friendly and took very good care of us. Highly recommend!

title: Good food, need better staff
comment: We were staying at the sheraton skyline and were assured that we didn't need a reservation here. We went to have dinner and the lady at the front desk said that we actually did. She then blanked us and ignored us after this.  We were lucky that a manager came and helped us. Half the restaurant was empty and the tables were needed at 9.30. We were willing to take a table till that time since it was just 8pm.  We ordered food for 4, 2 adults and 2 kids. At no point did anyone point out that the food was too spicy for kids. When it arrived, we were then told if we needed something less spicy, there is only one thing on the menu for the kids, chicken which they could whip up real quick. We didn't have many options at this point. We ordered it.  The food was really good though but at this point too much for 2 people. We asked if we could take away some of it, but we were told that the sheraton policy is no takeaway.  The staff are not great at all, they do not do the food any service at all.

title: Most amazing restaurant ever
comment: Me and my family and my friends were totaly mesmrised by cooking personly cooked by Jaskirat Singh. He personally came to our table to show that Madhus make every occasion special and take so much pride in their amazing special establishment.  I will always recommend this fine dining restaurant. With waiter service who make you feel truely special.

title: Nice setup, lovely food
comment: We were 4 of us here for a dinner. The restaurant setup impressed us and also the food taste. Be it the Butter Chicken, Saag Lamb or the Prawn Kadai; taste was good. The garlic Naan, the Chilli Cheese Naan and also the Mutter Pulao had a good taste. If you are in the area and are keen on eating Indian cuisine, go to Madhu's

title: excellent Indian cusine
comment: Surprisingly positive experience! The food was excellent, best Sagg Paneer I've ever had. Excellent service as well, especially our waiter Denny who was very attentive and helpful.

title: Amazing restaurant
comment: This place is great! If you love a good Indian come here! Food is great, the staff were amazing! The stunning hostess and all the waiters were so sweet and attentive to our baby and our needs. Very family friendly and just a nice atmosphere! I would definitely be back again!

title: A wonderful splurge for the single traveler; excellent for family-style dining!
comment: Passing through LHR on an overnight stay, I had dinner for one at Madhu's on the advice of hotel staff. I enjoy finding exquisite Indian food whenever I'm in the UK; Madhu's did not disappoint! The decor is vibrant but tasteful, evoking traditional South Asian design without seeming stodgy. The restaurant was full of families and birthday-celebration groups, which did make for a bit of a racket, but everyone was clearly having a great time. I found the service to be impeccable: I was seated within 3 minutes of arrival (with apologies for the delay!) and an assortment of papadums with chutneys arrived literally before I had sat down. My drink order was taken within a minute of being seated, and my waiter, Denny, swung by to answer any questions I might have about the menu. Ordering as a solo diner was a bit of a challenge because the food at Madhu's is clearly meant to be shared with a larger group. I ordered nalli gosht as my main, and on Denny's advice, the rabota prawns as a starter. My cocktail and both dishes arrived quickly, with excellent sequencing, and I enjoyed both of them very much. The lamb was so succulent that I even enjoyed eating the fat and connective tissue -- truly the mark of quality meat that has been well prepared! My cocktail blended perfectly with the flavors of the meal, and I found myself sampling the pulao rice by itself simply to enjoy its delicate aroma and texture. I'd happily return to Madhu's any time, although I hope to be with a much larger group next time in order to sample more of the amazing variety of foods, especially the innovative and delicious vegetable dishes!

title: Excellent food & service but so much waste
