comment: We came here for my father in laws birthday, our waiter was Denny who provided us with excellent service from start to finish. The food was great and all came out on time.  My only concern was the amount of food wastage, as we ordered from the set menu and couldn’t consume the amount of food they were bringing out for us. It really made me feel so guilty that all this good food was simply thrown away, it’s fine that we can’t take the food away but Madhu’s should find a way how to tackle this problem as we ourselves were unsure of how much food we should order as there was more than 10 of us.  Please can you have a look at this I would of gladly would have been happy that the food sent to the hungry or those less fortunate but the waste must stop.

title: Great food close to airport? Yes!
comment: Stumbled upon this gem while stranded near Heathrow due to cancelled flight. Goes to show that preconceptions are never right. Definitely recommend it. Rich flavors but not overdone. It won't disappoint.

title: Ashton was great!
comment: The restaurant was busy to the max but we were tended to with stride. The food is excellent and Ashton, our server, described dishes, made suggestions, and answered all our questions professionally and patiently. It was a great surprise this restaurant was at the Sheraton Skyline. They had a full bar and wine list as well. I would definitely eat there again and would ask for Ashton!

title: Was expecting more
comment: We went here on after a recommendation  Got here slightly earlier than the opening time  Asked the hotel about parking  They explained the system  But said they couldn't possibly call the restaurant as they wont answer until 6 on the dot so couldn't help  We then went in at 6 on the dot!  Lovely surroundings  Nice smiling hostess  Lots of tables but one of my pet peeves is when they want you all to sit all together  When you have a lot of tables you don't need to sit right next to the previous table you've seated  The restaurant seems popular  Filled up pretty quickly  Our waiter was lovely  We were brought mini poppadoms With 3 lovely chutneys  The appetizers were lovely  Some of the best I've tasted  The main courses were ok  Nothing special  In fact my husband wanted to ask if they left the seasoning/flavored of his  It was more of a meat stew and I had to agree with him  The man clearing the tables and bring food was so nice  Really lovely and very pleasant  He was actually a real credit to the restaurant  When leaving as I didn't have the mans name I told them at the front what a credit he was to the restaurant  Well that was a waste of time  They Couldn't have been more disinterested if they tried

title: One Of The Best
comment: We Stay At Sheraton Skyline In London And Had An Amazing Dinner At Madhu's. The Ambiance Was Lovely, The Waiters Were Very Attentive. The Food Was INSANELY DELICIOUS...... This Is Definitely A Must Visit Restaurant If You Are In The Area.

title: Best indian restourant I have ever tried, India included.
comment: Aarti was a fantastic host. Food was incredible, price was extremely competitive (way below expectations!!) and taste was superb. Will come back shortly!!!

title: Great experience on Diwali day
comment: We did not know it was Diwali festival day, so there were lots of families that evening but service was great. Our waiter Franco was very friendly and great at service. We did not have to wait for long for food, the taste was great, very authentic. Franco was willing to move us to a different table since the family behind us were a little loud but we were ok with their level of noise. My girlfriend and myself had the best evening around heathrow and we are planning on visiting again next time we are around Heathrow.

title: Excellent food and service.
comment: We have eaten at many Indian restaurants, this restaurant was one of the top Indian restaurants we have been to. The service was very good, especially our waiter Franco. The food was very tasty and we would definitely recommend it. We will be back!!

title: A Fabulous Experience
comment: We decided to host a Sunday lunch for some friends and relatives to further celebrate our sons weddings that took place in 2016. From the start we found Claudio Fernandes very helpful, knowledgeable and a good listener. We agreed the date 4 months ago. The big day came and we were naturally nervous. Vinod was very reassuring and his team seemed calm but in total command. The non alcoholic welcome drinks were varied and our 75 guests never had to ask to be served. The starters were excellent with 50% non veg. Main courses were beyond my expectation, Bhuna Chicken, Aloo Gobi and Dhall + another 4 dishes. Hot fresh roti and paratha. They served Kulfi in smaller portions so guests could also try the Rasmalai. The service was relaxed yet very efficient. My nephew has a nut allergy, the waiter brought him an individual safe desert without even asking. Their food and service is possibly some of the best we have experienced. Our guests were without exception impressed and some said they were certainly coming back for a special dinner. You have to be really awkward to find a single point of complaint. The value is excellent as Claudio and Vinod delivered their promise and more. If you are thinking of a lunch party, this venue takes some beating.

title: Flavorful food
comment: When you first sit down they bring you these little lite cracker things w 3 sauces. Really enjoyed those while deciding what to order. Had the machuzi kuku and it was so so good. And the roti as well, warm and plenty. For hotel food, I was pleasantly surprised. Services was attentive. The inside of the restaurant is quite modern and dressed up, but still ok to be casual. Lots of folks just hanging out enjoying.

title: Excellent food and great service!!!
comment: We had a great evening, food was exceptional, probably the best Indian food we've ever had. The service was excellent, overall 10 out 10, would definitely recommend!!!

title: We enjoyed the food so much we returned a week later
comment: This is a gem of a restaurant with attentive service and generous portions of excellent food. Jerry was our server and Naz made the food recommendations. It was a wonderful treat and we will be sure to return when we are in London again. Thank you!

title: Excellent venue and service
comment: Fantastic service, venue and dishes. Best Indian restaurant we have ever been. Particularly pleased with Denny. Definitely recommend to everyone and will visit again if we are in the neighbourhood.

title: YES YES YES PLEASE
comment: I have eaten there several times this week and the food is EXCELLENT. Denny has been our server and has provided great service each time. The atmosphere is lovely. The drinks are good. The flavour of the food had me eating way too much because I enjoyed it so much. They validate parking and you will want to come again and again.

title: great food and service
comment: visited twice in last month beacuse of very delicious food and service  Though the place was very bz Ali was there everytime we wanted something . had great time with his presence and sense of humour..  would be back as the food is just the best here

title: Lovely Food
comment: Would thoroughly recommend this place.  The food was cooked to perfection and one of the best Indian meals I have had. I also thought the price reflected the great quality of the food. A lovely treat and will definitely be returning.

title: Great Indian restaurant
comment: Chose to eat here as was staying in the Skyline hotel. Decor felt more like a typical Indian restaurant than generic hotel restaurant. The menu was small but the choices I made were delicious. If you are staying in this or another nearby hotel and can face a heavy Indian meal, this place is strongly recommended. Overall I'd say that this place makes me more likely to want to stay over at Heathrow!

title: Lovely Dinner!
comment: We enjoyed a lovely dinner at Madhu. The food was delicious and the service attentive and fast. Franco did a great job in making sure we had a great experience! We would definitely return.

title: Dinner
comment: Great service by friendly staff  Great atmosphere and décor  Great food, lovely flavours, spices and textures

title: Excellent!
comment: I've heard this place has a pretty good reputation. We were a large gruop (15). Went for the Set menu @ £30 per person - great selection, plenty of it and the staff were flexible with the couple of dietary requests we had. I'd be very happy to visit again.

title: loved the ambience
comment: had a drink first at the poolside bar and then went on to have the £40 set meal with family. Lots of choice and authentic taste that suits punjabis well, also the butter chicken could have done with a bit more spice. Great find will be back!

title: Excellent
comment: Great food. First time experimenting with indian cuisine. The staff was great and they always made sure the food was good. Thanks for the plate orientation and recommendations.

title: Delicious meal.
comment: We ate here whilst staying at the hotel and were not disappointed! The service was very good, no long waits, delicious food and generous portions. The lamb chops which had been recommended at the hotel reception were fantastic!

title: EXCELLENT INDIAN FOOD
comment: I had low expectations of a airport hotel restaurant considering the Sheraton is not one of the most "fabulous" Sheraton's - meaning it needs a little remodeling work. Madhu's was quite good and the service was impeccable. The quality of the food was just as good as some ultra expensive Indian places I've been too in central London. The décor was great - something that you would imagine at a high end hotel that charged $500/night. I had to keep telling myself that I was at mid-range airport hotel. I would absolutely recommend coming and stopping by this tasty place to grab a bite. It's quite affordable too.

title: Brother's 31st Birthday
comment: Been here twice now.  The food is exquisite, could not falter any dish we had.  Also, I had a dessert that was made by Ladurée which was one the best desserts I've had at an Indian restaurant, so was a nice touch. Table service is excellent too. Our waiter Denny did an impressive job. I'd highly recommend this place for special occasions based on the ambience.

title: Hated it
comment: Hate the people hu work there... zero Hospitality and zero human touch.. u dnt order there waiters will give u order... wow what an experience. Went there frst time and thats the last time... dnt want to see or hear this restaurant name again...

title: An authentic taste of Indian food and hospitality
comment: Amazing, Authentic and Absolutely yummy! Was staying at the hotel before a flight on Val's day and they had a delicious special menu. All the food was delicious and the service faultless.  Even if you are not staying at the hotel you should come here for a proper taste of India. Indian's are world famous for both their food and hospitality and this place is so on point I thought I was going to take a Rickshaw to the airport!  Eat here, you will not be disappointed and the price was very reasonable for a hotel restaurant too! Really made our Valentines day special!

title: Best service so far in London
comment: Thanks our fabulous waiter, Franco we had an absolutely unforgettable experience. Some family members had never tried Indian food and the suggestions and attention to detail made the experience very special. Our 9 year old granddaughter was taught a lesson she will never forget. Many thanks! We were blessed to meet your staff.

title: Food does not live up to the hype/name
comment: I have been to Madhu's 7-8 years ago (the one in Southall). I loved the food then. I remember thinking that the food was closest you would get in any Indian 5 star hotels. I was there for my birthday in January. Expecting to be as good as I remember. Sadly it wasn't. Great ambiance, friendly/attentive service. The starters was just above average but the main course was as you would get in a Indian wedding on a buffet. Meals lacked flavour and were sweet (may be to suit the English palate). We could'nt finish the main course. So we asked tif we could take it away and go straight to desserts. Unfortunately, they dont do that so. we just left disappointed.  I am sure there are other Indian restaurants I can go. Definitely, not worth the money you spend!!!

title: A Unique Indian Restaurant
comment: The Madhu's has a fabulous selection of freshly prepared grilled dishes, with delicious spices. Try to order as many as you can and then share them among yourselves to experience all the delicate flavours of this superb Indian cuisine. The service is fantastic and our waiter, Franco, was able to advise us on the best dishes to order. He even challenges us with a brain teaser at the end of the meal

title: Madhu is Marvellous
comment: A group of eight of us went on Sunday evening (19th Feb). We were given a room off the main restaurant which was private, cosy and beautiful. The table looked pretty and a pleasure to look at and that was before the food started arriving! We had a variety of recommended choices from the Robata Grill - the prawns were superb as were the lamb chops. Then we had mains each. The food was so good and lots of it, we could have shared mains, portions were very generous. The staff were very good and attentive and very pleasant. Some of the party had desserts which looked delicious too. Presentation of all the dishes was a delight. All the wines were well paired with the meal too. We had a great evening I will definitely be going back. Just to add to a great evening we had pre-dinner cocktails in the bar next to the restaurant on the ground floor, which is by the pool so you can pretend you are on holiday ! Loved it all

title: Lovely ambiance and food
comment: The food was very nice specially salmon which was boiled while wrapped in a leaf. Butter chicken was nice. I would recommend if you want mid budget Indian dining.

title: One of the best!
comment: Superb menu and surely one of the best Indian restaurants in London. It has a (deservedly) good reputation. Not cheap, but offers succelent and mouth watering Indian dishes that are obviously lovingly prepared with care. My Tilapia Masala Fish was outstanding, the Makhni Dhal simply superb, and the Roomali Roti to soak it all up with was a real treat (not many places do this type of bread)! Great setting and atmosphere too. Go there .... treat yourself to a feast of the senses!

title: Good food, service and location
comment: Finding an Indian restaurant inside a business hotel in London is a rare site. And thats what made my business trip so comforting. After a day's running around on an overseas business trip in London, all an Indian like me can expect is some good Indian Dinner and for which I again dont have to dress up and go out a few miles. And my wish came true. Sheraton skyline @ Heathrow is anyway a great comfirting hotel and what made it so special for me is that it houses Madhu's ( one of the leading Indian food chain of London ). The food quality, Portioning and the service is perfect and your hosts further make the experience great by making you extremely comfortable. Thank you Rukhsaar , Jose and the team Madhu / Sheraton.  Deepesh Jain

title: Decent food, slow service
comment: A decent meal but the service lacked. The restaurant wasn't incredibly busy for a saturday night but the staff seemed busy in themselves. Slow to react. Apart from that the food is delicious. Well worth a visit if you are in the area and fancy an Indian.

title: Visit to Mathus Sheraton
comment: Excellent food and excellent service. Slightly expensive but well worth it. Would definitely go back again.

title: Great food
comment: The food was great and the ambience was very nice, however the service was slow. Overall however it was a pleasant experience.

title: Lovely atmosphere
comment: Living so close to the Airport I've driven past the Hotel many times. Friend recommended that we eat there. First impressions very good, after all its fine dining. Excellent service with good food to match, I ordered the prawn curry. The sause was on the thick side but still tasty. Good venue for special occasions or business. The free parking is a added bonus. Would I go back? Yes

title: Awful
comment: I was really looking forward to a meal hear especially having read the reviews online. The service is faultless however the food tonight had more salt in it than is humanly palatable and the managements ‘favourite dish’ was ruined the after taste and salt ‘burn’ is still with me.... I was given a discount having mentioned this but Guys, if you want to charge what you do, please present edible food

title: Great food, excellent service and good value
comment: Just enjoyed a wonderful meal at Madhu’s - delicious flavours and skilfully advised by Franco. Thanks for making our evening so special. I can recommend this place wholeheartedly. Suggest sharing a main!

title: The Flavour Punch
comment: From the moment we arrived, the service was exemplary and was surpassed only by the most beautifully cooked and flavoured food.

title: Fantastic food
comment: Excellent food. Superb staff. Nice ambience. Loved it. Only suggestion is that the portion for one person should be made smaller.

title: Indian Cuisine at its best
comment: Rather than sample European food whilst staying at the Sheraton Skyline I opted for an Indian meal and was not disappointed with my choice. The food was very tasty and generous in proportion so much so that I could not quite finishe a lovely meal.

title: Impressed!
comment: We checked out the foodie options at the hotel and were delighted with our choice. Helpful, efficient service and delicious food. Spotted that whether you were a single traveller or couples, the seating was sympathetic. We would definitely eat here again.

title: fabulous food and service
comment: we are staying overnight at the Sheraton Heathrow, and popped into the restaurant tonight just on the off chance. wonderful attentive and helpful staff (not the usual sort of curry menu - we were the only non-indian table) , very good atmosphere and the food was incredibly good

title: Good Indian restaurant
comment: This is a good Indian restaurant but a little bit expensive. Good food and good attention... They have a nice curry, you can try the wasabi prawns and all the starters.  It's a comfortable restaurant in the hotel, s you don't need to move...

title: Excellent food, service and decor
comment: I went here for Valentines with my fiancé. There was a set menu for the night and the amount of food we received was plentiful. The taste of the dishes is of a very high level, you can tell that they have used high quality ingredients and that the grilled meats have been marinated properly.  Despite eating so much, I never had even a slight bit of a stomach ache the next day, something which is not a given with most Indian restaurants! The service is excellent and friendly. The waiters ask you how you are finding things but never to the point that it annoys you. The décor of the restaurant is also very stylish. I would definitely recommend this if you want a higher end Indian dining experience. Perfect for special occasions.

title: As always a great place to eat
comment: While transiting Heathrow, I often stay at the Sheraton Skyline Hotel, where there is the Madhu's restaurant. It serves excellent Indian food, and I have never been disappointed. The menu is extensive, and the service excellent. I had the Saag Ghosh, and it was delicious. I will continue to return when traveling here.

title: Excellent service
comment: Excellent fresh food..excellent service by polite staff..very accommodating...was served by Franco who was ever so polite and helpful from start to finish. Salmon parcels were a hit..perfectly cooked..a definite recommend..thank you staff at Madhus for your legendary service

title: Great Ambience with scrumptous food
comment: We had visited once before for a party and just loved the food hence decided to go for dinner and I must say was not disappointed. The service, food and ambience just took me off my feet to write this review. I would recommend anyone and everyone to visit this restaurant if they are looking for a great meal that will feel overwhelmed after their visit to this restaurant. 10 stars ++++++. Thank you Only thing I would request the restaurant is to start allowing customers to take food if left in abundance if ordered more because for me ''I don't eat to live, but live to eat'' Just a suggestion as wastage of food is disheartening. Thanks again

title: Wonderful surprise
comment: While staying at the Sheraton we were fortunate enough to come across Madhu’s Restaurant. We sampled a number of dishes and were assisted by Franco in the selection. Franco suggested the grilled scallops and asparagus and lamb spare ribs and both dishes were superb. For mains we chose Masala fish and Kadai prawns along with Naan bread again the flavours were exceptional. I can highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Really fabulous food
comment: We have just finished a really tasty meal at Madhu's, not takeaway food but authentic dishes, with an excellent selection for vegetarians. We had the pleasure of being waited on by the lovely attentive waiter Ashton.

title: Pre flight Stay
comment: We arrived at the Skyline Sheraton and decided to dine at Madhus. We were warmly received by the staff and immediately seated at this very popular and busy restaurant. Our waiter, Ashun, was charming and helpful making good recommendations on the dishes. We had a pleasant dinner.

title: very impressive!!!
comment: Went for a xmas do with my business associates last sat 18 dec.  we went for the xmas menu and i must say it was one of the best xmas meals i ever had in an Indian restaurant for a while, cleverly drafted menu with wide variety of dishes and excellent combinations with a decent price , what else do u want, all of us loved it and enjoyed every bit of it. Would specially like to mention that all of us were really impressed that turkey was part of the meal and what a brilliant way to cook it , something different from traditional roasts. Also beautiful starters, and delicious dessert, one of the best gajjar halwa i ever had in any restaurants in the world. Service was spot on and it really added to our evening. Thankyou Madhus and just keep it up. we will be back soon

title: overrated over price
comment: Not my type of restaurant for the price enjoyed the pheasant pub more which is around the corner from the hotel quality of cuisine is questionable

title: Wonderful service
comment: Food was tasty , setting was nice . What stood out for me was the customer service in particular the hostess Naz who so warm and friendly and was very prompt with her service .

title: Xmas Panorama 2016
comment: We stayed in the Sheraton skyline after the overnight flight home. We has dinner here and it was very good. Nice room plenty of space and not too noisy. The menu was Indian but the food was superb. Our water was very helpful in describing the menu and making suggestions. I recommend this restaurant.

title: Good North Indian food
comment: A good fine dining North Indian restaurant with live cooking.  Good service with chicken and lamb starters to die for. Ideal for business and leisure dining.

title: Excellent Service
comment: Menu was limited. Food presentation was excellent. However, the flavors was not a match to the original Madhu's. Service was the best we've experienced at a restaurant.

title: The best lamb chops ever!!
comment: Really. The lamb off the grill was fantastic. From the food to the service (which excelled) to the ambience I was very impressed and so thankful we stopped in for our last meal in GB.

title: Enjoyable meal but pricy
comment: Eating in airport hotels is generally a pretty depressing experience so we were attracted by the fact that the Sheraton Skyline boasts a branch of the long-established Madhu's of Southall - so much so, in fact, that we chose to stay here overnight before an early flight from Heathrow. The restaurant occupies a very large and rather bland room. Attempts have been made to break up the space with an alcove for private dining and spaces reserved for large groups. The much-trumpeted Robata Grill is barely visible behind a translucent screen at one end of the room. Diners seem to divide about equally between air travellers and family groups from the locality. The menu begins with a list of dishes cooked on the grill which appear to combine starters and mains but which it states will be served when ready, tapas style. Fortunately our (2) butterflied king prawns and 4 large pieces of Sheekh Kebab arrived together: both were excellent. For mains I opted for a very dark, rich Saag Gosht (a lamb and spinach dish) while my wife chose something more unusual, Punjabi Kadi (a vegetarian dish of dumplings in a strong yellow gram flour and yoghurt sauce). With a Peshawari Naan between us this was a substantial meal, too much for us to finish in fact. My only real reservation about our meal concerned the price: 2 cocktails, 2 starters, 2 mains, naan, raita and mint tea came in at £85 once 10% service had been added. (Despite this service charge, space was left on the credit card slip for tips, a deplorable habit.)

title: Another super meal
comment: Dined here again and so enjoyed everything. The pre starters are so tasty consisting of small poppadoms and three different dips. Stayed on the vegetarian for mains and we were both delighted. The service is good and staff very friendly and polite. A great place to dine .

title: Terrible food and Worst customer service ever!!
comment: We had reserved half the restaurant for a family party. Firstly the food was terrible, if that that is what you call fine Indian dining then you are better off getting a local Indian take away! Secondly there should've been waiters designated for the party and shouldn't be asking for water, waiters should've been waiting on guests!! Towards the end there were no waiters around and a few of us were very thirsty and noticed that the waiters for getting waiter from near a sink in the corner. As there was no one to ask we decided to go to the sink and get some water from a bottle. If there was someone around we could've asked. As we were leaving we were asked to pay for two bottles of water!!! Can you believe the cheek!!!! The manager on Sunday 15th January was ignorant and had a smug on his face throughout the time were trying to resolve his water issue. Ended up paying £7 for two water bottles!! One we opened and one which was half drunk and was by the sink. This was a horrible experience and this restaurant made us feel like thieves!! DO NOT go to MADHU's if you want Indian threes are lovely places in East London at half the price and twice the taste.

title: Fantastic pasta full of flavour
comment: Went to this Cafe 2 times so far with my family. The chicken and mushroom pollo pesto pasta was by far my favourite dish - cooked to perfection, one might say. The flavours were perfectly balanced, chicken and mushroom was cooked and put together very nicely. Their juices are also quite stunning, they are actually freshly hand-squeezed (instead of the usual tropicana orange juice you get in most cafes).The portion size was just right, and nobody left anything on their plates. Fresh, delicious lunch is served!

title: 5 star Food
comment: First would like to say about the ambiance, really great right from top to toe. Food was simply perfect right from starters, curries, biryanis and desserts they were just amazing. I believe they have worked a lot to deliver such passionate food. The young knowledgeable waiter was thorough with his food and unselling skills. We enjoyed every bit of it. Will definitely come back.

title: Fantastic service and quality
comment: We had a selection of vegetarian and meat dishes, and all were top quality. The lamb chops for starters were particularly good. Fantastic service and location. I would recommend.

title: Great quality restaurant
comment: My partner and I ate at the restaurant when we stayed at the Sheraton hotel. The food was very good but the service was better. The food was delivered exceptionally quickly and serviced was amazing.  The price of the restaurant is not for anyone who is on a budget however if it is quality eastern restaurant you are looking for then this is the place.

title: One of the best
comment: I am a great lover of Indian food. I was travelling to Stockholm and staying in the holiday Inn. It was my wife's birthday and we were out with friends. Quick search and this place was a 5 minute walk. The welcome was top class. The atmosphere and ambience was perfect. I had spring chicken starter and lamb main. Absolutely delicious. My wife had lamb chop starter and lamb sag. She loved it. All round brilliance. Cost for 4 people including pints of beer and wine ... £50 per head.. highly recommended.

title: Very good
comment: Ambiance very good, quality / test of food very good, suitable for large gatherings , staff very helpful and friendly, cost- slightly higher side. overall very good place for Indian food.

title: Go for the Royal set menu!
comment: Went here with colleagues and we chose the Royal menu which was a set menu for £30.00. We had a delicious and interesting mix of starters and mains catering for both vegetarians and meat eaters in abundance. The portions were generous and it was certainly good value for money. The staff could not do enough for us and we weren't a particularly large group either. It was a busy night at the restaurant, clearly a popular restaurant in the area! I'm going back again with friends!

title: Wonderful restaurant and wonderful service
comment: Lovely Indian restaurant within the hotel but you would never know that. Great ambience with great menu choice and wonderful service.

title: Birthday celebration
comment: Booked the chivas 70 for the birthday of my brother had a blast special mentions to the staff and the guy who served us Ali brilliant service and delicious food, the ambience food and service everything was top notch.

title: A hidden gem
comment: We stayed overnight at the Sheraton Skyline and wasn't expecting much from an airport hotel restaurant but were pleasantly surprised. The meal was very tasty and the service was very good. I would definitely recommend it.

title: Food and service are both extraordinary.
comment: I could not be more pleased with Giuseppi and Aki and all the other fine servers in this fine restaurant. Beautiful room, fine dining and lasting memories whether solo or with guests.

title: Great hotel restaurant
comment: We were staying the night in the Sheraton Skyline hotel before an early flight. We had see. Reviews of the Madhu's restaurant and it was convenient to eat here. The menu is very good, contains several recognisable and typical Indian dishes but there are other items available which were not dishes we see in restaurants where we live. I had chicken makhni, husband had bone in recipe. Accompaniments of peas pilau rice and a sesame nan. A glass of red wine and a pint of Cobra. All for £46.  We thought it was good value considering the location. We use airport hotels quite regularly and it was a real pleasure to find such a good restaurant in a hotel that could easily provide bland food, much more expensively.  Thanks Madhu's and thanks Sheraton!

title: A Fabulous Dining Experience
comment: Superb chicken biryani. The aubergine bhurtha was the best I have had. Good value considering the 5 star venue.

title: Good food, no chai
comment: This is a good restaurant with good quality food, good service, but with limited choice and in the higher price bracket. Gluten free was handled well with many choices. Not as much selection as Madhus in Southall though. It's more about the grill and less about the curries. But there's one big thing missing to finish off the meal, and that's a Chai. I received an apology for it and was embarrassingly told that it is not available, many ask for it, but the management doesn't want to add it to the menu. This is a case that if the customers are asking for it, although you may disagree, for something so simple, it might be time to add it. Apart from mint, they only have bagged teas.

title: Expected better. Dissapointed
comment: My second visit here. So starters are fine. Decent. Quality. Tasty and just right. The mains... this is where it falls apart.. one of the chicken dishes was cooked on the bone.. ok.. but way too runny. The other butter chicken.. the meat had cartalige pieces. Just don't expect that.  Stick to the starters.. skip the mains. No desi chai available either.

title: world class !
comment: one of the best Indian food around, amazing food! loved it, tastefully decorated great service top notch food!! will be back soon for more.

title: Best Lamb Saag
comment: Wow. Really good decor, friendly staff but most importantly amazing food. This has to be one of the best flavoured Lamb Saag I have had. And I have had plenty.  I would highly recommend this place and look forward to coming back soon !!

title: Overrated
comment: I think this place is trying to be something it's not. Looking at the restaurant it has a great vibe and atmosphere, looks classy and elegant not like your standard Indian in the area. So I give it marks for that however the food just doesn't live up to standard, I believe it's trying to be too Modern and it just doesn't work for me. I thought it would be like the Southall Madhus a little more rustic and home like. Although i like the setting the food was a disappointment.

title: Brilliant Restaurant
comment: What a superb restaurant. We enjoyed a memorable meal here with some work colleagues. The food was sensational, everything we ate was delicious. The service and staff were exceptional. We will definitely be back, thoroughly enjoyed everything.

title: First time in an Indian restaurant
comment: The decor was fantastic. The food was delicious. The staff was friendly and helpful on food suggestions I would give this a 5 stars except there was a family group next to us and the kids were loud and standing on the seats and running all over. I know it's not the restaurants responsibility to discipline kids but someone needed to coral these kids!

title: Very good Indian
comment: Staying in the hotel, indian restaurant was a bonus, just about to tuck in to a medly of tandoori dishes, smells great, looking good, tastes better, give it a go

title: Great starters, average mains!
comment: The restaurant itself, as a venue, is a lot classier than other local Indian counterparts; in layout, service, table settings and location.  The starters were, in my opinion, amazing! The chicken and lamb kebabs from the grill were cooked to perfection - charred in the right way but still tender and flavourful. The paneer had the taste of grilled halloumi (that's a compliment!) and the papdi chaat was also very good.  The mains however, were average. They were on par with offerings from more local, more reasonably priced restaurants. The murg chicken had an overpowering taste of cardamon and the lamb on the bone only had one piece of lamb with the marrow in it. Desserts were very nice and I strongly recommend the kulfi which was presented very well. It was our number 1 choice out of the 3 desserts we tasted.  If I could complain it would be about the following 3 things: Parking in the hotel is busy, but mainly because they have chosen to block off 20 or so spaces with boards for whatever reason. They didn't allow us to take away the leftover mains - of which there were plenty! I've paid for it, so it's beyond me that they couldn't put it in a box. Late into our meal, a table of 4 people were let in despite being dressed in football shirts and one of the gentlemen had a vest on. They proceeded to make an awful racket and ruined the end of our meal. If you're going to dress the restaurant to be classy, then expect the same from your customers.

title: Friendly and good food
comment: I was searching for a place to eat and checked the menu and thought hmm ok I'll give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised how friendly the staff and owner was and the food was really good and good value for money as well. Will definitely go again.

title: Always perfect
comment: I stay on bath road quite a bit and have dined in Madhu's many times. The menu is simple because everything they do is excellent. I recommend the salmon Tika as stater and even the aubergine salad is amazing. Flavours which remind me of India! Thank you Madhu's.

title: Upmarket Curry House with a twist
comment: Very yummy yet expensive curry house. Only downside was after over ordering, as often my other half does while hungry with the menu, we were told we could NOT take any of the food we ordered, eventually paid for but were too full to eat - away. We were told "This is a Sheraton policy". I have been to other Sheraton restaurants and had take away. Shame, left a bad taste in our mouths yet not from the food. Whatever you order make sure you'd be able to eat it all there and then at the table - it won't be allowed to leave the restaurant with you!

title: Incredible Dining Experience!
comment: We were skeptical at first,had heard mixed reviews. However, the young lady at the front "read" our approach and quickly asked if we had any questions for her before we made a decision to dine. While she was asking, she pulled out a menu and while describing choices, she discreetly allowed us to see prices, and informed us the portion were ample size should we choose to share. Prices appeared to be fair considering the atmosphere and location. We decided to try an appetizer......WOW!!! from the moment we sat, until our last after dinner aperitif we were astounded. Not only the quality if the food, but quality of service; from every one of our attendants! Especially Naz and Ali. We were educated, not only on the foods, but the history and care going into this marvelous restaurant. My husband and I shared 2 starters that were fabulous...we could have stopped there because we were full, but it was so good we continued. Ordered an entree, and shared it, then HAD to try dessert. By the time we finished: 2 starters,1 entree, 2 desserts, 2 after dinner alcoholic drinks AND a bottle of wine, our bill was $92.....we were pleasantly shocked...we sat there for almost 2 hrs enjoying food and great company of the staff...We will definitely make this a regular stop when we return to London.

title: High End Indian Dining
comment: Had an amazing evening - King prawns, and salmon were fantastic, the samosa's looked completely different to what i'm normally used to but OMG they delivered - I could have eaten them all evening. We had a large selection of starters cant fault any one of them. When the mains came I was stuffed so didn't try much of them although I did have the lamb curry which was flavoursome - very tasty. Love indian food - go for the experience

title: Worst food Ever
comment: After seen ad on tv decided to visit restaurant i must say i had the worst food ordered the lamb chops which didn't have any flavour, the Biraney no taste , avoid this restaurant if you can as the price dont match the quality of the food . Wont go naver again.

title: Amazing
comment: Staying overnight at the hotel we decided we might as well have a curry although were surprised that the Sheraton Hotel had an Indian but WOW it is amazing. One of the best Indian restaurants I have been in. The decor is plush, smart and expensive, very classy. The staff are beautiful in their uniforms and very helpful. The menu is very different, it felt very authentic Indian and not the regular 'take away' stodgy. Delicious everything and good value. A selections of Curries, rice, bread and beer for two people was £42 with service. I would travel to eat here even if not staying in the hotel it is that good.

title: Great food with good ambience
comment: Well cooked and well served, making it a great experience. Highly recommend the lamb chops and Jhinga (prawns) achaari as starters.

title: Great start to our holiday
comment: Staying at the Sheraton before catching a flight, we spotted Madhu's and decided to give it a try. Absolutely brilliant, fabulous food, very good service and you could clearly see that a lot of local people also use it, particularly for celebrations. Reasonably priced for a four star airport hotel, we'll be back.

title: Yummy airport village food
comment: Better than expected for hotel restaurant food. Nice extensive menu. Great service. Reasonable prices. Great option if you want a nice meal in London on a short layover. Easy even if your not staying right at the Sheraton...we walked from a different hotel in the area, no problem

title: Dinner for my wife's 40th
comment: We love this restaurant. Madhu's Indian food quality with a Japanese twist.  The menu is faultless, everything is made with great care and tastes amazing.  Highly recommended. A little pricey, but with every penny.  Oh, and, make sure you get your parking at the Sheraton validated by the restaurant.

title: Excellent Quality
comment: Conveniently located inside our hotel. Many Indian visitors which tells a story. Scampi and lamb chop were our fantastic. Very tasty and well spiced. We will definitely come again!

title: Excellent
comment: Surprisingly good even my three children enjoyed it mihaela service was excellent. We would love to visit again next time we are traveling and staying over.

title: Let down
comment: Our meal at Madhu's was average at best. The restaurant is crowded however the staff are helpful and attentive. It does get noisy, so avoid this place if you are looking for a quiet dine in option. Prices are reasonable considering this is London, however the biriyani and the mutton dish highly recommended by the staff were a let down. We live in the Netherlands (with barely any Indian dining options) and were looking forward to this place. Bland and rushed in is the best way to describe the dishes. I'm hoping there is more to this place than what we experienced on our visit.

title: Excellent Restaurant
comment: This restaurant was fantastic. Service was friendly and attentive and the food was amazing. Highly recommend.

title: Great Food
comment: On my family visit we all enjoyed the food and service. We ordered a variety of different dishes which were all cooked to perfection

title: So Delicious!
comment: While staying overnight at the Sheraton Skyline Hotel we luckily found Madhu's restaurant right in the hotel. Both my husband & myself were longing for some good Indian food as the places in central London were, surprisingly, very disappointing. We didn't have high hopes of having a great meal but boy, were we pleasantly surprised. Every dish we had was absolutely delicious. Staff was very friendly & attentive. Go. You won't regret it.

title: Excellent food
comment: Really impressed excellent food specially starter. Excellent service from staff.Will go again soon......

title: Excellent food
comment: The food was superb. Everything tasted great and fresh. The only downside is that it is too noisy and crowded. I would say it's ideal for bigger groups and families. if you are looking for a quieter, more private evening, this will not do. but great experience for us as we were a bigger group.

title: Expensive - lack of choice
comment: Don't get me wrong - flavours are fantastic, however lacks the basics, korma, curry, onion bhaji's to name but a couple. Isn't cheap either.

title: Exceptional Indian Cuisine
comment: I have travelled throughout India on many occasions and this is by some way the best Indian meal I have had outside of the country. It's a first class dining room, excellent attentive staff and the food is as good as the Bukhara at the ITC Sheraton in Delhi (which is as good as it gets, so that's a big recommendation). Well done to all involved in producing such an excellent product!!

title: I would certainly recommend it, and if it was closer to home I would want to go back.
comment: We were staying at the Sheraton on way to the US overnight and fancied something different so we went to Madhu's Indian Restaurant within the hotel. When we first went in it was really quiet and it’s a big restaurant, but as the evening went on it filled up. It is clearly a restaurant that the local Indian community use which is always a good sign. The food was excellent, authentic and delicately spiced. The service was also great and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal. The only thing I would mention as this is an expensive restaurant, I think the quality of the food warrants the prices but may be a surprise to some. I would certainly recommend it, and if it was closer to home I would want to go back.

title: Ms Raburn
comment: Better than anything ai have ever tasted in States or elsewhere! Reasonable prices. Mr Sheddy was very pleasant like all the staff there

title: Awesome Indian food
comment: I had one of the best samosas and aloo chaat that you can find anywhere ! Service was quick and courteous. Food was delicious and pure north Indian. We had kadhi, lamb kebabs, pulao, naan, dal makhani and it was amazing !

title: If you enjoy good Indian cuisine, then this is the place to eat.
comment: The restaurant is situated within the Sheraton Skyline. The decor is beautiful. The staff were very attentive and polite. My husband is a very fussy eater but he ordered and very pleasantly surprised. The entrees were delicious and the other dishes that we ordered were to die for. I would highly recommend this restaurant, if you like Indian food and appreciate cleanliness and good service then this is definitely the place to eat.

title: Good dinner
comment: Service was quick Food was good. Restaurant was near and clean.  Portions were average size. Kids enjoyed the butter chicken and garlic naan.

title: Expected bettet
comment: This place was highly recommended. The restraunt has good ambiance. Starters were ok. Big portions so suggest go 1 between 2 for starters. Mains were average at best, poor cuts of chicken used in mains. Allow £50 per head with drink. Can do better

title: Wonderful restaurant!
comment: My family and I stayed at the Sheraton Skyline for one night before going on our British Isles cruise. I chose this hotel because it looked very nice AND because it had an Indian restaurant which I knew my family would love. Usually airport hotels aren't great. We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel, but definitely for Madhu's. This restaurant has beautiful decor; the staff was very nice and the food was above average. My family of 9 had a wonderful dinner at Madhu's and if I lived locally, I would love to go more often. I'm so glad we chose this hotel so we could enjoy such a wonderful meal! Thanks for the great dinner experience Madhu's!

title: Tasty Indian, hotel prices
comment: Came from the Marriott next door for dinner. Food was pretty good! Garlic naan, chicken in a good sauce, and biryani which was a bit bland. Overall pretty tasty though a little on the pricey side. Would return

title: Great food and ambience
comment: Located inside Sheraton Skyline, this is indeed a lovely restaurant for business or private gatherings. Despite having no reservation, our party of 6 was seated fairly quickly. Excellent choice of fayre ... Murg tikka and Nyamah Choma for starters. The chicken tikka was delicious but the lamb chops were exceptionally tasty. We ordered baingan bharta, kaali daal, kadhai prawns, tilapia fish curry and nalli gosht with some roomali rotis for mains. There was much delay in getting the main course and we saw others who had arrived much later than us getting served earlier. After few reminders the food was served. The dishes were quite tasty. Hence not deducting a star for the delay.

title: Fantastic food
comment: I stayed at Sheraton Skyline with family during my birthday weekend. On our first night, I have noticed the amount of people dining at Madhu's so we decide to try it the next next. The restaurant was very nicely decorated. The staff were very helpful. They were fully booked but upon knowing that we were hotel guests, they managed to accommodate us. Food were reasonably priced and amazingly good. I thoroughly enjoyed the Nalli Gosht. I would certainly recommend this restaurant.

title: Excellent Service
comment: Excellent service, good food and a nice atmosphere for a hotel restaurant. Quite mean on the wine servings by the glass though which just took the edge off the experience, but overall would recommend.

title: Wonderful Indian style food
comment: the restaurant provides good reason for travellers moving in and out of Heathrow airport to stay at the Skyline Hotel

title: Excellent!
comment: Brilliant service, lovely wine and the food was absolutely divine! The waiting staff couldn't do enough to help, lovely atmosphere and would highly recommend! Look forward to returning!

title: Excellent!!!
comment: We hit the jackpot. We had to stay one night at the Marriott next door before we flew out and thought we would be stuck with a lousy airport hotel meal. We found this restaurant on trip advisor. We loved it!! The food was amazing. The service was excellent. When we arrived at 6pm, they asked if we had a reservation because they were full. They got us a table so we were lucky.

title: Best Indian Food in a Long Time!
comment: While we can get good Indian food in Canada - Vj's in Vancouver is exceptional - quality Indian food is not very common. That's why Madhu's at the Sheraton Skyline Hotel on Bath Rd at Heathrow is such a great find. Rich luscious sauces, just right spiced lamb curry and the most succulent chicken tikka we had ever had - fantastic food. But there is more. The service was thoughtful and skillful, the menu enticing and the atmosphere magical. We were en route to Italy and needed an overnight stay at the Skyline - my favorite hotel on the Heathrow strip - and we're delighted to find this Indian treasure. Now we may see the Skyline as a destination in itself, since the food was so good. Exceptional cuisine served with elegance and style.

title: Excellent
comment: The food and the service were of a very high level. Would certainly go again when flying from Heathrow

title: Excellent Indian food and great service
comment: Recently had dinner at Madhu´s Heathrow during a stay at the Sheraton Skyline and very much enjoyed the food. The mini-papadums with various dips were fantastic, the appetizer (a filled potato dumpling with yoghurt sauce) was outstanding and so was the curry I had as a main. Service was very friendly and fast. Great design with two private rooms as well. I would for sure be back if I am in the area again.

title: Simply delicious
comment: Wow....we visited last night for dinner. First time for me. I can honesty say it was the best Indian food that I have eaten outside of India....chicken appetisers were delicious and my favourite dish 'Dal Makhani' was simply to die for. Definitely will return. Great ambience, beautiful decor and great, friendly service :-))

title: Best Indian food and Service
comment: Came here for my wife's birthday. Service immaculate beyond 5 stars. Food beyond quality. Whole atmosphere from service cycle start to finish is outstanding !! I would pay the price to come here again and again!!!

title: Great fresh food !
comment: Without question the best cafe in Beckenham. The food and drink selection is fantastic and always very fresh and well presented. Carl and his staff are always friendly and welcoming. Their coffee is the best.  I'm often found here working and am proud to call it my second office!

title: Good food and excellent ambience
comment: Been here a few times, and cannot complain about the food which has always been top notch.  The service is excellent too.  The prices are are slightly on the upper end, but reasonable and reflect the brilliant décor inside. Very good if you want to impress someone on lunch or dinner.

title: Welcome surprise
comment: While staying quickly overnight at LHR I was at the Sheraton Skyline hotel. I knew there was an American bar with basic food there so I was headed that way when I saw a sign for Madhu's. I didn't know what kind of food it was, but was very excited to learn it was Indian cuisine. Wow!!! The food was exceptional. For the Americans out there (and anyone else for that matter) who are not aware of the delights of Indian food this is a must try. While not the healthiest of options I could not resist the butter chicken dish. It was simply delicious. Great service, really good mojito (I know it's an odd pairing) and good wine. Give this place a try. I will stay at the Sheraton just to eat here again.

title: Nothing Special
comment: Decided to try this restaurant as it had been recommended to us. I called Madhus Heathrow to request a booking for 2 people on a Saturday evening, upon calling the receptionist said they had no tables available for our requested time, I then searched on Open Table for restaurants in the Heathrow area and strangely Madhus were showing availability on the exact time/date that we had called previously and asked for, so I then booked successfully online. We got to the restaurant on time and the receptionist said our table was not ready and would be 5 mins..........15 minutes later we are still standing by the door waiting to be seated, she said they were getting our table ready and I could see from where we were standing that the table was nearly ready, when another couple walk in and the 2nd receptionist gave our table to them. We were stunned; this in our opinion was really unprofessional. We then waited for them to set another table up this was in the middle of the dining room and not very comfortable but we had to settle for it as it was nearly gone past 9pm. 2 things in our opinion did not make sense, when you call them to book they say there is no availability when there clearly was on Open Table, and the lack of communication amongst the staff, had the first receptionist liaised with the 2nd one then she would have known we had a table booked and the first table ready should have been given to us.  Food is average; we ordered the chicken tikka which was barely warm so we could tell it had been just sitting around waiting to be served, the other dishes were ok. If you decide to dine here, note that the portion sizes are generous so only order what you can eat as they will not allow you to take away any left over’s, which was for us a complete waste of food and money.  Service was below average. I read a previous diners review saying ‘this is one of the best Indian restaurants in London. A fantastic five star dining experience’. In our opinion it is a busy Heathrow Airport restaurant with high prices, definitely NOT a 5 star dining experience...... I doubt we will be returning here.

title: Great service and good food!
comment: Although we had to wait half an hour for a table for two, the service at this restaurant was great! The food was also very tasty and reasonably priced as well!

title: Superb - try it if you get a chance
comment: Part of the Madhu's chain , the team here look after you and serve great food.  This is quality curry which is enhanced with excellent attentive service. I always look forward to returning to this hotel and restaurant

title: Fantastic Meal
comment: Wonderful food, very flavoursome and tasty. The food is served beautifully and the service is attentive but not over the top. Great cocktails as well. Free poppadoms and dips whilst your review the menu.

title: Good food,bit pricey, silly policy on taking food away
comment: My wife and I had a nice meal there this evening although one of the starters was very salty. Explained to the waitress that it was too salty so we could not eat it and they still charged for it but removed it once I complained. I requested if we could take the food we could not eat since I had paid for it. The manager gave some lame excuse that Sheraton does not allow it as somebody might claim against Sheraton if the food causes a problem and they had mentioned it on their website. For the prices they charge, this seems a silly policy.

title: Worth going out of your way for!
comment: I have been a long standing customer of the original madhus. I was keen to try this restaurant. I may be bias as I grew up going to madhus and they catered for my wedding, however, I'm a foodie and being indian I was dubious about what this addition to the madhus family would offer - if anything.  I was incredibly pleasantly surprised. The menu is refreshing it centres on dishes from the grill - which is focal to the restaurant. The food was superb and different from their flag ship. It was the best indian meal I had had in a long time. Genuinely fresh, well prepared and considered food that really is different. The grill items really are worth trying. The chicken tikka, lamb chops, sheekh kebabs and vegetables are excellent. The naans were fantastic all fresh and well balanced.  The mains though not grill focused were truly great. They were unique tasting to their original restaurant and they had a depth of flavour that met up to the quality of the grill / starter course. Very impressive indeed.  The service is good. A cut above your average local restaurant. All in all madhus Heathrow gets my thumbs up. I will go again, I will tell others and you should go too. You will not be disappointed. Well done madhus.

title: Was just about average
comment: Stuck in a traffic we decided to abandon an orignal plan and hopped into Madhus at the Sheraton Skyline , bath road. Carrying its reputation from its Sothhall outlet was a let down. Limited menu and not very efficient service. But enjoyed the meal in any case.

title: Best Indian restaurant I have eaten in
comment: Beautiful decor fantastic food real authentic cuisine...a true delight of a find I would stay at the Sheraton just to eat here........large portions so be careful not to over order the squid stuffed with salmon was a first all served beautifully it's a real family affair plenty of birthday parties with t h children around 6 pm but if you want more grown up book later..well worth a visit and the appetizers of dips were gorgeous....

title: Do not over order, you can't take it home.
comment: Food was good, however do not over order as you can't take it with you. Very frustrating as we definitely over ordered. Management need to change there policy.

title: For an Airport Hotel this was an excellent meal. Great start to our holiday.
comment: We were incredibly and pleasantly surprised to find such a good Indian restaurant at an airport. We had an excellent meal - every item tasted of the different spices not, as sadly in many Indian restaurants, just the same sauce ladled over everything but the meat had obviously been properly marinated. One of the best Indian meals we have had outside India. Service very good indeed. We would go back.

title: Disappointed
comment: Got invited for a treat and had great expectations but felt let down. No taste, flavours, so left with great deal of disappointment.

title: Not a normal airport hotel restaurant......
comment: I understand why most of us are always wary of airport hotels but this place defies that and is worth a visit despite/regardless of the proximity to Heathrow.  Excellent service and decor instantly set it apart as an Indian restaurant as opposed to a "curry house". Wide and varied menu, with creative dishes . If an a group, ask to see set menu options, plentiful dishes and a great way to sample the delicious and unusual choices.  Everything feels fresh and bespoke.  Nice place to go.

title: Amazing food
comment: We been invited by chef preet tandi. We use to eat his food in nobu london. We visited on a busy Saturday night and enjoyed the theatre of top quality indian cuisine. The cocktails were a great start to the meal, and although enjoyed everything we ate, I thoroughly recommend the tandoori quail and robata chop which was outstanding! The staff were very knowledgeable and helpful regarding any questions about food . Thank you preet will see you soon....

title: Better than I expected
comment: The robata grilled food was excellent, particularly the butterfly king prawns and lamb cutlets! I would recommend that you avoid the scallop and asparagus dish as the scallops are absolutely tiny. I asked the server to request for the chef to make the food as mild as possible and I found everything to be great. The servers were all great with very friendly service and excellent advice on choice of dishes. The decor and ambiance of the restaurant was also very nice. Remember to collect SPG points from the front desk for the meal as it's within a SPG hotel (Sheraton)!

title: Excellent food and service. 5 star
comment: Great food and service. Visited the restaurant with family for a birthday, on a Saturday was fully packed and the service was 5star. The manager Vinod and the team know how to treat customers. Food was amazing, starter Lamb chops and Prawns are a must. Portions are great and filling. Main course was amazing everything had an amazing fresh taste. All the meat and chicken is nice and healthy tastes and spices are great. Ambience and decor is nice and relaxing. Cutlery m and crookery is very high quality. Would recommend Madhus Heathrow as one of the best Indian restaurants in London. A fantastic five star dinning experience.

title: Indian Delight
comment: Tried Madhu's on a whim and found an Indian delight - situated in the Sheraton Skyline this is a bright spacious quality Indian with excellent and friendly staff Menu is large and reads well and contains a mix of well known dishes with some new combinations - something for everyone. On seating they bring you some mini popadoms with three sauces - very tasty and worryingly addictive  Two of us dining - one Sheekh Kebab and one Jhinga Achiari Prawn butterfly style chargrilled - both from the Robata Grill 4 kebabs and 3 prawns - very nicely done and presented and tasty  Mains were Murg Makhini tandoori chicken with creamy sauce and Nalli Gosht - lamb and their signature dish - one potion of lovely Pilau rice - their advice  Washed down with a well priced Pinot Grigio and some draft beer  Highly recommend - very good fun lovely service and on the night we were there - good number of diners  Well recommend this for a visit - makes an Airport hotel stop a more enjoyable one

title: Fantastic Indian food
comment: The Indian food here is excellent. As good as anything I have had in India. Service is Ok, and price is reasonable.

title: Indian Tapas
comment: Excellent food , efficient service with a smile. Book to be sure as many locals eat here too. Inventive and varied menu. Good price for London airport hotel.

title: Dissapointed
comment: Used to enjoy popping in for lunch, as the food is nice and the staff usually quite pleasant. However, last time we visited they got the omelettes wrong, didn't add cheese and they were quite overcooked and rubbery. I didn't eat the meal and told the waitress there were no cheese in our omelette (she couldn't care less). When I paid I mentioned it to the member of staff at the till and she was quite rude and obviously took umbrage, I was surprised at her reaction as it was totally unexpected, instead of apologising she was very negative. I paid in full and left, never to return. OK when things are good but beware of there being a problem! NOT recommended!

title: Mrs Lahmamsi
comment: Yet again I have visited rendezvous caffe with my friend for breakfast and I can easily confirm this is my favourite spot in Beckenham .  Highly recommend their scrambled eggs with smoked salmon and avocado

title: Best cafe in beckenham
comment: The food comes nice and quick, top quality amazing taste. The staff who work here are extremely nice and polite. I come here every Saturday for lunch.

title: Pleasant food but poor customer service
comment: We used Madhu's as our caters for our reception and it wasn't bad seeing as my husband selected them. So I was keen to see how the food would be at the restaurant. From the moment, I walked in I loved the decor and the chairs it was beautiful and the starters we amazing too. They were unusual and tasty for an Indian menu but the mains were a little over average.  I wasn't too keen on the dal makani it wasn't extra amazing and when we asked for a doggy bag, we got the dal wrapped in aluminium foil with no tub, which was disappointing, as I ended up throwing it in the bin when I got home. It's definitely not hygienic to wrap food up in just the foil. When we asked for the unfinished food to be packed to avoid wastage, we were told that they don't offer this service, which is strange as what does actually happen to the food?  I would recommend that Madhu's should rethink their food wastage strategy and offer tubs for customers to take food home, if unfinished like us. I mean after all they are 5 star and do produce good quality food, so why do they let themselves down on customer service?

title: Work Christmas Party
comment: For our Christmas Party this year there were thirty of us and we were treated to a special menu at Madhu's. Very good and authentic food, beautifully spiced and full of flavour. A very good standard of service by the pleasant staff.

title: No Doggy Bags!
comment: I recently visited Madhu's and as normal ordered way too much food. The curries were OK but over priced. I was totally appalled when I asked the staff to box up one of the untouched curries to take home. Apparently it's not restaurant policy and has to be thrown away!! How totally ridiculous!! In this day and age when most companies are trying to reduce food waste, Madhu's actively encourage it!! Shame on you.

title: Team night out
comment: A great restaurant with a good selection. Staff very good and welcoming. The food was of a very good quality and the right amount.  Would definitely go again.

title: 5* food and service
comment: Just visited for the second time . Had organise a meal for 30 clients .The food is the best Indian I have tasted in London. We went for the Christmas menu and were not disappointed.Several starter courses , main and dessert .Great variety to suit all tastes including vegetarian options for a couple of our guests . The whole event from booking to the serving was managed impeccably by Vinod. He has a great team working for him and nothing was too much trouble for them.Would recommend to anyone for quality food and service . Will hopefully be booking again for our clients for next year .

title: Great option for stay at airport
comment: We chose to stay at the Sheraton Skyline before our flight the next am because we wanted to try the Indian cuisine here. Excellent service. We were seated immediately and, although our table was at a slightly awkward angle, the staff was very attentive and polite. We had the Aloo Tikka appetizer, Murg, Punjab Kadi, and a few of the breads. Everything was great, especially the chicken dish. Beautiful atmosphere as well.

title: A Nice Meal with Good Service
comment: We were staying at the hotel and ate here as we wanted something more formal. The service was prompt and attentive and the food very nice. It was a reasonable experience and one we would repeat when next at the hotel.

title: Delicious Food & Great Service
comment: The Biryani & Butter Chicken are a must. The restaurant Manager ( The Lady was dressed in Black ) & Ali in particular are great hosts & will advise you on the qy=uantity to order. Just leave it to Ali & he will take care of you.  Long story short....Above standard !! Thanks a lot Ali !

title: A Wonderful Restaurant (in a Hotel!)
comment: We have visited Madhu’s Heathrow location several times. Every time the food was memorable. The special grill made gorgeous starters and entrees. The classic Indian favorites were fresh, obviously prepared with care and memorable.  Two notes: the service is variable. I’m not a perfectionist, so having someone learn on my visit is fine. But others might be less tolerant. And this is a family restaurant. So there are kids around, some taught to share a public space, some taught little about how to navigate eating with other’s thoughtfully. That was a bit more difficult.  But we will go again happily, look for seating in a quieter corner and enjoy the excellent meal!

title: Perfect for a date!
comment: Authentic Indian food, excellent service, beautiful and romantic ambiance. A MUST try restraunt.  The only down side is if you have left overs they don't give it take away. But the food is value for money.

title: A weekday visit
comment: Back here for the first time since August, made a booking but there really wasn’t any need as Monday night and plenty of tables available.  Service was good however at times over kill as they weren’t busy we had waiters and waitresses coming over every couple of minutes asking if we were ready to order not knowing who was supposed to be looking after our table. Didn’t enjoy the starters but the mains, saag lamb and Daal Makhanhi were top notch with garlic naan

title: SUPERB RESTAURANT
comment: My wife and I used the restaurant during our stay at the hotel. The service and food were both outstanding and we had an excellent evening. Will certainly eat here again.

title: Do it
comment: I've been here 3 times. The robata grill is phenomenal - I can't choose between the king prawns and the lamb, so I get both. The service is great, everyone attentive and friendly. Last time I booked at the Skyline just so I could eat here.  I'm shocked it's not rated higher!

title: Great cafe
comment: Rendezvous has excellent staff and food plight and very helpful and friendly very clean every dish is perfect

title: A nice surprise
comment: The night before our flight we were not particulary looking for an Indian meal but as the restuarant was in the hotel we went for it. Very pricey and we were in a part of the room that did not have much atmosphere however the food was fantastic. Great way to start the holiday.

title: Good Biryani
comment: Though the serving of the Biryani was smaller than expected it was well worth the purchase and meat was tender and spices were perfect for both the lamb and the chicken entrees.

title: Excellent service, ambience plus good food
comment: We went to Madhu's for my wife's birthday. Children enjoyed the mocktails very much. Though, the food and dessert options were limited, the food was really tasty. The service was excellent. We were served by Ms Harman. She was very polite, friendly, hospitable and looked after us very well. Clearing the tables and bringing the fresh plates for each course of meal was very prompt. The ordered items were served very quickly.  The ambience is excellent. Another thing I liked, unlike other restaurants, the table for 4 was very specious. All of were sitting very comfortably without rubbing our shoulders with each other.    Overall very pleased with my visit. Will surely go there again.

title: excellent service and tasty food
comment: excellent service and tasty food, the waiter was very efficient polite and helpful, the food was delicious and price was fair. I thought was quite an honest restaurant.

title: Mother's Day Brunch
comment: My husband and I have been regular diners at Madhu's for years and they even catered at our wedding in 2011.  We attended their Mother's Day Brunch yesterday (something they have never done before) and it was lovely. The food was delicious as ever, the service was beyond impeccable and we couldn't have asked for a better ambience. We had our two children with us so it's very child friendly and is my go to restaurant for any special occasion or celebration.  The staff are very friendly and polite and did whatever they could to make us feel welcome. A perfect Mother's Day. Madhu's is always a winner in my eyes!

title: Good food and servcie but too expensive for kids and family on Mother's Day
comment: It was a very well organised lunch in Sheraton skyline. The service was very attentive and professional. Food was also good. It worked perfectly as a brunch concept. Liked the attentiveness of the Manager Mr Vinod, supervisor Ali and the server Cajetan. The entire family enjoyed except the fact that we had two kids of 7 years age and we had to pay £60 for both of them which was a rip-off

title: The best coffee in Beckenham...
comment: This place is just the best place in Beckenham for coffee. It's way better than the chains. Their latte is easily the best in Beckenham. If you fancy a bite to eat I would totally recommend it. Great salads, great paninies and sandwiches. Oh and the breakfast is also good. The price is very competitive. It's a must visit cafe if you need a coffee or a bite to eat. One more thing, they make the best smoothies.

title: Great food!
comment: Rendezvous Caffe is awesome! Food is always freshly prepared with quality ingredients. The staff are always friendly and everything is served with a smile. Highly recommend!

title: The grill is superb
comment: I have visited this restaurant twice in the last week. Each time I came back a happy man. The service is very friendly, quick and helpful, ambient atmosphere and food extremely tasty. One must say I preferred the taste of the grill rather than the curries - chicken tikka and lamb chop were out of the world. One one occassion we took the set menu which I find overpriced but if you go ala carte, I think the prices are pretty reasonable by London standards. Unfortunately, only open for dinner

title: Very Nice Restaurant at the Airport
comment: This is a beautiful restaurant with a great atmosphere, very good food, particularly the lamb chops, and the service is attentive not over bearing. I had Punam as my waitress and she was very good, always checking to see if I needed anything and if my food was OK. Just enough attention not invasive. The food was brough out at a good pace. Good place for a business type dinner as it was not too loud. As I said in my title, this is a great restaurant if you are staying at the airport overnight.

title: Nothing To Shout About!!!
comment: Firstly I am trying to working out whether all the reviewers who have given this establishment a 5 star rating are related to the owner or never tried Indian food! I don't know which?? We booked a table for 30 people for a 50th Anniversary on the recommendation by a previous patron, now I understand that he has never paid for a meal personally and its on his expense account! The whole group could not be seated on 1 table so we ended up on 2 tables side by side....NOT ideal. Bearing in mind part of the group 5 had flown in from the USA & India we wanted a "wow" factor for the venue, to be fair it was that, but what let it down was the food, service & price The food was mediocre at best nothing to shout about at all have been to "Dhaba" style restaurants literally down the road in Hounslow who serve better quality food at half the price. Little do the hotel guests or those in the surrounding hotels know that a simple bus ride away in Hounslow you have the choice of all the Indian restaurants you could have, if you are more adventurous Southall, the home of the curry in the UK is a 20/30 min bus journey away!!  Try KARACHI EXPRESS situated on Bath Road Hounslow West (10mins away) but my fave THE ROYAL ALBION on Hibernia Road, Hounslow (20mins) this is a pub/Indian restaurant VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED  Initially we were told that the meat served at Madhu's was NOT halal and on arrival we were told that it WAS (the meat eaters in our group do not eat halal) so after the table fiasco this was another blow. The Saag Paneer was the most bland I have ever tasted as was the gobi & Dal makani, the only thing that tasted good was the chilli/garlic nan, The Salmon & Prawn starters were excellent and that was the only good food that they served us (but Pricey)!!!  The food price was shocking, you would have thought we were in Central London!! The end bill was nearly £900 we had 3 variety of starters & 5 choices for the main course ALL veggie. The "raita" portion was barely enough for 1 person, was £4.50 even though we ordered 4-5 everyone took one spoonful. When we ordered more rice, nan & tandoori roti it arrived after all the main course dishes were finished. This was the fault of the management and I do not blame the single waiter that served us, he was busy dealing with other tables.......surely if you have a large group there should be at least 1 waiter/waitress ring fenced to deal with the group especially when you have to take drink orders for 30 people as soon as he had finished taking the orders, the first lot had already finished their drinks and need a refill. Rather than have gone on the recommendation I should have in hindsight gone with my wife and tried the food first before committing to the booking....a mistake that won't happen again. I wanted to give it a fair star rating as my parents enjoyed the evening and the bill was not as much as I had initially thought even though there were a few members of the group ordering beer & wine but you have to bear in mind we did not order the meat dishes which cost more!! The manager (without us asking) gave us a 10% discount probably because of the table/seating issue. I would NOT recommend Madhu's & would not dine here again!! PROS: Nice setting, Free parking CONS: Food, Price, Service, dealing with large groups!

title: Took visiting friends...
comment: Different experience to many Indian restuarants... From memory different menu e.g. no bhajis and different options to usual. Nice to be able to see the cooking, impressive. Too pricey tho... Over £100 for 4. Some of the accompanying dishes were overpriced for sure.

title: This is my all time favourite restaurant
comment: Great food and awesome ambience. Place is not cheap of course but it’s worth the experience. I go here on special occasions and otherwise as well for a nice Indian dinner!

title: Great Food!
comment: Booked into the Sheraton Skyline the night before our trip to Japan but didn't expect to find gourmet Indian food on the premises. Attentive, friendly service, wonderfully spiced and flavoursome food, not too detailed a menu but all perfectly prepared. My local just isn't going to come up to scratch after this. I mean, even the naan is extra special.

title: Great food, terrible service
comment: The food here is quite good and varied. Has just the right amount of spice. Unfortunately, the service is not good. We asked for water over and over. We had to walk back to the front to get menus.

title: England 2018
comment: This was my second visit to Madhu's Heathrom. My first visit was in 2016. Went back this time with my son and I had to go back. The staff was very attentive and the food again was 1st rate!

title: Great indian food
comment: Food was great and our waiter Franco was really good. Highly recommended for indian food lovers. Biryani is awesome

title: Disastrous ! ruined my late father's birthday celebration
comment: Ambience was good....the food was Terrible.....Murgh Malai chicken was Raw and smelling....Kebabs were cold.....peas Pulao was stale.....literally soaked in oil......rotis were not baked properly....
