The service was even worst (except for Claudio)..reserved a Table when landed no table reserved ....disrespectful behaviour by one waiter...don't care attitude....and much more. I have raised a formal complaint...... let's see ....

title: Absolutely amazing!!
comment: We stopped to check out the menu and the hostess told us we should reserve a table. Boy was she right. When we arrived for our reservation the place was hopping! We ordered the Samosas and Aloo Tikka for starters, both were incredible but the Aloo Tikka is an absolute don't miss. Entrees were vegetable dummplings and Murj chicken. Again both were amazing and we couldn't have been happier. This place is an absolute don't miss if you are in London!!!

title: Excellent food and service
comment: Food was really nice, and the service was excellent! Service was provided by ‘Franco’, he was so polite and kind, very hard working indeed!

title: Birthday Ruined !!!!!
comment: We had booked a table for 26 people they didn't tell us the booking would require us to be on 2 separate tables. We turn up to find out our group had been split, it ruined the evening. Manager blamed us and said we didnt specify, he wasn't understanding or empathetic. Food was mediocre, not worthy of the price. Won't be going there again. My Joint Birthday with my best friend was ruined and no compensation was provided either not even an apology. Bad customer service very disappointed.

title: Excellent hotel restaurant
comment: Located in the Sheraton Skyline Heathrow Hotel this restaurant serves very good Indian food - not just the typical butter chicken and tikka masala. Friendly staff as well.

title: Excellent Restaurant
comment: Visited here tonight with my parents, our waiter Franco was extremely friendly and attentive. The food was excellent, freshly prepared and very tasty. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and very relaxing. Would definitely return here and recommend you visit.

title: Nice place to eat
comment: It is a every nice place to come with family and friends. The service was lovely and the cook is really good at their job. I would love to come back and eat again here

title: Five stars !
comment: Lovely little cafe with great tasting food and welcoming staff, especially recommend the mushroom and spinach with poached eggs on sourdough.

title: Sunday Breakfast
comment: I always visit here whenever possible and am never disappointed. Had the granola pot with fresh yoghurt and fruit which was nicely presented and so enjoyable. Staff are always polite and great to talk to which all adds to a relaxed friendly welcoming atmosphere. Please give this lovely independent eatery a go as is more than your usual bulk standard cafe and you’ll be pleasantly surprised at the quality and price. Highly recommended.

title: The best cafe in town
comment: Everyday I come to this lovely and welcome cafe .,, Great coffee blend , very very friendly staff, Sam is always smiling , clean and bright, wide selection of breakfast and lunch, almost a second home for me... I recommend a visit ... then with just once you are hooked for life...

title: Excellent
comment: Lovely atmosphere very nice food kind staff recommended for breakfast great variety of dishes thank you.

title: Brunch Date
comment: A gem of a place! Great menu with lots of healthy options and priced exceptionally well. The food was cooked to perfection: I highly recommend the smashed avocado, poached eggs on sourdough toast from the healthy breakfast options. As for the Cannoli... simply sublime! All the above was topped off by the friendly and engaging staff and excellent service.  Definitely see myself becoming a regular here!

title: Enjoyable dining experience
comment: My wife and I stayed overnight at the Sheraton Skyline hotel before returning home from Europe. We hardly ever eat Indian food but Madhu's at the hotel is convenient. It is a richly appointed space, quite large and staffed by a large number of people. Our meal was delicious, helped out in our choices by our server, Franco. He was courteous and informative and we would certainly be sure to eat there again when we stay overnight at Heathrow. Fran and Joe Biscoglio Bronxville, NY

title: disappointing experience
comment: well, i was expecting a greaet experience given the madhus name, but was so disappointed, food was ok, but staff service was well below acceptable, but after complaint they did recoup some of their experience, however i doubt î will attend this venue in the future

title: Peppered crab claws - fantastic !
comment: A party of three -in addition to above had kebabs -lamb ribs -chops -chicken tandoori all very well prepared And served to a high standard -service good -however was disappointed with chicken curry and wild mushroom  Rice was not up to the standard I would visit again as good value

title: Great find
comment: So we stayed a night in the Sheraton Skyline en route to the US. We were tempted by the sports bar but decided to try Madhu’s for our evening meal mainly because it was full. Great decision because we had amazing food and great service from Franco. Definitely recommended

title: Fantastic Little Find!
comment: Stopped here by chance with my Mum and so glad we did. Had a lovely lunch and the hospitality was impeccable. Can’t wait to go back and try something else off the menu.

title: Amazing Place to Eat!
comment: I came in with my husband for breakfast and couldn’t fault it! Amazing food, the place was immaculately clean and the staff were so friendly and welcoming. I will definitely be going back and taking my children too.

title: Just Wow!
comment: Unbelievable food, great atmosphere with kind and friendly staff. Will definitely be returning and telling my friends about this great little find.

title: best cakes in Beckenham
comment: I regularly pop in and the service is always excellent, the menu is really good and they have the best cakes

title: Great food and service.
comment: I go there most days for coffee, tea and the best pain au raisin you will find. We also go there for a family brunch - food is top notch, great service and best eggs in beckenham. Thanks to Sam and team - many breakfast places in Beckenham - this is one of the best!!

title: Worth travelling to Heathrow to eat here!
comment: Beautiful decorated restaurant in the Sheraton Skyline hotel.  The maître-de was beautifully dressed in a traditional tunic and staff were smart in waistcoats and trousers.  The open robata grill gave proof that they acknowledge confidence In what they prepare - their turned out their food with pride and it was utterly delicious.  You can eat here - even if you aren’t staying at the hotel - and you can park here too ( for free!)  I was very impressed and look forward to coming to dine here again.

title: Great Dinner!
comment: We enjoyed a great dinner at Madhu's! Everything from the fresh juices, drinks, and food were amazing. Our waiter Franco was wonderful and very attentive!

title: Don’t be fooled. Simply fantastic
comment: Hotel Restaurant? Indian? I am so happy I did not let my preconceptions guide me, as I was quite surprised and deeply impressed; Kind, caring and attentive service, outstanding food (best Indian I’ve had in a very long time) and a cosy atmosphere. I will stay at this hotel when passing through Heathrow in the future so I can eat here. It tastes and feels like eating at my friends house. Thank you again for helping me turn a rough work day into a happy one

title: Delicious food. Attentive service
comment: This was my second dinner at Madhu’s restaurant at the Sheraton Skyline Heathrow. On both occasions, l was served by Punam (who remembered me from my first visit two months ago!). Punam was friendly, charming and attentive and helped me feel welcome and relaxed, especially as l was eating alone. Every dish l ordered was cooked to perfection, with subtle and delicate flavours prepared in an enchanting balance. Just when l thought l understood the dish, a flavour or fragrance would emerge to surprise me. No wonder Madhu’s is now my Indian cuisine restaurant of choice every time l spend a night at Heathrow before my intercontinental flights!

title: Lovely grub
comment: Been coming here for a few years now,staff are always friendly and food is always good,highly recommended

title: Tuna Toast
comment: I had a tuna toast and it was fantastic, staff are always lovely here. Always ready to help and provide you with healthy alternatives. Great cafe as always

title: Very friendly coffee shop
comment: Me and my wife visited the Rendez-vous cafe last weekend, both food and service were second to none. Thank you for your warm welcome.

title: Happy days
comment: Breakfasts are good service is great especially from the cockney lady she is super friendly and happy to please, the chef could learn how to do runnier eggs though..

title: Restaurant
comment: i arrive in caffe very welcome staff i order the full breakfast was nice really recommend look forward to go again. thanks for service

title: Morning
comment: Excellent place to have a quick breakfast with a quick and professional customer service. I really love having my breakfast there before the start of the working day, it is a bonus and tonus place...

title: Really friendly staff good food
comment: Went in on the off chance as my phone was low. Asked to charge my phone... The friendly service and freshly, well presented counters led me to get some lush falafel and a full English. And 2 coffees. All delicious. Nice vibe. Good to while some time away in.

title: Best ever
comment: The experience I had in this restaurant was absolutely amazing I had the best time there the hospitality was very nice the service was impeccable the food was perfect especially the lasagna I would recommend it to anyone

title: Happy customer
comment: This is my spot now . The place ticks every box for me... food...staff...reasonable prices...location...owner...and the list goes on .

title: Shame
comment: Food was actually very nice and the standards where as expected from this well known establishment. Service was lacking, shame given the setting and clearly an effort made on ambience. Very very silly policy of not being able to take away excess food. We over ordered to sample multiple dishes to find to had to leave it behind..........

title: food
comment: the breakfast buffet is good here and the staff was very accomodating. though the furniture in this restaurant needs to be updated.

title: Excellent food excellent service
comment: Absolutely amazing team always welcoming and the food is great best chief. The pasta dishes and cakes are to die for

title: ANOTHER GREAT EXPERIENCE
comment: Returned here a few times since last review and always thoroughly enjoy my visits. Had another lovely granola pot which was nicely presented and very tasty. As always Sam and his staff were very attentive and made my visit the more enjoyable. This great cafe deserves all its success and all the positive reviews are a testament to all the hard work the staff and owner put in - please support this fantastic eatery, you will not be disappointed

title: Beckenham’s Best!
comment: Rendez-Vous has quickly become Beckenham’s best & newest treasure. Conveniently located on the High Street, you can’t miss this gem of a place. From the moment you step in the cafè you’re made to feel right at home with the warm reception and cozy decor. The food choices are absolutely amazing in taste and price. One of my favourite dishes is the Moroccan pancakes. I love this place, and if you’re looking for a place where the customer service is as good as the food, I recommend you try Rendez-Vous, I guarantee you won’t be disappointed.

title: Stellar food, great service. This restaurant doesn’t disappoint..
comment: Staying next door at the Marriott, decide to change it up, go for Indian food. Wow! We’re not Indian food neophytes, but these guys kick it up. Great food, great service (thank-you Punam) and stellar beer (love the Cobra IPA) . Can’t go wrong

title: Very classy, very impressed!
comment: We were staying at the Sheraton for one night prior to flying off on holiday and decided to give this a try - what a totally unexpected bonus and pleasure. Everything about this restaurant was spot on - great atmosphere and decor, friendly and efficient service and superb, imaginative food. My wife and I shared 4 courses - scallops and asparagus, chicken tikka, portobello mushroom salad and mutter rice - and with drinks and service the total bill came to £52.25, which I thought was good value. Easily one of the best Indian/Asian cuisine restaurants I've been to.

title: Great grilled meat and fish
comment: A last minute booking with a friend whilst waiting for my wife's flight to land and I'm so pleased I tried this place. This is a busy and reasonably large restaurant with both traveller and locals in abundance. We were greeted by charming management and served very quickly. The menu is fairly small which is good and the recommendations were spot on. We had delicious chicken tikka, lamb ribs and giant prawns, seasoned perfectly. This was followed by their signature lamb dish on the bone and a murgh tikka. All fantastic and I am actually planning our next visit.

title: Nice food
comment: Went with friends on a Wednesday evening and it was busy which meant service was a bit slow to begin with but as the evening went on the service improved. The menu is not vast but what was on offer would suit most people. The food was delicious and the potions were good sized. Not too expensive given it’s location to Heathrow Airport. Worth a try if staying in or nearby the Sheraton Hotel

title: Friendly staff and quality healthy food
comment: Great friendly atmosphere for friends and family, fresh quality food, would definitely reccomend, menu is varied and has a variation to choose from,.

title: Amazingggggggg
comment: This place is the most amazing cafe I have ever been too there food is 5stars service wonderful pleasant friendly polite and a great place to eat feel comfortable and happy I was having a bad day .. but after going here it made my day , they sell all types of food which is a plus so will I eat here again ohhhhh yesssss

title: A great evening, wonderful service, phenomenal food
comment: I had a layover at Heathrow and booked a last minute hotel at the Sheraton. I wasn’t aware of Madhu’s, but I’ll be back. The restaurant is worth a visit all by itself. My waitress, Harman, provided incredible recommendations for drinks (try the Guavarita, do it), appetizer (the lamb chops were amazing), and for a tasty sampler dessert. I had garlic naan ( again, Harman’s excellent recommendation) and Madhu’s chicken tikka. It was wonderful. The environment was great. The food was reasonably priced. And the service was spot on. Check it!

title: Always good,food great,friendly staff
comment: The plCe ne er ceases to amaze me,it's so good even when is busy. SAM tbe new owner has such a good memory.he remembers everyone drinks ,the coffe shop was incredibly busy on sunday,sam managed to get us a table,kate was super friendly with the kids ,brilliant. Nice atmosphere,beutifull food .definetly going back again.thank you guys for your service ,keep it up

title: Pre flight meal
comment: Friends local to the area had suggested we eat here .... and they were not wrong. We were staying in the hotel & had previously booked a table.    It was a lovely evening. The welcome we received was a great start & we were given a choice of tables, which were attractively set.   The staff were friendly, prompt & informative, helping us to select just the right amount of food..... and what food it was! The pappadom appetiser was a surprising and excellent introduction of what was to come. I chose a starter & main from the robarta grill - the spices were enough to tingle the palate but not to excess.  The presentation of our food was outstanding & that seemed to be so for all the tables around us. A truly great restaurant & one we'll be returning to whenever we can.

title: A great little local cafe/restaurant
comment: I eat here probably 4 or 5 times a week, usually for a breakfast, and sometimes for a sandwich at lunchtime. I have never been disappointed. Staff are friendly and efficient, even at busy times. The food is, and always has been, excellent. The menu is varied and good value. The restaurant is comfortable and clean.  They use turkey rashers rather than pork bacon, just in case it is a matter of overwhelming importance to you. The turkey rashers are actually very tasty, and a nice change. (If you want piggy bacon, there are about 5 or 6 other cafes within 100 yards which will supply it.)  I wouldn't use the place so often if I did not consider it excellent. Keep up the good work.

title: The right place
comment: Quaint, beautiful atmosphere and very keen staff!!  Breakfast is amazing! Their hot beverages are simply breathtaking!

title: Discraceful customer service
comment: Handing of complaint for the significant delay in the delivery of the mains was far below the standards expected by Madhus and their management. Real eye opener to the lack of customer care when things go wrong. Won't be dining here again, not because of the issue itself, but lack of admission of fault and failure to reasonably rectify.

title: Good food but VERY EXPENSIVE
comment: Been here a few times with work clients which is a mercy because the pricing is not cheap. Two small-medium sized lamb chops for £10!! However - they are the best lamb chops you will eat this side of London. The decor is nice and staff are well-trained but please - do something about the pricing!

title: Awesome food, lovely staff, excellent service
comment: This caffe is now my local it has everything!  The service is impeccable, the staff are so kind and attentive. They really take time to get to know and develop a relationship with their customers; to the point were they know exactly what is wanted before I have to say anything.  I’m a picky customer but they have never complained and they are all so willing to meet my dietary needs...(non meat eater) it’s just a bonus that the food and drinks taste great too! The pricing is reasonable for the quality of ingredients and service provided too!  Yes, I’m a regular and I wouldn’t have it any other way

title: Happy days
comment: Another lovely experience in caffe rendezvous.love the service.amazing pancakes .this is the second home from now on.

title: Nice , friendly and clean little Cafe
comment: I have been here a few times now and probably one of the best little cafes I have been too. Firstly all staff are welcoming and friendly. The breakfast is delicious! I normally go for the veggie breakfast and my partner would go for the salmon and avocado everything taste’s so fresh. Oh and the fresh smoothies are refreshing. Would definatley recommend and we will be coming back soon. Thank you

title: Great food and service
comment: Our server Punam was so helpful and friendly suggesting to us the best way to enjoy all the wonderful food. I highly suggest if you like Indian food or want to try it for the first time.

title: Fabulous!
comment: Whenever we need an airport hotel, we stay at the Sheraton Skyline just so we can eat dinner at Madhu's. The food is delicious. It is an eclectic Indian style food with all the regular dishes of Biryani, raita, naan breads, curries, and also the most delicious grilled meats. The lamb is some of the best I have ever had. I've eaten lots of Indian style food here in the UK and in Asia, but Madhu's is some of the best I have eaten. They have their own style and a true "Wow" factor! The service is excellent. 3 Cheers for Franco who was our server the last time we were there! He was always attentive to our needs, but certainly not intrusive. We are returning there again soon, when we take our next flight and stay over at the hotel. If you are anywhere near the Sheraton Skyline hotel, do book a dinner at Madhu's.... You won't be disappointed!

title: Business dinner
comment: GREAT FOOD, seriously I've been wanting to go back since we went. Small group of 8 we had a room off to the side, very attentive and knowledgeable staff. Amazing selection of items, all very tasty and just generally fantastic.

title: Excellent, excellent food
comment: A small group of friends and I had dinner last night. We all chose the menu degustation and it was fantastic. It was definitely more food than we could all eat, but it was so lovely to try so many different dishes. We really enjoyed both the food and the service we got from Franco. Excellent experience, and I look forward to returning soon.

title: Overpriced for a mundane experience
comment: We had a dinner in here a few days ago. On first impressions the restaurant seemed very smart, quite spacious. We were seated immediately as the restaurant was very quiet that early in the evening.  We all ordered drinks & started to inspect the menu.  My Mum is vegetarian, & the choice really wasn’t very good for vegetarian curries. However, with quite a lot of debate with the waiter who was incredibly difficult to fully understand at times we got her sorted. My Husband wanted a very spicy curry, something along the lines of the heat of a Vindaloo. We were told that wasn’t possible but they would spice up a massala which certainly isn’t a hot dish. After ordering a rather large group of ladies came in & amongst a near empty restaurant were seated directly behind us. After 5/10 minutes or so we asked if we could move table due to the noise & that we just wanted a quiet dinner. We were met with some hostility by our waiter, who questioned why we wished to move after we had just explained why. He then said he had to ask his Manager if we could move! Baring in mind only a few tables out of a fairly large restaurant were occupied. He came back & asked what was wrong with the table. At this point my Husband & i we’re getting quite irritated by his attitude.  We said once again because of the noise please move us to a quieter table. At this point had he not moved us we would have settled the drinks bill & frankly gone elsewhere.  After being moved, the food arrived. My Husbands spiced up masala wasn’t very spicy by either of our standards, but had decent amount of flavour. My Mum was quite disappointed to find her vegetarian makhani was a cheese curry.  I had the murgh makhani (butter chicken) it lacked any real flavour, had no sweetness. The chicken was good & tender, but the curry itself wasn’t great. We ordered a plain boiled rice & a saffron rice. Which came white, absolutely no saffron was used in that rice, it had a few seeds in & one cardamon pod & some peas on top. Saffron makes rice yellowish in colour & adds a distinctive flavour. This tasted almost indifferent to the plain boiled rice. The naan bread was nice but a very small portion size.  Over all, the dinner was over priced, lacked anything special & earlier in the dinner the first waiter was quite honestly highly irritating & argumentative. Neither of which are qualities one wishes to encounter on their dinner out. Doubtful we would come back again, and we do stay in this area many times a year.

title: Very good service, nice food and desserts
comment: Liked the salmon starter.the chicken dish was great. The desserts wer frat with lots of variety. Ambience was superb. Special place for special occasions.Harman was excellent.

title: Business Meal
comment: Great food, and excellent service from Harman. Would definitely return here again, as it also had a great friendly atmosphere.

title: Great Experience
comment: Normally, restaurants inside a Hotel Chain would be a mixed bag in my experience. True, there are exceptions (think ITC in an Indian context) but Madhus is a nice place. A fantastic one actually considering it isn't in a fancy location. Service is attentive, choices are satisfactory, quality is great and finally, the taste is incredible. Not overdone, not pretentious, not a lackluster fusion of everything. It is authentic and consistent.  If you are in this part of town and you fancy an Indian meal, you should check this out.

title: Toasted bacon and egg Bap
comment: I’ve been coming here for a good few years and have always been looked after by polite and professional staff excellent value for money

title: Best cafe in Beckenham
comment: I am a regular at Rendezvous! Not only is the food fantastic the service is excellent! I always go in there with my little one as it is such a calm, comfortable, friendly environment and someone always opens the door for me when I’m stuggling with the pram lol. I usually get a cappuccino (the best I’ve ever had) or the iced vanilla latte which is equally good! I’ve tried a variety of meals on their menu and I’ve never been disappointed! The cakes are to die for! I usually go for the rendezvous breakfast which is delicious, it’s nice to go to a cafe which serves Turkey Rashers and beef sausages as not many cafes do! I’m a big fan of this cafe and always bring my friends and family there who all share my opinion.

title: Great food and great staff
comment: The staff are very polite as soon as you enter, always welcoming. They are very accommodating. The food is great too. I tend to come in on my lunch break and order their Mexican tuna. If you like something with a bit of a kick, I suggest you try this.

title: I love those Turkey Rashers!!
comment: Superb food here, loved the breakfast and the service/atmosphere fantastic. I’ll be going back for more!

title: Chris
comment: Stopped off here several times for breakfast and coffee Always greeted which a smile from Sam the chef . Quality coffee and breakfast would recommend to all .

title: Rendezvous Cafe
comment: Within the last year Rendezvous has become a favourite for myself and Mum. For us it's close to work aswell. The food/meals are always brilliant and well presented. This is also accompanied by the friendly staff who have got to know our 'usuals' when we walk in. Service is always prompt which we like as we only have the hour for a lunch break. They have a vast menu and there is always something that they place a slight twist on to make it stand out from the other cafe's in the area. Highly recommend for breakfast and lunch.

title: Best Coffee in Beckenham
comment: I go to Rendezvous every morning for a coffee and I have to say that in my opinion it is the best coffee in Beckenham. The staff are always friendly and communicative. Definitely 5 out of 5 for me

title: Absolutely must try! warm and welcoming and great food
comment: My first time visiting this cafe I was greeted with warm friendly smiles from the staff excellent customer service and great hot food. I personally ordered cheese, spicy chorizo, spinach omelette with chips which was delicious. And it was also recommended that I try the avocado smoothie which may sound strange but I promise you it was absolutely delicious once again you must try it. I will definitely be going back again and again.

title: Best breakfast, coffee and service in Beckenham
comment: Fabulous cafe in Beckenham, highly recommended. Excellent variety of food, best coffee in Beckenham and great customer service.

title: Best breakfast in Beckenham!
comment: We have only recently discovered Rendezvous in the last couple of months and now we just won't go anywhere else! The coffee is dreamy, and there are so many milks to chose from. The food is high quality and the portions are generous. The staff are always smiling which tops the whole experience off. Keep up the good work guys!

title: Breakfast
comment: Thorpe-Hylton family. Took the family to Rendezvous Caffe this morning for breakfast, it was fantastic. I had Vegetarian breakfast, wife had Jacket potato, rocket and mozzarella with cheese, Son had Spaghetti Bolognese and cheese. It was so good we even ordered another Vegetarian breakfast. Definitely will be eating there again.

title: Lunch time menu
comment: This place is amazing. I get lunch from here most days. No lunch boredom for me. Lovely customer service. Amazing sandwiches and wraps. And when you fancy a naughty cheeky burger it’s the best I’ve tried. 5guys/GBK you have serious competition

title: Fantastic food, great service
comment: We were served by Franco and he was extremely helpful and charismatic. He helped us with the menu and even had a few tricks to show the children. The food was sublime and I would recommmend this restaurant very highly of you like Indian food. The flavours were amazing - we had prawns, scallops and chicken with daal and rice. The flavours were spectacular. Thank you to all the staff - especiallly Franco who made the evening fun and helped us to have a great time.

title: What’s happened????
comment: What’s happened??? Madhus restaurant at Heathrow was my favourite place to go to until yesterday’s visit. Suggested this restaurant to my colleagues but was very disappointed!!! Vegetarian option for set menu cold aloo gobi kadhi dhaal rice with peas naan £33 - dhaal looked like it had been reheated so many times it was tasteless aloo gobi was initially very cold the only tasty thing was kadhi with pakoras (2). I was extremely disappointed with the food - usually food is excellent quality and more choice. We had to ask for a paneer dish but out came saag with 3 bits of paneer!!! The starters were tasteless. Have you changed the chef???? Left feeling cheated ......

title: We like the food but they don't like us
comment: It was a a last-minute decision to have Indian that evening as we were staying at the same hotel that houses the restaurant. We are a family of 5 (grown-up kids). They told us over the phone that they don't accept reservations (which they actually do). We walked in and they had some available tables. It took them more than 5 minutes for the reception lady to pay attention to the fact that guests walked in to dine. The service continued to be off that evening with the waitresses not making eye contact, not naking any effort to help us ordering (i simply asked if how spicy were two particular dishes). The food was just above-average (would rate it 7 out of 10) but with the service being below average (2 out of 10), it makes it difficult for us to return... the staff needs to make a bit more effort.

title: Good Food!
comment: The food in this restaurants is really good! But our server was not very friendly and smiley.But over all this restaurant nice and cozy.I will eat here again.When I come back to London.

title: lovely food and service
comment: Really enjoyed our meal, a little pricey as a family meal but useful for an occasion. excellent service

title: The best hot breakfast
comment: I was with my family in rendezvous coffee and I found everything amazing . the service and the staff is friendly the hot food was amazing Specially the English breakfast . Sam he's working there and he's really lovely Man , finally I found my place .  Definitely I will came back .

title: Yummy food and lovely staff
comment: We went and sat outside with our pooch. The waitress was super friendly and offered some water for our dog. We both ordered the jone made burgers and lived the paprika fries that came with them. Service with a smile and super tasty food to boot. Will be coming back to try a breakfast soon.

title: Lovely
comment: I got a lasagna with my family on a Sunday and it was quite busy and we got our food just in time and the staff are very nice and happy

title: For a special Treat...
comment: Food was great, portions sizes are small and prices are too end. This is definitely a place to celebrate a special occasion rather than a boys night out.  Saying that, the service & food was second to none. Exceptional and varied menu with great guidance from the staff. What I found exceptional was that we ordered more naan bread (as we ran out) and the manager noticed so without hesitation and asking refreshed our cold dishes with new! Now that is a customer experience worth shouting about - never had that before. It works out at about £50 per head but def worth it if your celebrating or entertaining. Worth a visit.

title: Delicious
comment: This is the best food I've eaten at a Heathrow Airport hotel to date. My family & I decided to get a sharing plate each as a main rather than as a starter (designed to be shared as a starter amongst 4 people I'd have thought), they were very tasty and catered to those with varying levels of tolerance to spice very well with a good mixture of sauces. Prices were about what you'd expect to pay at a nice restaurant near an airport, not cheap but certainly not overpriced either.

title: Elegant, Extraordinary Menu and Delicious as it Gets! This restaurant is standalone Stunning!
comment: Order absolutely anything and you'll be so happy! We wish we could eat here another 100 times and the prices were so decent, lovely wine selection. Honestly wonderful and I am not always easy to please

title: Great coffee, food and service
comment: I go most weekends with my baby daughter on route to the playground. The coffee is made with more care than most places in Beckenham and any hot food I buy is always freshly made and good value. The cafe is easy to walk past but keep an eye out for it, you won't be disappointed.

title: Superb
comment: This must be the best Indian food I have eaten outside India. Superb. Staff excellent. So surprised in a hotel.

title: Sophisticated
comment: I've eaten at Madhus many times and have enjoyed the meal every time. The menu is modern and sophisticated. The ambience and customer service is great.

title: Best ever
comment: I went to rendezvous coffee with my friends and the healthy breakfast was amazing with some drinks come with it , the stuff they are lovely and everything clean and the best service We had definitely We will come back.

title: Excellent food and service
comment: Frequently landing into Heathrow with a hotel stopover I can't recommend this place highly enough. Tremendous food from start to finish, no matter what you order. Madhu's dictates the fact that I stay in the Sheraton Skyliner hotel (no disrespect to the hotel). Wonderful Nepalese food, on a different level. Special mention to Punam who always takes excellent care of me as a solo diner.

title: Amazing Food
comment: This was our first visit and a real treat the evening before our flight. Tasty dishes and attentive service. Would definitely recommend.

title: Excellent decor, service and food.
comment: From the moment you walk into Madhu’s you are taken well care of by the staff. Dori, the hostess, was particularly attentive. Our waitress made excellent recommendations. We thoroughly enjoyed the food and experience. Recommended.

title: Superb food, better than the central london restaurants!
comment: I organised a dinner here on Friday night. We chose the A La Carte menu and the food was outstanding... I have been to many central london restaurants and this beats them all for taste, atmosphere and value for money. There was no surprise why every table was taken in the restaurant. I would like to thank the managers Vinod, Claudio and Sherin for the hospitality and look forward to visiting again.

title: Lovely
comment: As staying at the hotel before flying out we decided on an Indian . What a great choice. The greeting from Doori who then showed us to the table to everything the service the food was first class !!!!

title: International Women's Day dinner
comment: Amazing service and delicious food. Went for an International Women's Day dinner and there was a great atmosphere all around. Some good musical entertainment. It was a fab evening, would definitely go again. Recommend to all.

title: Fantastic
comment: I took a party to celebrate International Women's Day and it was outstanding, the evening was perfect for a group of women to enjoy themselves. The food was divine, the pink G&Ts sublime and the atmosphere oozing enjoyment! Am planning my next visit.

title: Double Celebration! International Women's day & My Mum's Birthday
comment: My mum said that was one of the best birthday's she's had! The service and food were both excellent. We started the evening with some interesting starters, wasabi prawns and chicken shammi kebabs. The kebabs were tender and perfectly cooked and the prawns had a crispy coating with a wasabi kick.The staff were attentive and met all our needs, they topped up our glasses without needing to be asked. The thali dishes were varied and portion sizes were just right and there was much attention to detail with their presentation.Highly recommend the masala chai panna cotta dessert to finish. We had a lovely evening and one my mum won't forget in a while.Thanks to Poonam Ball for her exquisite menu for the night.

title: Best dinner ever!
comment: The food here is amazing! Try the kabobs and don’t miss the naan! I didn’t know anything about Indian food and the staff was lovely, guiding me. Really great service too.

title: Best coffee
comment: Best coffee in beckenham with excellent service. Didn’t have to wait long at all, enjoyed the friendly and relaxing ambience

title: Lunch with a smile
comment: Friendly, affordable, great value and tasty. Sam and his staff are a credit to the eatery industry. They always make you feel welcome and a pleasure to use on a regular basis. Keep up the great work!

title: The best Thai food outside of Thailand
comment: I honestly couldn’t fault anything there ; the most delicious and soulful Thai I have ever eaten! The service was superb; very warm and friendly and in s lovely restaurant  I cannot recommend it enough! Great portions too and very reasona priced! Would be back soon

title: Yum yum!
comment: Visited Awesome Thai for the first time this weekend and loved every second of it.  Amazing authentic Thai food, great service and very good value for money. Good wine list and very moorish Gavi to wash it all down.  Please give it a go, you won't be disappointed

title: Great staff, delicious food, lovely atmosphere
comment: I surprised my wife by taking her here for her birthday. We both love Thai food, and I had booked ahead. When we want a treat, we'll get take-out from here, but we'd never eaten at the restaurant before. We were looked after superbly by Mel, our waitress, and the food was of a really good quality, with a decent rosé from the wine list. They brought out a complimentary birthday cake for my wife, and it made it all-the-more special. If you are looking for a nice, friendly atmosphere where there are couples and groups alike all enjoying their night out, this is a great place to come. The cost is very reasonable and the staff are welcoming and efficient.  It's just a really lovely place to go.

title: Birthday celebration
comment: 10 of us celebrated a special birthday here last week and the staff could not have been more helpful! The food is utterly delicious: we had the sharing platters to start followed by a variety of rice, curries and noodles. The Phad Thai is absolutely awesome! Our ages ranged from 15-65 and there was definitely something for everyone! Really authentic thai food , fabulous service and a lovely atmosphere too.

title: Birthday night out
comment: We had such a lovely meal on Friday - and always do whenever we go to Awesome Thai. Great food, great service, friendly people and they always make such an effort for birthdays! Highly recommended...

title: Delicious food, lovely atmosphere and friendly and welcoming staff!
comment: Booked this restaurant last minute in the early evening as we were looking for a local thai and were really impressed. The food was absolutely delicious and really reasonably priced (Ordered 2 x Alcoholic drinks, a starter, 3 x main courses and a side and the bill came to £48.00). The staff were welcoming and the atmosphere was perfect for a date night. Will 100% be returning!!  NB: Visited on a Thursday night and the restaurant was full so would definitely recommend booking!

title: Good food and ambiance
comment: Went for a lunch on Saturday afternoon. We had green and red curry which were very tasty and well cooked. The restaurant had nice music playing on and overall atmosphere was relaxed. We are planning to go back again.

title: Saturday night delight
comment: this was the first time that i had been here and a shame that i haven't been here before because it was excellent. I have been to quite a few Thai restaurants in London but this one stands out very well. The food that we had was excellent. I liked what was on the menu as there were some spins on well known thai dishes. One delight was the sauce that came with the crab starter, that special. the food was delicious all the way down to the broccoli dish, i could have had that on its own. Will be coming back for sure. And thanks for putting a rioja on the wine list. I know it doesnt go but it never stops me.

title: Best favourite brunch place ever
comment: If you’re looking for something comfy, cosy, friendly and delicious breakfast or lunch this is definitely the best place to go... I definitely love how I’m treated every time I have my brunch here. They don have much of a gluten and diary free options but the chef always make it happen, they will actually cook and make the menu adaptable for my gluten and diary free diet l... thank you so much for your great job

title: David
comment: This is our favourite Thai place in London. Very good service and awesome food at reasonable price. Very friendly staff that pay attention to small details. We became regular customers and we love going there! They also offer some treats that are delicious! We had dinner at Awesome Thai in 6/7 occasions and it never disappointed! Great experience ,great food,friendly staff!Like at home!

title: Excellent food and service - as usual!
comment: This is a regular 'haunt' of ours and never disappoints, the service is as close to perfect as you can get, friendly, attentive and efficient. If you want a great Thai meal in south west London then this place is "awesome"!

title: Ruined Mother's day meal!!
comment: Beware its a con!! The food was disappointingly mediocre. Pani Puri was so rubbish, the chef should be ashamed of what he served. The puri was so scantily filled with just sprouts that it was not worth £7. Lacked of potatoes or any flavour completely. The Alloo Tikki was 1 tiny Tikki cut into 2 halves and served in a plate of chana. Pathetic again for £7. They don't deserve to have a location like the Sheraton Hotel. The waitress had a cold so she kept sniffling in our ears quite loudly. I watched her swipe her runny nose with her palm a few times whilst serving a few tables. Disgusting!!. She was not properly trained for silver service. She kept leaping across the table to reach for plates and cutlery instead of coming closer. The table offered to us, a family of 5 were two round tables joined together. It made it difficult to share food and make it enjoyable. When I complained, I was offered desert for free. This didn't really help because the kulfi was commercially bought and not made by the chef. It tasted powdery. All in all the restaurant was nothing special. A local takeaway compares better than this restaurant. The furniture is old and chairs looks tattered. The pictures on the website are when they were newly opened. It's definitely not like that in reality. Don't be taken in by the lovely pictures. It's not posh at all.

title: Great Indian Menu
comment: The menu was diverse and everything sounded great. I had lamb chop starter and chicken masala for the main. Both were excellent. At little on the pricey side but it’s an airport restaurant.

title: Mother’s Day Brunch
comment: Table of 4 for Mother’s Day brunch. I was not expecting a buffet style set up. Food was good although the aloo tiki chaat had not aloo.  When food was not available in the buffet stations the chefs would promptly bring to our table.  Have eaten at Madhus Heathrow several times the only thing which puts me off is the bad behaved children running up and down the restaurant this takes away from the fine dining element and I also do believe charging service charge for a buffet is a bit cheeky. All in all food and atmosphere and great company is what makes a good meal. 2 out of 3 is not bad. Loved the saxophonist he was a great addition.

title: Very good
comment: We went there as a big group and it was a very good experience lovely Thai dishes very attentive service

title: Awesome!
comment: We went to this restaurant as it was recommended by good friends who live in the area. We were very impressed with the quality of the food, the nice local atmosphere and the prices! It was a winner from all angles and we will go back there for sure! It was awesome as its name says!

title: Awesome indeed
comment: We tried Awesome Thai for the first time last night for dinner - wow incredibly good, fresh, homemade food. The ingredients were delightfully fresh and the sauces tasty and homemade. The service was friendly and quick. The one thing I would suggest is a greater selection of gin or vodka - very limited spirits menu. I had the Por Pia Sod, fresh rolls stuffed with prawns, avocado, mint, cucumber and carrot (I know this dish as Summer rolls) the sauce was super tasty without burning my mouth off! My partner had Giew Tod - deep fried prawn wantons - My main dish was Kaeng Khao Supparod Koong - Mild red prawn curry with fresh pineapple and coconut rice........ again the sauce was light and full of flavour and not over spicy. The prices are very reasonable and the ambience is relaxing and calm. We are already planning our next visit.

title: Simply excellent food
comment: Just collected and eaten a delicious meal: red curry / pad thai & a few other dishes. Friendly service, fresh ingredients and the best tasting thai food for miles around. Been coming here for years but haven’t left a review before - nothing short of yummy..!!

title: Awesomely Lives Up To It’s Name!
comment: You set the bar pretty high when you call yourself “awesome”. Awesome Thai exceeds the bar. I didn’t expect a local restaurant in Barnes to do this but the authentic Thai food really is awesome. We brought some friends who’d never been, ordered atleast 12 different dishes and they were blown away at how good every dish was. Recommend!

title: Great food but dreadful wines!
comment: Food was on the whole delicious, service a little slow considering they knew we needed to leave after 90 mins for the cinema. Poor choice of white wines though. I suggest avoiding the Pinot Grigio and also the Sauvignon blanc. Both were thin, had no bouquet, and a sharp acidic after taste. A shame as the next price bracket was another £10.

title: A Beautiful Area and a Fantastic meal
comment: Last week we went to Barnes for a wander as we have never properly explored the area. We decided to come here because my wife fancied a Pad Thai and also because it had a good rating on TA. From outside it seemed quite posh, but once inside it seemed less so but still quite modern and stylish. I particularly liked the big bulb- shaped lights .We ordered the mixed starters for two which were quite sublime and packed with fragrant flavours imbued with delicacy and freshness. The Prawn Pad Thai was in the same league with the Prawns being particularly juicy and succulent although on a personal level I would rather have had a less intense sauce because it does not allow the other flavours to come through. Overall it was a magnificent meal, welcoming service and very reasonable too! We can’t wait to go back !!!

title: Take away
comment: What a wonderful place. I wish I could of eaten in but it was so popular there was no availability for me last minute. Not eaten the food yet but I’m already sure it will be great based on the decor, fantastic service, friendly staff and enticing smells!

title: Attention!Best Restaurant!
comment: Awesome Thai is an amazing restaurant!The menu is huge and there is much to choose from.I have been at this restaurant many times and tried many of the dishes and not once has one tasted bad. All of the dishes are decorated beautifully and taste good too.The surroundings are nice and the staff are kind and welcoming.I will definitely come back!

title: Very nice food and service
comment: The best restuarant we visited during the time in London based on the taste and also the price. Soft crab 5/5 Green curry 5/5 Grilled prawn 5/5

title: 18th Birthday Dinner
comment: We booked a family dinner for my sons 18th Birthday. From the outset Vinod was a delight, always attentive to our needs and wishes in ensuring the event went the way we wanted and we were happy with the arrangements. His attention to detail and patience was a great help, especially as we kept tweaking our requirements.  When the big day arrived we could not have been happier. The food was delicious and we lost count of how many of our guests complimented it. The service was also first class with several waiters ensuring non of the guests glasses went dry from the free open bar. I would highly recommend this establishment for its high quality food, ambience and outstanding service.

title: Fabulous find thanks to Tripadvisor
comment: My brother in-law and I are both from out of town (him from Bristol and me from Cape Town) and so we relied on tripadvisor to suggest a Restuarant. And what a find. All three course were delicious, and the service was excellent.

title: AMAZING
comment: Best restaurant in barnes, recommend the noodles. Such nice people and food will blow you away. However often busy so book!

title: Great food at a great price!
comment: Seemingly a local hotspot and I can see why! From start to finish, the service was exemplary.  The restaurant is cosy and outside seating a lovely touch.  The food is of the highest quality and freshness. I couldn’t recommend this restaurant more! I will be back very soon.

title: Great food and service
comment: Really tasty food, good value for money and very friendly service. They’re always busy which shows that locals love it. Will definitely be returning.

title: Servise and food
comment: Amazing place to come to enjoy with family or couples. A lot of variaty of thai cultural food. Definitely the best tiramisu in town. And our server Mel was just charming. Thank you very much, we will be back

title: Evening meal
comment: Had an evening meal here on a Friday night ,we booked a table at very short notice , booked for 7 30 pm and we were asked to ensure we ready to hand it back by 8 30 which was good with us, great service, very friendly staff, fab food , we really couldn't find any fault.

title: Awesome is correct
comment: Enjoyed a super meal for three, shared starters for three. Main of spicy chicken for me, green Thai curry, stir fry prawns and asparagus. All excellent. Two Awesome Tiramisu. Loved it and would go again!

title: Lives up to its name!
comment: When researching Thai restaurants for my brother's birthday dinner, Awesome Thai came up with 5 stars all the way. I thought it was too good to be true as the menu items were reasonably priced. I booked a table and we all went to the restaurant. Food and service was excellent and they presented my brother with a lovely tiramisu cake - Thai style. We'll certainly be going back there. Booking recommended.

title: Great experience
comment: We had a lovely time here. Great food and service by our host Shelington. We would definitely we visiting again.

title: Absolutely gorgeous
comment: We sought TripAdvisor prior to booking into Awesome Thai & wasn’t disappointed.  We had been at the Olympic cinema earlier & fancied a bite to eat after.  Now we’ve been to Thailand, enjoyed many Thai meals & this one was absolutely to die for.bery reasonably priced with equally gorgeous extensive wine to complement.  We mentioned our recent trip to Thailand & marriage & was presented cost free a beautiful tiramisu for two! How thoughtful!  At £36 for two of us & we were full,? Definitely recommend, we will be back! Thank you.

title: Truly Wonderful Restaurant
comment: This was our third time we visited this wonderful restaurant. The food always tastes amazing. We arrived around 6:00pm on a Saturday night and without a reservation ( we normally book in advance) but we were just as welcomed by Shannon the manager. We had a selection of dishes including the Giant Grilled Prawns, The Steamed Scallops, The Thai Green Curry, The Thai Satay, The Prawns with Aubergine and Steamed Rice. Everything tasted very fresh and very tasty. The restaurant is very cosy and the staff are always at hand to greet you. We were served by Sally who was genuinely very friendly and polite. We think that the first impression one has when entering into any restaurant for the first time is usually the one that sticks in people's mind whether it's be good or bad. However, we were pleasantly surprised when we first visited this restaurant there is a certain "good feeling" about it when you walk through the door. We have already made this our favourite Thai restaurant which we will visit very often with our friends. We highly recommend it but be sure to book in advance.

title: Billed £100 for parking in the Sheraton
comment: It offers a posher and pricier experience than your local curry house (Its in a hotel) so I booked to come here for my son's 18th.  Weird timings - 17.30 or 20.30. I had to choose the relatively late 20.30 slot. Not sure who eats at 17.30 but it means they can get in two sittings. That tells you all you need to know.  People well dressed. An event venue.  Food was goodish. I wouldn't say it was the best but a cut above the average curry house. (Not my local curry house though). We asked the waiter to recommend some dishes as the menu is large and we were hungry by 21.00. The meat and chicken curry were cooked in the same sauce so tasted similar (picked up by mother in law who is a good cook). Can't remember the names but something poncy. No-one checked up on us. Needed water/beer. Had to keep grabbing other waiters after waiting for ages as first was busy with other tables. Would have had deserts but getting late and couldn't be bothered with what was going to be a long wait. Hostess turned up at the end to get feedback. Would have been nice to see her at the start or even midway through the meal incase we needed anything. A very average experience. Did get a receipt after a number of phone calls to Madhus to prove we were customers. This needs forwarding to the carpark agent so they can hopefully cancel my charge. At no point did anyone tell us we needed to validate parking. Quite irritating and in keeping with the overall experience hence the rating.

title: Delicious Thai food
comment: We have been going to awesome Thai for many years and have never been disappointed. The service is friendly. The food is reliable, delicious, and good value. We wholeheartedly recommend.

title: Excellent Thaï food for a reasonnable price
comment: Amazing experience (twice) there. The food is delicious, it's not expensive at all, and the service is very friendly. I will go back ! Their pad thaï is amazing :-)

title: Fantastic Dinner
comment: Just had dinner at Awesome Thai. Very appropriately named. Our server, Shannon, was very professional and extremely nice/friendly. The food is wonderful. We are no strangers to Thai food and this restaurant s as good as we’ve ever had anywhere in the world. No joke. Highly recommend this place!

title: Best Thai restaurant
comment: We came to this restaurant as we like Thai food. Service was fantastic and very polite specially Mel and the other waitress, food amassing ! I will definitely recommend this restaurant and we will come back :) xx

title: Excellent
comment: Came here for the first time last night with my partner. The service was outstanding. Every single dish extremely tasty and very reasonably priced. The small details here make all the difference: clean hot plates, sauces placed in small dishes apart,preference of the way your meat is cooked. Lovely dinner

title: Actually Awesome
comment: I’ve been to this restaurant quite a few times and have become somewhat of a regular visitor.  The reason I keep coming back to this place is for; the food and the service. Let me discuss the former. There is such a wide variety of food on this menu and it is all delicious. The soup I had for starter had tantalising flavours which left a hum on the tongue. The curry’s are creamy and flavoursome, and the duck is delicious. Don’t get me started on the coconut rice, it’s a game changer.  The service is always fantastic; you are served promptly and they always keep your drinks topped up. They are attentive and friendly, shout out to the waiter who has the menu completely memorised.  This place is truly awesome, would highly recommend. I mean look how clean that plate is, we had to tell her not to lick it!

title: Amazing food and service
comment: We came to this restaurant as we love Thai food. Service was excellent, everyone smiling and so helpful. The food was very nice, especially the soap.  Definitely I will come back and recommend to all my friends and family!

title: Anniversary Dinner - wonderful food and service
comment: We have been coming to Awesome Thai for a number of years and despite moving further away and being a 30 mile round trip to visit; it is still worth the journey. The hospitality and service is superb and the food is fresh, flavourful, well presented and reasonably priced. We decided to go to the restaurant for our 1st Year Wedding Anniversary as we have fond memories of eating there over the years. On the night we were running late and phoned ahead and they were very understanding and changed the booking for us straight away. We ordered 'The Awesome Thai Platter' which consisted of Thai Fish Cakes, Chicken Satay, Spring Rolls, Wrapped Prawns. The platter was fresh and in particular the Thai Fish Cakes were beautifully flavoured with kaffir lime leaves. The Spicy Green Papaya salad brought a tangy sourness to the meal to compliment the richness of the Thai Red Curry and Coconut Rice. We followed the main dishes with a Panna Cotta for dessert which was a great refreshing end to a lovely meal. Shannon made it very special for us, his service and delivery was excellent. At the end of the night Shannon surprised us with a special dessert, which was AMAZING! Many thanks to everyone at Awesome Thai, Mahbs & Rox

title: Very good!!!
comment: Came here after reading very good reviews and we were very pleased with the fantastic service and truly delicious food! Photos don’t do it justice as they came darker but please have the grilled prawns! (number 44!)

title: Excellent restaurant near London Heathrow!
comment: Madhu’s has maintained a consistent quality over the past five years that I have been visiting. I like this restaurant so much that I stay exclusively at the Sheraton Skyline or the Marriott next door now so I can have dinner here before flying out of Heathrow the next day. This time I had the Curry and Tandoori Thali which is a great meal for one as you get to try a little of everything. It costs £ 30 (£ 34.75 including taxes and 12.5% gratuity). For how good the meal was, I think this is a great deal! It has a Robata lamb chop, Murg Makhani (butter chicken in a tomato cream sauce), sag gosht (lamb in spinach curry), prawn moilee (two jumbo prawns in coconut curry), dal makhani, garlic naan, salad, and peas pulao. If you think the portions look small, be rest assured that they are quite adequate and the meal was sumptuous. In the past, I had ordered several dishes and it was too much food. The Thali is just perfect! I would recommend booking ahead on OpenTable as soon as you book your flight - they can get busy at times (with events) and you will not find a table at the right time otherwise. This place is so good that I no longer need to go into London for my butter chicken! The service was pretty good with several people stopping by. I highly recommend this restaurant. Marriott and Sheraton should take note that there are travelers like me who stay at their hotels because of this gem of a restaurant! Keep up the good work!

title: Awesome Indeed
comment: Great food and customer service made for an excellent evening. The attention to detail in reassuring my dining companion there was no crustacean products in the food they provided her was exemplary. Thank you!

title: Great Food
comment: Me and my husband had dinner tonight at Madhu's Heathrow and we were greeted by your host who was inappropriately dressed. This made me extremely uncomfortable through the evening. This is a family restaurant and you really need to pay attention to your hosts that meet & greet you upon entering the restaurant, to be dressed appropriately. The food was great and the staff were very welcome.

title: Excellent group visit
comment: After the AGM of the charity we're involved with, 14 of us had dinner on a Thursday evening at Awesome Thai. The food, service and ambiance were all excellent. It was also reasonably priced. Recommended highly for groups of up to 16 (their maximum I believe).

title: Totally Awesome Thai Food with a Smile :-)
comment: This is our second visit to Awesome Thai, we caught a movie at a local cinema in Banes and decided a late lunch at Awesome Thai would be just perfect. The service was spectacular and the food was totally majestic. We started with the Larb Gai and for our entrees we settled for the signature chef salmon, soft shell crab and aubergines, unfortunately no room for desert, one thing is for sure we will return for our third gatronomic food adventure! Totally recommend this amazing restaurant!

title: Truely Awesome
comment: With a name like Awesome Thai, this restaurant has a lot to live up to - but it does deliver! We had some of the best Thai we have had here. Service was very friendly, efficient - highly recommended.

title: Lovely food, lovely people!
comment: Having recently been setting up home in Barnes from Dubai, have now had one take-away, and a full meal in the restaurant. Busy, great tasty food, lovely staff, and good value for money. We have really enjoyed both our meals, and will definitely be returning.

title: Lives up to its name!
comment: This is a really fine restaurant, with elegantly spiced food, attentive but not intrusive service, and, unusually for London, reasonable prices. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Loved the service & the food!
comment: I wanted some good local thai and this place is it! Great service and authentic Thai dishes. I ordered the Pad Thai and my fiance had the Fried Rice.

title: Always good
comment: The standards have always been high, and they still are. The staff are wonderful, even though they busy, you never seemed rushed. The owner has right, and he he is also a very nice person.

title: Promised much.... delivered disappointment
comment: Boded well. Clean, reasonably busy. Good TripAdvisor rating. Service was indifferent and that is being kind. Of the two front of house staff the man was borderline rude...almost like we were doing him a favour, (the woman was as one would hope, welcoming and engaging). Drinks served. Beer exceptionally cold so things looked on the up. Started off with a chicken satay (x2) for each of the kids...delicious. Green mango salad...no chilli kick at all, no flavour that suggested fresh punchy Thai flavours I had wanted; massively disappointed. Main course came. Kids wanted chicken noodles; got chicken with rice. I remember the guy took the order with no pad. Fine if you get it right, but risking too much and it was a simple order, and I sent it back only to have to face some incredulity that it was me (or the children that were wrong). As it happened we kept it because they were too hungry and didn’t want to wait for the noodles. As for the dish...bland, no freshness or zing. That pretty much described my dish too. I ordered beef with chilli...no chilli, no robust flavours that had been anyway near a Thai flavour dictionary. Just couldn’t be bothered to make any comment when asked in a cursory manner if the food was ‘ok’. It was ok...but only ok. I asked the kids if they would come back. A resounding ‘no’. One from me too. Thai101 on King Street kicks this place into touch; out of the stadium in fact. A good sauce from the supermarket beats it too. Onto other establishments to spend my money. Won’t be back here anytime soon. Shame. I prefer local places, but will steer clear when looking for somewhere next time.

title: Another AWESOME THAI
comment: Another splendid evening, fantastic service, great food, and most definitely our favourite restaurant in Barnes! In fact, if it wasn't in Barnes, we'd travel the distance for this place!! Lovely team and perfect meal... thank you once again!!  (Our 11th visit with consistently great service & food!!) Donna & Eddie

title: Brilliant Food and Service
comment: Myself and 2 other friends had a great time at Madhu's and each time we have come the food has been to our expectation. The Service from Punam has been great, very friendly and gave us suggestions to try new food from the menu and we loved it. Looking forward to visit with friends at Madhu's soon!

title: Birthday treat
comment: What a surprise at Awesome Thai The service was great and the food was some of the best Thai food that we have had outside of Thailand.  A must try if you are in the area of Barnes. We will defiantly return.  5 star food and a great choice of wonderful Thai food with 5 star service.

title: Unassuming, but sumptuous!
comment: Checked out this Thai restaurant recently. The place was very busy with hardly any tables free... I realised why upon getting the dishes. They were delicious! Definitely worth visiting if you like Thai food.

title: Good news! Still Delicious!
comment: I love this restaurant, it's chilled, relaxed, friendly, the service is just the right level of attentive, and the food is deeeelicious.  Today, there was a small problem, and I'm only telling you about it because when you can really see good service is when something goes wrong. I ordered one of the hot and sour soups, Tom Kha Hed I think, which I've had before, and it was perfect, really good, hot, sour, satisfying, the whole bit, but this time it was really quite sweet, it was odd and just not right. I asked someone to test it, and they brought it back a short time later, I think they'd added lime, but I could still taste the sweetness, so they apologised, took it away, and assured us that it wouldn't be on the bill. Again, one thing was a little bit wrong, and they dealt with it really well, please don't let this stop you ordering what has always been a delicious soup, I'm sure it was just having a bad day!  Everything else we had, the Pad See Ew, the Green Curry, and the vegetable of the day - Pak Choi, was delicious as ever, really good, flavoursome, well cooked and really satisfying. They also often bring a pre-starter, a prawn toast for meat eaters, and for me, a beautifully neat summer roll type thing filled with fresh vegetables, which was really good, I definitely would have ordered more for a starter if I'd known what they were called!  TL;DR? Awesome Thai = appropriate name, go there, don't forget to book, even on a Monday.  And if you live locally and they look busy but you still want your Thai fix? THEY DELIVER!!!

title: Great Friday Night Treat
comment: A good find! Ordering is simple and speedy and delivery in under 30 mins. I had the soft shell crab and the green curry and would happily order both again. I’ll def be ordering and visiting again!

title: This little Gem is amazing
comment: This place is a regular haunt for me. The food is awesome, the staff are friendly and welcoming. The menu is authentic and plenty if vegetarian choices. The tiramsu is the best in London..see if you can guess the secret ingreadient

title: A MUST (please read)
comment: I've been meaning to write a review and I am not one to usually do so which means I only made a tripadvisor account for this! So, my partner and I randomly came across this restaurant online (due to my love for thai food) over a year ago for valentines day and though it takes us 1.5 hour to get there, we have been visiting this place since. Believe me, the journey is always worth it. Where can I start? I would literally rate everything in here a 10/10. The only improvement would be the drinks list, other than that I actually cannot suggest any room for improvement. The restaurant etiquette is superb, the best customer service. They make you feel more than just a customer, but family.  Their food, I really don't have words to describe how amazing it is! So authentic and full of flavour. My boyfriend is a super picky person, and usually isn't willing to try new places, but even for him, this place is number 1. I am glad I came across this place on Valentine's day because I am in love with this place. The interior is classy, so you'd assume the food is expensive, but its very budget friendly! So far, along with being the best Thai food I have ever tasted, the Panang dry curry is the best dish I have ever had in my entire life.

title: Excellent Thai food - a real treat
comment: We booked for a group of 7 and were very pleased with the food. The wine list was good and the Shiraz is recommended. The staff were helpful. We will definitely revisit

title: A great discovery
comment: We live in Barnes and decided to have dinner in this restaurant with friends. The food was so very tasty. Far far better than any Thai food we have eaten recently. The menu has dishes we have not had before. The service was so very friendly and very speedy. We were pleasantly surprised when the bill arrived. Far less than we had anticipated. Rick Stein should try this restaurant. He might learn how to keep customers.

title: Excellent all round!
comment: Celebrated my Aunts birthday there on Saturday and staff went out of their way to make it really special! Shannon managed the booking for us and from the word go he planned all the minute details - really impressed with the service, the food, the ambience and willingness to ensure we had a great evening - thank you Shannon!

title: Perfect every time
comment: My partner and I have been here countless times and every single time the food, service and atmosphere has been perfect. Doesn’t matter if it’s a sunday afternoon or a Saturday evening the restaurant is ideal. Shannon almost always ends up serving us and his funny personality always adds to the evening, keep it up you guys!

title: AMAZING CAFE
comment: Was amazing service and really nice people the American pancakes are my faves it’s my fave cafe I’ve been to.

title: had dinner 2 days ago .
comment: nice and warm reception , nice food and brilliant service ,Caetano served us and he is very friendly ,informative and lovely young man .

title: It has the right name!
comment: Given the recent swathe of new swanky Thai restaurants, we were looking for something a bit more relaxed and friendly. Awesome Thai not only ticks both these boxes but the food is fresh and very flavourful! We tried the usual suspects - Tom yum soup which was very nice and strong. The spring rolls were crunchy and with the right amount of filling, which was very tasty. We ordered the green Curry and a chilli and Basil stir fried chicken dish with steam riced.  The curry had a nice consistency - unlike the watery dishes you get in most Thai restaurants. The flavouring reminded me of food we have eaten in Thailand. Similarly the chicken was soft and succulent and just the right portion size. One of the lady serving us asked if i liked spicy food - on answering yes she had the chef ensure that there was added spicing in the dishes as well as side dishes of chillies. What a nice touch - shows they care about the customer experience.  The restaurant is a tad small and tightly packed but clean and nice. Staff very friendly and helpful and service quite prompt.  Highly recommended.

title: Excellent food & Service
comment: Really enjoyed an evening at Awesome Thai excellent food, service and reasonably priced. The restaurant is very busy at weekends, best to book a table 48 hrs in advance. I would highly recommend. Free parking outside from 6.30pm.

title: Wonderful!
comment: Lovely staff, lovely atmosphere and delicious food. Special mention to our charming waiter Chennon! We will definitely be back! Louise Moss

title: Amazing thai restaurant
comment: We have been there for dinner with a couple of friends. The atmosfere was nice and relaxing. The staff were smily and warm. The menu choice is quite various and the food was really good and well presented. The price is very correct i highly recommend this nice place

title: Great food
comment: Very big menu with lots of tasty dishes to choose from. All we had was delicious. Moderate prices, excellent and friendly service. Will definitely come back.

title: Good local Thai
comment: The number of Thai restaurants seems to have exploded - is this now Britain's favourite cuisine? Awesome is a good example of somewhere that gets it right - large menu with all the classics that one knows and loves. Nicely balanced flavours, freshly cooked and served by friendly attentive staff. What's not to like? Definitely worth a visit.

title: Average Thai
comment: It is clearly brave to call yourself something like “Gino’s Excellent Italian” because it can only raise expectations. And this is not awesome in any way that contemporary parlance implies. Nice people but very average Thai food. The starters are rough and the main courses standard to low end fayre. And it is not a bargain. No return is planned. If you are hungry for lunch go to Arte Chef 50 metres down the street.

title: Good Thai in a busy part of Barnes
comment: Popped in last night, they squeezed us in to a 75min sitting and overall a good experience. Food was tasty and service was good. The waiter mentioned we were late when we turned up, although the table was not laid so they were hardly waiting for us. We ordered quickly and sat down to a really good satay, deep fried prawn and veg spring rolls. Also tasty prawn crackers and crispy seaweed. All excellent, not greasy and I think the satay could be on the best ever list.  Mains was green thai curry, prawn with asparagus and pad king plus 2 Jasmin rice and a pad Thai. GC was top notch, spicy enough but not overpowering so you could still taste to lemon grass and ginger. The prawn and asparagus was tasty, well cooked prawns, well cooked asparagus in a lovely thai sauce. The pad king was also well cooked as was the rice. After having several below par pad thais recently this was back up there as a good pad thai, tasty, fresh and almost as good as when we were in Thailand.  The waiter nearly ruined it at the end by trying to clear away the dishes while one member of the party was still eating but I'll let him off as we had overrun. Overall I would recommend but be prepared if you are near the front there's lots of walk ins and lots of deliveries. We didn't order wine but the overall cost was <£15 a head which is ridiculously cheap for such a good meal. I would say this is up there with Hansa Kitchen in Weybridge as the best Thai we have had in UK.

title: Mediocre, far from awesome
comment: Sought this place out based on the trip advisor community making it the no. 1 Thai in London. It isn't. Nothin was so bad it was worthy of complaint, it just really wasn't good. Menu quite uninspiring (and physically hard to read!), King prawns and rice were bland, Chicken in cashew nuts gloopy akin to a Chinese version. To finish things of, the slow return door takes forever to shut, and when the delivery guy is in and out like a yoyo, and it's snowing outside, it's freezing inside too! Service was good (if you are used to being timeslot managed as a lot of thai places do!).

title: Excellent food
comment: Don’t be tricked by the humble appearance of the restaurant. The food is very good. And the service even better.

title: Fantastic Meal
comment: We had the most fantastic meal here! We live locally in Barnes and we're recommended to try this restaurant. The service was fantastic, and they timed the starter and main perfectly! A small break to allow your food to go down was perfectly timed. We were served by a lovely lady and an extremely nice young gentleman that took the time to make conversation whilst cleaning out table. It's a great restaurant, always busy but that didn't effect the service. We enjoyed every moment, and the food was delicious! Best meal in months, if not years! Thank you.  Donna & Eddie

title: Lives up to the name!
comment: D's been wanting to visit here for ages, and we had the perfect opportunity on New Year's Eve (after enjoying a mid-morning appointment with 'Paddington 2' at the Olympic Cinema opposite!). We opted to share Yum Nuea (traditional Thai salad, I've had it with shredded duck, minced chicken - this time, thin cuts of beef) and Pad Khing (stir-fried ginger, mushrooms and spring onions in a yellow bean sauce with prawns). Both were simply delicious! The salad was fresh and vibrant (the addition of a little mint, inspired) and the touch of heat in the Pad Khing hit the spot, the prawns cooked perfectly! We will be back for sure, just need to work out what film to see next!..

title: Excellent Authentic Thai Food
comment: Best Thai Food ever in London, nice presentation, fantastic service with warm welcome, highly recommended if you looking for original Thai food

title: Fantastic as per usual
comment: Hi it's been a few months since have been to awesome Thai due to moving away from the area, but we decided to go for dinner  today and it's still as awesome as ever  The best lamb chop I have ever had  Great food great staff

title: Awesomely Lives Up To It’s Name!
comment: You set the bar pretty high when you call yourself “awesome”. Awesome Thai exceeds the bar. I didn’t expect a local restaurant in Barnes to do this. Eating the red curry, I closed my eyes and the flavours transported me back to a recent holiday in Thailand - its that authentic. The decor is nothing special but the staff are warm and friendly and the food is great value. Reservations essential. This was my first visit but it will not be my last. Recommend!

title: Truly Awesome!!!
comment: Booked well in advance for a 50th birthday celebration, received a confirmation phone call nearer the time - that's good service. We wished we hadn't eaten earlier that day because we would have cleared the entire menu, as everything we had, from the soft shelled crab, panang & lamb chops to the wine, was exceptional. We were seated in the corner, perfect for people watching! The service was attentive but not intrusive, The waitress who explained how the dressed salad was to be poured over the crab deserves particular mention!! I'm planning to book for my Birthday in Feb - better do it today!!!! Great experience.

title: Awesome Thai was Totally Awesome!
comment: What a really beautiful surprise, we popped into this amazing restaurant for supper and was totally amazed by their great service, absolutely no request was a problem, the food was some of the finest Thai food I have ever eaten, totally delightful. I cannot commend the restaurant further, truly a great visit to Awesome Thai, we will return!

title: Awesome food, awesome service
