Awesome by name and awesome by nature, the red duck curry they serve here is simply the best. We've been twice now and both times were just as good. Complementary crackers on the table (such an easy but nice gesture so often overlooked by other rest), followed by satay chicken and spring rolls. Lovely. I've had the red duck curry twice now and my partner had the green chicken curry with coconut rice and sticky rice respectively and both times, we left nothing on our plates, it was so good. They bring little hot plates to the table that they put the china plates with the food on, so the food keeps piping hot - which I love! Service is fab - my partner didn't even have to ask for another beer when his glass was empty. And very reasonably priced at £50 for two covering two starters, two mains and rice with beer and wine. Now my fave resto in West London and deservedly so. Can't wait to go back.

title: Authentic Thai food. Highly recommended.
comment: Decided to give Awesome Thai (instead of our usual Thai Square) a visit last night. From the point we entered the restaurant to the time we left we were appreciated. We are a couple who appreciate real Thai food rather the disguised ones (blend/mild food). If you are looking for great authentic Thai food, look no further.  The owner and staff members were friendly and had customer service at heart. The complimentary prawn cracker, fried seaweed, prawn on toast, chilli paste and little Valentine's Day jelly hearts were the cherries on the cake. Keep it up guys. Will visit soon...this time with whole family!

title: The best Thai in London
comment: Me and my partner are a Thai food lovers. This is just the best Thai food and restaurant we have ever tried so far.  The best Pad Thai and Duck curry ever. Tasty, fresh, perfect dish side...and really good price. We had the tiramisu for dessert and it was just amazing. Best Thai Tiramisu. Just delicious. It is a familiar small restaurant. The atmosphere is really nice, authentic and staff is just incredibly nice, friendly, courteous and attentive. It was our first time and we will definitely come back very often as it has just become our favourite restaurant in London. Highly recommend.

title: Nice food , nice people, nice area
comment: Awesome Thai food like the name given to the restaurant. Feels authentic and nice atmosphere. The people owning the restaurant are lovely. You can follow your meal by a nice walk along the river.Highly recommend.

title: Amazing
comment: We regularly go to Awesome Thai and it never ceases to amaze us. The staff, particularly Lert and Pam are amazing and always go above and beyond to make your visit the most amazing experience. The food is out of this world and can be catered for your own particular taste. Would thoroughly recommend to anyone. Best Thai for miles. Thanks guys.

title: Average Thai. Not Awesome.
comment: Don't know what all the fuss is about. Have any of these reviewers been to Thailand? I have many times and I've also eaten in a lot of Thai restaurants in the UK. I can tell you as an experienced Thai food cook myself that the Thai food served in this restaurant is average by UK standards (which is low compared to Thailand).  We ordered a Thai green chicken curry which was terrible because it was made with a pre-purchased commercial paste to which they did what most UK (and some Thai) restaurants do which is to just add some coconut milk for a tin, add too much sugar and then plop some veg in. No sign of that much needed kaffir lime zest, or galangal and a measly amount of thai basil not leaving enough aniseed taste. The result was an over creamy, over sweet curry with no fresh/pestle ground grain and no aromatics. The Thai green chicken curry paste should have been made fresh for a restaurant that is rated so highly on TripAdvisor. No 44 out of almost 17,000 restaurants and probably the No.1 thai restaurant in London? I don't think so. We also ordered the fish wrapped in pandan leaf which was average and sea bass with 'special sauce' (made with tamarind, fish sauce and sugar), which was also average. Service was OK. The atmosphere was OK and the prices were also OK. All in all this Thai restaurant was average - certainly not awesome and not worth travelling a long way to visit.

title: Birthday family meal
comment: We went to this restaurant with 15 adults and 2 children, so as you can imagine a variety of food preferences, tastes, allergies ect! The staff were so patient, went in to detail to explain the ingredients (when needed) and catered to exactly our needs.  The food was amazing! Not a single fault or complaint... it was to perfection.  Highly recommended! Definitely value for money.

title: Awesomeness
comment: Beautiful looking food, fresh and vibrant flavours. Service is always spot on and friendly. The pana cotta with the kiwi sauce was awesome. Great value

title: The fantastic Awesome Thai, once tried you will be smitten.
comment: A complete gem of a Thai restaurant. Fantastic fresh food And incredible array of scrumptious Thai food, a real jewel of a restaurant. Thank you Lert & Pam great welcome and scrumptious food.

title: Dependable and Friendly
comment: Nothing earth shatteringly innovative, but very good standard Thai fare and the friendliest of service. The restaurant itself is not swish, but clean and pleasant, if a bit cramped. We are regularly, especially for take away.

title: One of the best thai restaurants outside of Thailand
comment: I really like Awesome Thai, I have recommended it to many friends and they too haven't been disappointed. The food is very tasty, beautifully presented, quick service, pleasant ambiance, friendly staff. I particularly like the special fish wrapped in banana leaf, the masamman curry is divine, the papaya salad is a burst of freshness and flavours. I was pleasantly suprised by the Pandan pancakes filled with fresh coconut. All deserts have a twist that works really well.

title: One of the best thai restaurants outside of Thailand
comment: Went there last Saturday evening with my partner. Barnes is a lovely area and the restaurant was welcoming and neat inside. The staff were really lovely and welcoming! I had Pad Grapow Gai and it was amazing as the Yam Nua was I had as a starter. My partner had a lovely Thai green curry that was delicious too. This restaurant is highly recommended. We will definitely go again when in London.

title: No service charged or given
comment: Our second and last visit here reminded me why we do not go more often. The basic problem is they take more orders than they can cook for, resulting in horrendous delays for takeaways and diners. The two couples either side of us were beside themselves with fury, having repeatedly asked for their meal, which they had to rush as they were going to the cinema. They both booked in good time but the delays were chronic. Even the takeaway clients were being asked to come back in 10 minutes or wait , resulting in a constant flow of people and the small restaurant being crowded. If this was not bad enough, the waiter kept a wine cooler between us and the next table, despite the fact neither of us were having any wine. Lastly, the lighting must be worst around, unless i have missed it. When our food arrived, the rice was overcooked and the duck laced with an overpowering sauce, which meant the meat was tasteless. Good news is that the green curry was ok and the beer cold. Conclusion,only go when you are not in a rush or you are immune to delays and mediocre food. I write this review after much consideration, as I am a massive supporter of local restaurants

title: Awesome Thai
comment: Really outstanding food and service, and fabulous value for money. We mostly have a takeaway but came with friends in Saturday night for dinner and we were not disappointed.

title: Great Thai food in London
comment: I went to Awesome Thai with a friend (who had been there before) on a Saturday evening. We had an early booking as from 7pm onwards all tables were reserved. Good sign :-).5 The service was prompt and all staff were very friendly. The food was excellent: I had pu nim tod (deep fried soft shell crab) as a starter and pad khing (stir fried ginger, mushrooms, spring onion, with chicken) with rice as a main. The portions were of a nice size and I had no room left for dessert! Prices are very reasonable too. I will definitely go back to Awesome Thai and recommend it to more friends.

title: Awesome place to et thai fodo
comment: Love this place. I usually take my friends to eat here because they serve excellent food with reasonable prices and great service. As a Thai student, I always come here to have Somtum Plara(Thai papaya Salad) which they would always add special ingredient for me. I believe people who come here will never be disappointed. Good choice indeed.

title: Good food and service
comment: Very much enjoyed our meal here. Great service and delicious food. Waiter brought extra chillies and a complementary dessert having ordered another.

title: Another wonderful meal-
comment: We were given a great welcome and enjoyed a fabulous meal, my favourite duck with tamarind sauce. If I have a house guest this is always my first choice to go and it never fails to live up to expectations.

title: Birthday celebration
comment: This restaurant is the best. My boys are 16 and 23 my girlfriend is 55 lm 61 . We love the food so fragrant .lovely staff and the whole experience was topped off with a huge smile from the owners Pam and Lert . We have been coming here for nearly four years now and always treated as part of the family, please come and experience the Awsome Thai x

title: Excellent food and service
comment: Found this place through TripAdvisor and was really glad that I did. The food is great and the service also, we were on our way to a concert at Hammersmith and the staff there made sure we had all our food in plenty of time to make the show. Price wise it is excellent, to be honest I was worried that given the location and great value prices that quality would be compromised, I needn't have been worried, it was excellent, don't let the cheap looking menu put you off. Will be back very soon

title: Truly awesome!
comment: This is our favourite Thai restaurant in London by a mile. We love it and get takeaway from here on a weekly basis - it's always excellent, with very friendly service. The Pad Thai is delicious and the Panang curry out of this world! They are always very accommodating with me being a vegetarian as well. I absolutely love this restaurant and am always recommending it to friends and family.

title: Great food, excellent dessert
comment: I love Awesome Thai! The food is simply delicious and definitely up there for Thai cuisine in West London. My husband and I visited frequently however since having a little one, we haven't been able to go due to the restaurant being quite small and I dont think it's the most baby friendly.  The tiramisu is in my top three tiramisus I have ever had and that's something considering one was from a highly rated restaurant in Italy and the other a great Italian chef!

title: Best Thai I’ve eaten at
comment: This is a wonderful, bustling, friendly restaurant that serves excellent authentic Thai food in a pleasant atmosphere. The staff a so friendly and charming they could probably serve hot dogs and it would still be worth going. Fortunately they serve fresh, unfussy, tastey classic Thai food. They also do takeaways. Just the best.

title: Mrs
comment: We enjoyed an excellent meal with very good service last night at the 6 pm sitting and would definitely recommend this restaurant for excellent Thai food

title: Awesome Thai is truly awesome
comment: Great food and fantastic service, I highly recommend it, as the food is great quality and food comes very fast

title: Mg
comment: Awesome host !!! Awesome food !! What more can you say about this wonderful place !! The only restaraunt full on a weekday night !!

title: Impressive Thai restaurant
comment: I and my girlfriend went to the awesome thai. We had ordered  " Crispy soft-shell crab " served with special dressing. It was amazing, dressing was not overpowering and all ingredients working together very well and texture of the dish wonderfully. " Steamed scallops " served with lemon sauce. Scallop very well cooked and lemon sauce was just right.  " Grilled sirloin beef " served with salad and egg fried rice (in the menu didn't mention about salad and egg fried rice). This is my star dish, (personally beef lover) Beef was cooked beautifully medium rare juicy and a little bit hint of herbs. I love love it.  " Grilled marinated lamb " served with the same as Beef dish. Lamb was very well cooked still pink and moist.  " Seafood pad kra prao " It reminded me of having food in Thailand again.  Lastly very warm welcome host. I have had a perfect dinner.

title: Next best thing to Koh Thai Tapas
comment: This place was pleasantly surprising as we didn't expect the food to be so tasty. We normally travel to get a good thai restaurant but this one is just round the corner and almost better than our usual! Green curry is the best we have ever tasted. The service is incredible and very warming. Defo reccommend

title: Exquisito Thai - exquisite Thai
comment: Totally recommend restaurant. Very good food with vey good taste and quality. Not expensive (not cheap).  Restaurante muy recomendable con platos muy ricos con mucho sabor y buena calidad. 100% compulsory visit. Must be visit. 100% visita obligada.

title: Another great meal
comment: A belated review of another excellent meal, this time an end of year lunch for a party of eight, food as good as ever with the usual friendly and efficient service. Recommend very highly.

title: Never disappoints
comment: Lurt and co are friendly and attentive, and great Thai food. The soft shell crab a particular favourite.

title: Amazing
comment: We stayed in Hammersmith at the weekend, we went to see Billy Connolly at the Apollo.... Anyway after a quick search on tripadvisor we found this gem, 5 mins away!!  The restaurant is beautifully decorated, very smart and modern.. The food was absolutely amazing, could not fault a single thing! We ordered the mixed platter to share for starters which was delicious. Not sure of the names of the other dishes we had but again, they didn't disappoint... Big portions and not expensive either! If your in the area this is a must, can't wait to come back in the summer!! 5 stars.

title: Beautiful food.
comment: We've just got back from a meal at this restaurant. Everyone is very friendly and welcoming. There's a lovely atmosphere. The food is delicious. Well worth a visit.

title: excellent
comment: excellent food and service. price are more than reasonable comparing to quality. I recommend it 100/100 Make sure you book :)

title: Wonderful food & service!
comment: I took my Mum to Awesome Thai this evening for her birthday. It was such a wonderful experience, we were both delighted.  The food was absolutely delicious, so flavoursome. The staff were excellent!  Also I think extremely good value for money.  I highly recommend this restaurant!

title: Awesome!
comment: Great food, fresh ingredients, really friendly and helpful service. It's wonderful to have a neighbourhood estaurant serving authentic Thai food. We can also recommend the take way service. Quick, efficient and also delicious. Rick. East Sheen

title: A fantastic meal
comment: I had been recommended this place by some friends and it blew me away. Very friendly, professional service and a beautifully kept restaurant, with more than reasonable prices. We had the duck red curry, Phad Thai & grilled prawns - all delicious and complemented by a starter and desert on the house since it was our first visit. Probably the best Thai I have had in London and definitely a new local favourite - can't wait to go back!

title: Decent Thai food
comment: Decent quality Thai food. I ordered the Pad Thai and that was very tasty. No complaints! Great if you're local.

title: Authentically cooked and well presented
comment: I've been far away from home for years and missing my Thai dishes so badly. This place reminded me of having dinner at my favourite restaurant located just by Choapraya river in central Bangkok!! Will definitely come back with my colleagues again!! Yum!!

title: Went back and will go back again, was great !
comment: I have just had luncheon at Awesome Thai and I will definitely go back again. The staff is very nice and kind, and the food is great.

title: Ning gray
comment: I have very good time tonight and very good food with my friends lovely people very good service wram and welcome diffinily I'll come back here again

title: A bit average?
comment: Tasty food but not very special - the lunch box is quite small and not particularly good value I thought. The restaurant was a bit quiet at lunch time on a weekend, so maybe it was lacking atmosphere which impacted my experience. The service was a bit lacklustre and I just didn't feel like the food blew my mind. I have had much better Thai food in 101 Thai Kitchen in London.

title: One of the best dining experiences we have ever had
comment: We are back in the UK from Cyprus for 3 weeks for Xmas and as it was my wife's birthday wanted to celebrate somewhere special. Our son and his family used to live in Barnes before they moved to Australia and recommended the Awesome.Before we retired to Cyprus we went to Thailand every year visiting just about every Region and fell in love with the food.Sadly Thai food in the UK did not taste the same - it was good but not wonderful.You could have a good experience in nice surroundings but it came at a price and simply did not match the true Thai experience. Obviously there is only one place to enjoy Thai food at its best - in the country itself - but the Awesome comes very very close to take you back to those idyllic times in Thailand. The staff there are simply wonderful,charming and helpful - the ambience is so so good - and the food - simply out of this world.We have never tasted Thai food like it anywhere else in the world - apart from Thailand itself - and we will never forget last night there for my wife's birthday.Also as I said earlier to sample Thai food "above the average" it comes at a price - the Awesome value for money is enequalled - starters.a main dish,rice,beautiful stir fried vegetables and a nice bottle of wine - £53 !!! It would cost you that per head at places like the Blue Elephant and the food is not as good.If we do not do anything else on this short trip to the UK it has been worth the cost of 2 flights from Cyprus just to sample the Awesome Thai Restaurant.

title: Average rather than Awesome
comment: After reading such rave reviews about this restaurant, I was really looking forward to our visit. When we arrived we had to wait near the entrance almost hovering over other diners. There are tables either side of the restaurant then tables for 2 in a line over what might be a natural walkway. Everything is quite close. We were seated after a few minutes and our coats taken. Our table was right by the bar and telephone. The decor is eclectic and I am not sure that it works. Some wood panelling but not particularly Thai style, multicoloured flashing LED icicles hanging all around the restaurant and one side has large lightbulb shaped light fittings. The restaurant was busy and the service was a little slow. That said the staff were warm and friendly. There was 'elevator' music in the background, but what disturbed me the most was the constant trilling of the telephone. Not just a ring ring. The same annoying ring that my home phone has. It was constant. The restaurant is obviously popular for takeaway, and from our vantage point close to the counter there was a busy stream of people perching on the adjacent tables waiting. This was a little distracting. We both had the soup starter (I think mine was Tom Yum Hed). It was nice enough, but not particularly fragrant or anything to write home about. I had a veggie dish of Aubergine and the coconut rice. Again, nothing unpleasant about it but to me it was lacklustre for a Thai meal. I also had the banana fritters and ice cream for dessert. The fritters were nice enough but the ice cream was definitely from the cheaper end of the spectrum. However, I suppose at £3.95 you get what you pay for. I love Thai food, think Thai Square is overrated but by comparison to this would give them 4/5, and particularly like Suk Suran in Wimbledon which offers light, delicate, flavourful food. So where I would give Suk Suran 5/5 for food, 4/5 for value (its not cheap) and 3-4/5 for service, by comparison I rate this as 3/5 for food, 4/5 for value and 5/5 for service. What I did observe here however, was many regulars warmly welcomed, and lots of smiles from the staff, so what it lacked in some areas it did make up for with friendliness. It is possible I am more fussy these days, as nights out are rare (due to babysitter costs), so I really want to enjoy the moment. I wouldn't rush back here, but plenty of the people of Barnes seem happy with it, so who am I to argue? All I would say is, if you love Thai and want to try something really exceptional, go to Suk Suran in Wimbledon. It is gourmet Thai dining.

title: The best Thai restaurant in London
comment: I have been to Awesome Thai with my boyfriend for a several times. One of my favourite dish is the soft shell crab served with special dressing. The asparagus wrapped with bacon and the steam scallops with spicy sauce is recommended. As well as the salmon salad (called Meing salmon) which is very tasty and gives you a notable of Thai herbs. For the main course we ordered grilled marinated lamb, grilled sirloin beef (medium cook), stir fried black pepper and garlic with beef, Pad Thai noodle and stir fried aubergine. The foods were absolutely perfect and the taste was just right as always. After we have finished our main course, we had Thai Tiramisu and Pannacotta as we are sweet teeth and we still have a room for the dessert. There were fantastic and nail our dinner. The service was excellent even the restaurant is packed. We recommended you to reserve the table because the restaurant is always fully book especially Friday and weekends. We will definitely come back again.

title: Excellent food and service
comment: We were waited on by Punam who was wonderful. She was attentive and made us feel very welcomed. The food was very good. Highly recommend for good food and service near Heathrow (in the Sheraton).

title: Strong Indian spot at LHR
comment: In between flights at LHR and had a great dining experience with at Madhu’s with Caetano. Proper Manhattan and outstanding masala...

title: We're already planning our next trip back!!
comment: Beautiful little restaurant wilth beautiful views of a church. Staff were friendly and warm from the minute we stepped through the door. the atmosphere was chilled and rather romantic in my point of view. The food was amazing and well presented - you got what you asked for and was well presented. In my opinion, don't go on the chilly rating - I had a Yellow curry which states 1 Chilly and have to say there was no spice at all. it was that good we are already planning a trip back and will be taking our friends along!!

title: If you love Authentic Thai try this place for sure
comment: Great service, ambience, and food. The highlight is undoubtedly kaeng massaman keak (curry with lamb, potatoes, onion and peanuts). Thanks for the anniversary desert surprise to make the evening so much more special.

title: AMAZING THAI FOOD AND HOSPITALITY
comment: My husband and I decided to stop and have our meal here last night, it was our first time here. We both love thai food and have been eating it for years. We ordered a vegetarian green curry and some other bits.  It was probably the best Green Curry we have eaten, it was perfectly spiced, so tasty. and they made all the food without fish sauce (us veggies) , which was great!! The staff were super impressive, so polite and kind. Pam was one of the staff who looked after us really well. Thank you to 'Awesome Thai' for the AMAZING food. We will definitely see you very soon. Jaimie

title: Beware of any restaurant that calls itself 'awesome' - it's invariably mediocre!
comment: I really don't understand why people have rated this restaurant highly. There are many places where you can eat terrific Thai food in London but this isn't one of them!  Eight of us ate dinner here tonight as it's opposite the wonderful Olympic cinema. We shared four starters, all of which were bland, tasteless and under-seasoned. My main course of duck red curry (badged with 2 chillies so designated 'hot') comprised several pieces of overcooked duck floating alongside pineapple chunks and grapes in a mildly seasoned gravy. I could have challenged them under the Trades Description Act for misuse of the word 'curry'.  If you want fantastic, spicy, authentic far-Eastern food, go to Thai Pin in St Margarets and enjoy the real taste of Thailand!

title: A Great Local in Barnes
comment: This is a great local Thai restaurant serving excellent food. The owners are very attentive and are very popular with the local crowd. Their prices are very very reasonable along with their wines and I would highly recommend them. They also deliver and you can pop in for takeaway.

title: The Best Thai I have eaten at
comment: Met early ( which was just as well ) as we were going to the cinema opposite. Met at 7.00pm and by 7.30 they were asking people to wait or come back later. Always a good sign I thought and I was right. Mixed platter to start which was great, Satay, Prawns, Asparagus a really good varied mix. My Lamb Chops after were terrific, cooked perfectly and served with a fabulous tangy salsa type sauce. We were out in good time for our 8.40 film so not a long drawn out affair but perfect for a pre film meal. Will defineitly be back soon

title: Divine !!!
comment: I guess I am now addicted to Thai cuisine...went in with friends and we truly had a great feast. Lovely starters and awesome flavoured aromatic mains...The service was top notch with the perfect setting and decor.

title: Superb!
comment: Absolutely delicious! And great service! Best Thai Restaurant in town for sure! Lovely atmosphere :)

title: Great food great service
comment: Having been here a number of times I can recommend this place over any other Thai places in London. If not for the food then for the service. I am always looked after here and have never had a bad experience with the food. As a foodie I can recommend this place. It's one place that can put awesome in front of its cuisine and live up to standard. Worth a visit and it's always full of people.

title: A wonderful dinner : fantastic food, great service !
comment: First time in this restaurant, and not the last for sure ! The food was very good and my girlfriend knows what great Thai food is, as she is from Thailand. The service was great and quick ! My girlfriend and I had a wonderful time, and when we looked around we saw it was the same for everyone else. The strongest recommandation !

title: Great local Thai restaurant
comment: We're very happy to have found this friendly and authentic Thai restaurant on our doorstep - the menu has many classic dishes and specials such as the spicy lamb chops in a kind of bento box. Great prawn crackers and free dish of crispy seaweed when ordering takeaways.  It's busy so probably best to book, but takeaway is also reliable.

title: Number 1 Spot in Beckenham
comment: Number 1 Spot in Beckenham for a Chai Latte. Great service and amazing food also!  Would highly recommend.

title: Lunch
comment: Excellent food once again, really tasty eggs benedict with great seasoning. Nice crispy chips. Couldn’t resist taking a piece of cake home as was too full from the ample portions to eat it there and then! The owners were as friendly as ever. Lovely.

title: A visit in Thailand
comment: Located in Barnes district, Awesome Thai offers the best authentic experience if you wish to bump into the Thai culture. The staff was very kind and friendly, excellent service and the dishes were brilliant. We found the asparagus with bacon and the fish cake lovely. A place that deserves more than one visit. They invited us for a pot of jasmine tea and a generous portion of a birthday cake. If you want to taste the traditional Thai food you cannot miss out: it's a sensation of flavours.

title: Awesome thai
comment: Very nice service & perfect authentic Thai food. One of the best Thai Restaurants in London. Will come again!

title: Best Thai restaurant
comment: Frequent visitor with family, never had a bad meal. Outstanding food. Very friendly staff especially Coon Apple. Very child friendly, even my youngest who is a fussy eater is looked after. Nothing is to much trouble at Awesome Thia. Awesome by name and awesome by taste. Ellie

title: Excellent Thai food
comment: As consumers of Thai foods here in Britain and Thailand over many years  I was delighted to find Awesome Thai in Barnes. My particular favourite is grilled marinated lamb. The service is quick and efficient. There is a very friendly atmosphere. I hope to go there many more times.

title: A standard local Thai restaurant
comment: As far as a local Thai restaurant goes this is good. It would be unfair to suggest this is 'very good' as there is nothing particular that stands out and certainly nothing that has the 'wow' factor. It caters to the local, mostly uninitiated diner who has minimal expectations.  The food is fresh and probably slightly over priced for what it is but then being in Barnes you can expect a 20% uplift from the off. I would suggest sticking to the usual Thai staples such as a green or red curry and perhaps egg fried rice. The latter is definitely not freshly cooked to order as it would not be possible in the time it is served from ordering.  'Apple' the owner is a nice friendly chap and deserves to do well if nothing for this reason.  It is clean, relabel and delivers locally.

title: Great place to eat before going to the cinema across the street
comment: Very accommodating when the restaurant was close to full and found us a table. Service was quick and excellent. A wide choice of Thai food and our choice made it obvious that they know what they are doing! Good quality and well priced

title: Good food, great service
comment: Really nice Thai food with the most friendly and amusing staff, Great midweek treat, the best dish was the soft shell crab

title: Delicious food and friendly staff
comment: Fresh and tasty food, relaxed atmosphere and charming staff. The homemade Panna Cotta with kiwi sauce was heavenly!

title: Great Thai experience
comment: Fantastic place a bit off course from super central London but definitely worth it. Staff is superb. Food Thai at its best. Great the coconut soup. And the Thai beef salad.  Will be back!!

title: Sunday morning breakfast
comment: Rendez Vous is a local favourite of ours. We come here quite regulay as the food is excellent and the staff are very freidnky and helpful. My sisters favourite is eggs royal and my brother in law love the veggie breakfast. I love everytuing, including their oasta dishes at lunch time. I would recomend this restaurant ti anyone.

title: Saturday Lunch
comment: Just visited for Saturday lunch. Yummy food, big portions. We struggle to find dog friendly places to have lunch and were about to sit outside when we were invited in. Thank you for inviting us in from the cold. Will certainly visit again.

title: Really good Thai
comment: Have eaten here loads of times, with family and friends. Great food and service. Very friendly staff. Always make my kids welcome!!!

title: Great service, amazing food
comment: Very nice small restaurant. The food was very good. A bit pricey but well worth it. We had to wait for our order a bit, it was very busy. Recommended!

title: Definitely awesome food!
comment: We found this great Thai restaurant on a trip to the cinema in Barnes. The food was brilliant and the service was great. The dishes were all tweaked to our individual taste as we range in age from 8 to 47. The dishes were freshly cooked and the flavors were delicate - one of the best Thai meals we've had! Epic and awesome!

title: First time visit
comment: Truly Awesome place. All personal extremely friendly and efficient. Amazing food. Will definitely come back and recommend it to friends for a great meal.

title: Varietas delectat!
comment: When you are bored with English meats go and visit this small, modern restaurant with autentic thai food. If you like thai cuisine you won't be disappointed, if don'd, this is the best place to meet it! Food is great, service kind. We even had the opportunity to sing thai folclore songs...

title: A must for a Friday/Saturday noght
comment: Independent family owned restaurant, the owner "Apple" is so passionate for his food & just full of life. His energy creates a great atmosphere that's infectious.  The food was exceptional & I will definitely be returning

title: Good Thai food
comment: All there but with the temperature turned down a bit to allow for those who haven't visited Thailand to try a bite. Very good service and very polite and friendly staff. Dare one say priced almost too reasonably compared to the more expensive and less satisfying restaurants closer to the heart of the West End.

title: Lovely relaxed Thai restaurant, with great food and service
comment: Fantastic food and service throughout the evening. First time my girlfriend had eaten in the restaurant itself, but after a great take away the week before, we decided to give it ago.  Luckily managed to get a table for two, so might advise to book to avoid disappointment. Nice welcome from all the staff, and a good atmosphere inside.  A very good menu with your standard Thai food, would personally recommend that platter to share to start, and the Pad Thai with chicken or prawns. Cant go wrong. A great place to visit, and the best Thai food I have had by comparing other Thai restaurants in Barnes, East Sheen and Richmond. Looking forward to our next meal there already.

title: Best Thai Restaurant in England!
comment: The name of this restaurant says it all. It is awesome. I'm part Thai and this is the best Thai food I've eaten since moving to London. Located in charming Barnes, it is a quick journey just over the Hammersmith Bridge. The manager/host has a name that is pronounced like the fruit "apple", is very hospitable and friendly. The service is phenomenal as is the food. I highly recommend it if you are craving Thai.

title: One of the best Thai restaurant
comment: I think this is one of the best Thai restaurant I have ever been to. The food is tasty and the dish also comes in a good size. Highly recommend.

title: Superstar Kate
comment: Regular excellent service from Kate, and the food to go with the service is equally as amazing! Would recommend to all !

title: Fantastic
comment: Visited here after reading Trip Advisor. The food and service was fantastic. The homemade coconut pancake desert was a real treat. For the location the price was good value. Nice to be given a pot of green tea to finish off.

title: Good Thai in a convenient location near London Wetlands Centre
comment: Good Thai food with a friendly welcome very close to the London Wetlands Centre and the Olympic Studios Cinema (opposite in fact). Had a good lunch here with Singa beer and coffee afterwards. Roughly £70 for four people with desserts but no wine for lunch. Desserts were good (particularly the fried banana with ice cream).

title: Brilliant local Thai - awesome service!
comment: Just been here for the first time for my wife's birthday. Fantastic service and welcome, delicious starter platter, very good but not exceptional main courses (spiced for western palate), and a lovely birthday pudding surprise. Good value, modern not cheesy decor and busy on midweek August night. Booking advised, we'll be back!

title: Has stood the test of time. Remains awesome.
comment: A lot of restaurants are good for a period and then slip into the "also ran " category, but not this one. Great food everytime and great people.

title: Always a pleasure
comment: I live it here. The staff are so friendly and attentive, especially "Apple" who is something of a charmer. The food is fresh, the place is clean, the atmosphere is easy and the prices are reasonable. What more could you ask from your local Thai? Give it a shot Photos: Crispy Wonton, Penang beef curry

title: Even Thai people like it
comment: Was recommended to go here by a Thai friend so I popped in after the theater for a quick bit, we got in just before close at 11... We quickly ordered a Penang beef curry and a crispy sea bass... The curry tasted great but the beef was tough so I'd go for chicken next time, the sea bass was great, very tasty and crispy... I was told the seafood was good so maybe stick to that.... But it good and reasonably priced... I'd go again, service was quick and friendly...

title: Yum yum
comment: Food was great as usual. We came very late on a Sunday, but the staff were still very welcoming and gave us a great after pub meal. A MUST if you like real Thai food and style.

title: Awesome
comment: Delicious food and nice environment \(//∇//)\ . I highly recommend grilled marinated lamb for main course and Tiramisu for dessert.

title: Wow!
comment: My husband and I walked 4 half miles to eat here and it was well worth it. We had the awesome starter to start with, this had 4 dips, Thai fish cakes, prawns in batter, spring rolls, satay chicken and asparagus with bacon wrapped around. The starter was brilliant and it did not stop there. For our main we had Thai green curry, beef Penang, rice noodles and jasmine rice. The beef was melt in your mouth, the flavours where wow. For dessert we had coconut pancakes wow again. We finished with green jasmine tea. We also had a beer and wine with our meal. The service was the best I have ever had, all the staff had cared. Great prices for the food and service you get. This has to be my favourite Thai restaurant. This restaurant lives up to its name, go and try for yourself!

title: Fabulous Thai
comment: Our second visit here and the food impressed again. There is a delightful lightness and subtlety of flavour to the dishes here which one wants but increasingly seem to have disappeared from Thai restaurants. The service is absolutely spot on. The only slight negative is that this very full restaurant could do with some sound suppression. Happy Barnsites don't half make a racket.

title: Family Dinner
comment: My daughter was missing spicy Thai food so we tried this restaurant for the first time. Awesome indeed! Very authentic Thai food including the som tam. Every dish we selected was great, and Jenn was happy with the chilli rating of the laab. Best of all were the very warm and friendly owners and staff. Thank you Khun Pun. We feel like we have new family in Barnes.

title: It was really niceeeee ! I would highly recommended
comment: It was really niceeeee ! I would highly recommended! the food was very yummy and service was really nice !

title: excellent service and decent food
comment: We are regulars here. they always remember us and the food is reliable and good it could be spicier but I am sure if you asked they would up the spices!

title: Great flavours. Good service
comment: We've been twice now and I already feel lie I'm a valued customer.  The flavours are wonderful and quality of the food really good.  The restaurant's quite small but comfortable. A bit noisy when full (which is most of the time!) but not horribly so.

title: Second visit did not disappoint
comment: Had lunch here a couple of years ago after visiting the Wetlands Centre nearby. Did the same trip today and felt like a Thai late lunch once more so crossed our fingers that this place was still open. It is and food was just as enjoyable and well presented as remembered. Excellent fish cakes and red curry. And lovely service. Highly recommended.

title: lovely friendly staff, great with kids, relaxed atmosphere, very good food
comment: Great service, above average thai food, friendly staff great with kids. Busy for a Wednesday evening but food came out quickly.

title: Fabulous food and service!
comment: Highly recommend the delicious special soft shell crab, tiramisu dessert and Nicki our waitress (and everything else in between)

title: Great service - Exceptional food
comment: We are locals and this is a regular eating place, however, Apple. Let and the team make everyone feel welcome and special. The food is consistently great and extremely flavoursome, take your tastebuds on an excursion with the different dishes offering varied and mouthwatering experiences.  Make sure you book as this is a firm favourite with many and you may need to resort to a take away! The wine list is reasonably extensive too. Go on, take the plunge - you will not be disappointed

title: One of our most favourite restaurants ever!
comment: We come here often and it is always great but today was extra special as we told them it was our cousins birthday,they brought out a delicious cake and sung happy birthday to my cousins. Matthew age 12

title: Good BUT certainly not Awesome
comment: Following reading other reviews we went along to this restaurant expecting amazing food. The food was fairly good but certainly not out of this world. We have had better elsewhere. The satay was excellent but then we also had a couple of their specials for starters, tiger prawn salad with aubergine, the aubergine was a soggy, tasteless mess and we had avocado, spring onion and prawn wraps which we felt were bland and uninspiring - we left half of the dish. The main course's were good, a generous portion of sea bass in chilli sauce and great pad thai, but considering this is quite an expensive restaurant and is self styled 'Awesome', it just does not quite live up to its billing.

title: Perfect brunch spot!
comment: I cannot recommend this delightful cafe enough. The Ginger Beet juice is heavenly, the food is outstanding and the service is warm, fast and friendly. Definitely my top spot in Beckenham.

title: Local cafe
comment: Great cappuccino. Welcoming friendly staff, and, unusually, dogs are welcome too - and your pooch might be lucky and get a bit of sausage from the kitchen . It doesn’t get any better than that.

title: Best Thai in London
comment: This was our first visit her but won’t be the last. Fantastic food, we had a soft shell salad and beef salad for starters - both superb. The pat pong Gali seafood curry main was the best I’ve had outside of Thailand.  A really classy and welcoming space with great service too. We will be back.

title: Wonderful food
comment: We have visited this Thai a few times now and the service is always very friendly and efficient and the food is always excellent while also being really great value. The restaurant itself has a very nice ambience and it is now one of our favourite places to eat out.

title: Monday visit
comment: even on a Monday evening at 9pm busy. great staff. service excellent. clean. food freshly prepared. xxxxxxxxxxx. xxxxxxxx

title: The standards since last year have dropped
comment: The staff are amazing friendly. I first time me and my partner tried Awesome we were blown away by everything. If i was writing this last year it would be 5 star but for some reason the food does not seem as good as it once was? Everyone I recommended Awesome to and loved it last year have also shared the same view. It's still good but i can't recommend it till the food gets back to what it was last year. Will try again maybe in 6 months to see if it's back to normal and give a better review.

title: Very good for take away
comment: Very good take-away, no nonsense thai food, fantastic kind service - the napkins are very well constructed!

title: Really good Thai food!
comment: The food took a bit long to come for us but apart from that, everything else was great. Staff were very friendly and tentative. Food was amazing! Glass noodle salad was very delicious, great balance between sweet, sour and salty. Other places tend to make this dish a bit too salty. Beef salad with onion and cucumber was also one of our favourite. Our best dish of the night must be grilled duck in tamarind sauce. Had it with coconut rice and you'll finish it in no time. I found their dishes were spicy in general but easy on your palette, so do not worry if you can't eat too spicy. Besides, price was reasonable. I would expect a bit more expensive given its location in posh area. Give it a try and you will see what i mean.

title: Superb Thai food
comment: This was our first visit to this restaurant in Barnes, the menu was quite varied and of excellent quality. We tried Pu Nim Tod, which is a deep fried soft shell crab served with sweet chilli sauce, and the Awesome Platter consisting of various Thai starters, asparagus wrapped in bacon something we haven't had before it was all delicious, this was followed by Yum Nuea a spicy beef salad and a Thai red curry, the servings are quite large and we were totally stuffed after the meal. This was all washed down with a bottle of the house white, very nice.

title: Best Thai in London!
comment: We are massive Thai food fans and nothing beats this place! Beautiful food, incredible service (always with the biggest smiles), and VERY fair prices. Recently had a birthday dinner and was surprised by the staff with complimentary dessert, candles and singing.. We didn't even tell them!! Wish I could rate these guys higher. It doesn't get better.

title: A wonderful Thai restaurant
comment: I just love this place. The owners are delightful, the service out of this world and the food just excellent. I highly commend it. The take away service is also exemplary. If I have one (minor) criticism, it is that when you dine in the dishes would benefit from a little more sauce... while take away comes swimming with sauce! It's an odd discrepancy, but one I can live with as the food is outstanding.

title: Great Thai Food
comment: Went for a chilled meal with friends, very relaxed, lovely staff, great food. Would particularly recommend the Massaman Curry

title: Not just Thai curry
comment: What a lovely restaurant. I love Thai food and am always looking for somewhere that is a bit more than just Thai curry. This is the place. Really interesting and varied foods beautifully presented by lovely warm staff. Full to the brim of local Barnes residents as well as some from over the river! The staff really care about the food and the presentation. We started with the soft shell crab which was delicious, then had sea bass lamb chops and chicken curry with pineapple. Phad Thai and coconut rice. Forgot the little amuse bouche prawn toast to start. All finished off with their ginger and honey tea.

title: Loved it
comment: Miss having great Thai food, but found it in Barnes. The staff were absolutely fabulous and dinner was excellent. Highly recommend.

title: Takeaway good but not great !!
comment: By reading other reviews I was expecting more!! I think that was the Main problem ( they had a lot to live up to ) but have had better and has been a better price , They did get my order a little muddled up and was not as hot as I would have liked .

title: Truly awesome!
comment: Best Thai kitchen in the region and obviously our regular treat going forward. Very lovely to our little boy. Book your table upfront; small and busy...

title: Holiday
comment: Amazing, aromatic and AWESOME!!! Pardon the pun but absolutely amazing service, food incredible, friendly, lovely ambiance, attention to detail and explanation of food and origins of ingredients given freely. Eat Thai often but never have one on this level!!!!!! Would definatey travel over 200 miles again to return!!!!!! Come and try for yourself!!!! Can't rate it enough!

title: Delicious food- great service
comment: We visited the Awesome Thai restaurant based on recommendation from a friend. We were not disappointed,in fact very impressed. We ordered 2 ThaI seafood soups- hot spicy in a delicious unctuous gingery broth. Mains of red thai chicken curry and a beef salad were fresh and authentic. In between courses, we were presented with an amuse bouche which was delicious and tasted all the better as it was free of charge. Service was impeccable and prices very reasonable indeed.  Fantastic restaurant in a nice location -easy to park and a friendly neighbourhood gem!

title: Awesome indeed
comment: Always amazing service and great food. Definitely worth the visit to Barnes. Can highly recommend the fresh rolls vegetable and the beef pa nang.

title: AWESOME every time!
comment: I discovered this lovely place about 1.5 years ago through Trip Advisor and have been going there at least once a month for dinner. As it's been flawless every time, with friendly service, fantastic food, great prices and very authentic flavours, I have been bringing friends, family and work colleagues regularly and every one of them just loves it. Having travelled to Thailand a couple of times, I found some of the dishes better tasting than any other places there and to date, I have not found a bad choice on their menu. A definite must if you find yourself close to west London - it is absolutely worth it!  Tip 1: Some of my favourite dishes are the Pad Thai, the Thai green curry with coconut rice, the Tom Ka Gai soup, the fresh rolls or the soft shell crab. Tip 2: Depending on where you staying in London, bus 209 and 485 can bring you in from Hammersmith station and bus 33 comes in from Richmond. Hammersmith Bridge and the pubs around there are a nice scene of scenery, plus with a visit to the Wetland Centre and lunch or dinner at Awesome Thai make a great half-day out.

title: Mr
comment: Best Thai in Barnes! We enjoyed our meals very much we are looking forward to our next visit in a nearby future

title: Good food, good value for money & great atmosphere
comment: My girlfriend has been to Awesome Thai many times and said it was really good locally. So I thought I'd try it out, I'm quite particular with Thai food, from experience it can be cheap or really good but never in between. Awesome Thai was definitely one of the more positive experiences. Wine selection was good and the ambience was pleasant, not too loud not too quiet. I had Tom Yum for starter & fresh rolls (I do eat a lot as an Ultramarathoner), the flavours were intense and really fresh. I was very happy with my choice! I try and refrain from having a Green Curry, but opted for the Red Curry with prawns. Was very impressed with the quantity, they were generous with the prawns too. Service was quick and easy, had no issues at all. Would definitely recommend this place amongst many other Thai restaurants in the area

title: Really, really confused - am I missing something?
comment: Went on a Saturday night and based on the reviews was looking forward to it. What did we experience? Perfectly pleasant service in perfectly pleasant surroundings. But the food? Meh would be generous. The spring rolls tasted exactly the same as the ones you get in Saibsburys, so did the sweet chilli sauce for that matter. The Tom yum wasn't bad but the fish in pandan leaf (one of the chef specials) was actually rather repulsive - too soft and mushy so very unpleasant to eat.  Not sure if people in Barnes have never eaten proper Thai food or if expectations are really low but with headings like 'best Thai in Barnes' (there are only 2!) please don't get your hopes up. This is a very average restaurant.

title: Best Thai in my life!!!!!
comment: First time visit as had read so many good reviews. Absolutely loved it. We have been to many Thai restaurants but the best thing about this place is how balanced all the dishes are. Everything is cooked so well that there is no overpowering taste of one particular ingredient. The service is great too, normally when the food is really good and has had rave reviews, you sometimes find that the service starts to wean however the cafe style approach of the staff means its a very relaxed and informal environment. Ordered lamb chops as a main and was very impressed with the quality of the lamb, no cheap cuts of meat here just very well cooked and amazing lamb with the best mint,garlic dressing I have ever had. Will definitely be coming back to try more dishes on the menu.

title: Still Awesome!
comment: Sometimes when I go back to a restaurant after having a great first experience, it doesn't quite measure up. Not here. I loved it on my first visit and love it still. It is the best Thai food I have eaten outside of Thailand. It is also very handy for the fabulous Olympic Cinema. That's date night sorted! It is always, deservedly, pack so make sure you book. You will not be disappointed.

title: Good Food,friendly atmosphere
comment: The restaurant is situated opposite the Olympic cinema.This is not a large restaurant so I'd advise booking.It's popular and with good cause. The food is delicious and the service attentive.A meal for two with beer or wine will cost around £40-45 with tip.The restaurant encourages customers to review them on trip advisor which shows a justified confidence in their fare.

title: Best Thai food in London. Exeptional service, Staff really take care of you
comment: We went as a group of 4 friends to Awesome Thai as it was highly recommended. The food was amazing we ordered a section of dishes to share so we could try a bit of everything. My favourites were the marinated lamb,so tender and juicy, the Giant King prawns with garlic and spicy lemon were out of this world and the Thai green Curry with chicken so tasty and authentic, the list goes on and on....the staff were really kind and knowlegeable making our experience as a whole superb. This has become my new favourote place to eat, what can I say it just makes you want to go back again and again. Thank you

title: One of the best Thai meals we've had!
comment: This really is awesome thai food! Staff very helpful and friendly. Probably best to book as even on a cold damp Wednesday evening the restaurant was full.

title: Lives up to it's name!
comment: We had an excellent meal here. The staff were really friendly and suggested what we should try. Highly recommend.

title: Good but not great
comment: Went for lunch thought it was average as starters were very good but main was cold. Ok tho defo not 5 star service

title: Took us back to our holidays in Thailand
comment: Fantastic meal and service. Best chicken pad thai in London. Lot of choices and feel very cosy. Lerd (the boss) is an amazing person, thanks again for that very good evening!  Emilie & Fred

title: Really really good
comment: The tamarind duck is stellar. Lovely staff. Definitely one of the better Thai restaurants in London. Shame it's in Barnes so we won't be regulars as staying with a friend here

title: Quirky name actually true
comment: Don't be put off by the name. This place is in no way pretentious. There is an air of confidence and you do feel in good hands. The owners and staff are friendly, cool and laid back, They are also proud of the quality of their dishes and service. We love it and when ever we gat the chance, when up in London, we go to Awesome Thai

title: Best ever. Fantastic and wonderful.
comment: Certainly the best Thai meal I've ever had outside of Thailand. and better than most of had inside Thailand. The scallops starter was wonderful. The spiced fish was out of this world. The Rice was flavoursome and elegant and very well done.  The service was friendly, welcoming and with real charm, Grace and passion. Don't pass this place by

title: Amazing!!
comment: Went for dinner tonight before going to see Rocketman at the Olympic tonight.  Everything from start to finish was absolutely incredible, the service was super friendly, professional and knowledgeable. We had one gluten free member of our party and one vegetarian, both were accommodated without any problems at all. The food is perfectly cooked and utterly delicious! I have a few photos but not of all the food as I was too eager to eat it! The bill came it at about £120 for five people for dinner which was a few starters to share and a main course each, which we all agreed was incredible value!  I will definitely be returning and will be ordering from their takeaway menu in the very near future

title: Tasty Thai
comment: Summer rolls were fresh & tasty, 1 of the best pad Thais I've ever had (inc Thailand) & spicy green veggie curry. Great value, friendly & speedy service. Highly recommended.

title: Convenient Well Priced Local
comment: Went with my husband and best friend for her birthday. The menu provided a wide selection of options and portions were generous. The staff were charming and the prices all very reasonable. Only drawback, if you're sensitive to MSG as I am - take care - I woke with a bad case of MSG face the following day.

title: Briiliant
comment: One of our favourite places to eat. Delicious ample portions and wonderfully attentive and friendly staff. We have to resist going too often!

title: Been here many times
comment: very friendly and excellent food ,wine, and especially service-didn't want to leave....! Totally in love with place-inspiring delightful-what more can I say....

title: Very nice and friendly restaurant!
comment: Me and my famiy visited the restaurant on monday. The food was excellent and the staff very friendly and nice to us. Since we are an allergic family I must say that they helpe’d us out very well. Our last dinner on London was really a hit. Tomorrow back to Sweden. Thank you Awesome Thai for an awesome evening.

title: Simply the best!!!
comment: Just simply fab!!! nice food, 1st class service, what else you expect frm a restaurant. Grilled-lamb and the fresh rolls are among the best. Just go and try them youself!!!

title: Underwhelmed
comment: I had high hopes based on the fantastic reviews but left disappointed. The food is definitely tasty but not exceptional, and there are better Thai restaurants in London. The portions were also small for the price. My main dish, a Thai classic, was starter-sized, and was pretty stingy on the meat content. The hosts are very friendly and the place is nice... Can't fault that... Maybe I had the wrong dish, but I can't see what all the fuss is about.

title: Delicious, authentic Thai food
comment: This restaurant is fantastic. We picked this restaurant for my husbands birthday after reading the reviews on here and were both really pleased. The food was flavoursome and presented nice. The service was great too. Will definitely make the trip again. The pad thai was particularly delicious.

title: As you should expect
comment: My sons girlfriend suggested we eat here as she had eaten here in the past and it was very good so we drive from Croydon on her recommendation. We chose the sharing starter platter which was presented well followed by 4 very different mains all tasty and as you should expect from a Thai restaurant. The evening however was made by one of the very polite and friendly young ladies that served us who I understood was part of the family business. It costs nothing to smile and it helps makes for an enjoyable experience for everyone. Well done!

title: Fun!
comment: We visited Awesome Thai on a Thursday evening after working all evening locally. Apple and his team were able to accomodate 5 of us very late on in the day and the food was absolutely fantastic. We were welcomed to stay as late as we needed and never felt rushed despite arriving so late. I can't recommend it enough, especially the tasting platter to start! Some really intresting fushion dishes from the chef also makes for a more interesting eating experience than your standard Thai fayre. We not only have found an excellent Thai place, but also a new pal in Apple who could not have been a better host. Although he has some work to do on his singing... ;)

title: Splendid!!!!!
comment: This restaurant does one of the best Thailand food in London and is able to provide its customers with fine dining service and manage to top that up with amiable personalities of its staff. Very well done indeed!!! It's a pleasure to be in your restaurant. Thanks Awesome Thailand

title: Average just about says it...
comment: I had been before to this Thai restaurant soon after it opened, and had been a bit underwhelmed by the food.  Having read so many recent rave reviews, I returned to give it another go. On the plus side, it is friendly and comfortable, good value, and conveniently placed opposite the popular new cinema in Barnes. However, the food was not terribly tasty: the "tasting platter" items were mostly a but dry and boring; we each ordered a different stir fry for the main course, which was perhaps a mistake as they were both a bit bland. So I would take some of those rave reviews with a pinch of salt.

title: Brilliant, as good as being in Thailand
comment: Have been a few times with friends and am always very impressed. The quality of the food is superb and the service is excellent. I've lucky enough to have been to Thailand several times and (apart from the weather!) this is as close as you can get to being there. Looking forward to going back again soon

title: Terrible name, but ok
comment: Really? Does it really have to have such an awful name? And an illegible logo too. It has rave reviews, and I was taken by regulars to admire it. I did, to an extent. I've had so many Thai meals it's hard to say what is authentic. I've eaten in Bangkok too, but still can't pin it down. Basically, we had an enjoyable meal. Not the best Thai I've had, but decent.

title: Yummy Thai - like the 'Awesome' name!
comment: This is the second time we've eaten here, and once for takeaway lunch. I highly recommend the red Thai curry with prawns and pineapple, it's on the sweet side, but delicious. Tom Khan Gai was filling and full of mushrooms and chicken. Good satay with a sweet and sour cucumber sauce and a peanut sauce. I would recommend the box set lunches both in and out. Service fantastic.

title: Dull
comment: Hi Madhu You've billed yourself as "Fine Dining", but the self-congratulatory billing is as far as you get. You're tucked away in a corner of an airport hotel, down a soul-less corridor, past the toilets. You’re poorly signposted. You’re on two peculiar levels, each with a very bare floor. All your furnishings are hard. All your acoustics are, therefore, harsh: hardly what I want if I am to dine finely. You have an elegant maîtresse d’hôtel, who does her job well, but her heels clack loudly as she rushes thither and hither across the floors. Your furnishings are dark, some even black. One of the floors is dark. This is not uplifting for customers who want to eat and drink well. The table at which you seated me wobbled. The papad nibbles were nice and the beer was chilled and priced very reasonably. Well done. My main dish, your variant on nihari, was great in conception but there it remained. By the time it was developed and delivered it was bland and unattractive, insufficiently spiced and not unctuous enough. Nihari should be nihari, please. The naan, by contrast, was super. Super, too, was the service from Ms Poonam (thank you, Ms Poonam, for making a dull experience as pleasant as you possibly could). I protest at your imposing a service charge, but the law allows you to do that. So please will you consider a simple, customer-friendly statement about how you distribute the money you've collected? Tronc, perhaps? Fine dining? No, sorry, you missed by miles.

title: Wonderful experience!
comment: Fantastic, nice and polite staff, lovely atmosphere and tasty food. The kitchen was very complaisance according to our special needs (gluten- and diaryfree). I would love to come back the next time I’m in London.

title: Lovely birthday meal
comment: I went to Awesome Thai for a birthday lunch with my family. I love Thai food and chose the restaurant after reading the other glowing reviews here. We weren't disappointed.  My dad made the booking in person and happened to mention it was for my birthday. Meanwhile I was liaising with the team on Facebook to check on the options for vegetarians. They were extremely helpful, advising me on dishes to avoid and reassuring me that they would be ready to cater for our needs.  The food was great and everyone from toddler to retiree enjoyed it. I particularly enjoyed the vegetarian fresh rolls with avocado, cucumber, carrot, mint and coriander. But the best thing was the warm, friendly staff.  As we were getting ready to pay, we were surprised by a chorus of happy birthday accompanied by a special birthday dessert. They even thought to provide enough spoons and bowls for everyone to share it.  Altogether a very enjoyable experience.

title: What a fantastic thai restaurant and what lovely people who run it.
comment: So glad we stumbled upon it. It will now be our stapLe Thai take away and local thai eaterie. Fabulous.

title: authentic food great service very friendly just like thailand
comment: we had such a good time. i'm still regretful i missed giving tip when the food already was more than reasonable priced. the service is also very very very friendly.

title: Great takeaway!
comment: My partner and I are very happy with after our experience! The delivery was quick, the food was hot & delicious. Their pad thai was possibly one of the best pad thai's we have ever had. Would definitely recommend.

title: It's all in the name - Amazing Thai
comment: We travelled from Scotland , arrived in Wandsworth & used trip advisor for our choice of restaurant . We came across this place and after reading the reviews quickly called them. Me & my wife with our 6 week old baby (pram in tow) ate with my mother & my 2x teenage siblings . This evening could not possibly have been bettered. From the moment the call was answered the welcome was tangible!!! Upon arrival the wonderful group of staff couldn't do enough for us, nothing was too much. Then the food was served.... We ordered a spectrum of dishes from the menu - Thai classics & chef specials & everything was truly fantastic. I have spent 2.5 years in Thailand & since my return eaten in many 'thai' restaurants throughout the UK and Amazing Thai is simply the best!!! - not to be missed, ENJOY X

title: High expectations from rave reviews
comment: ...and the food just lived up to those reviews. We got the lunchboxes between us as they seemed very good value, however the rice, fruit & tiny salad are quite 'filler' so perhaps better to just pick a dish and forego the variety. The green curry and chicken satay were very tasty. The decor is utterly super, really classy and great ambience, nice jazzy soundtrack. The service was incontestably professional and attentive, but far from friendly. The restaurant was not crowded and the waiter kept discreetly aloof. I feel perhaps for the full effect an evening meal would have bought out the best in the venue but it was a prompt, satisfying lunch nevertheless.

title: Best Thai food outside of Thailand!
comment: Wonderful fresh Thai food, incredible flavours and a lovely atmosphere. It really deserves all the plaudits. I also get takeaways from there which are excellent as well. Love it.

title: Tasty Thai food
comment: I love Thai food and I am always on the look out for a great place to try. The food here is very tasty some of the best I have had, the only thing letting the place down is the service. Found it difficult to order as the server couldn't understand my order. But will return for the food.

title: best Thai in the neighbourhood
comment: really flavouresome fresh food. their curries are excellent, but its their fish dishes that are such a fresh treat. Their scallops and pandan white fish are so fragrant and light, but wonderfully tangy the food, the service and the atmosphere are all fab highly recommend

title: Very good but not awesome
comment: This little neighbourhood Thai is justifiably popular for its warm welcome, competitive prices & delicious, fresh-tasting food. Staff are ever-helpful & will do their best to accommodate even on the busiest night. Service can be a bit challenged on such occasion but their charm overcomes any complaint on this front. The food is dependably good, whether a typical green or red curry (for which they will modify the chilli hotness on request) or one of the house specials like the dry curried salmon fillet; presentation is also immaculate. That they do take-aways is an added bonus for those lucky enough to live locally. Don't forget to book, at weekends especially.

title: Nice evening, service and food
comment: We enjoyed our evening here and was well looked after by Punam. It is not cheap, but the food and service was very good

title: Christine Vernon
comment: fabulous food great service excellent waitresses especially PUNAM lovely friendly lady always greets with a smile . Have been coming here for years and will continue to do so! X

title: Would highly recommend!
comment: Been to Madhu's several times before, but tonight's meal was exceptional. We were served by Punam who looked after us with diligence and care. The food was very flavoursome and cooked to perfection. :)

title: Amazing food and service!
comment: Some of the best Indian food we have ever had! Amazing, friendly staff (including Preer) served us quickly and took the time to explain to us the different dishes. The restaurant was busy even at 10pm and it is clear why!

title: Tsegaye
comment: Preet very good service I have good time super hospitality delicious food I'm so happy to be here to celebrate my 10 year anniversary

title: Leah
comment: Preet super service we had 10 years anniversary with good food good service I’m glad to be here to celebrate my anniversary

title: 60th Birthday
comment: Had a really lovely meal for my friends birthday. Lovely food and excellent service. Would definitely recommend.

title: Indian meal
comment: Came out this evening & went you spice station. Very good service & food.  Definitely going to come again.

title: Great food
comment: First time back since lockdown but food and atmosphere still top quality - thank you Spice Station

title: Best curry in chingford
comment: Me and my family have been using the spice station for many years, we have tried all the others but keep coming back to the best curry in Chingford, the staff Shah, shakil, Khan and Raj are simply perfect hosts, we have four quite fussy sons and it’s never an issue to change a dish or add something .. keep up the great work. Darren, Tara and the boys

title: Amazing restaurant
comment: Amazing food and atmosphere. Great service with very friendly staff ! The music also kept us entertained!

title: Dinner
comment: Amazing service and fresh food. Very friendly staff with a free shot at the end of the meal. Will be back soon

title: Sunday dinner with my girl
comment: I loved the tikka masala chicken and the spinach sauce, amazing taste! Also the atmosphere was nice and we got served very quickly. And let me not forget about the coconut rice, a little sweet and original taste.

title: Great atmosphere
comment: Lovely host who stays to chat whilst still following government guidelines. The food was great and the service was swift whilst making you feel at home, 100% recommend to anyone looking for great food and a laugh even with this pandemic going on.

title: Lovely sunday dinner
comment: Amazing food, lovely service by Khan and reasonable prices. Highly recommended! We had a lamb chill masala sauce with coconut rice - delicious! Definitely, add this place to your must visit list when in north Chingford area.

title: Amazing Restaurant
comment: The food was great at Spice Station the portions are just the right size and the food has lots of flavour. The staff are also very friendly and create a nice atmosphere. I will definitely continue to come to this restaurant.

title: Mr F
comment: This place is really without equal in the suburban town... I have done them all for breakfast and lunch and it’s first class without being a la carte.. Staff are friendly, the boss is genuinely honest. Cakes, afternoon tea, lunch or breakfast.. clean toilet too. 1st class all round

title: Brilliant service! Even Better food!
comment: I visited this lovely place for Saturday brunch and enjoyed the decor a lot. The service was impeccable! And the meals we ordered (Pancakes and a Full English) were just delicious and very well presented. Will definitely return. The fact that the place was so busy and bustling with lots of pleased customers speaks for itself. Well done!

title: Great place
comment: I was looking for a new place for breakfast so googled top 10 places in Beckenham for breakfast and Rendezvous came out on top. I must say it deserves it's ranking. The service is amazing. Staff are so friendly and warm. Food delicious. I ordered vegetarian breakfast. Definitely going back.

title: Shocking ! Paid for my food
comment: Shocking !  Paid for my food then asked for payment ? The manager is arrogant and the assistant a male asked very 5 minutes to give a 5*review ! No chance management rude ! And so expensive he changes the prices every time you go in there!

title: Worth a visit
comment: Friendly staff, delicious food and great price!  Most definitely worth a visit :-) Highly recommended

title: Great night!
comment: Khan was amazing, food was great, can’t wait to come again. Charles Totts does not follow up on odds!

title: Great staff, great service,
comment: Great staff, great service, great food, we come here all the time, one of the best restaurant in chingford, lovely family restaurant, highly recommend

title: Amazing food and amazing customer service , can’t wait to come back
comment: Amazing food and amazing customer service , can’t wait to come back and bring some friends with me ,

title: Great Food and Service
comment: We had an amazing starter and a beautiful main dish, extremely beautiful place and the service was great.

title: An amazing service
comment: It was a great finding this place as it is our first time here. We had a butter chicken curry and chicken tikka masala with coconut rice and nan bread, they were really good and the food came really fast. The place has a really good service and it looks great too. Everything was really well priced and we really enjoyed the meal!

title: Mr
comment: The food was immaculate the service was very good and the waiters were all smiling and lovely would recommend.

title: Always perfect and fantastic service
comment: Cannot fault the quality of food or the service. The food is always excellent, and portion size massive. The staff are friendly and the service is second to none. Would recommend without a doubt.

title: Best Indian restaurant in chingford
comment: We regularly visit spice station for dinner, amazing food and service is excellent! Never had a bad meal, highly recommended!

title: Great Indian.
comment: Visiting my school friend in chingford and we came to this lovely, friendly restaurant. They catered for our taste buds, adapting dishes for our individual requirements. The portion sizes are ample. Fully recommended!

title: Great restaurant
comment: As always a great meal. Food is always fresh and tasty, and the staff very friendly, the best Indian restaurant in Chingford by a long way.

title: My favourite Indian restaurant
comment: A great meal every time. I’ve been coming here for years and no other Indian restaurant compares. Excellent service too.

title: Indian
comment: Great service and great food, always guaranteed a great meal! Highly recommend. Best curry house in Chingford

title: Love Spice Station
comment: Been a regular for about Five years, absolutely love coming here the food is Excellent, staff are amazing always so friendly,a superb evening always,this is my favourite restaurant highly recommend.

title: Great food
comment: Quick service, friendly staff, great food. Highly recommended! Recommend the chicken korma and tikka.

title: Best Indian
comment: For everyone’s reference this Indian is the best in Essex, I come here with family, friends & business and the service and food is always 10/10 I couldn’t recommend a better Indian and I have tried many in Essex. Highly recommended.

title: Best restaurant in Ching by far
comment: The blokes here are absolutely lovely. Always very welcoming and friendly. The food is top tier, honestly best ruby I’ve had hands down
Friendly welcoming staff, great atmosphere and the food was absolutely delicious... my new favourite Indian restaurant by far... thank you guys!!

title: Great food and amazing service.
comment: Great food and amazing service. The staff are so friendly and always go the extra mile. Best curry around.

title: Avoid this place at all costs.
comment: I went to this restaurant for a can of diet coke and keema naan when I went in there there was this waiter standing there the whole restaurant was empty it was late at night. He stared at me very aggressively and then he gave me a glass of coke saying it was £2 when I asked for a 80p can of coke. He carried on staring at me rudely. My father had been in the restaurant business over 20 years and I never approached a customer in this manner. I then walked out of the restaurant without ordering anything. That same waiter kept on staring at me as I was getting into my car to drive home as I had worked all day. I then blasted my horn at him and drove off. I was parked on Garfield road talking to my friend on the phone when suddenly 2 cars blocked me in. It was that waiter and the other staff who work there. My window was open and that waiter had a long metal spanner in his hands, I immediately closed my car window and dialled 999 and told them I was barricaded by 2 cars. The waiter than tried breaking into my car by pulling my door handle. The other staff then started taking my photo with there smart phone. One of the waiters started saying, "You think we don't know anything" in Bengali as I speak the same language as them and I am from the same ethnicity. I said, look sorry for blasting the horn. A lady was looking out the window through her house. The waiter started saying, take his photo call the police, that ladies gonna call the police. I said to the owner the other waiter was rude, he said the waiter was his uncle, he then threatened me saying we can call more people. They left and 10 minutes later police arrived, I explained to the police what happened, they said I can make a allegation that the waiter confronted me with a metal spanner but it will be his word against my word. The officer then said he'll go and talk to the staff in the restauraunt. Absolutely disgusting, 7 employees ganging up on someone with a metal spanner. He needs a spanner, cant fight with his fists even though he had all his friends with him. What a cowardly human being needs a spanner and bullying 1 person because he's scared. Anyone reading this review I have written this review with integrity and honesty if you are humane don't go to this restaurant go somewhere else please. In fact I know the restaurant owner in Vujon Indian restaurant 2 doors away, the owner has known me for 10 years and the staff know me, they treat me with manners and respect. They should get a zero rating.

title: Amazing food
