comment: Dined here on father’s day with my wife and baby. Great food and great staff. In particular, they were were helpful and catered well to my daughter who has allergies and they were reassuring which is great for us parents! Thanks to the staff for a lovely evening!

title: Excellent meal with family and friends
comment: We visited for my daughters 7th birthday recently and Maurizio fitted us in at short notice and did a great job as always looking after us. Excellent authentic food and a lovely garden at the back. There is always a good recommendation if you want to try something different. We have been coming to the restaurant for a long time and it never disappoints. We will be back soon!

title: As good as the reviews say
comment: Selected this place based on the Trip Advisor reviews and rating and it lived up to the praise. Mauricio served us and was friendly and attentive. The food was lovely we had risotto and Pappardelle (though the pizza looked excellent) and the little garden out back was a nice, well put together space. Had the vibe of that lovely little place you find on Holiday.

title: Birthday trip
comment: Just simply amazing, the service (Francisco was the best waiter!), the food, the setting. Exactly what we were looking for, thanks very much, highly recommended!

title: table for 24 outside
comment: Really well looked after, we were lucky with the weather, so was great. Staff were on hand through out, all food came out together, which isn't easy for a table our size.Tthey were really patient with us!!!!

title: Top
comment: We are coming here once a month. We never had a bad meal, food and service always been high standard. Thank you very much Maurizio and team.

title: Enjoyable meal in the summer sun
comment: We came here after reading Trip Advisor reviews and it didn't disappoint. Excellent Italian food, very well presented. We both had fettucine, with gats cheese and tomatoes for me and mushrooms for my husband. The latter should hev come with speck, but they were happy to adapt it as we're vegetarians. The panna cotta for pudding was the nicest I've had, and the free limoncello at the end was a very nice touch. We eat in the garden, and the atmosphere was relaxed and family friendly. Idela for a warm summer evening.

title: Great
comment: Another great meal in this fantastic restaurant. This time we dine at the back garden..good food and good atmosphere

title: A true Italian experience
comment: Maurizio is a great host. Food is as Italian as it can be. The place is quaint and the overall experience is a five star one. Followed the TripAdvisor advices and gladly I can confirm that the food is as good as it can be.. From the bolognese to the pappardelle al cinghiale to the cheesecake, everything was as great as it could be. Highly recommended

title: Father’ day
comment: We just came back to this amazing restaurant for a lunch. We were very impressed with the quality of the food and the service they provide, especially with a full house. Thanks again and see you soon.

title: Satisfied signore!
comment: We were a group of 21 friends heading to Twickenham the next day. We're not from the area and had to trust trip advisor!!!  In the days running up to the booking, Maurizio was in touch and so helpful. He asked how we wanted tables set up, offered mixed stater platters to make the meal easier and quicker for us. We preordered our mains. They catered for all dietary requirements. On the night, we were situated outside, undercover, heating on towards the end of the night. The Italian staff were really attentive and entertaining ; jugs of water always filled, drinks orders taken quickly. The food was great... Pizza, pasta, meats, fish. Everyone enjoyed their food. At the end of the night the bill was split to cater for the big group. No fuss to do this. Thank you!!! From Vicky

title: Excellent food and service
comment: We were in Teddington overnight for a family wedding and Italian food we all liked so decided to go to La Dolce Vita. We knew the food would be good from the other reviews, but the food far exceeded even our high expectations and the service was top notch. It was so good that La Dolce Vita may well become my go to restaurant even if I'm staying in North London.

title: The best Sunday Lunch by a country mile.
comment: Had a great Sunday lunch. As per usual the food was outstanding. I had the Liver which I can only describe as the best you could ever taste, I am addicted to it The head of our family sadly was not able to attend but she insisted the rest of us went. La Dolce Vita sent her a portion of her favourite ice cream and she loved it. This place is a gem in our community and Sunday lunch could not be spent in a more hospitable place. I highly recommend it.

title: Amazing
comment: What an Amazing place, Maurizio is a very friendly Host. Superb food and very nice atmosphere. Thank you Maurizio

title: Very Good Food
comment: Just had a wonderful late lunch and was outstanding food and outstanding service from Maurizio we would highly recommend will definitely be back again very soon. Robert Michelle And Kody

title: Service
comment: Maurizio gives you the best service ever and the food is outstanding. Guys give it a go and you will be their customer for ever

title: Local restaurant slightly off the beaten track
comment: We had heard good reports about La Dolce Vita but in the seventeen years that we have lived in the area we had never been there. It is about a quarter of a mile out of Teddington town centre but worth the trip. A number 33 bus stops outside if you don't fancy the walk! Good Italian food and efficient and friendly staff. We were surprised to find that on a Wednesday night the place was packed so were lucky to get the last table.

title: A MUST GO!
comment: Went here for my anniversary with my girlfriend. We were greeted to a complimentary drink to begin our celebrations, a lovely touch. The food was amazing, the best selection a steakhouse can offer! Perfectly cooked and served beautifully, not much could have improved our time there.  Staff - EXCELLENT  Food - EXCELLENT Atmosphere - EXCELLENT

title: Very enjoyable visit we will go again when in the area. Great food and friendly service.
comment: We were greated by a very friendly owner. We were celebrating a birthday and received a complimentary drink. The rib eye steak was excellent, taken with a nice bottle of Malbec. Friendly staff and nothing was too much trouble. Booked as a result of the reviews and we were not dissapointed.

title: Excellent food at lovely local Italian
comment: This is a lovely local restaurant with surprisingly good food. We went based on reviews and were not disappointed. A group of 7 of us from SW London & home counties planned to meet up and this was a convenient mid-point between us randomly selected based on the reviews. We were so lucky to find this lovely local gem. The food was excellent, the staff so smiley and nice. Teddington is really lucky to have this place.

title: Nice, but just that's about it
comment: Went here after the great reviews...was a busy restaurant for a Sunday bank holiday evening which was nice. Our glasses of wine weren't terribly nice and quite acidic. We had the beef carpacchio and bruschetta to start. Carpacchio was ok, although could've been more thinly sliced and seasoned more. The bruschetta was soggy. We had to order the fettuccine with speck and truffle oil (both tables next to us also ordered it and it looked great). I was unfortunately underwhelmed by it and the temp didnt help with it being like warm. My friend had the sea bass which was also just ok.  The highlight was the tiramisu which was delicious. The staff were very friendly and made us feel at home, which was lovely, but we had slightly higher expectations for the food. The pizzas looked great, so maybe next time we'll go for those!

title: After rugby meal with my little brother
comment: Had an excellent meal at La Dolce Vita . Recommend the fried squid with also comes with white bait. We both had steak which came with peppercorn sauce,Italian potatoes and broccoli. Attentive and efficient staff . Recommend this restaurant.

title: Another amazing meal
comment: We are coming here once a month at least. The food and service here are exceptional and the atmosphere is even better. Well done Dolce Vita!!!

title: Tremendous
comment: We had another amazing meal in this little gem. Superb food, superb staff, Very nice atmosphere and lots of fan. Thanks again

title: Hidden Gem
comment: Took the family here for Sunday lunch having read the rave reviews. Got to say it lived up to those reviews in every way. Food was amazing, service was really great and the garden was a real treat. Sitting there in the warm weather eating delicious Mediterranean food was like being on holiday.  Every dish was outstanding. Highly recommend

title: The sweet life indeed!
comment: both the food and the service at La Dolce Vita were superb. There is an air of authenticity, without overpriced dishes or pretentiousness. Will certainly be coming back with friends again soon! Thankyou Francesco.

title: Lunch
comment: What a fantastic place. We are visiting from Australia & went there based on the reviews & it easily lived up to them.  It’s very cosy & you are welcomed & looked after beautifully.  The Risotto was AMAZING, the best I have had outside of Australia & the marinated olives yummy, fresh sardines ah what can I say it was ALL fantastic. 5 stars & we will return before going home to Aus again. Cheers.

title: Ultimate steak!
comment: One of the best meals I've had in London in a while! The steak left me wanting more and hoping to repeat again soon, the portion was so large I couldnt finish it I had to share it with the entire table and all agreed, the ultimate steak. The staff treated our party very nicely and was helpful, sweet atmosphere. The empanadas as well were VERY good.

title: Brilliant pasta
comment: We visited La Dolce Vita last weekend and both had pasta - my girlfriend had fettucine and I had the duck pappardelle. We were both amazed. This was the best pasta, that we had ever had in England. We will definitely be back.

title: Friends
comment: Once again a great meal with friends, great service, food was excellent. Staff were very attentive, it was one of the party birthday and the waitress made sure my friend got a cake with candle a lovely touch.

title: Birthday Celebration
comment: 8 of us went to Dolce Vita last weekend for a birthday celebration.As always we had a lovely greeting from Luca. We all shared different starters and we all enjoyed them. For our main course all but one of us had pasta. I had fettuccine with aubergine & goats cheese & it was delicious,a couple of my friends had pappardelle with wild boar, someone else had sea bass. It was all delicious. 4 of our friends were visiting from Ireland and they commented on how good the food was. The service from Luca was very good and also from another man helping. We were not rushed, which was great as we had a lot to chat about. All in all another very enjoyable evening.

title: Excellent Italian fare
comment: A party of eight of us came here all for the first time. We experienced the best of everything - good service with a genuine Italian atmosphere, first class food and good wine. My pasta was cooked "al dente" to perfection with a fungi sauce that was both delicate and extremely tasty. In fact one of the reasons I go to Italy is to have perfect pasta, which is so rare in the UK, and so I have slightly less reason to go now I have discovered La Dolce Vita. The one slight downside was the noise - it made it difficult to have a decent conversation (common in Italy also) but not enough to take away my 5 star assessment.

title: Lovely family lunch Saturday
comment: Very friendly atmosphere, relaxed and welcoming. Superb service. Food lovely and will be returning very soon. Our second visit already

title: Gorgeous
comment: Very good food in this little gem, I never had any issue with them, very good value for money and I cannot wait to go back there again and again. Thank you

title: Should be Kept Secret
comment: La Dolce Vita in Teddington is the kind of place you don’t really want to tell people about because you don’t want everyone to know. It’s a great little restaurant, the food is delicious and the service is friendly and efficient. We went for a birthday celebration, the lamb cutlets from that day’s specials menu were outstanding, and the welcome and general atmosphere delightful. We will be back. But don’t tell anyone!

title: Excellent local Italian restaurant.
comment: Have been to La Dolce Vita several times in the last year or so; always great food and friendly service. The restaurant was very busy this Saturday, normal for a weekend with pretty much every table occupied. Although we were a party of eight the service was very friendly and efficient, whilst the lovely home cooked Italian food was great. They have a decent selection of wines too. Many thanks to all at Dolce Vita for another lovely evening. A real gem of a restaurant.

title: Great food and great service
comment: Chef Marco in particular was brilliant - thank you for some really great food and a very nice evening in Teddington

title: Brilliant
comment: Delicious food, great service. We were a party of 8. Food was hot, well presented and well cooked.  Chef was happy to cook for a vegan on the spur of the moment and food was delicious. Nothing was too much trouble and thank you Maurizio for your attention and suggestions  Thank you

title: Very Nice!
comment: Myself and my partner went today for my birthday, lovely food and excellent service. We were greeted with complementary prosecco when we sat at our table and the meal ended with a delicious cake on a plate decorated with "happy birthday".  We had calamari, chorizo and salad for starters- very nice. Both had Serloin for main- delicious and perfectly cooked. We couldn't fit in a dessert as we were both full. Excellent service from all the staff especially Ivan who mainly served our table, He was very attentive and friendly. We will definitely return and will be recommending this restaurant to others. Quality and at a great price too.

title: Perfect choice - my 30th birthday
comment: I had my 30th birthday at this restaurant and the food was amazing. The staff was very friendly and polite. The manager Juan was so helpful and made sure everything went as plan. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and will definitely be back.

title: Good priced steak
comment: A pretty good steak restaurant with decently priced steak.  We each had two courses, the main being steak of course. We went for the provoleta cheese and beef empanadas as a starters, which we both enjoyed.  I had my 9oz ribeye steak medium/well done, which is how a normally have it, but it was probably a little bit too much on the well done side for my liking. I would go for medium if i came here again. All the steaks come with a decent sized portion of chips or mashed potato. For a few pound extra you can have a sauce with you steak.  Service was excellent.

title: Wholesome, personable, real
comment: Just a down to earth warm atmosphere place with real people serving real Italian food. Personable staff, those you can chat to fell at home with. Thank you Maurizio.

title: Phenomenal food by phenomenal staff
comment: words cannot describe how authentic and delicious this food is. surprisingly affordable for the taste you experience and the food is always out in a timely manner. I cannot recommend this higher

title: Excellent Genuine Italian
comment: My first visit - really warm welcome ,rapid drinks service , freshly cooked food that was simply excellent. The calves liver was divine.The guys are doing a great job & I’ll be back.

title: Friend's 50th Birthday surprise
comment: Fifteen of us spent a fantastic evening at La Dolce Vita after a day at Hampton Court. Mauricio was very accommodating about our requests. The welcome we received and the service we got was fantastic and the food was superb. Shared platters were enjoyed by all as a starter followed by various pasta dishes. The tagliatelle vongole was sublime. Wine a reasonable price too. Would recommend and a friend said she wished the restaurant was nearer to us. Busy and great atmosphere even at 6.15 pm so booking advisable.

title: Great food, atmosphere and service
comment: My husband and I recently held a private lunch party at La Dolce Vita on the occasion of our Silver Wedding Anniversary. We couldn't have been more delighted with how the occasion went. Maurizio, the owner, was available several times before the event to discuss details on the menu, wines, and best table configurations for 40+ people. With so much enjoyment and excitement, the noise level was rather loud, but apart from that, everything went completely to plan and all our guests had a very enjoyable time. A most memorable occasion on all accounts!

title: Great food and Atmosphere
comment: Absolutely fab place to eat. Staff are warm and always welcoming and the food is good and not expensive.

title: Luka aka Superman
comment: Booked this restaurant after reviewing Tripadvisor for a great venue in Richmond on Thames. The restaurant lived up to the excellent reviews. The star turn was the front of house Luca. Due to his colleague calling in sick he had been left to take care of about 20 covers single handedly. A task he took in his stride. Despite the above he found time to engage with everyone and the smile never left his face. Great food, great service, great venue. Don't miss out when in the area. Thanks again Luca.

title: Thanks for wonderful evening!
comment: Great restaurant- fabulous food, top notch service and all round a good experience. Huge thank you to all the team that make this work so well!

title: Dinner
comment: Read the reviews about this restaurant and it did not disappoint. The prawn starter and the mains were tops. Menu had something for everyone. The whole family really enjoyed it and we will certainly be back soon.

title: Fabulous
comment: Just popped in for a bank holiday lunch, extremely pleased with the variety of choice on the menu,We had scallops, lasagna and butterfly prawns as starter all delicious. We all had different fishes salmon, sea bream and vongole all fabulous.  Staff was really attentive and would like to thank them for a great service. We will definitely be returning very soon.

title: Allergy Sufferers, Stay Well Clear of this Place!
comment: Are you suffering a nut allergy? Stay away. Otherwise, you will be prompted to choose between mash and salad though steak is why people pop in. Apparently the chef slaps everything into a nut-soaked oil they cook with. If we were not there because of a special day, we would have left immediately. For everyone else not suffering an allergy, this place seems alright for a proper piece of meat.

title: Couldn't fault it
comment: My partner and I went as we love steak. This place didn't disappoint. Made a reservation which was easy enough. Had a good selection of wines and cocktails. It's nice that the steaks come with a 'complimentary' side, normally you have to pay for them. We also had the brocoli and creamed spinach. Everything came out hot and cooked to perfection. Couldn't leave without having a slice of fudge cake. Space isn't very big, but there was a table set up for about 12. Luckily we left just after they sat down, I feel they would've been loud and disruptive (but not on purpose) so is best for small groups. Staff were polite, just what you would expect. Would definitely go back.

title: New Years Eve Group Celebration
comment: We were a party of 19 pax and had an absolutely amazing time (again) at the Buenos Airies in Chiswick. The staff, service and food are top class indeed.

title: Excellent as usual
comment: Because of my job I haven't been out in a while, and I am glad i am back in this lovely little family restaurant. Luca was entertaining as usual and he told me I have to thank Fransesco and Peter for the tasty dishes.be back asap.

title: True Italian delicacies
comment: Great place and the most amazing Italian food that you can possibly find in the UK.Absolutely fair pricing (especially for the students Menü) and great, entertaining service. Would come again anytime! Cheers to Luca!

title: best pizza in town
comment: This is by far the best pizza in the area. A lovely family run restaurant, we always go whenever the kids fancy calzone. Everything is freshly prepared to order, and we highly recommend the pasta and pizza dishes.

title: Great Local Italian
comment: We have been coming here for years and are never disappointed. Great Fritura, wonderful fresh pasta and real interesting mains. Staff are very welcoming...always a great night out.

title: Best pizza
comment: I think this has to be the best Italian restaurant in Teddington. Family run and good prices. Bravo!

title: Can’t fault good food and excellent service.
comment: Once again an excellent experience. Good food, excellent service and lovely ambiance. Can’t fault, a great family night out.

title: Excellent birthday lunch
comment: Delicious food and delightful service made this a great meal! Will be returning for another similar experience for sure. Lis

title: Better and better
comment: We keep coming in this amazing restaurant because food and services are second to none. Thank you guys!!

title: Excellent meal for our anniversary
comment: I went with my girlfriend from our anniversary, since the first calling to reserve the table with Juan I felt great vibes for his kindness and availability. The restaurant is very cozy and intimate.. lovely atmosphere. We had empanadas as starter (very good) but the best choice is been my fillet, of course Rare.. delicious !! Excellent quality of the meat. They gave us a Prosecco for celebrate our anniversary.. very kind ! All the staff in general is been very helpful in everything and always very gentle and friendly. Really recommend for every occasion . Definitely we will come back !

title: Outstanding food and great service
comment: The staff were great - we wanted to sit in a booth but both were booked from a later time and they allowed s to sit there as long as we could clear in time for the next sitting. The food was great, the wine recommendation was outstanding and the whole experience was outstanding. Thoroughly recommend it and will definitely be going back!

title: Great food and atmosphere
comment: We managed to get a table for the lunchtime before the England Ireland rugby game, this was our second visit here and it was every bit as good as last time. It was quite noisy but only to be expected from a restaurant full of rugby fans, great atmosphere, a really good selection of typically Italian dishes, super pasta and pizzas, a reasonable wine list with something for all budgets and the most friendly staff. Would thoroughly recommend.

title: Day at the Rugby
comment: We had travelled down to Teddington to stay for the weekend and to go to Twickenham to watch the Calcutta Cup. We were meeting two friends for lunch and they booked La Dolce Vita.What a find a small Italian restaurant we all had different starters and mains and we all thought everything was excellent. Great Wine as well and for a reasonable price. Owner very hospitable and great service, will go again when in the area.

title: Great restaurant!
comment: Really friendly, lovely food and great atmosphere. Definitely recommend it for a enjoyable meal out!

title: So disappointed
comment: After reading all the good reviews we booked her for 6 people for my birthday meal with some friends. 3 people ordered the pan fried seabass and what they got served was steamed plain seabass with soggy skin and had never seen a pan it its life. I had the lamb loin with roast potatoes and spinach. Whilst the lamb was tasty the potatoes were about 5 new potatoes roasted and the smallest amount of spinach. I finished the meal starving. Tiramiso was lovely but the apple struddle was again soggy and heated in a microwave. Waiter even admitted his own mum serves it cripsy but it's the way they do it here. So one of my friends had soggy fish and pudding. Worst thing for me though was after the meal going to the men's toilets which were filthy and clearly not that days mess and that shocked me. Over priced for for quality of food served and unclean toilets. Not going to make me want to go back I'm affraid

title: The loveliest locals restaurant
comment: I’m nervous about posting this as it can be hard to get a table as it is... We love this local restaurant, slightly off the beaten track in Teddington, i.e. not on the High Street. It’s a not very well-kept secret amongst residents. The food is fabulous, freshly prepared, delicious and amazing value. There’s always a great atmosphere, it’s cosy and welcoming. The wine list is good too and the house red wine at around £15 a bottle is outstanding. It’s great with a group of friends, with kids or as a couple.

title: Outstanding
comment: Guys we had the most enjoyable evening in this amazing restaurant. Superb food and professional service. Thanks again

title: Number 1 for a reason
comment: Now i understand why this restaurant is number 1 in Teddington. We had 3 course meal and everything was outstanding. Scallopes wrapped in pancetta to start, sea bream in a potato crust and pistacchio and orange cheesecake.... OMG.... Sensational.. Very friendly staff.

title: Lovely little Italian
comment: Came here for the first time. Hidden gem. Lovely friendly staff who accommodated our vegan requirement with a delicious fresh pasta dish.

title: Great for a family gathering
comment: The were 13 of us for a birthday celebration. This is a family run business and is very cosy. Service was goof and the food was excellent. We had a relaxing meal with good size portions and a very reasonable price. We will be returning in the near future.

title: Birthday Dinner
comment: A real authentic Italian restaurant with a warming and welcoming environment. Definitely recommend it.    My partner and I with his family spent the day in London to celebrate his birthday.  After a lovely long walk around, we wanted to find a special place to have our dinner. In the end of the day,on your birthday you wish to find a restaurant that will make your dinner even more special.  After looking on Google for a pizza restaurant, we landed to ‘La dolce Vita’ in Tottenham. It was love at first sight with their online menu. We called and booked a table for our dinner.  Arrived at La dolce vita, a gentleman welcomed us and showed us our table.  We had fritto misto as starters and pizza as a main.  Alongside the starters, we received olives, bread and butter as an extra during our meal. At the end of our meal, after paying the bill, we received some amaretto and limoncello liqueur.  Treats that you usually receive when you dine in Italy. The gentleman who took care of us, was very attentive, welcoming and make more enjoyable our experience. Hope to come back soon.

title: Great service and food
comment: Hugely busy with pre Christmas parties. To be expected a couple of weeks before Christmas.We had to wait a short while table which was slightly irritating. One of our group is coeliac with an egg allergy but Enzo the waiter was very helpful indeed. The empanadas are great as a starter as is the chorizo in red wine. The steaks were very good indeed and exactly medium rare as ordered.  I didn’t like the booth table for six but there was no other option. I shall specify next time. Very good food and very good service though.

title: Delicious
comment: Our favourite restaurant in Chiswick. The food is incredible (especially the dulce de leche cheesecake!) and the staff is excellent. We will certainly return.

title: Consistently good!
comment: This place is a great steakhouse and better still they do 241 on Tuesdays. Went here with my sister. Had the prawn starter and beef empanada to share both fabulous..for mains I had the rib eye steak with sweet potato fries. Perfectly cooked meat and amazing fries. Service was excellent too.

title: Simply excellent
comment: One of the best Italian restaurant in London area. Owned by an Italian guy who knows how to treat customers and serve some authentic Italian food. Great atmosphere, even greater food and outstanding service. I will be a regular customer from now on. Thank you guys.

title: Great Italian food
comment: We visited here last Saturday 16th, my wife’s Birthday. It was lunchtime and half term so aside from a few cyclists was empty. We were well looked after and service was impeccable. Food was great, good traditional Italian, home made pasta, plus meat dishes etc. Arancini starters were excellent as was my spicy pizza. Everyone’s meals were great and as a surprise one of the desserts ordered came out with a candle for my wife’s birthday. I had mentioned it when I booked so that was a lovely touch. It’s those little things that make the occasion. Highly recommend and am sure it is rammed in the evenings so probably best to book. We will be back..

title: Will definitely return
comment: Visited for the first time after a recommendation. Food was great, staff very attentive and friendly. Will definitely return.

title: Fabulous Find
comment: I booked this restaurant to celebrate my father in laws 80th birthday following all the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. As we were going early on a Saturday lunchtime, I was a little apprehensive that there wouldn’t be many people in there and that it would lack atmosphere. I couldn’t have been more wrong. We arrived just after 12:30 and already there was a table of 6 and within no time the restaurant was full! The service was excellent despite the restaurant being very busy and atmosphere was fabulous. The food was amazing, offering a good selection of Italian dishes and the birthday celebration was a total success. Everyone in the restaurant sang happy birthday to the birthday ‘boy’ and he thoroughly enjoyed his birthday lunch. I would highly recommend this small family run restaurant and can’t wait to return.

title: Lovely little Italian
comment: Booked a table for two on a Friday night, was quite busy but not too noisy. The restaurant is petite but very nicely formed. Menu has a good selection of pasta, pizza and other dishes; all were lovely and fresh and served in the right amount of time.

title: Amazing
comment: Beautiful restaurant, delicious food and the service was second to none! Will definitely be back and telling everyone about it

title: Good steaks, nice price, comfortable sized restaurant
comment: Always a good choice of place for steaks, prices are reasonable and the quality is very good. Staff are always friendly!

title: Great service and very friendly
comment: Came here because another local Italian restaurant was closed. We had never been here before. The staff were very welcoming, the food was delicious, my four kids all tucked in and loved it. There was a good atmosphere in the restaurant too. Thank you, we'll be back.

title: Enjoyable Evening
comment: Had a lovely evening in La Dolce Vita last night, the food was delicious, the wine was excellent and the waiters could not have been more helpful. This was our first visit but will definitely not be our last.

title: Lunch
comment: Delicious food and wide selection of wines (recommend the 2016 Chianti) great service from the friendly Maurizio, nice environment - and very reasonably priced.

title: Delightful visit
comment: My friend and I were served by Luca and Francesco, two very attentive and friendly waiters. They catered easily to my friend’s vegan needs with no hassle. The food was delicious and extremely reasonably priced. Overall it was an excellent experience and we will sure be returning!

title: Buonissimo!!
comment: I have been coming to La Dolce Vita for 6 years and the food is as good as ever. the service is great and the restaurant is very cosy.I am very critical of Italian food as I am Italian myself. Well done to Maurizio and his team. Massimo

title: Super tasty Italian food!
comment: I recently visited La Dolce Vita for lunch and I’m already addicted. The food is really good and the staff very friendly. Highly recommend.

title: Lovely Italian food
comment: All good here! Good extensive menu and traditional Italian dishes. Good service and would be happy to go again!!

title: Fantastic Pizza
comment: Excellent pizza and I’ve had a fair few in Italy  Went today specifically for pizza and tasted as good as any in Italy itself Have been before and the pasta is likewise authentic excellent Italian cuisine Great service to boot so thought I’d add to the reviews not that they need it Keep goingj

title: GREAT,GREAT SERVICE
comment: I was back in London on Saturday and my friends took me out for dinner.i was gladly surprised to find myself back in this lovely little geam!the food was as good as the last time but the highlight of the evening was once again Luca! This guy should be on a stage! He was funny and still very professional and attentive, though the restaurant was packed.lots of customers hugged him before leaving like he was family,and that says it all!I can't wait to be back and have another great evening.

title: Good Restaurant
comment: Excellent authentic Italian food, well presented, generous portions. We like individual, family run restaurants where the food is good and we are given a friendly welcome, this restaurant had it all. We were visiting Strawberry Hill House which is within a short walking distance, a nice stroll after a good lunch.

title: Great night out!
comment: Five of us went for a meal on a Saturday night. Awesome steaks. A bit cool but perfectly cooked. Julia was absolutely brilliant. Wine was great. Manager, Enzo, was attentive and wanted to ensure a good meal was had by us all. We had a brilliant evening and the food was good. Service was great. Lovely ambience.

title: I have eaten numerous times and the food is excellent.
comment: The food has always been excellent and the staff serving very well mannered and responsive. A week ago we had Alessio and other girls serve us who were fantastic.

title: This restaurant always delivers great quality and service
comment: This was my third visit to this wonderful restaurant, I cannot fault it in anyway. The staff, service, food and wine are all exceptional. Thank you

title: Amazing food and service
comment: Delicious meal from starter to main course. A dedicated and professional service from MR Enzo. We did not have a booking and he made sure we do get a table and introduced the best deal quality/price to us. The starters were delicious and the meat mouthwatering. The wine list is quiet open and the prices remain affordable for this kind of restaurant. Also, prepare a 10% tip on top of your bill for the service which is well deserved. An unforgettable sunday late lunch experience. Will definitely go return again.

title: Authentic Italians
comment: Great dinner at this amazing place..  Luca and the Chef Francesco are very warm and welcoming..  The food was very delicious, and gave us the true italian taste while in London.  We’ll be back soon

title: Very nice food
comment: We have been here again after long time and the standard did'nt change at all.. amazing food, great service and good atmosphere..thanks again

title: Food was excellent
comment: We were a group of 4 visiting the restaurant and walked to and from the restaurant on a balmy warm first weekend in September evening. The booking was for 8.00pm, I have never been crammed in like sardines in a restaurant before, but this restaurant managed it well.  The waiting staff were a sweaty mess, not smelly or a problem, but they did not stop, they worked hard, for the whole evening. They should be given an award as they worked like trojans! The restaurant did not have a cooling system and the temperature was a bit unpleasant and sticky.  The service was slow, however after being served drinks and ordering the evening flowed ok.  There was a 50th birthday with a table of at least 8 patrons who seemed to get preferential treatment.  The food was authentic and tasted excellent, it was served quickly when ready, but not thrown down on the table as I expected after seeing how busy the two waiters were. If in the neighbourhood would I return? Probably not.

title: Soooo good!!!!
comment: Another amazing meal with family, staff is brillant, and atmsphere is even better.. Looking forward to see all of you very soon...

title: Wow !
comment: I was recommend La Dolce Vita by a few friends and I'm so glad they did. I took my mother her [she's Italian] for lunch on New Years day and we could not fault it, the service was warm and welcoming,whilst the the food was outstanding ! We will be coming her again.

title: Great service and food
comment: A great atmosphere, and loved the food. The service was very personable and we felt very welcome. Loved the grilled prawns (had them without chilli!!) and the calves liver was done perfectly.

title: My favourite Restaurant
comment: The staff are welcoming and friendly, food is AMAZING and reasonably priced. My favourite restaurant in the whole wide world. Thank you Dolce Vita team

title: Perfetto!!
comment: A lovely, warm and friendly little restaurant. We were greeted by Maurizio who was very welcoming and looked after us the whole evening. The food is delicious, authentic Italian cuisine, well priced and I would happily pay another visit.

title: Excellent find - 25 min from LHR
comment: Excellent homemade Italian food. Luca (waiter : manager) was great at recommending all courses.  Starter: grilled sardines (best I’ve had since last trip to Portugal) Main: tagliatelle with wild mushrooms, truffle and Parmesan. Homemade. Delicious. Truffle was perfect, not too strong.  Dessert: homemade tiramisu. WOW homemade Limencello to end.  Prices great as well.  Wine selection small but authentic.  Highly recommend.

title: Buonissimo
comment: Had an excellent lunch here for a friend's birthday with over thirty guests. The staff were friendly and helpful, the food excellent and fresh. Obviously a good atmosphere among friends. Intend to visit again soon.

title: Great Food and Great Prices
comment: Food was amazing and affordable too best Italian around for sure. Owner is really nice and definitely recommend.

title: Delicious home-cooked Italian
comment: We needed a restaurant open for lunch on Christmas Eve and stumbled upon La Dolce Vita online - an excellent find. My fettucine with mushrooms, speck and truffles was amazing and unusually presented, and my parents both praised their pappardelle with wild boar. Garlic bread came with the mains but was very good and the complementary bread which arrived first was warm and tasty too. Desserts were also fantastic, and polished off quickly!  The welcome and service was warm and efficient and the bill for three pastas, three glasses of wine, three desserts and coffee came to just under £90 - decent value for money. Very highly recommended.

title: Top Christmas lunch for 20-odd hungry cyclists
comment: Lovely, convivial lunch with loads of variety for 25 hungry cyclists from my Club. I had a couple of nicely cooked sardines and calves liver Veneziana with mash and green beans, all 'just so'. Some of us hadn't been before and I spotted them taking flyers so that they could bring their other halves. I came for an evening meal a couple of weeks ago and was impressed. Had a lovely Chianti, enjoyed myself.

title: Authentic food, exceptional service and atmosphere
comment: Second visit in as many weeks. The fresh pasta is as good as we have had in any high end Italian restaurant, the wild boar ragu was a perfect winter dish, hearty and full of flavour. The scallops perfectly cooked and the pea purée and pancetta made a sublime dish. Francesco gave us a wonderful welcome making us feel like old friends on our first visit. A real find. We will be coming back again to experience and explore more of the fabulous food and charm La Dolce Vita has to offer.

title: Exceptional Christmas Day at La Dolce Vita
comment: After spending a wonderful Christmas Eve with Maurizio, Luca and the team last year we decided to take the family along to share Christmas Day with them this year. After a warm welcome, we settled down at our table and were greeted with Prosecco and a bottle of my favourite red wine, opened and familiarising itself with room temperature. Dinner started at 2pm and gently rolled through starters (king prawns wrapped with pancetta and cooked in nduja were delicious; butternut squash ravioli and chicken livers were enjoyed by everyone else), melt in the mouth beef medallions with dauphinoise potatoes for main course and homemade lemon tart for dessert got my vote, although other family members loved their turkey, halibut and panna cotta dishes respectively. Maurizio and the team offered a round of drinks to end the meal for what was a memorable and thoroughly enjoyable Christmas meal, spent with family and friends.

title: Excellent service
comment: I've been there on the 26th with friends and, since I was recently in italy,my expectations were high.the dishes I tried ,if not outstanding, were actually very good but what I REALLY enjoyed was the service.the manager ( Luca ) was funny,attentive and very professional.his anecdotes about Italy made me laugh so hard! We went there just for something quick to eat,instead we had an evening to remember. Thank you very much and I hope to be back real soon

title: Eccellente!
comment: Been there for the first time tonight. I am Italian and very critical of Italian restaurants in UK as they tempt to "adapt" to the British palates. La dolce vita instead remains true to Italian tradition, using fresh ingredients and serving abundant portions. Tipically, bread and olives are complimentary, a rarity nowadays in any restaurant.  Fried seafood starter was perfect, crisp and thoroughly cooked. The sardines had the great bitter taste you only experience in seaside Mediterranean areas. Pappardelle with wild boar ragu' (tomato sauce) and taglioline wild mushroom and speck were both exceptionally good, my wife who's a great chef admitted they were perfect. We also shared a margherita pizza to try the quality, dough is great and fresh. I personally prefer the mozzarella cut in chunks on the pizza, but that's just me. Strudel for dessert, again home made as mamma would do. Luca e Maurizio are friendly and efficient despite the busy night. Prices in line with the area, not the cheapest but very worth it for quality. Overall a 5 star experience, I will be back!

title: Lovely little find...delicious Italian!
comment: Found this little gem on TripAdvisor whilst looking for a stop off for lunch before setting off on the M3. Decided to stop because of the great reviews and La Dolce Vita definitely did not disappoint! The food was absolutely delicious and well priced and the manager was super friendly and welcoming. Would highly recommend!

title: Jen's Birthday
comment: Nice welcome when we arrived, they had noted it was a birthday and a glass of bubbly was given to the birthday girl, great atmosphere, attentive staff, good food, we will definitely be going back

title: Very professional service
comment: I found the food perfect and the staff very professional,specially Ivan and Alex. I Will be back soon.

title: Awesome meal for 4!!
comment: Wow, is all I can say. We had the full works and really enjoyed everything. 4 of us went, and benefited from the Tuesday special which was a bonus when it came to paying. The starters were great, especially the empanadas. The mains were awesome, my wife went for the mixed grill with a friend and cooked over everything and that is rare. My other friend and I had steaks, my sirloin was perfect, so. Ice I didn’t even add my peppercorn sauce as I didn’t want to ruin the taste. My friend she. For the 48hr marinated fillet and we all had to try a bit as the taste was so good we all had to try a bit. All meat cooked exactly how we requested. We will definitely be going back - great food and great service!!

title: Fantastic dinner
comment: Very good food and fantastic service. You can not ask more. Everything went well from start to finish. Enzo recommend nice bottle of hermanos Malbec. Nice touch for a candle on our dessert. Thank you

title: Wonderful birthday dinner
comment: We visited for my son's birthday and were not disappointed. The pizza is excellent and the children's portion is a generous size. My husband had calves liver which was perfectly cooked. Lovely, attentive and personable service.

title: Delicious meal
comment: We chose this restaurant because it was near to our air b&b but what a good choice. The food was delicious and the service was really good. The staff were friendly and we had a really good evening there.

title: Superb
comment: Stayed in Twickenham for one night and found this restaurant on trip advisor, and what a find it was. Francesco was just lovely, really welcoming and attentive throughout our meal. We had the sardines to start which were tasty, my husband had the risotto which was cooked perfectly and tasted delicious. I had the pasta with mushrooms and pancetta which was equally delicious and presented beautifully. Tiramisu and cheesecake completed a truly yummy dinner !Thank you for such a lovely end to what had been a great day out in the capital. Definitely recommend

title: Amazing food
comment: Wow such beautiful food and attentive staff. I had the calves liver which has to be the best I’ve ever had. So tender and the tiramisu was stunning. My friend loved her risotto. Great night, can’t wait to get back again

title: First Class
comment: I can’t speak highly enough of this restaurant. The food was fantastic. Maurizio our host was so attentive and pleasant. It is an absolute gem and all at a very reasonable price.  Eight of us went for Sunday lunch and ended up spending the day there. It was a most pleasurable experience. Thank you Maurizio. I don’t live in the area but I will be back.  Grazie mille Mario

title: Delightful
comment: I was at a Christmas do where the menu had been pre-ordered. Service was great and the food was 'at home' Italian.

title: Birthday Lunch
comment: We found this place on TripAdvisor whilst looking for somewhere to take my Mum for a birthday lunch after finishing work in Teddington. We were not disappointed, the Arancini was the best I have had outside Sicily, Francesco happily offered to tweak a menu dish so that I was able to enjoy it, whilst being pregnant and needing to avoid certain foods. He really went above and beyond to look after us and made us very welcome. Everything we ordered was delicious and reasonably priced. We live in Surbiton and have some more local places we usually visit, but this place is definitely worth venturing out for and we certainly will be doing so.

title: Excellent restaurant with very friendly staff
comment: Read up on trip advisor and saw good reviews so decided to give it a go and we were not disappointed. Friendly welcome and excellent food. I had the beef medallion special and my partner chose the cod ravioli. Both were excellent, my beef was cooked to perfection and the sauce was beautiful. Followed up with the Apple strudel and Chocolate bombe. Staff were very friendly and ensured we had a great time. Good wine choice as well. Superb family run business, well worth a visit if you are in the area.

title: Excellent Italian food
comment: Excellent food, fresh, authentic Italian and tasty across all the pastas and main dishes . Very good price for the quality . V nice service and they were very accommodating to our large table with young kids who made a mess and not staying still . Highly recommend and we will return

title: Fabulous as always
comment: Wonderful welcome from Maritzio - the service, food and ambience is the best , thank you for a lovely evening . X

title: Excellent experience
comment: We had a great meal, freshly cooked and tasty. Service was excellent and the waiters cheerful and chatty. Portions were good, I especially enjoyed the liver, best I've eaten for years. Good, lively atmosphere. Probably best to book for a Saturday.

title: Quality food and great atmosphere
comment: We chose to eat here as we had just visited Strawberry Hill House nearby. The menu has a wide choice of food and I had the sirloin steak which was served with potatoes and broccoli. I thought the food was excellent and the restaurant was full even though it was only a Thursday evening so seems to be very popular. The waiters were friendly and efficient. The food was reasonably priced too. Definitely recommended.

title: Lovely local
comment: Lovely local restaurant in Teddington, good quality food, lovely wine, highly recommend the mushroom pasta and carpaccio. If you fancy a cozy evening in a local italian with good quality food then look no further.

title: Spot on
comment: This is the best restaurantin Teddington in my opinion. We were a party of four and all of us we were very happy about our choicesof food. Amazing food, friendly staff and relaxed atmosphere make this restaurant a winner.

title: Excellent meal
comment: We took my mum here on Saturday night for her Birthday, we enjoyed delicious food & wine and a relaxed atmosphere. The lamb main on the specials menu was particularly great! I would highly recommend La Dolce Vita and will be returning.

title: Slightly disappointing
comment: Went for a birthday meal after seeing the great reviews of this place but my partner and I were just left a little underwhelmed. Coke was flat, pizza bread looked good but tasted a bit doughy. Chicken was nothing special and the calzone for me wasnt the best. Owner contacted me to apologize and invited me to return to the restaurant. Very passionate and clearly loves his restaurant. All the other reviews cant be wrong, maybe just wasnt for us.

title: Fabulous meal
comment: Great food, authentic and tasty. Generous portions. Pasta was very good indeed as was a main of chicken with garlic mash and green beans. Desserts were really good and although we were full we did not regret making the effort! Very polite and helpful service. Wine well priced and delicious.

title: Very good!!
comment: Very lovely restaurant in Teddington! Good and homely cooked food ;) Cheesecake was amazing!! Thank you Mauricio for being a great host! Ranib and Susanna

title: Stunning
comment: I love this place, we came on monday evening and the restaurant was packed. I had the scallopes to start and the ravioli as main dish....both were gorgeous!! We will back soon....

title: Pre rugby lunch - perfect!
comment: Two of us went there for a meal before going to Twickenham. It has a great atmosphere, food and service. Very reasonable for the quality and so much easier than the bun fight in Twickenham as this is walking distance from Strawberry Hill. We had to wait only 2 mins for an Uber to the ground. We will be back!

title: Great food and service at a fair price
comment: Welcoming atmosphere, good quality ingredients and a very nice service (thanks Enzo). We tried the fried calamari, a 250gr rib-eye with sweet potatoes and the local cheesecake. Overall, a great balance between the location, the quality of the food and wine as well as the service. We would definitely go back again. A plus is the free parking outside after 7pm.

title: Faultless
comment: I had booked a table for me and my husband during our stay in London to celebrate his birthday. This is my first trip advisor review but I felt after our experience I needed to write one. From start to finish we had the most amazing meal. The food was incredible and served very efficiently. I had the roast belly pork and I have to be honest I’ve never quite seen a portion size like it. Talk about value for money. What impressed us the most however was just how attentive the staff were, we could not fault them! From the minute we walked in till the moment we left! Thank you so much for helping me to make my husbands birthday special. If we are ever in the area again we would definitely come back!

title: High calibre food and service
comment: We chose this Italian due to the glowing reviews it had received and it did not disappoint. We ordered a mix of homemade pasta dishes and pizza. All of which tasted truly authentic with good portion sizes. The icing on the cake was the service we received by Maurizio. He was very accommodating with a pleasing yet professional attitude which added to the whole experience. Would eat here again.

title: Lunch with friends
comment: The place is beautiful and relaxing, and the food is excellent... Great people and great service! Highly recommended!

title: Great food, warm service, reasonable prices
comment: Came in shortly before 3pm closing, yet Francesco still made us feel welcome. Really welcome. And they're clearly just as Italian in the kitchen: as good tagliatelle, risotto and pizza as we have found on numerous visits to Italy. Unpretentious people who clearly take pride in what they put in front of people, served in unpretentious surroundings.  Now that we've found this place, we know where to go in Teddington.

title: Lunch visit
comment: Awesome service, fast and friendly. The restaurant is nice and cosy and the food was delicious and for a great price. I would definitely recommend this restaurant

title: Great food, Great service and Great hospitality.
comment: My family and I are on holiday from Australia and spotted this gem by chance. The food that we ordered was perfectly cooked and presented, the staff were friendly and helpful. It’s a great shame I won’t be able to come here again for a long time.

title: Great for dietary needs
comment: I’m quite limited by serious food allergies and so find it hard to eat out but the staff at La Dolce Vita couldn’t do enough for me! The atmosphere was great and the food superb. I’ll be going back the next time I’m in the area.

title: Last dinner on trip...great!!
comment: My family and I were visiting my daughter who is studying abroad at St. Mary's University in Twickenham this Fall and had dinner at La Dolce Vita on our last night. We had looked at a couple of other places nearby and were just passing by and stopped in. We were the only customers in the place and the staff made us feel welcome and at home. They were super helpful and service was great. Our food arrived promptly and we loved our pizza. My daughter now has a place close by her school with awesome pizza and a wonderful atmosphere. Go to this restaurant, you won't be disappointed!

title: Amazing authentic Italian food!
comment: Amazing food! Loved the wild boar pasta and the tagliatelle alle vongole! Amazing authentic Italian food served by real Italians!

title: Pizza and Pasta
comment: With an Italian wife and so extended family you would assume that finding great Italian food is easy, wrong! They do it so well at home, it must be outstanding to even register. These guys do exactly that. Perfectly crisp base on the pizza, deep and rich ragu of wild board with fresh pasta. The service is real and honest and so are the prices. The only tip I can offer to my British friends, share some pizza to start, then ask what past and sauce they recommend and share a plate of that too. Too good not to have both!!

title: Great food
comment: Great food with a wide, varied menu. Good service. Free olives and bread given before meal. I had excellent salmon, and was also given free liqueur afterwards

title: Good steaks
comment: Enjoyed good food served by very nice waiting staff. Only giving four stars because the steak was let down by a stale chimichuri sauce.

title: Great service
comment: Went there for niece’s birthday - her choice. Enzo was charming, recommended lovely wine and was great with the children. Adult steaks were superb but children’s steaks (off the kids menu) not quite as good. (They have got used to organic and aged steak so are quite fussy!) Puddings were fab. Will definitely be going back

title: Super
comment: Visited on a Sunday lunchtime. Place was rammed which is usually a good sign. The steak I had was cooked to perfection. A nice cosy restaurant would highly recommend

title: fabulous steak house
comment: great vibe and superb service . loved every minute and the steak was just the best ever, Lovely little private side bar is a must

title: Great little restaurant.
comment: Tucked away on a road of shops this little family run restaurant is a great find. We had the 3 course set lunch menu at a very reasonable price. The food was excellent and the portions generous. We will definitely be returning.

title: Cracking lunch
comment: We were visiting Strawberry Hill House in the afternoon, so checked on t'internet for lunch options. La Dolca Vita shone like an irresistible beacon, so booked for 1230. We arrived at about 1210, warmly greeted and took a table near the window. As it was lunch, the plan was for just main course. We were brought a bowl of olives and some delicious crusty bread, hot from just coming out of the oven, We ordered chicken and lamb dishes and glasses of Nero d'Avola and Pinot Grigio and enjoyed the complimentary "starter". The wine was served and the mains arrived 10-15 minutes later. All was delicious and perfectly cooked. Our willpower yielded to profiteroles and fig, plum and pistachio tart (yum) and coffees. Service was genial and attentive throughout. The bill was under £70. What's not to like? This place deserves your custom if you are in the area. Actually worth a detour!

title: Great food and service
comment: Really impressed when I arrived that they'd looked up my name already. The service was excellent, very friendly and efficient. The waiter made the suggestion of buying a whole bottle of wine and taking home what we didn't want, which was much appreciated. The starters of Sardines were brilliant and the Cod special was evidently straight from the oven - really great flavour all round. I would highly recommend this restaurant and will likely make it a regular event.

title: Great food, lovely place
comment: We've spent a nice afternoon in La Dolce Vita's garden. Food was great- lasagne and calzone. We've enjoyed big portions in the afternoon sun. Maurizio, who served the food was very friendly,nice and funny. Lovely athmosphere and highly recomended place.We will definitely come back.

title: Steak, wine and chocolate cake
comment: Small and super friendly restaurant. The food was excellent and a small but good selection of wine to accompany the meal. The waiter was very "energetic" and humorous. I would definitely recommend this highly.

title: Great new find - friendly professional staff and great food.
comment: Absolutely loved this place. We chose it as it was central for our party of 8 celebrating Emma's birthday coming from Chertsey, Central London and Dorking respectively. It is in a nice quiet part of Teddington where street parking is good and there's a nice pub on the corner if you get there early as we did. The evening was so nice- great ambience and a nice, noisy buzz from a pretty busy dining room. The table of Italians behind us were having a good time - always a good sign. The food was top quality Italian comfort food at its best. I liked the way the waiter let me have a small portion of a main for a starter - Aubergine Parmigiana - lovely. My wife loved her scallops and the wine flowed nicely. I worried about ordering the calves liver as at other places I have occasionally had to send it back for being over cooked - this was tender and pink as I asked for and as good as it gets with delicious mash and great cooking juices. Others had fresh pasta- beautiful, seafood pasta and stew, pizza , sea bream and salmon - all very well received. I mentioned to the waiter at the end how much I enjoyed the liver and he explained every detail of the cooking - brilliant.  One of the nicest eating experiences I have had in a long while and while not near Chertsey we will return...

title: Fresh fabulous food
comment: Went tonight after checking trip advisor for a good Italian restaurant near us. This came out as number one for good reason. The food is outstanding, fresher and tastier than any Italian cuisine I've had in years and far better than any of the chain restaurants locally. I had the pappardelle with a wild boar and Chianti sauce which was amazing...followed by the dessert special of the day which was a lemon and poppy seed cheesecake with blueberries, which our neighbouring table then decided they were going to order later. This restaurant is perfect for a family night out as there is a kids menu too, with pizza you can customize, but would be equally good for a romantic night out as a couple or a birthday celebration. You can tell this is a good place as there were obviously local regulars in there who were known to management and treated as friends. I would not hesitate to go again.

title: Great lunch, good value
comment: We visited this Italian restaurant with friends who live nearby, it is one of their regular haunts. It was a late lunch on a Friday and when we arrived there were still a couple of other groups enjoying their lunch. The greeting was warm and we were soon pursuing the menu as well as the ‘set-menu’ offering 2 or 3 courses for a set price. I settled for one of the set-menu offers of an entree of grilled sardines followed by pizza. For the price, I was expecting that the serves would be smallish, but I was very wrong. This was a big meal, and very good meal, for a very little price. A nice glass of red wine and I was very happy. Our friends told us that the restaurant also has a very nice outdoor area at the rear, but it wasn’t the weather to explore. Nice little restaurant, worth a try if you are in the area.

title: Best steak in Chiswick
comment: We've been a number of times and everytime the Steaks seem to get better. The sharing steak platter is fantastic - highly recommend. The staff have always managed to squeeze us in and are very friendly, helpful and attentive without being in your face. Special mention to Giovanni who always goes above and beyond to make sure you have everything you need and offering suggestions.

title: Birthday steak did not disappoint!
comment: First time visiting this restaurant and won’t be the last. Excellent friendly service from the minute you arrive, cosy and warm atmosphere and delicious steaks! Some of the best steaks we’ve had by far! Only sees for improvement for me personally is the portion size - I feel they could definitely throw a few more chips and salad on the huge plate when paying £25 per steak. Brilliant overall!

title: A hidden gem
comment: Tucked away in Turnham Green Terrace it's easy to miss ,but this restaurant is worth seeking out . Front of house staff very friendly and efficient .The restaurant has a modern layout with a bar and a great atmosphere . Open kitchen serving great food .Our steaks were perfectly cooked good quality meat. Malbec sauce .......umm maybe too thin ,not rich enough for the dish.Plenty of dulce de leche desserts. Wine list is predominantly Malbec but an excellent selection fairly priced. Wen look forward to returning !

title: Unassuming excellence
comment: The restaurant itself is unassuming, unremarkable and you would drive past unless you knew... The food and service are authentic, high quality, delicious Italian served in generous portions and without fuss. Great value too. Molto bene. Well done!

title: Perfect even for birthday parties
comment: My husband picked this amazing restaurant to throw a surprise birthday dinner with my friends for me and we all loved it! The food was super delicious authentic Italian and the staff could not have been nicer. Even though there were lots of us they had no problem serving the food around the same time for all of us and at the end they were even singing 'happy birthday' for me. Absolutely recommend it!

title: Great independent restaurant
comment: A short walk from the high street, but it's definitely worth the journey. We had the Agnello con Salsa al Vino Rosso (lamb) and Swordfish from the daily specials menu. Both were excellent. Friendly and approachable staff from across Italy.

title: Another wonderful evening!
comment: Just had another great evening here with my mum and sister. After a meal here a few months ago we decided to come back, and after tonight, it's safe to say we won't go anywhere else! Amazing food and the friendly and relaxed atmosphere makes it our number one choice. Maurizio and his team work so hard and always give us such a warm welcome. Thank you for another great night with fantastic food and lots of laughter...and the cheesecake was amazing!!

title: Fabulous food and service
comment: We were welcomed by a very friendly and professional Luca. The food is just amazing, come here if you are looking for authentic beautiful Italian food.

title: Great Find
comment: Was looking for a nice family run Italian restaurant and came across this one here. Can’t fault it to be honest. Great Italian food with no frills. Friendly staff, great atmosphere, just what we were looking for. Will definitely go back.

title: Sunday Lunch at it's best
comment: Yet again I had the most wonderful meal at La Dolce Vita on Sunday. I had the liver which was the best I have ever had. I often eat here when I am in town and over the years I have come to regard this as the no 1 spot to eat and have a truly enjoyable time. Mauricio is a joy and his chef is one of the finest.

title: Nice lunch, friendly staff
comment: We had lunch here after reading to get reviews. The place looks nothing special from the outside, however let not this fool you! Our meal (pasta for him, chicken and potatoes for me) was very tasty indeed. We shall come back!

title: Very nice place
comment: I went for dinner with my boyfriend a week ago. Everything was really nice, the waitress was lovely and the food as well. I would really recommend this place for a good steak. Will go back for sure.

title: Excellent service and delicious food
comment: The staff is very friendly. We got complimentary glass of champagne and cake for my boyfriend's birthday. This was actually a very nice gesture. Steaks cooked to perfection. I'm glad we've chosen Buenos Aires to check on Argentinian food. Highly recommended

title: Fantastic!!!
comment: Popped in after our son's graduation for lunch. On the hottest day of the year, we were incredibly glad to walk into the air conditioned restaurant. It was empty, but it was 2.30pm on a Thursday. The service was friendly, the sangria was delicious. My husband and I had the £10 steak and fries lunch time and were surprised how big the steak was! We had ordered two sides, thinking it wouldn't be enough, but it was. My son's burger was beautifully presented and he said it was delicous. The desert menu, looked lovely, but we were too full to try them.

title: Delicious dinner
comment: We went for dinner today for 7 pm. Restaurant was not busy at the time as we walked in we were welcomed by assistant manager Geeza. Table was very neat and set nicely, after looking at the menu, we selected steak taster for the main and couple of starters such as bread olives and calamari to share. Starter was delicious specially olives followed by main - 5 different cuts of meet. I have to say that portion 75gr each cut per person was big enough and we enjoyed every single piece of it. We would recommend steak at this place as we are quite fussy about it. Geeza was very friendly and very happy to please his customers. He went above and beyond. We finished our dinner with recommended by Geeza Argentinean cheese cake which was fresh and delicious. We would definitely be back again. Thank you

title: Great food, family friendly and makes the best espresso in London :)
comment: We are family of 4 (2 adults, 2 children) from Melbourne, Australia. We were looking for a place to have a good lunch before making our way to Heathrow to go home on the last day of our holiday. We found La Dolce Vita in Teddington. Maurizio is very friendly and the food is good. Our children enjoyed their kids' meals. The kids' pizza is a very generous size and my son loved it. Our kids got juice and yummy ice cream as part of their meals too. The pasta was tasty. The home-made deserts were great. And Maurizio even made me an espresso which (as a coffee lover) I believe was one of the best espressos I have ever had.

title: Great little Italian - Ciro and Luca are really nice and friendly guys. Highly recommend!
comment: Been here quite a few times during work over the summer. Great place to relax, enjoy authentic Italian, the pasta is great. Superb place to chill and enjoy some fantastic food. Everything on the menu is worth trying. Specials in particular! If the aperol spritz was bigger it would truly be an identical Italian experience, as if you were in Italy ;)  Thanks for having me guys and I will be back for sure. 10/10

title: Teddington's Finest
comment: An unassuming facade reveals some fantastic menu items. We enjoyed immensely the welcome, service levels and a big compliment for the Octopus Salad with Caviar Crostini. 5 Stars from a hard to please connoisseur.

title: Great place to eat
comment: Were in a group of 9, table was set for us and we were warmly welcomed by Franceso and Luca. Service was excellent and the food was on par. An enjoyable evening, would recommend as good food and decent prices

title: Good family dining
comment: If you want a homely feel, with good food in a relaxed atmosphere then this is the place. Recently visited for a chilled out lunch with family and it was good...don't expect 'special' but good it is.

title: Good Value, excellent food
comment: We are regulars and love the good food, hospitality and fantastic service. Consistently good a rate event in today’s world!

title: Huge expectations as listed in top steak houses in london
comment: Arrived to a virtually empty restaurant at 1300 on a Friday. The menu isn’t long but just enough choices. Starter was six insipid just cooked shrimps in a “sauce” seemingly of melted butter and after, the strongest flavour was the lemon I squeezed over it. Main was an ok ribeye, it was the larger one but didn’t seem all that large. It was though cooked to perfection, there were skinny little unexciting chips that were at least hot! A few automatic trimmings would have been nice rather than paying extra for them. Kudos for serving cold water with lemon and mint with ice all in the jug. Not bad I guess but not sure it deserves such a high ranking amongst steak houses. Nice music and reasonably friendly staff, could have been a bit more organised/attentive.

title: Consistently Excellent and Best Value in London!
comment: Having lived in the US for nearly 15 years before moving to London in 2000, my wife and I were spoilt by USDA Prime. Morton's, Peter Luger's, Capital Grille, Fleming's, Smith & Wollensky, even the ethnic steakhouses like Brazilian Churrascos. You name it, we'd dined there! So to say that we're fussy about good steak would be an understatement. Over the past 19 years, we've tried many steakhouses across the UK and in London including Goodman, Hawksmoor, etc. yet we always return to Buenos Aires for a sure thing! For the money, the quality and consistency can't be beat! The wine menu is not extensive but there's a good selection that won't leave you wanting. Buenos Aires has several restaurants in London and we're just so glad one of them is in our local neighbourhood!

title: Good steakhouse
comment: Good service, very attentive. Dealt expertly in relation to an allergy sufferer and provided details of all ingredients. Good steak and a nice place in Chiswick to get together with friends or family for a great meal. Food good quality.

title: Lovely birthday meal al fresco
comment: Our family (parents, adult brother and two teenage sons) had a great birthday celebration meal at La Dolce Vita one evening recently. We really enjoyed the food (delicious - especially the fried seafood and fresh pasta), the choice of wines and the very friendly service. Our table outside at the back of the restaurant under cover was nice. Good value. Easy to book on-line as well - and I received a personal email reconfirmation. As it is within walking distance, we will definitely return - and would highly recommend.

title: A surprise find
comment: We were staying in Teddinton for the Hampton Court Flower Show and came across La Dolca Vita via tripadvisor. A lovely meal in simple surroundings. I had swordfish and my partner pork. Good service, an excellent Chianti and friendly atomoshere. We will return.

title: Birthday Treat
comment: We love this restaurant. My friend arrived early and was waiting for us to join her. Francesco made her a cup of tea (no charge) and really looked after her until we arrived. A busy evening as most people chose to eat in the outside restaurant. We chose to eat inside. Our food was superb. A selection of things from the menu and all were lovely. They offer a three course set menu too which is great value for money. They sang Happy Birthday and brought out a sparkling ice cream even though we were not charged for it. Such a lovely restaurant with a cosy family feeling. Fantastic hospitality.We will definately go again. Thanks Francesco and the Chef (Peter) for a lovely evening.

title: So pleased to have found this place!
comment: A last minute decision to look for a restaurant within cycling distance from home. La Dolce Vita had great reviews and did not disappoint. The chef saw us trying to find somewhere to put our bikes and came out to us, quickly sending someone out to help. As soon as we sat down in the lovely little garden, we were given bread and olives whilst we looked at the menu. The menu is excellent with several 'specials' as well. Every dish we had was delicious and the service was friendly and attentive We visited early evening on a Monday and most of the tables in the garden were occupied within less than an hour of us arriving, lovely atmosphere

title: Very Friendly.
comment: Small but very hospitable. Our waiter and the food were fantastic. Would highly recommend for a memorable evening out.

title: LOVELY SUMMER MEAL IN THE GARDEN
comment: Four of us ate here last week. It was hor so we sat in the garden which was quiet and cool but still had a good ambience. The service was exceptionally friendly and the food excellent. The menu was varied and not the usual list of Italian food. It was well cooked and presented. We will certainly return if in the area again.

title: fantastic food
comment: We review trip advisor reviews and looked at menues of those restaurants that looked good. We chose La Dolce Vita because it had calfs liver on it main menue. It is many years since wehave come across a restaurant that serves this dish. It is an excellent indicator of a good restaurant. My wife and friend and i were attending the hampton court flower show and wanted a food experience to complete the day. It is very rare for halibut to be on the menue as so expensive,scarse or both. It was one of the specials which we all had. It was excellent and was accompanied by mash and carrots. I dont like mash but this was great.The serving of fish was liberal such that felt full up. I always order cheesecake in hope that it is good. Usualy I am disappointed but it was the best i have had. it was also accompanied by a sauce which compliment it. i was enjoying it so much that my wife and friend also ordered and they said best thay had. We came back second night for the calfs liver. It is rare to see it on the menu nowadays as expensive and difficlt to get tender peices. Usualy it is grisly and chewy even if purchased from well know supermarkets. This calf liver was tender, no grisltle on any of the 3 servings. There were 2 big pieces on each plate with excellent sauce/gravy. It was made from onions that come from Italy with gave the sauce a sweet taste. More great mash potatoe accompanied by spinach with garlic in. Whole meal excellent and remanisent of many years ago when there were small italian family owned restaurants. We use to go to Italy and eat out at expensive restaurants with our Italian friends. Thier calfs liver not up to La Dolce Vita. I had Tiramasu which was light and excellent. For my taste would have prefered more alchol but this preferenbce. My wife and friend could not manage any more. On top of such excellent food was the very reasonable price which included vegatables. Other restaurants we looked at charged between £6 to £8 more for veg. Trip advisorr price category overstates La Dolce Vita when compared to others we reveiewded. The waiter and chef were helpful and friendly. My friend had to take a taxi back to hotel as bad back- one of the waiters took her. Overall fantastac food and very reasonable prices with friendly service. It is mid range price with food equal to any fine dining restaurant.

title: Evening meal
comment: Everything you could want from an Italian restaurant. Campari soda apperritive ? Check Lovely sharing plate of ham ? Check Cracking value pasta dishes? Check. Lovely wine list... Great staff. Good selection of digestives... Was a lovely romantic meal

title: The best so far we ever had in London!!!!
comment: My boyfriend has taken me there for a dinner.  Seeing the surrounding (which isn’t bad at all!! It’s nice and cosy, wasn’t just expecting what I experienced), I just wasn’t wowed, and I thought the same will go for the food- well I was very very wrong the moment I tasted the starter itself and then main!!! The food was excellent!!! Beyond excellent!!! The meat so tender and full of flavour!!! Everything was full of flavour!!! was just haven on the plate literally!! Travelling to many many country’s and eating in hundreds of restaurant (including Italy), I have nothing say apart from- hats down for all of you in the restaurant. It’s a big big WOW for the food You preparing ❤️ And of course without any doubt, we will go back and are recommending the place to all of our friends! Thank you

title: Eccellente!!
comment: I had been looking for a restaurant which offers very good home Italian meal. Thanks to Tripadvisor I found "La Dolce Vita". Eccellente! I visited this restaurant with my husband who has been to Italy uncountable times and he was also very impressed. The service staff was all very friendly even though it was a particularly hot day. They made us feel very comfortable in the cozy patio. We will definitely go there again and have seafood.

title: Wonderful little Italian restaurant
comment: This little gem was family friendly welcoming and the food was delicious. Five stars all the way. We checked out trip advisor looking for a place to eat in the area and wow so glad we did. Shame we live so far away we would go back again and again whole family loved it

title: Excellent food and service
comment: This is a great Italian restaurant with a good choice of food, well priced and good service. It has outdoor seating which is nice in the summer. I look forward to lunch here on most Saturdays. Highly recommended!

title: Friendly staff, good food.
comment: Really good quality Italian food. The pasta was tasted fresh. Also amazing service from the staff. Was given complementary bread for starter.

title: A firm favourite with all the family
