comment: This food is amazing. Delicious food every time I order. I can tell the meat is good quality ( coming from a family of butchers)  They are always happy when answering the phone. They always get my order correct even though I have special requirements. They have never let me down.  They even give me a free dish to try sometimes that is always yummy.  Thank you guys

title: Takeaway usually
comment: Big fan of OCK .... brilliant food, fresh ingredients and the best indo Chinese in the UK The staff are friendly, the chef knows Indian cooking well, and all the friends I have recommended this to thank me still....

title: Orpington Citi kitchen
comment: Excellent Indian food take away place. Helpful staff and great food. The food has just the right amount of spices. It is a genuine Indian restaurant with Indian staff and food cooked the Indian way. Being an Indian when I crave for genuine Indian food I visit here or get it delivered. Highly recommended.

title: Takeaway
comment: Ordered the Christmas Menu . Excellent service and absolutely delicious food. The Chicken 65 was a hit . Thank you. Will definitely recommend

title: Excellent Indian Food
comment: Excellent Food, Friendly and attentive Staff. Surprised to find such a good restaurant at Heathrow airport

title: So accommodating , authentic , traditional and 10.10 service
comment: I had made an error on my order and the staff were more than helpful adjusting my order , recommending what I would like and were extremely kind considering my complete mistake. Customer satisfaction was excellent and really looked after. From there the food was unbelievable , generous in size and absolutely amazing. If you do not like the food here you have no clue about traditional Indian cuisine founded cuisine ( Madhus is Indian Keralan ) You will love it , always on the mark and worth the visit worth every penny.

title: Fine dining
comment: I did not get an opportunity to personally dine in this restaurant but my granddaughters dined and shared their food with us. The food seems to be African dishes according to the one I had. Great taste.

title: Brilliant staff and food
comment: Visited Madhu's twice while staying at Sheraton Skyline. Staff were very attentive and food was stunning. Definitely worth a visit. Must give a special mention to Punam who served us what a cheery and polite lady. Thank you

title: Great Meal
comment: We weren't expecting an exceptionally good Indian, Punjabi, meal at a Heathrow airport hotel but this really was good.  You are offered really good poppadoms and sauces as an appetizer, and they were spicy. We had two types of chaat as a starter. Spicy and delicious, on the large size. Mains were thali prawns, chicken tikka and takka daal. All delicious, maybe a dish too many as the portions are generous. Service was very attentive. Thank you Punam.  I thought it was good value for money at £85 including drinks and the service charge. I lived in Birmingham for a long time and have had a fair few curries but this was near the top.  Highly recommended.

title: Nice food great company full of laughs
comment: Nice ambience, good service and excellent food. One I can recommend for vegetarians and reasonably priced.

title: Very average - nothing inspirational.
comment: Very average - nothing inspirational. Was expecting it to have much more of a wow factor - disappointed

title: Excellent food and service
comment: We have been to Madhu's Heathrow a few times in the last couple of months and greatly enjoyed the experience. We find the starters here to be wonderful and there was an occasion when we had only starters for our evening meal (several, of course). Our fave starters here are Aloo Tikki, chilli garlic prawns, chicken tikka. I am quite fond of their 'Masaledaar Kuku' and find that it goes quite well with rumali roti. The staff are polite, friendly and attentive - Vinod, Claudio, Sellington to name a few....The place appears to be a big hit with other families too, as most times Madhu's is 'buzzing'

title: This is the best Indian food
comment: This is the best Indian food I’ve ever had, the lentil soup was a delight! Punam Upreti Neupane, our waitress for the night, was very attentive and efficient by replacing the rice, which came with cumin seeds, without any questions. Both food and service were excellent, and the ambiance was perfect. Thanks for providing such a a great experience <3

title: Fantastic food
comment: Different from the run of the mill Curry house, but in a good way. Different flavours to the rest of the Indian subcontinent. The service and hospitality was first rate. It was almost like I was family.  I will be back next time I am in London

title: Amazing food mmm
comment: Food is amazing taste wicked love it's Will come again with a group of people  Well done staff lovely helpful with the Menu

title: When I dined here I had the Peshawari Tawa
comment: When I dined here I had the Peshawari Tawa which consisted of a mixed grill, chips and dal with a naan bread. The portion size was generous and the presentation of the dish was very good and the cost was very reasonable. The only negative thing was that the cutlery was not cleaned very well. I would want to dine here again.

title: Fresh tasty authentic food with welcoming friendly staff
comment: Very impressed with this outlet, one that locals must rave about and the 5 stars here are well deserved. Very friendly attentive staff, fresh authentic tasty food and good portion sizes.  Reasonably priced too, especially when considering the location. Fully halal, all HMC approved.

title: Best Restaurant for fresh and delicious food
comment: Best Restaurant in the town. The food is absolutely fresh and delicious like always,  Keep it up guys.... will definitely come again  In sha ALLAH

title: The best tawa I’ve eaten so far
comment: We travelled from the Midlands to this place to see what the hype was with these top reviews and were pleasantly surprised.  Fresh, full of flavour and authentic. If you are visiting for the first time the tawa is recommended to try an array of dishes and figure out your favourite should you visit again.  The Chapli kebab and karahi’s were my favourite dishes, not to say anything was wrong with the other dishes. I’m a meat lover and loved every bite of these two dishes. I like spinach and that along with the daal these dishes too were full of flavour. It’s very rare to find freshly made Pakistani food in UK, made from scratch, I could actually taste the freshness of each dish and that blew me away. Kudos to restaurant for providing this standard of food! I would definitely visit again.  The owner of restaurant took time to speak to us, he was very hospitable and courteous, he spoke with a lot passion about his food. The food is made fresh as he explained in small portions through out the day, the meat and chicken is not from frozen but sourced from the neighbouring butchers as when it is needed.  HMC certified. No one can fault a restaurant that prides itself in providing the best food and service to its guests especially when it is reflected in the end product.  The best tawa restaurant I’ve visited so far.  We were also offered complimentary kahwah at end of our meal.  A must try for authentic peshwari cuisine.

title: Excellent Food
comment: Having a meal at the Taste of Peshawar is the best way to celebrate. Totally addictive food. I couldn't ask for more.

title: GREAT FOOD AND FANTASTIC CUSTOMER SERVICE!!
comment: The best restaurant in wembley!! Specially the tawa for 7!.This is the only place we order from in wembley area.  Special thanks to Atif, hes always going an extra mile for us!! Will definitely be ordering more from here. I have already recommended this place to all family and friends and it has become one of their favorite restauran!.

title: Fantastic steak restaurant
comment: after being to the likes of STK, Gaucho etc , this is definitely up there or if not better! Amazing service , young girl was always there checking if we needed anything etc. Food was beautiful. perfect candle lit setting. will be returning!

title: Great place
comment: My sister & I went to eat here whilst on our short stay in London. Absolutely amazing food, good value for money. Excellent service too.

title: The best steak we've ever had!
comment: My partner and I came here for our anniversary meal and it did not disappoint. We both love steak and regularly order it when we eat out. Therefore on this visit we ordered the sharing meat board which includes 4 cuts of steak (rib-eye,fillet, sirloin and rump) These were cooked to absolute perfection, and tasted incredible. We genuinely think this is the best teak we have ever had! Each cut was packed with flavor and absolutely melted in your mouth. We also had the calamari and chorizo starters which were equally yummy to eat! We were helped when choosing our wine and were all round given fantastic service.  We can not recommend this restaurant highly enough- incredible food and great value for your money. We very much look forward to coming back again so thank you Buenos Aires !

title: Great food
comment: This place is excellent. We had the calamari and padron peppers for starters - they were great. Then we had ribeye and sirloin - which was cooked to perfection. Then we had the banoffee pie which was also spot on

title: Absolute delicious
comment: Food was amazing, and the staff were so lovely and attentive. We had the tawe (I think) never had anything like it! Would highly recommend- it’s a shame it’s so far away from home. Thank you for a lovely evening.

title: Best traditional food real tast of Peshawar
comment: The best food a real tast of Peshawar the best chapli kebab in London tray Peshawari special Tawa you will love, also Best lamb and chicken karahi kebab it it is the best traditional restaurant in london the staff is friendly nice and clean place. .

title: Excellent service and very
comment: Excellent service and very friendly staff. Very generous with their portions. Also the Chapli kebab was amazing! Never had one that good before. Definitely recommend.

title: Great food
comment: We have now been twice there. Food is fantastic, specially their tawa and Chapli kabab. Anybody who is vegetarian can have their Aloo Palak and Daal. Both are great. Staff is very courteous. At our first visit we did not know ehere to park our car and one of their staff members actually escorted me to show the place which is behind their restaurant

title: food and service
comment: Being an English very first time in an Asian restaurant the food was very fresh and tasty the customer service was outstanding worth to spend some quads here thanks to the business owner for a nice welcome.

title: Great food and experience
comment: It's was great experience and I never eaten before like this before and i must recommend it to all to try this. Prices are also very reasonable.

title: miss
comment: Excellent eating experience.. from walking in the door and being greeted by employee, seated and drink order taken, was maybe 5 minutes. Meal was served hot and excellent taste... It was my mom's birthday so i was trying to make her day and i can say that it was best decision to make and i took my mom there Thank so much for wonderful customer service and definitely recommend to my friend and family.  The green tea was amazing ☕️ ☺️☺️

title: Amazing experience
comment: I visited this restaurant with my family. The customer service here was incredible and the portions were very generous. We were four people in total, but the food we order was enough for another two or three. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.

title: The best Afghani food in Wembley Area!!!
comment: I always love coming to Taste of Peshawar! Its not only the food, but the friendly nature of the staff and the Green Tea after the food makes the place extra special. I have not known anyone taking negative about this place! Lovely food with excellent service. I enjoyed here with both family and with work colleagues. A place worth vising for authentic Afghani taste!

title: Great food
comment: Excellent customer service, gave us very good suggestions and house recommendations. Food was delicious, house offered us tea at the end which was very kind of them. Highly recommend a visit!

title: Well cooked, fresh and Absolutely Delicious
comment: Invited to dinner at this restaurant,and thoroughly enjoyed the variety of food. From mixed Grilled (lamb and Chicken)food, curry, Channay and Saag. All served on one big Tawa. ( A new experience for me). Cooking time was normal, Service was excellent and thoroughly enjoyed the food. Will be back again with my family.

title: Delicious Food
comment: We came to Taste of Peshawar in our little visit to Wembley as the reviews were really good and this place really deserves them. The food was delicious and really tasty. We had the Tawa, which has a bit of everything and every piece was increadibly. Special atention to the lamb, incredibly juicy and full of taste. I am not a very fan of spicy food and I can say that it was the right level of spicy. We had some mango lassi as well, which was really nice. The staff was really friendly and caring that everything was ok for us. If we come back to Wembley we'll definitely come back.

title: Delicious Food & 5* service
comment: Wanted to try some Peshawari/Pakhtunkwa/Afghani cuisine and this was the nearest restaurant from Chesham. Arrived 8.30pm & left at 10.30pm. Food was very tasty & freshly cooked. Had the tawa platter and really wanted to try the chapli kebabs. Also ordered Kabuli pilau & salty lassi.  The food was well presented and tasted delicious. The meats were well cooked and the chapli kebabs are the best I've tried in UK. Fresh nans and fresh salad. Was good portion sizes and the lassi was very nice. We ended the evening with some lovely tea. Staff & owner deserve a special mention as they were very friendly,professional & hospitable and always taking care of our table. Will definately come again insha Allah.

title: Tawa you beauty!!!
comment: Shared the ”tawa for 2” at Taste of Peshawar. Was a great experience overall. Exceptional customer service. Awesome taste of the food. Felt like I was in Peshawar for an evening. I would definitely recommend giving them a go! I can promise that you will love it. Thank you.

title: Tawa Zindabad
comment: Tried their signature dish, TAWA, a delicious platter. Spices and recipe were on point. The best customer service. A very pleasant experience overall. Definitely recommended.

title: Best Chappal Kebab Ever!
comment: 10 Out Of 10 The Best Chappal Kebab I’ve Had Brother Arif Owner Of This Amazing Restaurant Is A Really Good Man, Was Down To Earth & Hospitable... I traveled from Sheffield to come try the food and it was worth the journey  #DONCertified #TasteOfPeshawar #BestFood #Wembley

title: Great fresh food!!
comment: Great food and service, because it was all made fresh there was a little wait but definitely worth it!

title: The best👍🏻🥇🥇🥇♥️♥️♥️!
comment: First of all thank you so much for the lovely approach of the waitress after that we enjoy a lovely tasty food. Thank you for the best service you provide to the customers.  We ❤ Taste of Peshawar we will meet soon definitely

title: Traditional Real Peshawari Food
comment: Hi. Guys some my family friends recomand me Teast of Peshawar.  Honestly lovely restaurant. Clean  Friendly peoples  Really Teasty and Delicious food. I definitely come back again and recomand. Thank you

title: Very ordinary food
comment: I was their on Saturday and food was of very poor standard. Sorry I will not be visiting again, Also having Eastern European working in Peshawari Restuarant just doe not go well togeather .

title: Very tasty food!
comment: A great find if you’re visiting Wembley for an event, a little bit away from the busy stadium area, so you’re more likely to get in on an event day. Staff were very welcoming and happy to answer questions about the menu, all food freshly cooked, and very flavoursome! Very reasonably priced too.  However the restaurant is not particularly visually appealing, so don’t pass by, as you will miss a great meal.

title: Yum
comment: Restaurant served large portions and food was delicious and affordable. Waiters were very polite and service was very quick. Complementary salad was served during the meal and complementary tea was served after the meal. Would be lovely if they had more vegetarian options.

title: Great Restaurant
comment: Great Restaurant, the owner is amazing, very polite asked us anoit the service and about the food and offered us tea at the end. Fabulous experience.

title: Good for groups
comment: We had a group booking - large plates available to share. Friendly staff who explained parts of the menu to us and great tasting food. A little hidden gem in Wembley

title: Would I go back? Definitely
comment: Would I go back? Definitely YES. Great Naan bread, fantastic chapli kebab, very good chicken biryani, tasty lamb karahi and very friendly staff.

title: TOP QUALITY PESHAWAR CUISINE
comment: This place is a hidden gem. We ordered a leg of lamb 24 hours beforehand and a peshawari Tawa platter for 6. The leg of lamb was well marinated and cooked to perfection. The Platter for 6 was well presented and the food was mouth watering. Everyone of us enjoyed everybite. The chappli kebabs are hands down the best we've had in the UK, absolutely tasty and well seasoned. The manager Arif bai looked after us really well and also gave us some complimentary dessert and green tea at the end.  If someone is looking for some seriously tasty peshawari food, then this is the best place. Recommended to all.

title: Excellent food good hospitality
comment: Excellent food good hospitality only problem was didn’t gave a detail bill have to ask for it .  Food was really tasty and delicious. Parking is very easy to do as free parking outside the restaurant . Quite big portions will definitely visit again.

title: Great food!!!
comment: Had an amazing couple of visits to this place! It has absolutely fabulous food. Definitely a must try!

title: TASTE OF PESHAWAR.
comment: Best chapli kebabs in London without a doubt. Would recommend to everyone when looking for a good place to eat.

title: Excellent restaurant definitely recommend!
comment: I have been to this restaurant twice with family and the service and hospitality is impeccable. The staff is absolutely kind and amazing and go to amazing lengths to provide the best service to their customers.  They have a range of options from qabuli plaou to karahi chicken which is cooked to the best.  We are offered free beverages after which is really nice of them. The beverages are freshly made and served beautifully. I would definitely recommend this restaurant definitely 10/10 for me this restaurant is good for any occasion and is great for family dinners!

title: Wedding catered for
comment: Amazing amazing amazing! Chapli kebabs rule!  Amazing staff Amazing food Amazing service!  Thank you taste of peshawar for catering for my wedding, the day was very memorable and your food was talked about and loved by all! Thank you again!

title: Very nice place
comment: Amazing food ,friendly people and very welcoming people Would recommend to anyone and everyone , overall 5 stars

title: Best north indian food I ever had (and I lived there for 2 years)
comment: The meat is fresh and you can really tell difference. Perfect balance pf flavours and spice, like your mum eould have cooked it for you. Friendly quick service and good prices. Will come again

title: Great asian cheap and tasty food
comment: We visited the restaurant at 11:45 pm which was late and it was full. However, Arif was so calm and eagerly served us with a smile on his face. He was spectacular as was the food. We tried veg Dal tarka and Saag aloo which was super. The Chicken n Lamb biryani was good too. The best was Chapli lamb kabab which is not found in most places. We did not try but the Tawa is a must too. The Kawa tea was fresh n awesome. We ended with Carrot halwa which was super too. All in all good service n great food. Very very reasonably priced too. A+++++ Highly recommended.

title: Best Chaplin kebabs in London
comment: I visited this restaurant on Friday night for the first time and I loved it. The food was great. The chapli kebab was super...I immediately regretted ordering only one. I have not tasted better. The other highlight was the chops in the mixed grill which were simple, but so tasty, which shows the meat is of a good quality.  The decor is simple, but clean and I guess they let the food do all the talking. It is also very rare to find Asian restaurants in London with a hygiene rating of 5, which was an added bonus. I’ll be going again soon!

title: The best Karahi & Chappal Kebab ever in London
comment: I visited Taste of Peshwar today with my family and we loved not only the customer service but the food was so amazing. We ordered Chappal Kebabs & Lamb Karahi for 7 of us. I cannot explain how tasty and delicious the food was. I wish if I could rate more than 5. I’d definitely recommend it.

title: Fantastic food
comment: Amazing place the food was great, mixed Tawa. After great food headed off to Wembley Arena. 100 out of 100  You will not be disappointed .

title: Mr Faizan Khan Lodhi
comment: One of the best Asian Restaurant in the Town without any Doubt. Excellent Customer Services and food is simply amazing. I Can assure to whom it may concern 100% satisfaction.

title: Mr
comment: I visit alot of time to this restaurant ,really impress from the nice behaviour of staff with delicious food with quite suitable price,,,thanks guys keep it up

title: Tasty food , not that much
comment: Tasty food , not that much variety but none the less cooked fresh and served quickly . Pilau rice was delicious so was the lassi .  Needs a tidy up inside and improve the atmosphere with some staff . The manager is friendly however and offers good customer service .

title: A Novel Culinary Delight
comment: Our party of 4( 2 Singaporeans & 2 Malaysians) thoroughly enjoyed our first introduction to Pakistani cuisine. For those who relish in trying new & enjoyable culinary delights, I fully recommend this restaurant. It looks like a nondescript suburban restaurant but the food is truly good and value for money. The staff are friendly as well.

title: Amazing food, serving, and hospitality
comment: I’m from Germany and on visit to London with family. We had a delicious food at the restaurant. It was well cooked, and the serving was a lot. Recommended !

title: Absolutely amazing!!
comment: Probably the best food we have ever tasted.Their food is out of this world and it brings me back to my home country. The staff are very polite and I would rate the restaurant five star all round. Food was fresh and tasty very different to everything out there. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

title: Highly recommend! Excellent food
comment: Firstly, I love the unique style of the large platter hot plate. A variation of different meats. The only one small issue I could only say, the meat chops were over cooked. Other then that all the other foods on the plate, amazing! Highly recommend a visit with friends or family. Great atmosphere, excellent customer service. Price is fair for what you get!  Will definitely be making another trip in the near future.

title: Delicious !
comment: Had a lovely family dinner and everyone enjoyed the variety in tawa  Kids loved the pilau and wings and the chapli kabab was the most delicious I ever had  Will definitely be going back  Highly recommend

title: Authentic Afghani Food
comment: Went with friends to try something different. Nice place, quiet, relaxing with friendly staff. Food was excellent. The chapli kebabs were quality and nice desi tea.

title: Amazing restaurant!
comment: Amazing restaurant! Excellent food,fresh like a homemade  Very clean and tyde! I will definitely come back!

title: Great food!
comment: Very delicious food at a good price. We ordered one biryani and curry massala with naan and they all taste very good

title: Truly enjoyed the experience!
comment: Absolutely loved the food, great serving for families. Lovely and welcoming staff, with a cosy interior. Truly a taste of Peshawar! Definitely recommend!

title: Excellent food with excellent service
comment: Best place in London with great taste, Reminds me Peshawar. Thanks for great service... Highly recommend to all my friends

title: Yummy!
comment: Had the steak sampler to share between 3. It was absolutely divine but I was still starving afterwards even with the sides! Staff were friendly and attentive and the food decently priced!

title: Friendly welcome and fantastic food: make sure you book ahead
comment: I visited the restaurant with my partner. From the moment we arrived it was clear that they are taking their guests’ health seriously as it’s very clean and fresh. We sat at a large table downstairs.  I had a large rib-eye steak for main and my partner had the spatchcock chicken. Both were delicious, my steak was cooked exactly as I’d ordered it. We’d started with the bread selection, chorizo and aubergine: all of which were perfect.  We shared a dulce de leche cheesecake for pudding: I mentioned to the waiter that it was a little more chocolaty than I’d expected (which wasn’t a complaint as it was yummy) and quite unprompted he brought out a second helping with less chocolate sauce on. Fantastic service! This was our first visit to the restaurant which we’d booked to take advantage of the Eat Out to Help Out offer, but it’s well worth full price and will definitely be returning. Just don’t expect to walk in: it’s popular, and with good reason.

title: Cant wait to return
comment: I was working in the area, and had dinner here one night. Amazing authentic freshly prepared food, great customer service from some lovely people. Please support them, they’ve only been established around one year they were telling me. I wish you every success guys, hope to return soon.

title: Fantastic meal before spice girls
comment: Wasn’t what we were expecting but were really impressed the food was fresh and extremely tasty will definitely be back

title: Amazing food, friendly staff and ridiculously good prices!
comment: Came pre-spice girls gig at Wembley with the hubby and ordered the TAWA for two! Wow.. how tasty and lots of different food to try! The curries were authentic (I’m Pakistani and can recognise a decent curry!). Really good price for two and plenty of soft drinks on option! I’m super stuffed! The staff were incredibly polite and helpful!

title: Fab food and great service.
comment: Fabulous food. Great service. Enjoyed a mixed grill for 2. Excellent find just before going to Wembley.

title: What a treat
comment: We stumbled across this restaurant on your trip-advisor listing as we didn’t want to eat at our hotel. First impressions was a very basic eating establishment but what a treat! There are only a few items on the menu but all looked delicious. We had the chicken Marsala curry with rice and side dishes of tarka Dahl and gobi aloo. Best Dahl ever it was delicious. Everything was cooked fresh to order and the owner was welcoming and attentive. Well done guys keep on cooking!

title: Best food ever
comment: Was at Wembley stadium and all the bars were full so got an uber to this place and what a nice place grate food lovely people will definitely go again.

title: Food is awful TBH
comment: The only thing from previous reviews ive read is that the staff are indeed friendly. However the food is not good. I went with my wife and friends before a wembley concert, we are all fans of indian food and have eaten in a huge number of restaurants including in india. The food here was overcooked and most likely reheated. The mixed grill was dry overcooked and a bit burnt. The chicken was dry and also overcooked. Much of it was deep fried. The worst thing was the meat in the curries which was almost non existent consisting of bones mainly and i can assure you we all felt the same. I dont like posting bad reviews but people need to know . We use tripadviser a lot and this restaurants reviews led us to expect truly good food and its never been more wrong and we were very disapointed. How it can be best and no1 in the area is frakly bizarre. They only plus sides are friendly staff and its cheap. Another negative is they dont serve alcohol and wont let you bring any with you unlike similar east end curry restaurants.

title: Great taste and affordable prices
comment: The food was amazing with a very warm hospitality, the staff are very friendly, The Karayi is very special with taste as of its origins-

title: Great Value Food
comment: Had a lovely family evening meal on the way back from Harry Potter Studios. Food was great, the Talwa option is great, tremendous range and very generous portions! Highly recommended!

title: A bit of everything
comment: Went to Taste of Peshawar last night. Ordered the Tawa for 3 which was more than enough. Food was of good quality and fresh. Place was quite busy which is always a good sign. Service was great, the tawa had a variety of different foods on it. The location was also good we were able to park our car in front of the restaurant. The place is quite small so would recommend booking a table in advance if a group of 6 or more are going. Overall a fab place which is reasonable priced.

title: Amazing
comment: World class service , made sure we were content with good Peshawari style food! This place is a good spot when going wembley stadium or Monks park masjid.

title: Taste of peshawar
comment: Great place to go to with family or friends great service and great food highly recommended, staff is very friendly and helpful

title: Best Chapali Kebabs In Brent
comment: Lovely food and great hospitality.The food came piping hot and perfectly cooked...Would recommended to all!

title: Fabulous Food
comment: We were slightly confused by the menu being westerners, but we soon sorted out what we wanted and ordered the mixed grill for 2. It was billed as a starter, but there is plenty of food for a main. We added some rice and the tarka dhal and sag aloo. Everything was wonderful. Freshly cooked, marinated meat was delicious. The Dahl was the best ever! All washed down with mango lassi and green tea. I would highly recommend this restaurant. Friendly, patient staff and a great chef!

title: One of the best
comment: First time visiting and definitely one of the best restaurants I've been to, both in terms of taste and service. Cant recommend enough. Will be back

title: Stunning!!!
comment: Overall great restaurant. Food was great, staff were amazing and the tea was a perfect end to lovely dinner.  Would recommend everyone to visit. With friends or family. Ticks all the boxes. Try the tawa great value for money. 9 of us ate for just under £100. WOW

title: Excellent
comment: Food was amazing and great customer service! We go out of our way to come here! Would recommend to all!

title: Not what you think
comment: I don't want to be negative but I can't help noticing that most of the reviewers have only submitted 1 or 2 Trip Advisor reviews, this establishment being one of them. I can only assume that they have a very limited experience of eating out. This restaurant was ok, but definitely no where near the level of 5 star points. I love all kinds of Indian food and made a point of choosing this restaurant because of the rating. I was very disappointed by the menu and the 'takeaway' style, when I was expecting a proper restaurant. Tables were basic cafe style, not laid with table cloths , cutlery or glasses. We were given cans of Coke and had to ask for a glass. This is ok in a takeaway, but not in a place where you are expecting restaurant standards. I noticed on the way out, a food hygiene rating of 3, I wish I had noticed on the way in , as again I wouldn't have thought such a low standard of hygiene would warrant a number 1 spot on trip advisor. Just be careful about what you expect, if you are looking for a good quality Indian restaurant, I suggest you look elsewhere.

title: "Best restaurant in this area"
comment: We visited this place with friends  And the experience was beyond expectation. Customer service was excellent , staff are very friendly and very helpful. Everyone loved the food and the quality and freshness is so good. I even took a takeaway for the family afterwards because it was so nice. Thank you everyone at ( taste of Peshawar ) For the excellent service and food. I highly recommend this place .

title: Excellent food
comment: Excellent food, great service. Perfect post-football meal. Tawau was very tasty, lots of different meats.

title: Will not disappoint - everything to satisfy your tastebuds!!!
comment: We made an improtu visit to taste of Peshawar.  It is one of those random finds in which we didn’t know what we were expecting. But it was a pleasant find. Adrianna the host on duty that day recommended we get the tawa for 2. It was perfect for the two of us as we like to try and taste a mixture of flavours and it offered exactly that. We got a mixture of the grilled meat peices and an assortment of different types of curries (veg and meat). What topped it off was the delicious and tasteful chapli kebab placed in the middle. Which is fried in the most biggest fryer I’ve ever seen... all topped off with a sweet dish of garjar halwa. (sweet carrot based dessert) and green tea to end the night! Arif the owner cooked all the dishes perfectly and you can tell her takes a lot of pride in what he does. Will definitely be coming back!

title: Must visit place in London
comment: In Wembley for the night so decided to check out this place. Cannot rate this place highly enough. if you are anywhere near Wembley then make sure you pay this place a visit, guaranteed you will not regret it.  The Special Tawa is to die for, you get to have so many different dishes on one plate and every one of them is amazing. All the food is freshly prepared and they don't even have a freezer as they get the meat from the butcher a couple of doors up every day.  If you're at Wembley Stadium or close by its an easy stroll to get there and worth every step that you take. But if you don't want to venture out then they do takeaway too.  Looking forward to the next time we're in Wembley as I know we'll be back there for another visit.

title: Friends get together
comment: Good tasty food . We ordered lamb karhai and Chappli kebab. Naan were fresh and tasty too . Good value for money

title: Taste of Peshawar wembley
comment: Delicious food, authentic taste at a reasonable price. Very good service. Would highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Hashim
comment: Food was delicious. Staff was very friendly and hospitable enjoyed the naan roti as well which was Fresh will definitely recommend friends and family and will revisit again

title: Phenomenal Tawa
comment: Ordered tawa for 2 and the food was very nice, service was amazing, I would definitely recommend this place to all and will be visiting again!

title: Great food and fantastic service
comment: I visited this restaurant last weekend for the first time with my wife and we both really enjoyed the food. We had the tawa for 2 which was a selection of different vegetable and chicken / lamb curries and sides. Each one was delicious! Service was very quick and the waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and polite. Will be visiting again soon when in the area. Highly recommended!

title: Wow ...ONE OF THE BEST Chappal (Chapli ) kebab in London
comment: One of the best kebab I have ever eaten in my life ,What a taste great food .The quality and quantity both was great

title: Great steak night . We had
comment: Great steak night . We had a lot of fun. Staff followed necessary restriction. The food was well prepared and wide selection of wine.

title: Wonderful authentic food.
comment: @1 star Dave and2 star Sally from Plymouth.  Before you start; I ve eaten in plenty of Michelin starred restaurants over the years.  Don’t comment on what you don’t know about. Proper Pakistani and Peshawari food is on the bone. It s tastier. It’s how we like it. This isn’t an “Indian” restaurant so calling it such just shows your ignorance. And diddums; you couldn’t bring your Special Brew in. Tough. Management rules. Get over it.  And to leave them such scathing reviews. I bet your plates were clean.  We come here regularly. Kids love it. I love it. People who know what our food should be like love it too. Stick to you chicken tikka masala and vindaloos. I m glad I won’t be bumping into you.  We ve just had another awesome meal here. Always welcoming. Always hospitable. Always authentic.

title: Dinner today.
comment: Best service, best food of our choice on reasonable amount free car parking in front of the restaurant.

title: Wholesome
comment: The Tawa for 6 was truly one of the best culinary delights we’ve experienced for a while in a Pakistani restaurant (and we experience quite a bit!). Finger lickingly delicious food, with a very polite and attentive staff. The complimentary green tea is also the perfect tonic after a big meal. Our new favourite local eatery :)

title: Major general
comment: Fantastic food,3rd time coming here with family. Food is absolutely amazing. Prices are more than fair.

title: Large portions of quality food
comment: We were hungry and ordered a couple of dishes. The portions they serve are big! Very good quality and the people working there are very friendly.

title: Mouth watering chapli kebabs
comment: Me and my mates been to alot of restaurants in London and even to Birmingham for kebabs but this one took us by surprise the best kebabs we have ever tasted and not only that but the tawa for 6 was even more yummy coz of mix grill and Karahi wow amazing. I would recommend it to all kebab, grill and karahi lovers to visit and the price is so reasonable and the staff is so friendly.

title: Mr. K Afsar
comment: Fresh, tasty food with that original touch and taste of Pakistani food from Peshawar. I have been to various asian restaurants and takeaway but the taste of food, including the amazing and mouth watering chapli kebabs is just unique. Customer services and cleanliness looks good. Go and try food of your choice with great taste.

title: Best Pakistani food ever
comment: Good quality food... very efficient and helpful service... friendly staff... huge variety... would definitely recommend....
Best food I’ve had in a while & best customer service too. 100% worth the drive where ever you’re coming from.

title: Best ever Food Yummy!!
comment: We been to many restaurants but found this one very tasty ! specially Chapli Kebab ❤️ Tawa was lovely too  Amazing costumer service  I would give 10/10

title: Great food, Great service!
comment: Very friendly owner, who makes you feel at home. It's only a ten minute walk from the Wembley stadium, so it's the perfect place to grab a meal before or after the game. The food is amazing and reasonably priced. Try the chapli kebabs!

title: Good
comment: I have enjoyed the food we had a small get together party with my Best way friends. Me and all my have like the food specially chapli kebabs and fresh made butter Naan.

title: A good steak with an Argentinian wine!!! It’s a must.
comment: All my compliments to Juan, so professional and even tried to make a spit fire cocktail for the first time, so much appreciated.  Great dinner and nice place to be!!! I’ll see you soon.

title: Lunch with Friends
comment: Excellent Food and service.. Went for Lunch with office colleagues and each of us loved the taste and freshness of food. Thanks for the staff for their kind service and hospitality..  Highly recommended for friends and families....

title: A visit to cherish
comment: An amazing experience at taste of Peshawar. Been for business lunches as well as just eating out with friends and always they meet our expectations. Would say they need to work on their timings though.

title: Definitely something not to forget!!
comment: Had the most amazing and delicious mouthwatering food. Wide ranged of various foods. The food was really good I would definitely going here! I’ve recommended to all my family and friends and their expections definitely met up. The staff were very caring and friendly ensuring we have a nice experience.

title: Amazing!!
comment: I tried it for the first time a few days ago and loved it, recommend it to my sister and cousins and went again a few days later. I definitely recommend this place, the food is absolutely delicious along with the friendly helpful staff.

title: Delicious Fresh and Tasty Food
comment: I went a few days ago with the family after reading some good reviews. Very welcoming, friendly and helpful Staff,  Were recommended Tawwa 4. It was Delicious, Fresh and tasty, we ordered some Chapli Kebabs and lamb biryani. It was awesome. A must try..... I would go as far as to say it's one of the best Restaurant In the whole London.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Smart Handsome owner ‘MUHAMMAD’ with excellent service and amazing food!!! STRONGLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!!
comment: I just want to thank all the staff and the owner Muhammad Qadeem of taste of Peshawar for their excellent service and lovely food I loved it everything’s fresh great quality I would strongly recommend this place to anyone that wants to have a lovely taste meal family or couples day out

title: Pakistani Food at its best
comment: My hunt for Authentic Pakistani food finally ends in London. Delicious, Authentic, Homely are the adjective best suits this tiny little Restaurant in Wembley. A MUST Visit...The Peshawar Thali with 6-7 different dishes in 1 Tawa is simply the best presentation and gives you all the taste in 1 Order. Kheer and Gajar Halwa was just Yumm…!!!!

title: Miss
comment: I went to the restaurant today and I enjoyed the food and the excitement and the amazing food and service provided

title: Amazing food!
comment: Food was absolutely amazing, great portion and everything tasted good. Nicely ended with green tea! Staff were very polite and welcoming, would most definitely recommend to visit!

title: Great
comment: Great portions, friendly staff, very nice good. They have a number of meals, three meal pictured has great variety.

title: Birthday dinner
comment: We went for my boyfriend’s birthday, it was amazing. We were seated with two glasses of prosecco, shared the 4 piece steak main between us (which was delicious) and given complimentary chocolate cake. Overall, a lovely evening, recommend strongly and would come back!

title: Licence to Grill
comment: Argentinians are world-renowned for their love of beef so any place calling itself the Buenos Aires Argentine Steakhouse had better deliver the goods. A friend and I visited in late October – Halloween to be exact – to belatedly celebrate my birthday and the restaurant did not disappoint.  The steakhouse is on Turnham Green Terrace and appears deceptively small from the outside. Inside, it is a large restaurant spread over two floors. I’d booked in advance and we were received by a surly gentleman on the front door who should smile more. Once inside, however, our waitress for the evening was Natalia who was very smiley, friendly and attentive throughout. I’ve been learning Spanish for over three years so was hoping I might get to practise a bit but we didn’t encounter any Spanish-speaking staff on this night. We were seated on the first floor, which overlooks the ground floor dining area. The restaurant is dimly lit with soft lighting placed sparingly throughout and would be a romantic spot to take a date.  To start, we ordered a bread basket to share and I ate the padrón peppers, which, if I’m honest, were a bit tasteless, despite being chargrilled and seasoned with salt. My main was more impressive though. I opted for the 11oz (310g) cuadril, which is a rump steak, and asked for it to be cooked medium rare. An attractive piece of steak arrived with deep grill marks and was served with chunky chips and a small side salad. Some of my friend’s green beans also found their way on to my plate. Slicing my steak revealed a pink centre and caused a small amount of red juice to pool on the plate, a good sign the meat had been cooked to my specification. (Fun fact: the red juice is not blood but rather water mixed with a protein called myoglobin.) I eschewed the offer of sauce and asked simply for some Dijon mustard, which I find provides the perfect accompaniment to steak. The meat was tender, juicy and a real treat to eat. I washed my meal down with a cold bottle of San Miguel alcohol free beer, which was a nice change from the more commonly seen alco-free beers in bars and restaurants.  My friend and I were thoroughly stuffed after our main courses and although we were both tempted by the churros, neither of us had any room for dessert: very unusual for us and a clear signal our mains were very satisfying. When it came time to settle the bill, we each paid about £37 for two courses and a drink, which puts prices in the mid-range.  I would have liked to practicar mi español with some Spanish-speaking staff but nevermind. Would I return? Sí, señor.

title: Excellant Food
comment: I have visited this Restaurent for the fifth time.The food is absolutely delicious.  You must try the Thava.....a mixture of grilled meat and lentils.

title: Best halal food Wembley
comment: Thanks to Mr Mohammed Khateeb and staff at the modern and excellent restaurant Taste of Peshawar in Wembley.  I stayed at travelodge near by and been twice this week during my business visit into Wembley London.  The portions are generous and nicely presented. After long day at work I went their for a chicken curry and naan and it was delicious, colours were very vibrant and the taste was amazing. The naan is one of the softest and tender ever! The chicken curry gives you a mouthwatering feel as you relax and enjoy the tv screen, nice decor and ambient lighting. I just came again today and had Bbq chicken wings on a sizzler taste fantastic with a chicken Biryani which is really tasty, filling and enjoyable experience  Thanks Mohammad for your great service and for the tea! Best wishes and see you next time I’m in London  Arfan South Wales

title: Amazing, tasty food! Lovely friendly staff.
comment: Lovely warm welcoming staff. The staff were so friendly and went out of their way to ensure you are happy. Great customer service.The food was all cooked fresh and you could tell by the high quality and tastiness of the food. The portions were massive and so filling too and the price was very good too. Cannot fault the restaurant. Would definitely visit again if I was to come back to Wembley.

title: Tasty food
comment: Food taste nice, all staff are great very friendly and warm welcome. Would recommend to my friend and family.

title: A honour to eat here!!! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
comment: I’ll start with the staff, from the humble and kind owner to the very efficient son and super friendly waitress a perfect mix, which is a bit like the food. Absolutely delicious!!! Everything had its own different flavours, with very generous portions. Truly a great great night, if you live local or not I’d give it a try. Thank guys for a fantastic experience. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Mr
comment: Unbelievable lamb Karachi superbly tasty would 100 % recommend.very friendly atmosphere.very clean and tidy place.

title: Absolutely amazing
comment: I have visited taste of Peshawar with my friends. We ordered the platter which includes almost everything I.e. chappal kebab, lamb chops, daal, lamb karahi, saag and afghani palou along with naan. We really enjoyed the Food. It was just like I’m eating in Peshawar KPK Pakistan.  I would definitely recommend to all my friends and family.  Akmal

title: Simply amazing!!The "TAWA" dish is a real delight
comment: It was our second time today n we were compelled to come back all the way from Watford just to have that amazing tawa dish which has a variety of chicken n lamb dishes with chana daal n saag n fries making it a balanced diet.The food was as delicious n fresh as before maintaining the quality and taste.The staff was very generous.Would recommend it to everyone i know.Would rate it 100%.5/5.

title: Dinner
comment: Very good food and taste.Exellent service. Quite reasonable.homely food and taste.we will go again.clean too

title: Mr family
comment: There food is amazing and delicious it's worth trying it out better then 5 star hotel food freshly made seating place is clean yummy on the lips and good customer service please I recommend every1 to check it out thanks.

title: Perfect 5 star service
comment: Perfect in every manner. Friendly staff and great food. I have visited many times and I would recommend everyone should try at least once

title: Take Away
comment: Great customer service and the food was typically Peshwari from what I have been told by the Mr’s.  Place was clean and looked good.  Unfortunately being of Punjabi origins I need some spice in the food. Grill was great, saag best curry but the other curries on the tawa was sweet like a desert. All I can say is I enjoyed the food but want some chilli in the meat dishes. Will visit again.

title: Peshawari food at its best
comment: Freshly made food, clean, friendly and calm environment. What else do you want to chill out with your friends.

title: Great food and customer service!
comment: The food was fresh and very tasty! It took a little longer to make owing to the large amount of food we ordered (and that it was fresh); however, it was worth it! The staff were very accommodating and friendly. The restaurant was clean and tidy. With me were people from India, Pakistan and Afghanistan and everyone agreed that the food was delicious. We will definitely go again.

title: Great restaurant
comment: Lovely place! Friendly staff! Vegan options available, we had the lentil dish and it is so amazing, that we have been back every Monday for the last three weeks! Family friendly, my little boy and I always feel welcome! Would recommend this place x

title: Brilliant all round
comment: I would recommend 100%. The food was amazing. The chef went above and beyond. Especially CHAPLI Kebab, Lamb Karahi, Kabul Pulao, and the last but not the least is the Gajar ka Halwa. Every mouthful was hit by so many flavours will definitely go back again and again. The best place for the Peshawari taste. Welcoming and Friendly

title: A must try
comment: Went a few days ago with the family for the first time...will definitely be a regular place now for me! The reviews really don't do it any justice! Staff are friendly and the food is awesome! We had lamb karahi which was made with not much spices but very authentic fresh and tasty, the Chapli kebabs are mouth watering. I would go as far as to say it's one of the best restaurants I've been to for a while.

title: Amazing food every time
comment: Today was my second time dining at this place and the food was as amazing as the first time. I have not had a better chapel kebab anywhere else. Quality of food was amazing as well as the taste and Service was very fast and polite. The owner cooks most of the dishes himself. What a great personality. No negatives to point out.

title: Amazing food amazing Service
comment: Today was my third time in this place the food was amazing and the service was top-quality always enjoy my food here best place in London   Highly recommended

title: Great food. Lovely staff.
comment: Wonderful and authentic food. Lovely owner and staff. Really hospitable. We went as two women on our own and were made to feel really welcome. Food was delicious and most importantly made fresh. Tawas were a great idea as you get to taste a bit of everything. Generous portions so we even had enough to take home too. Really wish these guys every success. They deserve it.

title: Vegetarian Tasting Experience
comment: What a fantastic evening at The Tudor Room. We can't recommend it highly enough. We had the vegetarian tasting menu. Each course was creative, innovative, beautifully presented and so delicious using high quality seasonal ingredients. Each dish was a stand out in its own right and also introduced us to ingredients we had never heard of before.The combinations of flavours and textures were in perfect harmony. We are not vegans but we noted that dairy products were barely used at all so this menu could easily be converted to vegan preferences. Special mentions much be made of the salt baked celeriac, and the artichoke dishes. Another course was bathed in a thai broth which had a depth of flavour that only time and talent could produce, balanced with lime which gave a unique spicy finish. Desserts were works of art - again with texture and taste combinations (e.g. lemongrass pannacotta , fig jam, fig sorbet and honey crisp) that elevated them to dishes of perfection.  Most of the courses were presented by the Head Chef or one of his team and we really enjoyed learning about the ingredients and inspiration for each course. We also learned that some dishes are only served for a few weeks or even a fortnight only in line wth the freshness and avallability of their ingredients. So you really are getting a seasonal dish of the moment!  Service throughout was very friendly, attentive, unobtrusive and knowledgeable.  I was surprised by previous comments on this site about what is perceived to be a formal atmosphere in this venue with a formal ? off putting dress code. Don't be put off. The website states that the dress code is "smart casual". The Great Fosters venue is such a lovely building - I feel it warrants a smart appearance. We personally wouldn't wear jeans to this restaurant, and in the winter a jacket would look smart for men -but its not a requirement. Most men wore a smart -ish shirt and trousers on the night we were there. We've eaten in many other fine dining establishments and this was no different. We found the atmosphere and ambiance warm, relaxed and very comfortable and we liked the buzz as the room filled up.  The more we reflect on our visit the more we want to return.

title: Wonderful service, delicious food, beautiful setting
comment: I really cannot say enough good things about our visit to the Tudor Room today. We started with pre-lunch drinks in one of the garden rooms - delicious virgin cocktails were very refreshing on a very hot day. The Tudor room itself is small - max about 20 covers and there were only two other tables occupied when we were there for late afternoon lunch - however were sat far enough apart that conversation wasn’t overheard and we weren’t interrupting others. We started with a delicious amuse bouche of Parmesan crostini with sweet corn. This was followed by a lovely melon and Parma ham veloute palate cleanser - with lovely texture of juicy solid melon intermingling with the puréed melon. The set menu includes a choice of meat and fish starter and main. We had a pregnant lady in our party who didn’t eat fish so her choices were somewhat limited. However even she was won over by the explosion of flavours in the meat dishes. We had quail to start and perfectly pink lamb for main. My friend who had the fish was mightily impressed with the Thai style monkfish. Desert was a choice of strawberry shortbread, a Black Forest mouse or cheese board. The cheese board was incredibly impressive including five different cheeses arranged as a flight in strength order. My dilemma over choosing the strawberry or chocolate dessert was vindicated by the gorgeous juxtaposition of cherry and chocolate flavours. We finished with tea and coffee and petit fours. Due to a very slight delay in us being seated our ore dinner drinks were in the house. The service was attentive but not obtrusive and all servers were knowledgable about the food. It was very special to have the chef come tableside to finish each dish. We ended our exquisite afternoon by taking our coffee on the terrace overlooking to beautiful formal gardens. A lovely afternoon and couldn’t recommend highly enough.

title: You gotta try the tawa
comment: Every time I come I get The tawa and I never get bored of it. It is worth coming just for the tawa alone

title: quality of food and the venue
comment: excellent food,excellent service,friendly atmosphere beautiful interior with comfortable seating.strongly recommended

title: Amazing authentic food
comment: We had the tabs for 3, tons of food, with great variety and everything is very delicious. Would recommend for families and couples. The owners are very nice and threw in complimentary tea too.

title: Amazing twist on food presentation
comment: We went there during the day. The place was empty. But the welcome was still warm. The tawa twist with the food was a nice surprise ( see pic) you can have a meal for 2 presented on one big tawa.  The staff were very polite keeping inline with Afghan hospitality. They even offered us the whole meal for free, as it was our first time there. But we insisted on paying.  The food highlight was chapal kebab. These were very very tasty. All in all a good experience. Ps recommend having green tea while consuming food, you will get the feeling of being stuffed after the tawa, green reduces the bloatiness and helps with digestion. Afghans drink this stuff by the jug load, I know know why.

title: Amazing taste
comment: This place was very awesome good customer service food was amazing cooked with fresh flavours I would recommend this place for any kind of taste bud fresh flavours of Peshawar.

title: Brilliant
comment: Went a few days ago with the family for the first time...will definitely be a regular place now! Went after reading some good reviews, but they don't do it justice! Staff were friendly and attentive, the food was awesome! Fresh and tasty, I would go as far as to say it's one of the best restaurants I've been to for a while.

title: Good experience
comment: Very nice and excellent food with good service and amazing tests. Specially tawa and chapli kabab is the best

title: Excellent food and service
comment: Excellent food good service, nice and clean, excellent location with free parking in nearby streets, excellent prices for the level of service

title: "Quality food"
comment: After tasting the food I ordered i was amazed how Nice and Quality of the food was! The food is made fresh and the taste is gorgeous. If you are thinking of trying this place  I highly recommend it.

title: A delightful discovery.
comment: In Wembley for the first time, looking for something to eat beyond the normal restaurant chains, we discovered the Taste of Peshawar and we were so glad to have done so. The first impression is of very warm and hospitable service and this sense never fades. Despite the menu being pretty full, we opted to go for the tawa for 4 as none of us had eaten this before. Before long a large sharing plate of chicken, lamb, chappli kebab, fish, spinach, dhal and chips arrived and a plentiful supply of fresh naan breads kept being served throughout the meal. The mango lassi was also delicious and we had a speciality chai generously served to us at the end of the meal. Overall it was incredibly good value and I would recommend without hesitation that you come here if you're in the area; if you're not in the area then I recommend that you get yourself over here!

title: So Worthwhile
comment: We are staying on a stay and dine offer (through Buy a Gift) it’s a divine, Great Fosters is a special place as is the Tudor Room. The service is attentive but not stuffy and the ambience is cosy and special. On to the food, everything we ate was delicious, with marvellous fresh flavours with beautiful notes coming through. Favourite dish for me it was the Turbot, Artichoke, lemon grass coriander, for my partner was the lamb with sweetbread.

title: Fantastic Lunch
comment: Well, what a great lunch. Cannot fault it in anyway. The food was excellent along with the service. Tony came to the table to explain and add a personal touch. Brilliant. And to be honest at £45 per head a bargain.

title: Beautiful dining room
comment: I was taken there for lunch and it was very special. We had Dover Sole cooked perfectly. The building is very historic, quite close to Heathrow Airport, and a super place to stay for a special occasion.

title: Amazing and Tasty Mix of Grill and Curry
comment: Was recommended by family friend Place is very neat and clean food. Taste is unique and lovely with good presentation on Tawa (big flat pan) Finished with nice traditional green tea Will come again

title: Amazing fresh food
comment: Best chapli kebabs and biryani i have ever tater in my life absolutely amaing food polite staff clean atmosphere good for family and friends, highly recommend this restaurant, had a brilliant time

title: Delicious quality quick late lunch
comment: Friendly, polite and helpful owner and staff with neat premises. They went out of their way to satisfy our taste and food preferences. The Peshawar bryani and mutton curry smelt so good and was well presented - the food was really tasty and evrything to the special tea was simply amazing. This was my second very satisfactory experience of this restaurant and it comes highly recommended - and we are regular, picky visitors and reviewers of only good restaurants. Top rating to this establishment.

title: Shafraz mohamed
comment: Most amazing afghani cuisine. There was a great atmosphere and an amazing Tawa. This is a must GO!!trust me you will not regret it

title: Amazing Food !
comment: We had dinner in the Tudor Room and had the tasting menu. The food was amazing and the staff were very attentive making the whole experience very special. You will be expected to pay 10% gratuity service. It's quite pricey to eat in the Tudor Room but well worth it would highly recommend

title: Delicious
comment: Just had Tawa for 1 person. Had a hint of chilli but not too hot, hot enough to enjoy and taste the flavours of the food. The food is all freshly made along with the naan bread. They are very accommodating people who cook your food to your specification. The price wash also good and the food was excellent. Will be taking my sister next time as we are both foodies. Would definitely advise giving this little gem a try

title: Delicious food and great service
comment: Delicious food, food taste like from home very fresh All staff are lovely and friendly specially Mohammad Kadeem ( apologies if I spelt your name wrong) great customer service skills he even recomand speciality dishes too and gave us massive pot of Peshawari Khawa on the house.

title: Naam he kaafi hai
comment: Great staff. Food was amazing one of the best Pakistani restaurants I have been too.... The true taste of peshawer... I would highly recommend this restaurant... Tawaa and peshawari kebab are their speciality....amazing tawa the one we had....

title: A marvellous lunch with superlative service
comment: There were six of us, all nurses with 215 years of nursing between us. We had the most amazing meal, and Yanis ensured we were looked after like royalty. Our lunch menu was small and everyone agreed that every mouthful was delicious, many thanks to the chef. The hotel gardens are set into small areas and I imaging you could sit quietly without being aware of other guests. Very pretty. A return visit is a must.

title: Freshest kebabs ive ever had
comment: The freshest asain/middle eastern cuisine Ive ever had (probably freshest ever, period). I had a sheek and chapali kebab on different occaisions and both were amazingly fresh and yummy, they were made on the spot to order. I havent tried their mains yet but if the kebabs are anything to go by their mains surely wont dissapoint. I would go as far as saying its a must try because truly its a must try! Staff were friendly, polite and accommodating. Premises are clean, neat and tidy. What more could you ask for from this hidden little gem. Watch this space...

title: Amazing food and location
comment: Tudor rooms serves great food deserving of their Michelin star. The setting is in one of Henry VIII old hunting lodges. It seems to have maintained many of its original features, which makes eating there that little bit more special. The staff are nice and friendly too, I recommend a visit.

title: Fantastic birthday celebration
comment: Amazing dishes made from quality ingredients were as delicious as you would expect from a Michelin starred restaurant. Friendly, charming and well informed staff helped make this a wonderful occasion for the four of us. This great experience made for a fantastic evening.

title: Fab food
comment: Went for lunch to celebrate a birthday. My guest was vegetarian. She thoroughly enjoyed her meal and this was her first experience of a Michelin starred restaurant. She was not disappointed and neither was I. The food and service was excellent. The choice of wines were good. Although slightly pricey it was well worth the money. We arrive first and nearly left last, no rushing by staff who were all extremely welcoming and helpful. It was a birthday celebration and the staff kindly ensured my guest was given a special treat. I’m sure I will eat here again. Thank you

title: Excellent service
comment: Our business meeting taking place in the Tudor room. The attention was very nice. The food and service is good. I like the restaurant decoration, beautiful. Staff is very friendly too. We will be back next year again.

title: Wonderful
comment: Our 1st time eating in a Michelin star restaurant & it was mind blowing. The service was excellent. The food was amazing. Lost count of how many courses were served. This quality doesn't come cheap, but as it wAs a special occasion, it was worth it. Go on, treat yourself!

title: Chef's tasting menu
comment: This meal was not only elegant but the chef designed courses for an allergy so that we had slightly different preparations with similar character for wine pairings.

title: Easy 5 star (er, circle) review
comment: My wife and I had the full tasting menu dinner (with matching wines) here last week and it was a pretty flawless performance all around - the team in the dining room, the somm, and of course the food coming out of the kitchen. We've had a couple of uninspiring Michelin meals in the last few months, but The Tudor Room has renewed my faith. The wait staff were exceeding efficient, friendly and unstuffy - I know it can be a tough and thankless job at times, but they all appeared to really enjoy working here (that goes for everyone we met at the hotel). We've been lucky enough to visit loads of 1, 2 and even 3 star Michelin restaurants and for me service doesn't really get much better than what we experienced here. The sommelier was great and really informative and enthusiastic about the wines he served. He even very nicely agreed to write down all the wines we had on the back of a menu so I could take it with me. And finally, the food was perfection itself. It was a kind of hybrid tasting menu where some of the smaller dishes were set, but unlike most Michelin tasting menu's, you still got a choice from three different options each for the 'starter', 'main', and 'dessert'. This was a nice touch and ensured we both got something we really liked, which on occasion doesn't happen with set tasting menus.  Every dish was full of flavour and perfectly cooked (and not overly salty, which we find so often). I'm guessing the chef was classically trained as the dishes weren't too wacky - they were basically tried and true flavour pairings, which is perfectly fine when everything is done to perfection like these dishes were. Well done chef! Sadly, I heard the chef was going to be leaving the restaurant soon. I'll have to keep track of where he goes next and I hope Great Fosters replaces him with somebody as good - a tall order I think.

title: Fine food but a bit soulless
comment: Went for a birthday meal with my wife. Had tried 9 months back for a special occasion but had to cancel last minute so was really looking forward For those of you used to a meet and greet at a Michelin star restaurant think again. We walked into main reception. Took our coats and told that someone from the restaurant would be with us soon. We waited a couple of minutes. Then asked if we could go to the bar and they called bar manager. Apparently was full so they said we could have a drink in the reception. Said no thanks. Then went to look around and eventually someone came from the restaurant....maybe 10 minutes had passed Shown into the restaurant (which was literally 5 metres from where we were waiting. It’s a single room (large living room) with kitchen off it. Tables vary in size and we had one for 4 people. Lacked any atmosphere...one of those places where have to speak in low voice and as room empties you can happily eavesdrop with no issue The service was ok....a bit over casual (crouching down beside the table...when there was zero noise) Food came at a rapid pace until desserts when the brakes came on and it was and hour to get through these Food was fine. Clearly very inventive but nothing that says “wow” or truly memorable. I have eaten many better meals of this style for way less than 95 a head  Disappointing

title: Perfection Plus!
comment: Had not been here for while, and this was our first evening meal at this lovely restaurant. Tasting menu with choices.........brilliant idea! There were 6 of us celebrating a special birthday. We sampled a bit of everything, with discreet (or not) sharing, each dish was sublime. One of our party is vegetarian, and she reckoned that this was the best vegetarian tasting menu that she had ever tasted.  For some of us , the highlight was the simply named "Langoustine Tea"......just a lovely langoustine, with a broth poured over it from a small individual "tea-pot". Absolute Heaven!! Would give anything for the recipe for the broth.......I could detect ginger, lemon grass, hint of chilli.......but what else?  Desserts out of this world. Service 200%, best birthday present I have ever had, better than many other Michelin-starred restaurants. A wonderful evening.

title: Perfect meal for a special occasion!
comment: Booked at the last minute for a birthday lunch for two, having read the great reviews online. Our experience was faultless, from the service to the wonderful atmospheric room, to the sublime food and delicious wine. We were very sad to hear that the chef was soon to leave (partly because he was going so soon that we didn't have time to squeeze in another visit!), and very much hope that this does not result in negative changes for the restaurant. I would honestly not change a thing about our experience!

title: Delicious Dinner and Excellent Service
comment: I rated the Tudor Room 5 following our last dinner there almost 3 years ago. On our most recent visit, the meal itself was exceptional, and every bit as delicious as before (inventive dishes, beautifully prepared and presented, complemented by the suggested wine choices) and service was extremely professional, knowledgeable and friendly. However, the room itself seemed overly crowded - whether more diners are now being accommodated or it just wasn't as full on our earlier visit I'm not sure. The result, though, was that everyone talked in such hushed tones to avoid being overheard by adjacent tables that the whole atmosphere seemed a little subdued for enjoying such delicious food. A small point, but on visiting the ladies' room, the hand towels had run out and there was no other means of drying one's hands - unacceptable in an establishment of this calibre (and price). Overall, though, a lovely dinner.

title: Very pleasant...
comment: Four and a half stars. We visited the restaurant on a Saturday evening, and very enjoyable it was... 1. The food was excellent 2. Nice ambience in a lovely room 3. Very good service by three different people 4. The tables are perhaps a little bit too close to one another. You can't help but eavesdrop on your neighbour. 5. Having ordered the Wine Flight to accompany my meal, I was a little disappointed to learn that the sommelier had the night off (On a Saturday ?!) 6. The Dress Code, which doesn't allow smart jeans, is a bit over the top All in all...definitely worth a visit.

title: A very enjoyable experience
comment: We visited for lunch. The Tudor Room provided a warm and fairly intimate, in a good way, dining space. We were served a nice amuse bouche followed by a cold soup. With a choice of two items for each course (rather than three as shown on the website sample menu) we then had a monkfish starter followed by turbot for main course, then chocolate mousse for dessert. This sounds ordinary on paper but the dishes were imaginatively presented and very tasty. Portions, in particular the main course, are on the small side but there is some excellent bread and butter. You can have cheese and all the trimmings - looked very good - instead of the dessert or pay a substantial sum to have this as an extra course. Coffee and petit fours are extra. We received prompt attention at reception with our coats taken and being ushered without delay to the restaurant where service was all the things it should be - pleasant, attentive, helpful and timely.  All the savoury courses were flavoursome and not overly salted like so many “chefs” seem to do to “bring out the flavour” whilst giving customers heart and kidney failure, through increasing blood pressure, as well as an unwelcome thirst. Wines by the glass seem very expensive. We had a half bottle, quite pricey, but very enjoyable.  We have dined at a few one star Michelin restaurants in Surrey recently and feel that this restaurant was better than the others on the three aspects of food, service and atmosphere. Congratulations to all concerned.

title: 10th Wedding Anniversary
comment: Amazing in every way, the front of house team were fantastic and the food sublime, many thanks for making the evening so memorable.

title: 30th Birthday Celebration
comment: We went to celebrate my partner's 30th birthday, and had a great time! I told them before hand that I was intolerant to onions and bell peppers, and they took special care for all of my food. We went for the 3 course weekday lunch menu. The food itself was absolutely delicious, and the service was outstanding. We also went for a walk in the grounds afterwards, and it was really quite beautiful. Highly recommended!

title: Good-to-average food, beware of dress code
comment: Went to the Tudor Room for lunch in early October with great expectations as it was based on a recommendation. Sadly the experience was ruined within the first few minutes when we were bluntly told at reception that they have a strict formal dress code - which was mentioned neither in the website, over the phone when making our reservation, or in the reservation confirmation email. We were then left in the lobby of the Great Fosters waiting for the restaurant manager, feeling like naughty schoolchildren awaiting our punishment. He invited us in to dine with them anyway, we apologised for not having known beforehand, and I suggested it would be helpful to have this mentioned on the website to avoid others making the same mistake - only to be told rather condescendingly that "well, we are a one Michelin star restaurant...". I'm sorry, but we've been to several other one- and two-starred restaurants who have been more than happy to welcome us and other patrons in smart casual, which is how we were dressed that day. I don't think he meant any harm by it, but that careless comment absolutely spoiled the afternoon for us, leaving my wife petrified of committing another faux pas and unable to relax. We should have turned and left at that point, but carried through regardless, only to find that... The food was decent, but nothing spectacular - I did enjoy my dessert, but the starter and mains were good but forgettable. The initial experience put a massive damper on the whole afternoon. To be fair, our waiter and waitress were lovely and warm, everything you would expect from a fine dining establishment, and they were truly let down by that one unguarded comment and lack of upfront information. I have no problem if a restaurant wishes to enforce a dress code and am happy to conform - I can totally understand that it changes the atmosphere of a dining room, and often for the better. But if you wish to do so, I think it would only be courteous to advise your customers up front (in my case, there were three missed opportunities to do so), and not make them feel like idiots, especially in this day and age where a Michelin star can be awarded not just to white linen restaurants, but to hawker stalls in busy food courts and pubs where casual dress is the norm rather than the exception.  Needless to say - we will not be returning.

title: Amazing gourmet experience
comment: Another absolutely wonderful evening with exquisite food and wonderful service. The presentation of each course was stunning.Will definitely return.Could not fault anything. We invited 4 friends & they loved it as much as we did. Nice relaxed atmosphere with friendly staff.

title: Absolutely Amazing!
comment: We visited the Tudor Room for my husbands birthday celebration and it was just amazing! From the service to the taste of the food to the atmosphere. The food tasted like pure heaven and I ate a lot of things I wouldn't normally and absolutely loved it all. All the staff there were so friendly and funny too. Thank you so much to everyone there for this amazing experience. I cannot wait to go back!

title: Amazing!
comment: We have eaten in a lot of fine dining restaurants around the world but never in England. Our first time was at Tudor Room and it was superb. Food was outstanding and the service impeccable. Can’t wait to return.

title: 5* Service for a 5* Restaurant
comment: Six of us visited here in November for a celebratory evening, the whole experience was first class.Great Fosters is a beautiful building anyway and have been here for afternoon tea so knew the hotel. The taster menu was exquisite and better than expected, I had the veggie taster menu and I can promise you meat eaters it was amazing , the other five guests chose the meat and fish option. The service from the sommelier and the waiting team and the manager was first class, not at all rushed and not at all stuffy, we had a very relaxed evening. Worth booking for months ahead and worth every penny, yes it’s not cheap but you get what you pay for. Can’t wait to return.

title: A Christmas treat!
comment: The restaurant itself is beautiful and the layout of the tables really gives it that sense of being the only diners in the room. I opted for the traditional Christmas dinner which was cooked to perfection but the highlight for me was the Christmas pudding! What really topped the whole experience off where the staff who where amazing.

title: Practically perfect
comment: This meal was the highlight of Christmas; we were welcomed in the entrance hall and shown to our table in a beautiful room which holds no more than 40. The 7 course menu was explained and we were given time to choose. Three different canapés arrived- all delicious - freshly made bread with differing butters and then a mini bowl of broth.
