My starter was scallops but the pigeon looked superb too. Of the main course choices the best was probably venison but the dish of lamb cooked 4 ways was almost as good. The deserts were incredible with a perfect looking apple containing a light bavarois with a blackberry centre - so clever. We had a really wonderful evening with amazing attention to detail. Just about perfect

title: Thought-provoking and divine dinner in the Tudor Room
comment: We have just returned from dinner in the Tudor Rooman and anovernight stay at Great Fosters The service in the Tudor Room was exemplary, and the food sensational. There were so many surprising flavours in each course that selecting one that stands above the rest is pretty impossible. If you enjoy the experience of food that makes you think; and travels a road somewhat off the traditional, you won’t be disappointed. My gluten free requirements were beautifully catered for: even specially made gluten free rolls and canapés: something that not every chef bothers about. It is surprising how many top quality restaurants fail to cater for people with food sensitivities properly. It was really nice to be able to have the complete experience: we shall definitely be returning.

title: AMAZING!!
comment: What can I say, a stunning experience. The food was very tasty, loved every course. The staff were very friendly and attentive.  Shame it had to end We will be returning very soon.  Would highly recommend

title: A very special Anniversary Dinner
comment: My husband and I celebrated our Wedding Anniversary and could mot have picked a more perfect venue. From the moment we arrived, we felt valued and looked after. We had the tasting menu comprised of many and varied dishes. Each one was carefully explained to us and my menu had been tailored to my severe allergy. Each dish was a work of art and tasted absolutely delicious. We were invited to ask questions too which was really helpful. For mains, my husband had the pork which he said had been the best he had ever tasted. For myself, the turbot, which just melted in my mouth. My husband doesn’t drink, but I indulged in a glass of Reisling suggested by the wine waiter. Just perfect. The service was just perfect. Just long enough between courses to have time to discuss and enjoy and efficient without being obtrusive. Altogether a wonderful evening out and one we hope very much to repeat.

title: Super restaurant and staff
comment: The Tudor Room deserves its’ star! This is a very talented chef! Super menu, food and matching wines. The staff are helpful, informative and not pretentious. Had a very enjoyable evening in a relaxed environment with superb food ( my husband and I enjoyed the bream, squab, lamb, pork and cheese). The sommelier deserves a special mention as his wine matching is innovative and very good. Would definitely go back and would highly recommend.

title: Simply exquisite
comment: Loved the food and attentive service. Great suggestions of wine by the sommelier. Knowledgeable staff. Hopefully you should be getting 2 Michelin . Well done.

title: I would Score this place with 10 out of 5
comment: A lunch in this wonderful venue is not to be missed. The environment is delightful in this beautifully preserved ancient Manor House (part of Great Fosters Hotel), the service is perfect - attentive, friendly but not over-powering and the food is excellent.

title: Out of this world!!!
comment: This is a dining experience on a different level. The intimacy of the room. The welcome, the service, the food, the drinks are outstanding. The presentation, the depth of knowledge of the waiting staff, the stunning flavours sensational. out of this world. Special treat for a big birthday and a wedding anniversary.

title: Lunch treat
comment: Was bought a voucher for my birthday and couldn’t wait to use it. The room is small but beautiful, the service is attentive but not over bearing but the food!  From the canapés in the bar to the blue mountain coffee to finish every dish was balanced, thought out and perfect presented. The highlight of the meal for me was lamb main, different cuts for lamb treated differently to create contrasting textures and flavours. Can’t wait to return

title: Superb!
comment: The dining room is very beautiful and the staff were warm, welcoming, friendly and efficient, without any hint of either superiority or obsequiousness. Food is exquisite and wonderfully subtle, leaving those superb tastes and flavour bursts after consumption. A most interesting amuse bouche preceded the lunching experience. Our pigeon starter was marvellous, complemented by a sharp, yet sweet jus. The halibut main was perfectly cooked and again, exhibited a subtlety of flavour which lingered on the palate. My chocolate dessert was.....sublime. My friend opted for cheese and she was very impressed by the well-kept and extremely interesting selection. Our meal was beautifully accompanied by a quite delicious Chablis which was sharp, clear and fresh.  Lingering over our tea and petit fours, it was delightful to chat to a super waiter and to the charming and highly knowledgeable restaurant manager, both of whom exhibited a tremendous pride in The Tudor Room and everything it stands for. This really is an excellent place to lunch or dine and it fully deserves its Michelin star and probably deserves two. Without a doubt, I shall return!

title: Special treat
comment: Visited for a birthday treat and had a really good time. Great service from the moment you enter. Canapés and drinks in the bar, followed by dinner in the Tudor Room. We opted for a vegetarian menu and had a lovely selection of some unique and other adapted dishes. Personally the puddings were the stars of the show and I would highly recommend the chocolate signature dish. Many thanks to the whole team.

title: 60th Birthday Celebration
comment: Six of us went to The Tudor Room for my 60th Birthday. It was FANTASTIC. The food looked like a piece of art work and it tasted just as good (if not better) than it looked. The service was EXCELLENT, no food left on any of the plates (6 courses) I guess that in it’s self speaks volumes. Can’t recommend this place enough...SUPERB . Not a cheap restaurant when you add drink etc onto the bill..WELL, WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY!! Highly recommend.  *****

title: Book Tudor, get Grill!
comment: Called specifically to book a table for Tudor Room for our wedding anniversary. Not at all pleased to find out Tudor Room is closed for the entire week and find out when we arrive at Great Fosters. We were instead reserved in for Estate Grill. If I was told on phone that the restaurant is closed, I would have booked somewhere else for this special occasion. You can do better that this, Great Fosters.

title: What a Great Start to our Weekend of Golden Wedding Celebrations
comment: My wife and I dined, with our two daughters and their husbands, on Friday Evening as the start of a weekend of Golden Wedding Celebrations. We are very lucky to live locally to Great Fosters and so have be many times before to both restaurants and for various other functions. As usual we were not disappointed. Food incredible. Atmosphere Wonderful. Service impeccable. Staff absolutely lovely knowing exactly the right level for each table around the room. For us that meant some joking and lots of laughs, all at a very sensible level so as not to annoy other patrons. It all made for a Fabulous Evening. Thank you Istvan, Duggie and your teams. P.S. congratulations on the first M.Star. Long overdue. At last the inspectors have had the scales removed from their eyes. Surely the second one must follow soon. We will be back again,( and again and again). Cliff and Janet Want

title: Exceptional From Start To Finish
comment: We notified the restaurant of our dietary requirements in advance (Pescatarian/Veggie) and upon arrival they presented us with a tailor made menu (Photo attached) As we were the first table of the day; we were seated first in the bar area which had great views of the grounds. Canapes were served of which the highlight was a Betroot Macaroon which was mind blowing!  Pre Starter was 10/10 Kohlrabi with an Olive Oil Ice Cream All of my dishes were much to my liking having dined in over a dozen Michelin Star establishments (Tudor Room is way up there with the likes of Gidleigh Park which has held a star longer and the setting is just as nice but closer to home) The manager, sommelier and waiting staff are all a credit to the restaurant and were attentive and very knowledgeable.There was also no sense pertinaciousness about them which you sometimes find in fine dining. A truly wonderful lunch worthy of every star and pound. Will be visiting again. Thank you to the team at Tudor Room! (Most thanks to the chef!!!)

title: Perfect Lunch
comment: Visited the Tudor Room for the first time with my wife in March 2018 for her birthday lunch. Verdict? Must go again soon. The food (flavours and presentation), pampering service, menus and wine advice, overall attention to detail and decor were perfect. Excellent value for money for a Michelin star restaurant. If you go you will not be disappointed. My only reservation in giving this restaurant such a glowing review is that it will probably make it harder for me to get a table next time.

title: Absolutely the best meal I have eaten - ever. Superb.
comment: Absolutely delicious meal, every mouthful bursting with flavour, exploding the taste buds. I cannot describe how fantastic it was. Lovely atmosphere too and great service. Wonderful selection of wines & great recommendations by the sommelier. It was a relaxed atmosphere, yet still great, professional service. ( We have been to quite a few michelin star restaurants, a couple of which we found to be a bit 'stuffy'). Great that it is only about 20 covers too, so quite intimate. Did I mention its the best meal we have eaten - ever. The head chef and his team must get a mention too for outstanding flavours and presentation of the food. Also cater for any dietary needs. I do not eat red meat so things were swapped about accordingly & they made me a fantastic vegetarian dish for my main course, on the spot as I did not fancy the fish meal. Very accommodating and all without a fuss.  Will definitely be returning. Cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough.  Also thought the pricing was very reasonable. £70 for an absolutely delicious 7 course michelin star dinner.

title: Brilliant in every sense ...
comment: Fabulous setting within a very grand estate. Fantastic food, service and ambiance. We visited to celebrate a business success. Each and every course were expertly executed - both visually and in terms of taste. There was the fluidness in the design of the menu - all supported by expertly recommended wine choices which complimented and enhanced the food. Do take the "Flight of wine" as the sommelier recommended very good wines to go with each dish.  This will be our first choice for other future special occasions.

title: Wonderful food, delightful service
comment: We went to the Tudor rooms with good friends who had been there before. I can honestly say that this was the best meal I have eaten for a long long time. We had the taster menu, every dish memorable. Attention to detail, flavours of each dish, appearance of the food, wonderful service, wine excellent. Throughly deserving of a Michelin star - Thankyou for a such a memorable evening.

title: Wonderful food, wonderful service
comment: We had a brilliant time at the Tudor Room. I requested (in advance) a vegetarian meal and no goat products because of an allergy and they made special arrangements, and I had a wonderful meal. All the food was delicious, imaginative and beautifully presented.  The service was excellent; the Maitre d' was hilarious, and restaurant staff were extremely friendly and made our visit very enjoyable and a lot of fun. I would highly recommend it to others.

title: The best lunch in Surrey
comment: This was my third visit to the Tudor Room at the fabulous Great Fosters; my first for lunch. From meeting and chatting with Istvan, the charismatic Hungarian manager in the bar, through to dessert, the experience was sensational. It can only be a matter of time before a second Michelin star is added. For £34 (including £10% discount for membership), you will have the best four course lunch in Surrey in one of the most beautiful locations. You will be assisted in your choice of wine by the very best sommelier - who even remembered the wine I chose on my last visit several months earlier! My choices for lunch were canapé, scallops, pork and the cheese selection (selected by Istvan), with a fabulous glass of sharp yet not too dry Vouvray. All exceptional. Make no mistake, this is Waterside Inn style fayre in a more relaxed setting. Highly recommended!

title: Oh so relaxed
comment: It was for lunch. The staff were wonderful, the food glorious. This was our second visit and it didn’t disappoint. Such wonderful surroundings, beautiful gardens.

title: Lovely intimate restaurant
comment: Lovely intimate restaurant the like of which we'd not experienced before. Fabulous value set lunch with lots of interesting ingredients and flavour combinations - terrific standard. My husband had the wine flight and was impressed with the knowledge shown of not only the individual wines but the finer details of what the courses contained. Staff were all very charming with the right level of attention without being too hovering! Would definitely recommend and visit again.

title: Perfect birthday celebration
comment: Lovely intimate dining room with great service and wonderful food. Restaurant manager read our group well and responded accordingly with right amount of humour etc. Sommelier very helpful with choice of wine too. Thanks for the champagne too ( 3 birthday celebrations being celebrated). That was a nice touch at the end of the meal. Would highly recommend for a special occasion.

title: Birthday Dinner
comment: I've been fortunate to have eaten in a number of Michelle star restaurants from 1 to 3 star and in my humble opinion this is an excellent 1 star Michelle star! There are only 7 tables in the restaurant so book well in advance. As you'd expect the food is amazing. What is also noticeable is the wonderful staff. They are friendly and made the dinning experience even more pleasurable  Well worth a visit if your starting in the hotel

title: Excellent!
comment: Great food and great service. I am a vegetarian and had some of the most amazing dishes. Will definitely return!

title: Wonderful experience
comment: This was such a nice experience...intimate and beautiful room, friendly and attentive staff, and amazing food! As a vegetarian, I was especially delighted with such a creative and delicious vegetarian menu. Can't recommend this restaurant enough.

title: Beautiful building and food
comment: The food served was excellent. I've recently been to the Waterside and felt I had a far better time here than there, and they have 3 stars! Service was also excellent. I have already recommended this restaurant to many of my friends and am very much looking forward to returning again soon.

title: Excellent evening-I can vouch for it!
comment: The family of a late friend whose estate I administered gave me a voucher for a meal in the Tudor Restaurant. Last Thursday I decided to use the voucher and take my wife for a meal. I booked a table for that evening. I have been to Great Fosters many times for civic and other functions but not to the Tudor Room. This is a beautiful venue with stacks of history. We were greeted outside and shown to reception. We took a seat in the entrance hall until a waiter showed us into the lounge for a pre-dinner prosecco. One of the best we have tasted. The attention continued with canapes that were delicious. Our order was taken. There is a 6 course tasting menu with choices on the starter and main course and the dessert. We were shown to our table by the maitre dee. The restaurant is staffed mainly by eastern Europeans and they gave us superb, friendly and helpful service all evening. The semellier was helpful although we only wanted one glass of wine each. It was an excellent merlot. We cannot fault the food or the service. The room has only 20 or so covers so it is warm and intimate.  We would recommend this for a special occasion with the meal at £65 per head plus discretionary service at 12.5% plus wines although not cheap good value for money.  Our voucher covered the meal cost and we were only presented with a bill for the drinks. Interestingly service charge is only added to the drinks bill which seems unfair so we were so impressed we added extra. We would certainly go there again with or without a voucher! Just two minus points, the poor lighting from the car park and the need for an additional cushion on the bench seat I sat on.

title: Private dining for 10 people
comment: This 7 course meal had attentive staff, great food however the dishes were Unique and tastes. However a tad small as I was still hungry by end of the night.

title: Birthday visit
comment: We have visited the restaurant on at least three separate occasions. In my opinion this is the nicest restaurant in Surrey. The wine waiter is simply amazing and he adds so much to the overall experience.

title: Charming, warm, intimate and hits the spot.
comment: This is possibly the best places I have dined in. The attention to detail here was impeccable. I eat halal only and they researched and catered for my dietary needs to the fullest. From the small door entrance, to the living room welcome into the private Tudor Room with its secret door, this is an exceptional place to be in.  My favourite people here are the wonderful witty staff. They are attentive and courteous, very warm and take great pride in the food they serve. They can certainly ensure the guests they’re hosting don’t have a single dull moment! They add Michelin service to the delightful food. The food was fine, exceptional flavours complimenting one another.

title: Wonderful experience
comment: The service, food and presentation was exemplary. Some of the courses were incredibly complex and interesting. We had a superb time.  One of the best meals and experiences we have had. Just watch the 'strong' goats cheese Exactly as described and very high quality. Just a bit much after the rich meal.

title: Spoilt by the bean-counters
comment: Although I can't fault the food, having eaten here 5-6 times since 2013, we now feel the service and ambience have been spoilt by the bean-counters. For instance this restaurant used to have a sommelier, who would choose the flight of wines dependant on one's taste in wine (full, flinty, fruity etc). One really felt engaged with and given to - helped by a sometimes generous glass of a wine he was particularly keen to share - as well as educated and entertained by his stories of visiting the various vineyards. Now there is no sommelier and only one set wine for each course of the flight and each glass is scant and parsimonious. Our server could tell us a sentence or two about some of the wines (as might anyone who could rote learn), but the richness of the experience has gone.  My partner generally has the cheese instead of dessert and although the choice and keeping of the cheese is good, the amount of accompaniments now feels niggardly and no one asked if he wanted more bread or crisp breads. On previous occasions more bread and butter has been freely offered. Also on other occasions we have come away with a little cardboard box of leftover petit fours, but this time, our tea came with just two tiny ones each on an amuse bouche tray,  Other staffing levels seem to have been cut back. For instance on arrival, no one greeted us. The receptionist was on the phone and it wasn't until I wondered aloud, if we should just proceed to the Tudor Room unaccompanied that a second receptionist literally popped up from behind the desk and asked us about our reservation. He then spent several minutes peering at a print out trying to locate my partner's name. (At another Michelin-starred restaurant that we frequent, we are greeted at the door and the greeter seems to be expecting us.) Housekeeping also appears to have suffered cuts, with no hand towels in The Ladies when I visited.  Strangely on booking we were asked it the meal was for a particular occasion and my partner said his birthday, but no one mentioned this at all during our visit. If the question is merely being asked for market research purposes, then it would be better to ask this after the event rather than raise expectations in clients that something might come of being asked it. The food was delicious, with special mention going to the most delicious turbot that either of us have tasted and also to a interesting cauliflower cheese amuse bouche, lifted by a slight chili back-note.  However we missed the feeling of being treated generously and greeted warmly that we have had on previous occasions when dining here and, as this is an important part of the experience to us, we may not return again.

title: The highlight of our stay.
comment: Having stayed at the property before many years ago we booked a special package for D,B&B for my husbands Birthday & Our Anniversary. The Tudor room wasn’t available previously and as we’re keen foodies we really wanted to give this place a try. The whole experience was wonderful, we started in the bar with G&T’s and were escorted through to the beautiful room, where thankfully the decoration has not been modernised like other parts of the hotel. The menu is a seven course taster menu where you get an option on a number of courses and we were very happy with the choices (sometimes with taster menus this is not the case). What is good is that the restaurant offers ½ bottles of wine which as I only drink White and my Husband loves Red meant we could each indulge without worrying about having to finish the whole bottle. Not once did we have to fill up our own glasses and our water glasses were topped up continually throughout the evening. Each dish was explained as it was presented to us, the service and food was exceptional. The highlight of our stay.

title: Almost perfect
comment: Had a very good lunch, excellent ingredients some flavours delicious. Was good to see the chef bringing some of the dishes to the table and explains the ingredients, food was mostly perfect just a small issue with one of the dishes but overall excellent experience

title: Birthday Meal
comment: We visited for my husbands birthday. Istvan and his team were wonderful and we enjoyed first class service from start to finish. The Tudor Room has so much character and we were given a perfect table next to the fire place. We went for the tasting menu which was adapted to suit our pescatarian meal requirements. The food was superlative! We finished with a fantastic selection of ten cheeses and truffle honey which was to die for. Overall it was a fantastic experience ! We will definitely return to the Tudor Room and would thoroughly recommend it for any occasion.

title: Excellent food, and fantastic value
comment: Visited for my birthday, and wasn't disappointed. The staff are excellent, and we were welcomed by the manager and waiting staff. Couldn't fault the food as everything was outstanding. Highly recommend for lunch, and we will hopefully be back to try the dinner option.

title: Relaxing weekend
comment: Lovely room staff superb ,a joy to eat in .breakfast was made to the great standard I would expect from a top hotel the staff were incredibly curtious and friendly .

title: Well worth a visit
comment: Excellent attention to detail from all staff. They were very knowledgeable on the food and wine and very friendly. We had a fantastic evening, thank you to all concerned.

title: By far the best restaurant in Surrey - where flavours are adventurous and taste exquisite
comment: I have been visiting this restaurant for five years now. At first it was a quiet hidden gem, with few customers but excellent cooking. Now, with a change in management team and Michelin star under its belt, it is much harder to get a table but it is so worth it. The menu is fairly priced, service is excellent but most of all the food is consistently outstanding. This is a place where flavour rules not gimmicks. You do not come away feeling like a guinea pig for a star climbing chef desperately experimenting with obscure flavours in hope to be proclaimed the next Heston Blumenthal (Sorrel, Story, apologies, rant over!), may of which just do not work. No here, you come away with a warm, gooey feeling inside, slightly full and bursting with compliments. I am going to stop now, as I don't really want you to go as i'd like to keep this place all to myself but sometimes in life there is talent that deserves shouting about - this is it. Well done to all involved.

title: An absolute gem
comment: Recently went for lunch and was impressed by the impeccable service. The staff were attentive, knowledgeable and charming. The food was everything and more than one would expect of a restaurant with a Michelin star. More importantly to my party, it was good food, perfectly cooked with exquisite presentation without the pretensions one is now so frequently finding elsewhere. The wine flight was excellent value and introduced us to new, high quality and enjoyable wines. Make sure you take time to look round the rest of the wonderful Elizabethan manor house and gardens.

title: Christmas in February
comment: This was my second visit to the Tudor Room. The occasion was a Christmas present for some very dear friends. We all greatly enjoyed the experience and were expertly looked after from being greeted at the door of the hotel to having our coats fetched for us after the meal. The food was delicious. For me the dish that stood out was the rhubarb with gingerbread and panna cotta. The service was excellent-good humoured, friendly and helpful. I look forward to finding a reason for yet another visit!

title: Fantastic!
comment: Absolutely fantastic ! Is really a room where you get lost in a fantastic food and with Excellent service ...  I am in love with this place :)

title: Lovely experience
comment: I have not anything to say. Just that was a lovely sensorial experience between the harmonius of the food and the amazing wines. The team is brilliant, autentic all of them and the chef is lovely. I will be back soon.

title: What a gem.
comment: I think that this is the first time in over one hundred postings that I have given five stars. The Tudor Room at Great Fosters is one of the finest establishments we have ever visited and that includes several Michelin starred places. The building is amazing, the food is sublime and the professionalism of the staff was impressive. OK,the drinks are a bit pricey,but for value, the set lunch is unbeatable-at £35.00 this is no more than I would pay at my local gastro pub. Having travelled far and wide in search of fine dining we find that one of the best is on our doorstep as we only live five miles away. We shall certainly return.

title: Gourmet Dinner with wines to suit each course
comment: Fab. A bit pricey but well worth it, if you want to be spoilt. Need to book as restaurant is small and intimate set in a Tudor room dating back to King Henry VIII.

title: Celebratory lunch
comment: We were looking for something special to celebrate a family event and we certainly found it at the Tudor Room. Intimate setting and brilliantly attentive service. We had certain dietary requirements which were comprehensively met by the chef. Food was excellent and beautifully presented. No hesitation in recommending Istvan and his team.

title: Amazing meal
comment: I have been a vegetarian for over 20 years and NEVER before have I eaten such visually beautiful, flavoursome food. Chef created the menu specially for my dietary requirements and each of the multiple courses was new and exciting for me. Istvan explained clearly and with gentle humour each dish as it was presented. The service was first class and the atmosphere intimate. I cannot recommend The Tudor Room highly enough and can only thank them for a wonderful evening.

title: Christmas Eve dining experience
comment: We booked The 8 course wine pairing Christmas Eve dinner. As usual we were not disappointed, the food was amazing and the wine chosen to pair with each course had been carefully considered. The evening was a great culinary experience with my wife and I continually being surprised and delighted with each course. red wine with fish - surely not! But it works ! Sherry in the middle of the evening rather than at the end were some of the interesting things we learnt and liked. The attention to detail and the service is always top notch so I would like to thank those at the Tudor room and the Great Fosters hotel for getting us in the mood for Christmas period.

title: Amazing place
comment: This is my third visit and this time I took my mum for her birthday. Amazing stay, amazing service and decor perfectly kept in keeping with the style of hotel. We dined in the tudor which was perfect.

title: A beautiful wedding meal and entertainment
comment: The whole estate is one amazing historical experience, evening walks in the ground s, are highly recommended,

title: Fantastic!
comment: Everything you could ask for from a Michelin restaurant , the food was amazing, serving staff were very lovely informative and had a good sense of humour which made the evening just that more enjoyable. Would definitely come back!

title: Enjoyable lunch
comment: This is my second visit to the Tudor Room for lunch and it didn’t disappoint. Staff are welcoming and friendly but not overly so. We were seated straight away and the manager introduced himself and checked our dietary requirements.  I won’t go into the ins and outs of the meal and service as it doesn’t need scrutinising. The food was good and the pairing wines were spot on. It’s a relaxed atmosphere, but please keep up a smart dress code. The cheese board is lovely with some tasty accompaniments. Happy to take questions about it all.

title: Anniversary lunch to remember
comment: What fantastic service! We were lucky enough to have a delightful meal prepared to an exceptional standard. We couldn't have felt more important. The manager, Istavan, bent over backwards to accommodate the very specific dietary requirements of my wife. He double and triple checked that these were okay but in a way that wasn't the least bit overbearing. All the staff were amiable, personable and professional. As a result the service fantastic and personalised and we would definitely recommend it here. One of the best meals and experiences we have had! We cannot thank the staff and chef enough for making our anniversary so special. Worth every single penny!

title: Relaxed lunch
comment: The lovely thing about lunch here is not just the excellent cooking but the relaxed atmosphere created by the staff. We couldn't fault anything except perhaps the hike in prices on the wine list from the last time we were here. Better than many other Michelin star restaurants we've eaten at.

title: Birthday treat
comment: This was our first visit to the Tudor Room since the chef gained his Michelin Star and we were delighted with the service and an exemplary meal. Every course was stunning, in its presentation and taste.  The Sommelier asked us about our preferred tastes in wine to help him make a suitable recommendation and then went "off-list" and found a bottle in the cellar which was reasonably priced. Overall a faultless experience and great value for money. The petti fours even came on a Happy Birthday slate which was a very nice finishing touch.

title: An ideal setting for a birthday lunch.
comment: We were welcomed at the door of the hotel and taken to the Tudor Room, which was very comfortable, although the Birthday Boy was directed to a rather low sofa, not a dining chair. He said he was fine! The waiting staff explained the menu. Notice had been taken of my sea-food allergy. After a glass of champagne we were more than ready for lunch. Each course was carefully explained. The food was delicious and the service most attentive, with friendly humorous touches. We welcomed help with the choice of wine. What the birthday boy could not eat at the time from the plate of petits fours was attractively boxed up for him to take away.

title: Wedding Meal at the Tudor Room
comment: From the initial booking the service was first class and delivered with style and humour. The food was absolutely fantastic and exceeded our expectations! I would have no hesitation in recommending the Tudor Room as it was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had.

title: Just a fabulous meal - try it
comment: Last night we enjoyed the Tasting Menu in the Tudor Room of Great Fosters. It was 6 courses for just £65 each which was excellent value. We treated ourselves to the wine that accompanied each of those courses which was £70 each ( presented beautifully by the house sommelier ) but don't worry as you could easily enjoy a reasonably priced bottle of wine. OK not cheap in total but if its a treat or you can do it, go for it. I also enjoyed the service which was fun.  There are 6 courses but none are huge so don't worry about over facing yourself particularly. Also good was a choice on courses 3 (main) & 5 (pud) which is unusual on a tasting menu. We chose different options and our wine varied with our choices. We found the restaurant on Trip advisor when looking for something nice after racing at Kempton. Try it - it was just fabulous!  p.s. watch your head on entry - there's one low door

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Really spoilt with all the lovely sandwiches and cakes Victoria cake, macaroons etc so many to choose from

title: A perfect anniversary lunch
comment: My wife and I had lunch here today to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We had got married at Great Fosters 8 years ago so it was fantastic to return. We had a fabulous afternoon, from the moment we arrived to time we left we were treated really well, all the staff were outstanding. The dining room is small and only seats a maximum of 20, but it’s stunning and full of character and the atmosphere was great. The food was excellent, we enjoyed absolutely everything we ate, nothing was left on any of our plates. As my wife is vegetarian the chef designed her, her own menu which she really enjoyed. My wife loved the parmesan canapés and I thought the pork dish was incredible. It was a perfect afternoon, we can’t fault anything, the food and staff were amazing. We also thought it was good value, it’s far better and much more reasonable than a number of 2 star Michelin restaurants we’ve dined in. A big thanks to the entire restaurant staff, especially the sommelier and our waiter Istvan who were extremely attentive and very funny, they made our afternoon really special .We can’t wait to return to sample more dishes, keep up the good work.

title: Excellent gourmet restaurant
comment: The menu offered was really varied, tasty, well presented and the stetting was nice. Good wine choice and fair prices. Friendly and helpful staff. We loved it

title: When will the second Michelin star be awarded?
comment: Fabulous food, wine and surroundings. This time we had our first visit to the cocktail bar which had beautiful winter views of the garden and very delicious cocktails - some well known, some in-house creations. Friendly and knowledgeable staff.

title: Could be best fine dining in area...
comment: We normally dine at Coworth Park or Pennyhill (fine dining) but The Tudor Room gives them a run for their money)... took my husband there last Sat for his birthday actually (dinner)... we had a top notch seasonal tasting menu and went for the wine pairing also (which was excellent). The Tudor Room has only 20 covers so it's small and intimate.. fabulous on a cold evening (log fire roaring as you walk into hotel).... Staff were excellent, very attentive but each course was a gastronomique delight! stunning presentation and the wine pairing spot on. We will definitely book again in near future.

title: Valentine’s Day dinner
comment: Had the best dinner I think I’ve ever had!! The food was incredible. The staff were also really friendly. Both me and my partner had a really good time and we hope to come back in March.

title: Beautiful experience in every way
comment: Simply amazing! Why go into London when you can have fine dining at Great Fosters in Egham. We dined at Tony Parkin's Tudor Room on our anniversary (having been married in Great Fosters the previous year). From the moment we were met by the friendly team our experience was flawless. Each course is carefully designed to wow but not over power. The dishes included goats cheese and beetroot palate cleanser, sea bass & cavair, quail, monkfish and a honey & milk pudding. Stephen the awesome sommelier matched each course with a beautiful glass of wine including a Verdicchio and Sancerre. I have to say it was simply a lovely evening and at £95 for 5 courses it is true value for money. What made it even better is that Tony personally introduced the dishes and talked about their creation, bringing each dish to life. We will be back very soon!

title: Excellent food and service
comment: We enjoyed an excellent wedding anniversary meal in the Tudor Room at Great Fosters on Friday 13th October and I would highly recommend it to anyone. The food was of a very high quality and the service excellent. It was also very good value. We were made to feel very special by staff at the restaurant and we will definitely be returning again soon.

title: Return to the Tudor Room
comment: This really is a first class night out experience - the restaurant itself is superb .... Jara and his staff are so knowledgeable about their food and wine and the way to present it and Douglas Balish's food is certainly very well worth the Michelin star it has earned. What finally brings perfection to the night out experience is the setting ... Great Fosters is a lovely building, the Tudor Room is intimately focused on the food and the reception rooms are superbly decorated .... coffee afterwards in the drawing room rounds off a wonderful evening.

title: Superb
comment: I almost don't want to rave about it too much in case it get's too booked up! This is a small dining room with circa 20 covers and no turning of tables. It feels exclusive and the service is attentive. Unlike many Michelin starred restaurants there is a choice of starters, mains and desserts including a cheese choice as well. I am GF and this was no problem just a few tweeks needed. We also had the flight of wines which was excellent and generous. The food was beautifully presented and just exquisite to eat. All the extra touches of canapes, amuse bouche, chefs extra and pre dessert expected at a Michelin star were fantastic. Not to mention the home made petit fours which we took home in a hand bag box as we were too full to eat them. A final shout out to the staff who were friendly and engaging with all of the customers. Excellent value and highly recommended.

title: Birthday lunch
comment: Fabulous lunch with relaxed but attentive staff. The best fine dining experience I’ve had with incredible flavours and a lovely and generous birthday gesture.

title: Excellent evening in The Tudor Room
comment: We were lucky enough to eat at The Tudor Room last weekend with friends. We had a fantastic evening in a stunning location at Great Fosters. The food and service was excellent, and the staff were extremely attentive; all our needs were very well met. We moved to the lounge after dinner to have our coffee, right by the wonderful roaring log fire which was regularly stoked by staff. Istvan, in particular, was very funny and just made our evening even more memorable. There is so much history at Great Fosters in everything you look at, from the paintings and tapestries to the architecture and ornate ceilings, that you can't help feeling in awe of it. Thank you everyone at GF for a wonderfully special evening. I definitely want to return to visit the grounds and Gardens.

title: Good flavours
comment: Have visited a few times and have always enjoyed the food, superb canapés, nicely cooked venison. Just one comment, because we never had coffee it would of been a nice touch if they would of offered us petit fours.

title: Birthday meal was exceptional
comment: My boyfriend surprised me with a meal at The Tudor Room and sufficed to say, it very mucb lived up to the 5 star reputation. The food was amazing - from the delicious canapes all the way through to the very special birthday petit fours and extra glass of champagne. Very thoughtful and special.  The staff were amazing! We were very well looked after and they made us feel very relaxed, even enjoying a few jokes with us too!  The surroundings and room itself were very beautiful. We highly recommend the experience to everybody.

title: Just perfect!
comment: Very attentive service, delicious food. Just perfect for a celebratory lunch. All dishes explained to us, brilliant wine recommendations and very good value at £35 a head for lunch.

title: Anniversary dinner 😍
comment: My husband and I got married at this venue so already knew how amazing the staff and service are and have eaten in the other restaurant many times. This was the first time trying The Tudor room and we came for our anniversary meal. The meal is a tasting menu but with choices for starter, main and dessert which was a great touch. The service was impeccable and the staff were so friendly.  I informed them before the meal that I was pregnant and they adapted all my courses to suit and also advised if there was anything I couldn't taste on my husbands plate for example, when the cheese board came out. The food was amazing and there was not one bad point of the meal. The canapés were delicious. My husband also did the flight of wines with the meal which he really enjoyed. They then gave us some petit fours with a happy anniversary message and as we were too full they boxed them up for us to take home.  I would not hesitate in recommending this restaurant and will definitely return. I also think the price is reasonable for a Michelin star restaurant. Thank you for another great visit Great Fosters.

title: Amazing dining experience in Surrey
comment: Last month we had the pleasure of dining at The Tudor Room. We arrived early and were escorted to the bar by the charming doorman. By this point, we had already experienced better service than some of the Michelin-starred restaurants we had dined at in London. Our waiter arrived in the bar and provided us with menus. He guided us through the menu and made us laugh (which occurred throughout the evening. Our canapes arrived (jamon croquette, beetroot macaron and 36 month ages parmasan pastry) and we washed them down with some Nyetimber english sparkling wine....  This was just the first 20 minutes of what turned out to be the best meal and dining experience we have ever had. We would like to thank Istvan, Nenad, Jara and Norbet (and of course Dougie and the chefs) for making this a fantastic evening. We're so glad that Dougie presented at the Woking Food Festival as we wouldn't have known about the Tudor Room. We look forward to returning in the near future.

title: Simply amazing!
comment: This was a Christmas present we finally cashed in from the in laws. Having been to countless top end restaurants, I can safely say the Tudor Room at Great Fosters was one of the best! There are only 7-8 tables, very intimate! The staff, the food, the atmosphere all very impressive.

title: Very pleasant
comment: Superb meal, thoroughly deserving of a Michelin star. Thank you to all of the staff who made the dining experience particularly memorable.  Had the pigeon starter and venison main, two classic British game dishes served impeccably. The langoustine tea, despite being out of place in the menu, was an absolute triumph.

title: good value lunch
comment: We were happy with our lunch and would return. The restaurant is nice and service is very good. The grounds of the hotel are nice although unfortunately we did not spot the path to the pigs and vegetable garden. Of the menu the turbot was not the most inspiring turbot ever, but it was nice enough. The bread could do with some improvement as it wasn't particularly Michelin-starred standard although it was also fine, just nothing to write home about. The pork dish could probably have done without the BBQ element as it wasn't particularly good at being BBQ pork, however the pork belly on the same plate was excellent. The soup was quite tasty but should have been hotter. The pigeon was very good. The scallop was a good size and nice. The amuse-bouche were nice. It was very good value for lunch and we felt that the restaurant compares well with other restaurants in the area.The menu for dinner looks to be similar so perhaps not such a good deal at almost twice the price.

title: 80th birthday lunch.
comment: The Tudor Room restaurant is an. Extraordinary experience! We were delighted with the attentive staff and innovative and delicious cuisine. Service was exemplary!! We will definitely be back!! Patsyvb

title: Fantastic meal
comment: We had high expectations for the Tudor Room and it met all our expectations and more! The food was fantastic, the wine pairings perfect and above all the service was amazing. Of all the fine dining restaurants we have been to, we have never had better service. Can't recommend it enough!

title: Outstanding experience
comment: We found this to be a lovely, intimate venue with friendly and attentive staff. Because the Tudor Room is small, (6 tables set on our visit) it means the personal service they provide is exceptional. The menu gave variety, yet not providing too much choice to confuse. Each course was described to us by the waiters and the food was absolutely divine. When I asked our waiter how the homemade butter was actually made, he explained the process and ingredients without hesitation. Superb knowledge and attention to detail. This was a special experience; one I’m likely to repeat in the near future.

title: Anniversary celebrations
comment: Met at the door, staff were extremely courteous and could not do enough for you. Jaroslav came and introduced himself to us after previously calling me earlier in the week to confirm arrangements, everything we discussed was arranged. Waiters were courteous and knowledgable, an excellent experience.

title: Amazing lunch
comment: The Tudor Room has kept their Michelin star, maybe more of a challlenge maintaining standards after winning their first star. Had a wonderful lunch menu, with their accompanying wines. The pigeon was sensational, so was the turbot. Various amuse bouches were similarly delicious, especially the langoustine tea! The sommelier was very forthcoming with all thinking behind each accompanying wines, all mostly unusual, and perfect, refreshing to go off piste and not stay with the usual French heavyweights. Cannot wait to go back.

title: Brilliant but...
comment: Exceptional in every single way except one. A wonderful place like this SHOULD NOT charge 12.5% service charge on the bill and then have an “add gratuity” option on the card machine. It’s awful. Sharp practise. And should be below a place like this. For goodness sake cut it out! It spoils what you do!

title: Wee cheeky treat!
comment: Totally as you would expect from the team here, pure excellence! Food was exceptional, but mostly the recommendations of wine with the Flight of wine! Staff treat you as the most important guests they've had, thoroughly exquisite experience! Highly recommend to any couples/ small parties! Top marks!

title: Superb
comment: Beautiful surroundings, excellent, attentive service and wonderful food: no wonder there's a waiting list to book a table !

title: Best Evening Out in a Long TIme!
comment: The Tudor Room is an intimate dining experience with by impeccable food, wine and service. Only 24 covers are served each evening, so it really is personal comfort... so much so that the waiter and my friend riffed off each other all evening... we laughed, and laughed, but the other diners were not disturbed. The room is cozy, quirky and full of Tudor charm. The only thing isn't perfect is that the evening goes too fast. Looking forward to returning someday... hopefully in the not too distant future.

title: Very special experience
comment: We arrived early to enjoy a walk in the beautifully kept garden with moats dating back to Anglo-Saxon times. We were then escorted to our table and made to feel very welcome. The menu was just right for us but difficult to choose between dishes since everything seemed delicious! A few extra little surprises before the meal whetted our appetite even further. After having enjoyed the exquisite cuisine and attentive service we reluctantly had to leave. All agreed this was amongs the very best eating experiences ever.

title: Wonderful lunch, great place
comment: Booked for lunch on a Sunny day. It is only a very small restaurant but absolutely worth booking. Service was very good, somelier did a great job even when i was very demanding. Food presentation was a picture but was also very well prepared, delicious. We had coffee on the terrace overlooking the gardens.  A great meal and lunch is very reasonably priced for a high standard like we experienced.  Will come back again

title: Delicious experience
comment: This was our second year celebrating our wedding anniversary in the Tudor Room .... last year's experience was superb and we didn't think it could be bettered but we were so delighted with the brilliance of the service at every level and, of course, the delicious food which is a work of art!! Douglas Balish and Jaro Sedlacek can be justifiably pleased with what is being achieved in this remarkable dining room.

title: Absolutely divine
comment: We had the most glorious and delicious supper here on a Friday night recently. All of the waiting staff were incredible, the food was totally outstanding and spot on all night, and the wine was perfect with it all. Two very happy and well fed customers! Particular nods of appreciation to the chef for serving quite such sumptuous food (we loved it all... pigeon starter, turbot, incredible chocolate dessert, gorgeous tasters between courses and amuse bouche - just YUMMY), to the sommelier for great wine pairing recommendations (and for the complimentary glass of Tokaji with my dessert!), and to Istvan, a waiter beyond compare!

title: Fabulous
comment: What an amazing dining experience, we went for my husbands 30th. The staff/service and food were 1st class. Highly recommended

title: Fine Dining Gem
comment: The Tudor Room dining room is small, but being part of the historically important Great Fosters Hotel, makes for an inviting place to sample some truly 'fine' dining. The menu is interesting and choice sufficient for most palates. Particularly appealing was my pork main course - portions of belly, cheek, and loin all brought together with a wonderfully flavoursome sauce, really quite delicious, although my wife said her Himalayan salt aged venison was one of the tastiest dishes she's ever had! In fact, every course was brilliant and as befits a Michelin Star restaurant, artistically presented. The wine list is varied and interesting and obviously put together by someone who really knows their business. Service is exemplary, with a friendly, informal but knowledgeable approach, with waiters not afraid to display a truly dry sense of humour! Thoroughly recommended.

title: Just gets better and better
comment: We had a wonderful lunch last week at the Tudor Room. Not only was the food immaculately prepared and presented but we cannot imagine anything more tasty. We also had a flight of wines, every one special. The first class service and the ambiance in the Tudor Room rounded of a perfect lunch. Can't wait to return.

title: Birthday treat
comment: Booked for my wife's birthday. Had a great set menu lunch with a few additional extras. Staff wished my wife happy birthday which was a lovely touch and placed the petit fours on a slate board with Happy Birthday written on it. Food was great and so were all the staff. Really enjoyed.

title: Tudor Room Restaurant
comment: We've just celebrated our wedding anniversary at Great Fosters, 26years after celebrating our wedding day here. What a fantastic time we've had over dinner in the Tudor Room. Delicious food and wine combined with top drawer service. Special mentions to Jaroslav, Istran and Norbert. Entertaining, knowledgeable, welcoming and great senses of humour!  Steve&Jane

title: Amazing and friendly
comment: This is THE best restaurant in the area. An amazing set menu, excellent wine pairings, outstanding cheese board, with attentive and informative service. You have to book well in advance.

title: TOTALLY AMAZING!!!!
comment: Really we have no words to describe what a special evening we had......the food was just incredible!!! One of our best meal experiences in a long long time. Tony and his fabulous team talked us through all the dishes ....all the waiters and waitress’s were top class!!! Can’t wait to come again. THANK YOU TONY AND YOUR FABULOUS TEAM x

title: Fantastic. A well deserved Michelin star for Tony.
comment: We had at fantastic dinner at the Tudor room.  Every dish was perfectly balanced in flavor. My husband had the wine pairing and said it was spot on. After dinner Tony came out and we had a lovely “food talk” We will definitely want to come back and eat here again.

title: Impeccable food, service and style
comment: A fantastic Christmassy Saturday lunch. The cosy and intimate dining space in the grandiose setting of Great Fosters was the perfect setting for a warming, wintery meal. The staff were excellent and the ambiance was fancy, yet simultaneously relaxed and inviting. The set menu of four courses was absolute perfection. One of the best Michelin starred restaurants I’ve been to - just awesome food.

title: Excellent food and service - a very memorable event
comment: We had dinner at the Tudor Room to celebrate our younger son's 25th. There were six of us and it was an excellent evening. The service was exceptional as was the food. We started with drinks outside on the terrace and then were taken to the Tudor Room. The food was excellent - including the vegetarian menu that was requested for one of us - the Heritage Carrot is awesome! Our vegetarian guest was delighted to be so well looked after and to have her likes/dislikes taken into account. Both our host waiter and the sommelier had great style and were entertaining as well as informative. Our son said it was the best meal he'd ever had. A great evening!  Two tips. 1. We should have allowed more time before the meal. The hotel gardens are beautiful and it would have been nice to have had more time to look around them. 2. We should have allowed more time for the meal itself. Reception had advised 2.5 hours. For a party of six this was far too little. We were still going strong after 3.5 hours and we had to forgo the coffee as our taxi had been waiting a long time. This is a tribute to the staff who never rushed us and had perfect timing for us. This quality of the food (and the cost) means that you do not want to rush it - especially if you are enjoying the flight of wine. So don't order your taxi too early like I did.

title: Great food and great service
comment: Went for a posh girls lunch to celebrate my best friend's 50th and it was a real treat. The food and level of service is very high in this small and intimate dining room, our waiter was Istvan and he was fantastic - charming and attentive in a very relaxed, yet still appropriate manner for a high end establishment (I have to say that I am lucky enough to dine in nice places a lot and Istvan’s style is very refreshing)..

title: Michelin star Magic !
comment: From the moment we were personally greeted at the entrance to Great Fosters and there on in....the evening was an absolute delight. We were a party of 6 celebrating my sons 21st. The attention to detail and presentation was superb.  The seamless service by the sommelier and waiting staff was much appreciated. The 7 course tasting menu was just amazing. Every course delighted and excited your taste buds..I cannot praise the chef Douglas Balish enough...indeed it was great he came out from the kitchen to speak to us. Thank you to you all at the Tudor Room for making this a truely perfect and memorable evening.

title: Superb experience
comment: This really is the place to go for that special lunch. We were immediately impressed by the intimate atmosphere and impeccable service, which throughout was discreetly attentive and never rushed. The menu was small but well balanced. Every dish we had was an imaginative creation and beautifully presented. The reasonable prices make the Tudor Room tempting for treats every now and then.

title: Very special food and service
comment: Went for dinner on my 40th, everything was amazing! Would unreservedly recommend for a special occasion. Food and wine was beautiful and service was second to none. Lovely atmosphere too...

title: Perfect lunch!
comment: The food and service were superb! We have eaten in various Michelin starred restaurants and this has been one of the best. All the staff are attentive and helpful. The hotel gardens were a delight. We felt it was also good value for the number of courses. We highly recommend it!

title: Dinner
comment: A fabulous dining experience. From the moment we arrived we were greeted politely and escorted to the Tudor Room for our dinner. The menu was thoroughly explained and included a bespoke vegetarian option if required.  The atmosphere was perfect and the information supplied on each course made your tastebuds tingle before you took your first mouthful.  The wines were perfectly matched to each course.

title: Superb Food and Wine
comment: A lunch was booked with 5 friends who enjoy their food and wine. We had a most enjoyable drink in the bar prior to our meal and were served delicious canapes. The food in the restaurant was exquisite and beautifully presented. All the food I had was delicious and I had no complaints about any of the dishes served. Highly recommend giving this restaurant a try and you will not be disappointed.

title: Couldn't fault anything!
comment: It was our wedding anniversary and I was going to book a restaurant in London but then looked for a restaurant closer to home. This apparently is the only Michelin starred restaurant in Surrey so we decided to give it a go. So pleased we did - the hotel is amazing with loads of character and the Tudor Room is exceptionally cosy and comfortable (seating probably no more than 20 people). there is a six course tasting menu with three options on each of the starters, mains and desserts. I won't go into what we had because the menu will have changed by the time anyone reading this goes there, but every course was exceptional and at £65 a head it was very good value. We also found all the staff to be excellent, from the lady on reception to the Maitre D'i, and the waiter who served us, they were extremely professional without being overly attentive (which happens a lot in Michelin starred restaurants - you take a sip of water and there's a waiter filling up your glass in three seconds!). They all also had a wonderful sense of humour, all of which made for a fabulous evening. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this restaurant and hope you have as good an evening as we did.

title: Simply Splendid!
comment: Idyllic ambience, exceptional cuisine and superb service what more could anyone want! How lucky are we to have this on our doorstep in Surrey. Thank you to one and all who made our first experience a most memorable one. Loved it so much have already made a return booking. WOW!

title: Tudor Room Lunch
comment: we were very lucky to have had a gift voucher given to us for a Christmas present. This was our first visit to Great Fosters and I have to say it was a wonderful experience, we visited the Bar area we were made very welcome and served perfect coffee. We were then introduced to Tudor room manager who showed us to our table all staff were friendly and very efficient, food experience was very different, menu was explained at each course and it was all delicious, we finished off our lunch with tea and sweet treats on the patio. All in all a great present to have received. Would definitely love to visit Great Fosters again, and would recommend to family and friends.

title: Exceptionnel - la cerise sur le gâteau
comment: We went to the Tudor Room to celebrate our daughter's graduation. It was a wonderful experience. The welcome was warm. The service was flawless. Our daughter is vegetarian and she enjoyed her special menu as much as we did ours. The food was exactly what you would expect. Delicate, flavourful, beautifully presented. They even had a special attention for her at the end. Simply perfect. Accueil très chaleureux, le service est attentionné, discret et très efficace. Les mets sont très finement présentes dans les assiettes avec des saveurs exquises et originales.

title: Very nice
comment: Recommend this venue lovely setting and good choice of foods.The price is a little on the upside but that uk for it.The staff were very attentive and met our needs.Food was top class as was everything here.

title: Fantastic Experience
comment: From the moment we were served our pre dinner drinks to us leaving the restaurant the service was outstanding, the staff knowing how to pitch themselves to our needs and requirements. The food was outstanding, art on a plate but with the quality and flavour to match. A big thank you to all, especially the chefs who we can't thank in person!

title: An amazing evening
comment: We wanted a special meal to celebrate our wedding anniversary and we certainly had that at The Tudor Room. We started with drinks and canapés on the terrace overlooking the beautiful gardens. We were then taken through to the room and had one of the best evenings, with fantastic food, drink and service. Like another reviewer, we have eaten at other starred restaurants but our experience at The Tudor Room was our favourite so far. It is such an intimate setting. The food was so excellent, every plate (as you would expect) looked beautiful and was fabulously balanced - leaving you wanting more but knowing that you'd had just enough!  I don't drink very much and the sommelier helped me to pair a fantastic wine with my main course. We added on a cheese course and again he found me a lovely port to go with this. All the staff went over and above to ensure our experience at The Tudor Room was an exceptional one, petit fours were presented beautifully, with a lovely happy anniversary message. Staff boxed them up for us as we couldn't squeeze another mouthful in! Our one regret - we were at the table for such a long time, we probably should have stayed the night! We will do next time. Go and experience an unforgettable evening - life is short; enjoy excellence.

title: Anniversary meal
comment: This is such a lovely setting in a fantastic and historic hotel. The food I have to say was sublime and the service impeccable.It truly lived up to expectations. The finest presentation I have seen on food for sometime and very clever and exhilarating tastes. We shall be back !

title: Wonderful ambiance and breakfast
comment: We arrived very early for our reservation at Great Fosters and had not had breakfast. We checked in and were graciously shown to the Tudor Room, which was soon going to stop service. We were kindly accommodated and enjoyed a wonderful breakfast. Highly recommend.

title: 5* Food, 5* Service
comment: Had lunch with my two best friends. We were celebrating a birthday. The food was outstanding but what really made the difference was the service. Overall, it's always excellent in this particular restaurant at the hotel but we were also lucky enough to be served by Istvan . A refreshing alternative for this type of restaurant - he is utterly hilarious yet very professional. He had us literally belly laughing on several occasions. It's a lunch we will remember for a long time ... and we will be back !!

title: Lunch
comment: Lovely old English style setting in this 15th century Manor House and gardens. Excellent restaurant service and beautifully presented, very tasty food. Really nice for a special occasion as it's not a cheap place. Don't let price put you off though as it's worth every penny.

title: Outstanding in every way
comment: From the moment I received a phone call to discuss tweaks to the menu to respond to my diabetes to receiving a specially printed copy of the menu, our experience at The Tudor Room was nothing short of outstanding. The food was fabulous; a wonderful combination of tastes, which crossed the spectrum of ingredients and appearances. It has been a long time since we tasted food as exquisite, a real treat for two foodies. And then we come to the service, which was also outstanding. Not at all servile, this was faultless service delivered with both respect and humour.  So our thanks to everyone; to Jaroslav, who was a great maitre d' and sommelier, to his team, and, of course, to the chef, who we didn't see but whose creations still linger and will for a long time. We moved to Surrey 18 months ago and we have been waiting to find Great Fosters and The Tudor Room. We are now exceeding happy!!

title: Great Fosters - The Tudor Room
comment: Absolutely perfect meal especially for a special occasion. The waiters were cheerful and very efficient and each course was beautifully presented.

title: Lovely present
comment: We had a walk round the lovely gardens prior to a delicious meal in a period dining room - a most enjoyable and memorable evening.

title: Fabulous!
comment: This was our second visit, which says a lot!  The room is small and tucked away, which could be stuffy and pretentious but is somehow relaxed and friendly. Very attentive, knowledgeable staff, who have the balance just right.  The food is fabulous. All dishes perfectly executed. The three course lunch menu is an absolute steal. If it's a nice day you can take coffee & petit fours on the terrace. The gardens are beautiful!

title: Special Birthday
comment: Actually just another Birthday, but made very special by our visit to the Tudor room. The service was very friendly, but at the same time the staff showed excellent knowledge. Food was excellent, well presented, innovative and with a real finesse in the balance of flavours. There were many closed eye moments, when you just want to savour the flavour and exclude the world. For the final course I chose from the fine selection of UK cheeses, my partner the strawberry dish which she thought delicious, but did not have quite the wow factor of the rest of the menu. My knowledge of wine is limited, but the suggested wines were excellent in themselves and where a perfect accompaniment to the food. To end -My thanks for the selection of sweetmeats presented by the restaurant to mark my partners birthday. The Tudor Room ranks very highly amongst the list of one and two star Michelin starred restaurants we have dined at.

title: Stunning location with fantastic food
comment: I went for lunch with my husband, from the moment we entered Great Fosters the staff we met were charming and attentive. The Tudor Room is just the right size with light music playing and the amazing food was beautifully presented by happy waiters. To finish we had our coffee on the terrace which looks over a magnificent garden.Such a lovely time.

title: Exceptional food and service at the Tudor Room in Great Foster hotel
comment: Impeccable service, impeccable food, every dish was made with great care. Well above a typical One Michelin star restaurant.

title: Exquisite food in a beautiful setting
comment: This is the only Michelin-starred restaurant in Surrey and I’m so glad we’ve discovered it. We booked in for a lunch, which was incredibly good value for money. Every dish was beautifully crafted and utterly delicious and the setting in the Tudor Room was intimate and comfortable. The servers were lovely, incredibly attentive as well as accommodating when it came to specific dietary requirements. They also surprised my mum with a special petit fours to finish things off for her birthday. The grounds are gorgeous too, perfect for coffee on the patio or a bit of a walk after your meal. We’ll be back as soon as we can!

title: Simply brilliant
comment: Put quite simply......"this is one of the best dining experiences I have ever had". Why? The service is amazing - especially the sommelier who has this fantastic ability to engage with guests and tell a story about each wine.  The wine tasting menu was perfect - a brilliant way to explore a great array of superb wines without breaking the bank.  And there is the food. It is absolutely sublime. Amazing flavour combinations, delivered with perfection and presented like a piece of fine art. The tasting menu is so well balanced - you get just enough in each course to feel perfectly satisfied.  This was a truly amazing experience and well worth the 'investment'.

title: Very good food and attentive service
comment: We took friends to Great Fosters for a celebratory anniversary mid-week lunch. We have dined here on a number of similar occasions. The lunch menu at £35 includes some tempting canapes to accompany pre lunch drinks, amuse bouche and 3 courses and is excellent value. The food looks beautiful and tastes very good indeed. Service is very attentive but discreet, with courses arriving at just the right pace and drinks topped up just when needed. The Tudor room is small, intimate and very relaxed. Coffee was served after the meal on the terrace where the waiter secured a table in advance for us. A nice surprise for our guests was a delicious plate of petit fours with the iced message 'Happy Anniversary'. far too many to eat so some were boxed for them to take home. A surprise to us as well as the staff had acted on information we made when booking so a very welcome extra. Only 2 small points. I would expect coffee refills to be offered, particularly as the quite large cups were barely half full on arrival, or even better, why not give pots of coffee for diners? And I still believe that service (12.5%) should be at the customers discretion to add and not to remove when it has been automatically added.  Be prepared for drinks and service to add significantly to your bill but then this is a fine dining restaurant. That said, this continues to be one of my two favourite restaurants, the other being L'Ortolan near Reading, and the lunch menu is exceptional value. Could it not be available every lunchtime and not just Thursday and Friday?

title: One of the best meals I have ever had...truly
comment: I have eaten at a number of Michelin starred restaurants, and I have to say I cannot remember leaving any other restaurant as content as I was after leaving the Tudor Room. It is small, intimate and service is amazing yes...but the food was really heavenly. This was a total treat, and we will definitely be back again...if you do decide to visit, splash out and stay in the beautiful hotel too. Absolutely brilliant meal, brilliant value and a really memorable dinner.

title: Fine dining at The Tudor Room
comment: Fantastic meal at this Michelin Star restaurant. The food is absolutely outstanding. Highly recommend for all occasions.

title: A night to remember
comment: We visited this restaurant on a special occasions and did not regret it! The menu was interesting and fun and our waiter Istvan and sommelier Juan were up to the task with a true mission to make our experience memorable and tasty!  We tried the pigeon and crab as starters and for mains we both went for the beef fillet; this you just try, as its taste and succulence were incredible! We recommend the chocolate mousse for dessert!

title: Outstanding!
comment: From the moment we walked through the door to coffee with petit fours on the terrace, we felt like the royalty that once frolicked here. Istvan (waiter) was both professional and highly entertaining, Juan (sommelier) took us around the world with his perfectly paired wines, Jaroslav (manager) brought everything together with poise and elegance. The biggest star of the show however has to be Douglas (head chef) who provided course after course of exquisitely plated sublime tasting food.  If you are looking for a relaxing day in the country with outstanding food and service at ridiculously low prices, do yourself a favour and head off to The Tudor Room.

title: Lunch - Stunning service and a wonderful experience.
comment: We went for midweek lunch in the Tudor room. The surroundings are fantastic, steeped in history and extensive manicured grounds. We were greeted as we entered the hotel and the attentive service continued throughout the dining experience.  The Prix fixe menu was delightful with good selections available without supplements. The dishes were explained beautifully and served professionally. The staff Istvan, Nenad, Juan and Juraplaw (sic) were adorable. Istvan the terrific Hungarian was amusing and informative and made our visit special. Thank you. If you like cheese the platter is amazing.  Treat yourself and let Juan, the sommelier, select the perfect accompaniment to your meal choices through the ‘wine flight’. The canapès, amuse-bouches and bread were small details showing the chef and assistants truly understand the customer experience. Thank you for a wonderful birthday. We highly recommend the gourmet experience and look forward to our next visit.

title: A special dinner for a special occasion
comment: The Tudor Room at Great Fosters is a great place to celebrate in style. The food was outstanding and the chef even coped very well with a non-dairy organic diet request. The service was always attentive. I would definitely recommend.

title: Well worth a visit , foodies will not be disappointed.
comment: I booked the Tudor Room for my husbands 40th birthday, as it's fairly close to us.  To be honest, i generally steer clear of 'big hotel' restaurants, and the pictures of the Tudor Room, with it's fairly 'austere' and (i guess) Tudor decor wouldn't inspire me, though it is what the name suggests. On that note I can imagine really that this would suit a posh winter dinner, being quite dark and 'tudorish' , and can imagine retiring to the lounge for drinks by a roaring fire etc...  However that said, the food is the winner, and is after all what you are paying for. A very very tiny few tweaks and I can imagine a second star would not be out of reach. In line with what others have said, the waiter was superb (discreet, but made a few choice jokes and i reckon judges what he can say by his audience!!) It made what could have been a fairly intimidating small number of covers and a small room seem that bit more accessible.  Value is excellent - given it is only the full tasting menu on offer - it's reassuringly expensive but also not silly money like others in the same class if that makes sense.  Some of the amuse-bouche were excellent - the coconut pineapple one being outstanding and i wish i could eat it everyday! Choices for starters and mains were great - 3 options each with well thought through choices to suit all , and wonderfully cooked and presented. I loved that for dessert you could choose a sweet or cheese, which is something we often end up paying additionally for a cheese course and it's really positive to see the cheeses were all British (and lovely!) . The cheese option was also wonderfully presented with a lovely selection of crackers and chutneys etc (the truffled honey wouldn't be to everyone's taste but lord it was good!!).  A good selection of wine to suit most budgets - lovely pre-dinner bubbles on the terrace and a great after dinner drink in the lounge (though very quiet and as i said above i can imagine this would be much more atmospheric in winter!) - and me going off menu for a rum old-fashioned (try it, it's the perfect after dinner drink!) was no problem at all.  Finally, something I've always thought would be good - with your bill comes a little 'takeaway' menu to remind you what you've eaten . I've often embarrassed myself asking for a copy of the menu at posh places (as i like my reminders on special occasions) and it's a really simple touch but was lovely! All in all, would heartily recommend and will definitely go back .

title: An Absolute 'Must' for Foodies
comment: There's really not much more to add to previous contributors' reviews of this superb restaurant. Great Fosters is a magnificent building and with wonderful grounds. My wife and I have been there on previous occasions when attending weddings or corporate events, but we had never dined in the Tudor Room - so we were really looking forward to it. The tasting menu, along with the canapes, amuse bouche and palate cleanser all combine to take you on a memorable dining journey. The food, matched with the excellent wine flight, represents great value when you take into account all the preparation, time and skill that goes into creating such fine dining. The waiting staff and sommelier are very attentive and enjoy some banter. Having dined recently at Raymond Blanc's Le Manoir (which has 2 Michelin stars), we both agreed that the menu and food served at the Tudor Room were better and, therefore, we believe worthy of a second Michelin star itself. We highly recommend the restaurant and are looking forward to a return visit at some time in the future.

title: First Class all the way
comment: I had booked this for our celebration dinner for my husband's retirement. He was immensely impressed with the whole experience! The menu is creative and delicious- We had a very hard time deciding and choosing! There are 3 starter choices and 3 mains choices which I think is absolutely amazing. The amuse-bouche(s) which were inbetween courses were perfect to cleanse and refresh our palate - tasty and very original. The presentation of all the plates was picture perfect! We really enjoyed having the flight of wines which were matched to our choices of starter, entree, and dessert - absolutely perfect again! The wait staff and sommelier were extremely pleasant, professional, knowledgeable and helpful with our questions and selections. We enjoyed chatting with them and learning from their suggestions. They have definitely earned their Michelin Star and should be awarded another star in our opinion! We will definitely return - very soon! We won't wait for a special occasion this time - it is too good to not go more often! One of the most enjoyable evenings we have had - by far! We also loved having a small version of the menu to take home with us after the dinner so we could reminisce and re-live this magnificent evening.

title: 5 Star Fabulous Meal
comment: My wife and I had the pleasure of dining in The Tudor Room to celebrate my Birthday. The whole experience could not have been better from start to finish. On arrival at Great Fosters we were warmly welcomed and enjoyed some wonderful hors d'oeuvres with our cocktails whilst deciding what to eat from the truly superb menu. After taking our seats in the restaurant it just got better and better.
