The meal was simply and utterly divine and the attentive service made the whole dining experience an absolute joy; what a night we had and we cannot wait to return. Thank you GFs for making my birthday visit so memorable and congratulations on receiving your first and well deserved Michelin Star.

title: Delicious and exceptional in every way
comment: Our dinner at the Tudor Room was faultless, start to finish. From drinks and canapes on the terrace through to every course of the vegetarian menu, we felt the dinner was exceptional. Great service from the waiter, who helped us pick interesting cheeses for the cheese course, and the sommelier, who suggested a nice wine pairing. Dinner at the Tudor Room is very fairly priced for a dinner that is both lovely and memorable in terms of food and ambiance. Highly recommended and would certainly return.

title: Amazing Michelin star restaurant
comment: Decided to treat my Mom for a good meal. Took her along with Mother in Law and my wife of course. We all thoroughly enjoyed the meal. The food was exquisite and the service was impeccable.  The entire meal was great but the dessert was on another level.  We also happened to have enjoyed afternoon team that day. So, dinner was a double whammy and a double dose of goodness. Not only this place serves great food combined with excellent service, it has great gardens to visit and a charming history.  The hotel rooms also look great. Whoever you are, if you have read this review thus far, you seriously need to go online or on the phone and make that reservation. Thank you Great Fosters. We shall be returning soon.

title: Great service, food and venue
comment: A very enjoyable lunch. The service was superb with attentive knowledgeable staff recommending excellent wines. Food was well presented with excellent flavours. I had the pigeon which was beautifully cooked. My wife had the crab which was also superb. The highlight for sure was the main course, I had the filet of beef and my wife had the trio of pork.  The venue is also beautiful and I would recommend a walk around the grounds, very romantic.  My only recommendation would be to add some French cheeses to the board but understand why they want all British ones.  Worth a try for anyone on the fence about going, delicious!

title: Perfect evening at Great Fosters
comment: We visited Great Fosters Tudor Room for my partners 40th birthday. We arrived early and had G&T's in the garden area which was beautiful.  The restaurant itself is lovely - intimate, but not awkward or stuffy. The food was absolutely wonderful, as was the wine flight.  I think the thing that made our visit so memorable and enjoyable was the service of the staff. They were brilliant. Our waiter for the evening kept us well informed and was a real character. The sommelier was brilliant too, really passionate and knowledgeable.

title: Superb
comment: We booked dinner for 4 in the Tudor Room. The food was excellent in everyway. The dining room was beautiful, the service was faultless right from the moment we arrived. I have no complaints whatsoever. Brilliant - Excellent - Superb - Wonderful !!!!!!!! Thank you to all the staff who waited on us throughout the night.

title: Pleasant surprise
comment: When our friends invited us for lunch in a Michelin star restaurant I was ready for an other time with great food, high prices and sort of "boring service". The Tudor Room was prove me wrong!  The food was great, the amuse bush followed by the crab starter already sett my expectations high, but the piece of art called the pork main course just made them look simple as it was one of the best course I ever had! The 3 different parts of pork felt like a piece of heaven in the mouth! Even trough there are only British cheeses on the selection , with the help of our waiter it became to be the best choice to finish. And the service is something what need to be mentioned! We been welcomed by the manager who presented the menus and double checked the allergies, the sommelier helped us to chose the right wines, but the best part came when our waiter Istvan showed up at our table. He is something really special! Makes jokes when it is needed, gives professional descriptions of food when he serves them and just always has a right few words to tell you to make you feel welcomed and special in the mean time!  With the team they have the service is just amazing!  The last, but very important piece is the price. 35 pounds is nothing for the meal what you can have there! Highlyrecommend to anyone who is looking for a good meal with great service and doesn't want to spend a fortune on it!

title: Amazing dinner!
comment: Such an amazing dinner. Lovely flavours and fantastic attention from every waiter..Istvam was great company and very informative. Such a character and made our evening great! Thank you.. x

title: Superb fine dining
comment: Went as a birthday treat for my wife to the Tudor room near Egham. I've traveled past Great Fosters for many years and was my first visit. The building itself is an impressive tutor building and the grounds and gardens are exquisite. The staff were very friendly and attentive when we arrived and were shown through to small intimate dinning area known as the Tudor room which six tables of different sizes. The day before the meal I was contacted by phone to check if either of us had allergies and if we had any food allergies or dislikes the staff also reconfirmed this at the table. we started with champagne my wife took the special of the 'Flight of Wines" which is to say a individually selected wine for each course. `After six courses it my wife looked quite merry. The food was superb and served by the staff explaining what everything was. Some of the best fine dining we've ever enjoyed. Not cheap but worth every penny to see my wife enjoying herself so much.

title: Delicious food and great service
comment: I booked a dinner for two in the Tudor Room. The venue is beautiful and full of character and history. The staff was very friendly and attentive, although it would be nicer to have a bit of privacy during the dinner (we were first in the room and felt "watched" a little bit, especially as it was very quiet in the restaurant, and there were more staff members in the room than guests).  Food was absolutely delicious, well presented and bursting with flavours. My special thanks to the chef and his team! Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience in the Tudor Room. Although it was quite expensive, but this place is well suited for special occasions dining. I would highly recommend it!

title: Very enjoyable dinner.
comment: we were staying at the Great Fosters hotel and enjoyed a wonderful dinner at the Tudor Room . The menu choice was excellent, the food very well prepared. Staff friendly and professional, good wine list.

title: Stunning meal, intimate surroundings, superb service
comment: A small restaurant located in a very traditionally British room within Great Fosters. Impossible to fault. The team take huge pride in the restaurant and ensuring everything is exactly as you want. Vegetarians, Gluten Free - all the options are well catered for and they really try to get it right. The food was superb across all the courses, fish, meat etc... all presented beautifully and with great flavours. Service was quick and efficient... the small size of the restaurant means they kept the flow going perfectly. Lots of gastronomic surprises between courses as well. Wine list superb with knowledgeable advice. Good food needs passion, this restaurant has plenty of it... just superb, thank you to all the team for such a great meal.

title: The best ever...
comment: We went there with friends who booked the table to surprise us, and I have to say the surprise was extremely pleasant! The room is one of the most awesome I ever been and the food is just wow!!! Going all the way trough the 6 courses meal is a wonderful experience, every single dish is full of taste and feels like a piece of haven in your mouth! The canapes were already a great start and the frog`s leg, the pigeon and all the others described by Jaro the manager, was one of the greatest dining experience for all of us!  The service was absolutely professional and attentive, our waiter Istran( maybe wrong spelling) made our evening even more enjoyable with his wonderful knowledge and passion about cheeses and with his awesome sense of humor! I would highly recommend to anyone who is looking for a great experience to go there!

title: Excellent lunch
comment: A convivial setting where superb craft skills were on display, and where the entire meal service was conducted professionally. All this backed up by a very warm and hospitable welcome throughout.

title: Fantastic evening
comment: We took a couple of friends out for an evening meal, having never been to the Tudor room there is always a little doubt in you mind that it would not go to plan. We have to say from the time we got to the Hotel and ate in the Tudor room to the time sat down with or coffee's and ports in front of the open fire. The surroundings are beautifully looked after, as the Tudor room has a small amount of covers, which we like a lot, you can hear each other talk. We can honestly say we had a lovely time, the food and staff where brilliant. we will defferintly be returning. Thank you very much to all the Team.

title: Excellent. Michelin Star deserved
comment: Glad that we have a Michelin Star restaurant in our local area. Great Fosters has always been an ideal place with its ground, character and history. And to have Tudor Room with its formal dining area and Michelin star honour is just lovely for our area.

title: Delicious food and Impeccable service
comment: Arrived early to wander around the maze and the gardens before settling down with a lovely glass of bubbly in the garden whilst waiting for our table.  Starters of smoked eel followed by langoustine tea ( broth ) , and two mains of beef ( with garlic mushroom and truffle ) and pork ( three ways with piccalilli ).  Settled for all ten cheeses for the dessert . Found the three strongest cheeses of the platter were our most favourites amongst all the savoury cheeses.  Compliments of the house were popping chocolates ( which were promptly consumed with childish delight ) and delicate macaroons and truffles which we brought home in a pretty Tudor Room doggy bag . Superb dinner and wonderful impeccable service in the intimate Tudor room. Highly highly recommended !!! Thank you to the chef and all the staff for a wonderful evening.

title: Wonderful lunch menu
comment: My friend and I visited for lunch. We had the set lunch menu that was delicious - from the canapés to the light, fresh amuse bouche and throughout each course. The pigeon starter was impeccable and followed by the pork which was a beautiful dish. Cheese selection was also extensive and lovely and accompanied by various chutneys and crackers. The lunch menu is great value. We then enjoyed drinks in the beautiful grounds. The service was first class and attentive - a very enjoyable visit, thank you.

title: First class food and service
comment: The lunch was a Golden Wedding gift from a Well Travelled Nephew who knows a thing or two about top drawer dining. Great Fosters hadn't been on our radar so we had no preconceived notions about what to expect. But the WTN knew.... Before the food, the service. It was gratifying to be served by unobsequious staff with a sense of humour whose welcome was warm and genuine. They understood the food, described it without affectation and served it unobtrusively. And what food....! Every mouthful had flavours we had almost forgotten. Three delicious 'amuse bouches', a pea and olive oil 'entremet' that awakened ancient tastes. Milady had crab with almond and avocado, I ate perfectly cooked red mullet and scallop. Her pork loin, belly and cheek drew long 'mmmmms' and this from a near veggie. I had the beautiful beef. If you wanted it other than sumptuously rare order something else or dine elsewhere. Conversation ceased. I had asked for a glass of syrah but Juan, the chatty sommelier, talked me into a generous glass of a South African pinotage and he was right. The chocolate desert was orgasmic (sorry Vicar) and accompanied by a kick-you-in-the-privates passion fruit sorbet. And there's more.... With the coffees came confections of macarron, bitter chocolate, pistachio nougat some of which came home in a doggiebox. . A £35 limited menu lunch at this standard is an absolute steal. The extras are pricey but so they should be. Please go there before somebody wakes up and raises the price to a level it deserves to be. My only micro-niggle is that the beautiful historic Tudor Room is a bit gloomy but if it was good enough for Chopper Henry it should be good enough for us.

title: Lovely Girls Lunch
comment: We love the Tudor Room, always great staff and amazing food - we have never had anything but excellence here.

title: perfect blend of wonderful food and excellent service
comment: Went here recently with a couple of friends for a Saturday evening supper. The venue itself is a beautiful period property (Tudor-esque) set in lovely grounds - spoiled somewhat only by the M25 being literally in the back garden :-S Pre dinner cocktails went down well followed by a superb meal. For me the Tudor Rooms had the right blend of wonderful food and excellent service. The food was called a tasting menu, but it was more like a hybrid of tasting and a la carte. Excellent flavours enjoyed by all at the table; a great wine list which was equally enjoyed by all :-) Perhaps the highlight for me was the unfussy, expert, efficient and warmly genuine service. top marks. Will be back for sure.

title: Above expectations
comment: It's rare when everything is just right. We could not fault anything and had the most delightful and relaxing lunch imaginable.

title: delightful
comment: It has been a while since I have had this type of meal......I will be back! the flavours were well balanced, service excellent, and good value for money

title: Excellent fine dining
comment: Really enjoyed lunch here with my partner. Fabulous menu, great cooking and service that was both witty and classy. Strongly recommend.

title: delightful experience
comment: We booked the Tudor room as a treat and it really didn't disappoint. It was the highlight of the whole weekend! Everything is set up in a way that makes you feel special and looked after, from the setting of the Tudor room, all the way through to the food service and the attention to detail. We had the lunch menu and it was excellent all the way through. This was a very memorable experience, and a relaxing walk in the gardens of the Great Fosters after lunch was the cherry of the top. Would definitely recommend and will be back for further special occasions. Thank you!

title: Wonderful food and service
comment: Staff were extremely accomodating to create an extra-special lunch for us, and the quality of the food was wonderful. They even boxed up our petit fours after coffee as we were too full to finish them

title: First 5* Dining experience
comment: We went to The Tudor Room as a one of experiece and were very pleased.. 7 stunning courses delivered in a fun and engaging manner.... A couple of tips from me... Think carefully how much you value the "flight of wines" paired for each course... This is something which will add to the overall experience and allow the Somelier to teach you a little about the wines. On the other hand you can order whole bottles which can save save a bit of money... and probably get you a bit more quantity of wine!!!! Another tip was when it came to desserts, both the chocolate thingy and the cheese board were great, if possible order one each and share so you don't miss out...!!  By the way - i once went to a Michelin star restaurant and left hungary... it won't happen here... absolutely full and content --- top marks!

title: Outstanding in every respect.
comment: Probably one of the best Dining experiences we have had in the UK. The food is superb, beautifully presented and cooked and an excellent if limited choice. The staff were charming, attentive but not intrusive and the atmosphere , in quite a small but luxurious but not over the top room, was delightful. Altogether pretty faultless; well worthy of its (newish) Michelin Star.

title: an amazing meal
comment: one of the best michelin starred restaurants we have eaten in and very good value for money. Only 7 tables so a very intimate restaurant.

title: Wonderful Service
comment: Great food. Beautiful wine. Absolutely great service. Overall a very enjoyable evening. I would highly recommend

title: Lunch - Stunning service and a wonderful experience.
comment: We went for midweek lunch in the Tudor room. The surroundings are fantastic, steeped in history and manicured extensive grounds. We were greeted as we entered the hotel and the attentive service continued throughout the dining experience.  The  Prix fixe menu was delightful with good selections available without supplements. The dishes were explained beautifully and served professionally. The staff Istvan, Nenad, Juan and Juraplaw (sic) were adorable. Istvan the terrific Hungarian was amusing and informative and made our visit special. Thank you. If you like cheese the platter is amazing.  Treat yourself and let Juan, the sommelier, select the perfect accompaniment to your meal choices through the ‘wine flight’. The canapès, amuse-bouches and bread were small details showing the chef and assistants truly understand the customer experience. Thank you for a wonderful birthday. We highly recommend the gourmet experience and look forward to our next visit.

title: Thanks for ‘Eat Out ...’
comment: On this last day of ‘Eat Out to Help Out’, huge thanks to Sam and his team for participating. It has been helpful to so many, but a lot of extra work for the team. So, thanks to you all for maintaining, so cheerfully, your usual first-rate level of customer care and service, as well as the superb range and quality of food and drinks. You remain, for me, the best in Beckenham - the place to be!!

title: Just Lovely
comment: Amazing service, lovely food with a strong selection for vegans and veggies. And they're dog friendly. We've been a few times, always brilliant.

title: i didn't think it could get better
comment: After being there about 3 months ago and having a perfect lunch we returned with the hope that they could equal the experience. Somehow they bettered it. The ambiance, staff, food and wines are as good as you can get. We had lunch on Friday with a selection of wines chosen by the well informed and helpful sommelier. Just fantastic, we shall return ASAP.

title: A very grand meal in a very grand setting
comment: The expectation was that we would be having a lovely, upscale dinner in a refined setting and what we received ticked all of the boxes appropriately. The multi-course meal was served by six different wait-staff and was done so attentively but unobtrusively. The portions were quite small, as one would expect in a very grand restaurant, but we felt surprisingly satiated. The presentation of each course was like a ballet... a theatrical production. The menu was very adventurous and held delightful surprises for our palates. Both of us cannot remember when we have had a finer dining experience.

title: A Great Lunch!
comment: Back to this wonderful place to try out the Lunch menu at the Tudor Room & it was a wonderful experience with gorgeous food. The fish starter & main were cooked to perfection the pigeon & pork were fresh and a delight on the palate. The desserts were sensational both the Breton with it's perfectly pink rhubarb with the right amount of tartness along with the presentation were a delight & the Chocolate was of the highest caliber--Absolutely lovely so compliments to the Chefs!! The dining room itself is delightful being full of History & very intimate and cosy..

title: Always excellent 24/3/17 Tudor room
comment: Good to be back for lunch for 3. Welcome; bar; service with French staff; ambience are all so appreciated in this haven of an historic building since subtlety converted into an hotel. Will come back again soon.

title: Continues to live up to our expectations.
comment: Having visited a couple of months ago we had to come back and were not disappointed. Our compliments to the chef and his team as the courses were well presented and we found that we did not wish to hurry any our courses, just savour the tastes. The restaurant team were also very good, attentive but not intrusive and the way they presented each course demonstrated a good knowledge of what they were serving. Altogether a wonderful experience in a lovely setting.

title: Lunch at the Tudor Room
comment: Again a wonderful lunch at the Tudor Room with excellent food and attentive service. We will be visiting again very soon.

title: Not bad, but some fundemental errors
comment: Well, the truth is I 'quite' liked it. If someone said they had booked it, I would happily go back and eat there, but I wouldn't book it again myself. I didn't mind the room and the service was OK, and fairly typical of a restaurant in this space. However, the food wasn't food enough for a restaurant of this supposed stature.  Starter of pigeon - cooked sous vide. Main of beef - cooked sous vide. Chef, in case you didn't know, this fashion came and went. It's lazy cooking, and it makes the food bland, and texturally wrong. And although there was a sear to try and put some life back into the meat, both starter and main were woefully under seasoned. I could understand it if there were 100 covers in the restaurant, and he wanted an easy life, but with so few choices on the menu, and so few diners to serve, there is no excuse for sous vide cooking (or under seasoning come to that). Get with the program chef! I appreciate sous vide cooking is not in itself an error, and some people, strangely, may like it, so here's where I think it was wrong, not so much open to debate, and reaffirmed that the clearly ambitious chef hasn't yet got the knowledge to carry this off to those diners who have eaten at the great places in this, and other countries.  The pomme puree was actually almost liquid. Lord knows what they did to it, as it didn't just seem like an excess of butter, but this liquid potato was just plain nasty and should never have left the kitchen. The small (but adequately sized) starter and main course were then dwarfed by oversized desserts. Why? The balance was completely wrong.  The biggest worry of all was the cheese board. Whilst there was lots of it, there was an horrendous concoction called 'truffled honey'. On taking off the lid of the pot, an acrid stench of truffle pervaded the room. Everyone on the table could smell it, and I only took the lid off for a second. I love truffle, but it is highly aromatic, and is to be used sparingly and with care. Whoever put this together, clearly thinks more is more. It doesn't mean that at all. It ruins it. Again, I worry for the skill and knowledge of a chef who would, in any way, think this disgusting tincture was appropriate to put out. The waitress actually said "Some people can't even have it on the table", and laughed. Surely that should tell everyone there something?? All in all, not a bad meal, despite my criticisms, but this place has a star, so every element needs to be spot on, and it wasn't. It smacked all too much of a provincial chef in a provincial restaurant who knows a bit, and is having a go. A restaurant putting out that food in London wouldn't last five minutes.

title: Delicious Friday afternoon lunch
comment: My husband and I had a very enjoyable lunch at the Tudor Room. The sommelier presented the menu and explained the best wine pairings and even suggested a non-alcoholic pairing for me. The meal started with some delicious canapes, including a beetroot macaroon, and a molten Parmesan filled cracker. This was followed by lovely amuse bouche of pea and ricotta, a starter of pigeon, celeriac and walnut and a main of beef, wild garlic and morel mushrooms. This was finished with a very generously-sized chocolate dessert, followed by white tea and petit fours featuring nougats, macaroons, caramel truffles, and chocolate/macaroon bites sitting in popping candy. I would highly recommend visiting the Tudor room for a tasty meal and very attentive service and all for a very reasonable price. A walk around the beautiful grounds of Great Fosters rounded off the experience.

title: Excellent foom and ambience
comment: The food was excellent and so was the wine choices that went with the food. A great three hours enjoying the food and wine.

title: Surrey's best and only Michelin-starred restaurant
comment: A very relaxed lunch, in a historic and beautifully decorated room. The food was all you would expect from a Michelin-starred restaurant, and the service was attentive without ever being intrusive. They catered for the dietary restrictions of one of us (gluten free and allergies), still producing amazing food. Well worth a visit on a special occasion, or just to pamper yourself and your nearest and dearest. Allow time to walk round the magnificent grounds - we were particularly lucky that it was a warm and sunny spring day.

title: Beautiful setting and lovely building
comment: The Tudor Room restaurant in this superb building is rather small (intimate), plain and uninspiring, perhaps so as not to take from the fine dining. The staff were efficient and unobtrusive. The pigeon was done to a turn (but no more) and the pork three ways was excellent. A very pleasant evening in a superb hotel

title: Simply sublime
comment: We had a really special evening here. The restaurant is full of character, and really intimate, as there are only 7 or 8 tables, and they are not crammed together. We had the tasting menu and also decided to take the wine flight. The sommelier was great, not too stuffy and made sure we were never without a drink. The service was efficient and didn't dominate, and the atmosphere was just right - lively but intimate. The food was fantastic, every course was a delight, something different but always top quality and full of flavour. This place fully deserves its new star, and should push on for another in my opinion.

title: Wonderful 50th birthday lunch
comment: This was a mid-week lunch to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. All the staff were lovely and the food was excellent - they certainly deserve their Michelin star! The Valrhona chocolate dessert was an architectural masterpiece.

title: First time fine dining
comment: My girlfriend and I had an amazing first time experience of fine dining that was set in a beautiful 15th century manor house. I cannot fault a thing,the staff were very welcoming. What more can I say,an absolute must if you have never been.

title: Tudor room
comment: A hidden gem great food service and all complimented by fine choice of wines by Stephen the somellier you will not be disappointed by checking this restaurant out -we d prefer you didn't !cant wait to go back

title: Excellent lunch
comment: Dined here for lunch after a previous lack lustre performance some time ago. Service was excellent, coordinated between all staff, unobtrusive but there when required, Lunch was excellent, well cooked and tasty. Even some items that one was apprehensive about were thoroughly enjoyable. Cheese board was really enjoyed with a very good range of English cheeses. Coffee was a bit lacklustre but didn't affect one's overall view. Would go again.

title: Exceeded all expectations
comment: Eat there on Monday the 20th February.The food was exceptional and the service was impeccable especially for the audience (they were cooking a room full of chefs) If you are ever lucky enough to get the opportunity to eat ther it will something you remember for a very long time. Well done all at Great Fosters

title: A Superb experience on all levels
comment: This was actually my second visit, and having been once before I was really looking forward to it, and it did not disappoint. The food is absolutely delicious from the canapés while having a drink in the bar, to the amuse bouche, the starter, and through to dessert. All was beautifully presented and cooked to perfection. I loved the fact that if you have any food allergies or dislikes you receive a personalised menu. Excellent wines, seamless attentive service in a lovely setting. I look forward to my next visit.

title: WOW. Truly amazing!
comment: Visited with my wife and two friends for my birthday. The setting is really lovely. The staff are courteous, smart and knowledgeable about the food. The food is outstanding. It's somewhere to go for a special occasion or a treat. You won't be disappointed.

title: Mrs
comment: We had the pleasure of Dining at The Tudor Room last Friday night. What an absolute delight. The room the service and oh my the food,was excellent!!! It was a truly memorable experience. We will most definitely return.

title: The best cafe
comment: Me and my boyfriend always go to this cafe, it’s our go-to. The customer service is always amazing. They gave my boyfriend a free slice of cake for his birthday.  Good to note: they don’t serve pork. They have beef sausages and turkey bacon.

title: Dog friendly Cafe in Beckenham
comment: Friendly staff, great service and excellent breakfast options in Beckenham (the paninis are very delicious). Our 4-legged friends loved the complementary sausage bowl too! Highly recommend, will definitely return.

title: A lovely experience all round.
comment: This was a thoroughly enjoyable evening. The restaurant is a pleasant and comfortable space and the service was excellent. I am quite fussy about my food but I could enjoy every course of this taster menu thanks to the helpfulness of the staff, e.g by offering me a vegetarian starter when I could not eat any of the three choices on the other menu. All four of us were very happy with our food. Having coffee in the lounge by the fire was a lovely way to finish. We are looking forward to another visit.

title: Top of the Pops
comment: Delighted to see that Rendezvous, Beckenham has been voted Number 1 in the top ten restaurants in the Bromley area. Congratulations to Sam and his team! A well-deserved recognition!! With apologies to the great Sir Winston Churchill: “Never in the field of human dining has so much been owed by so many to so few!” Well done to you all.

title: Birthday Meal
comment: My husband and I got married at Great Fosters in August 2016 so this is a very special place for us. We booked a romantic dinner at the Tudor Room as a special treat for my birthday. As soon as we arrived we were greeted in the reception area by a member of staff that had our booking details. I had booked a table for 2 but they had made a mistake on the booking and listed it as for 4. This was resolved very quickly. We were offered a seat in the lounge while they reset our table. We were then escorted to the Tudor Room to a lovely table near the door and the room was amazing. Large fireplace and old tapestry on the wall. The staff were amazing. Very attentive but not intrusive. The sommelier was exceptionally good and took care of us, as did our waitress for the evening. I could not fault the staff in any way. They were amazing. The food was delicious and cooked to perfection. We ordered the pigeon to start followed by the venison for the main. There were many other courses in between and everything was an absolute delight to the taste buds. Portions were generous and we both left feeling full. Now I am sure from the above you are wondering why the 3 stars. Firstly we wanted to give 3.5 stars but that wasn't an option. The reason for the lower star rating than we would like to give to Great Fosters was for the ambience. Ambience is very important to us when eating out as it adds to the whole experience. Although the Tudor Room was very pleasing to the eye there was no background music and my husband commented that he was distracted as a result by conversations of other diners. I had really high expectations following such a lovely wedding at Great Fosters. I was excited to go back for the first time since such a significant event for my birthday but the ambience was ruined for me by what sounded like a raucous party in the Estate Grill next door. It was so loud as the party were having a sing along which lasted our whole meal and I was mortified when they started singing The Proclaimers, 500 miles. I hate this song and it sounded like we were seated next to a pub at kicking out time. Such a great great shame as the Tudor Room experience would have been outstanding without this and with a little background music. Very unfortunate this happened on my birthday weekend. This was such a shame as I did not have the romantic experience I hoped for, even though the food and staff were flawless. My feedback to Great Fosters would be to think about what bookings they have and advise diners in advance if loud parties are taking place. If I had known this in advance we would have booked at a different time.  On the plus side at the end of our courses my husband ordered coffee and we were offered the option the remain in the Tudor Room or retire to the lounge. We opted to retire to the lounge to get away from the noise from the party. This was lovely and in hind sight it would have been much better to have had our whole meal in this area given the party noise. We had a very pleasant surprise in the lounge too when a lovely plate of chocolates and macaroons was brought out with a happy birthday message for me. This was a lovely touch. In summary I am really sad to give this rating as the food, staff and little birthday touch were amazing but the ambience on the night we went was terrible as sadly we were in a lovely environment with amazing food but it sounded like we were sat next too a very lively pub at closing time.

title: Food with passion
comment: It’s always a pleasure for the palate and the mind whenever I decide to stop by and appreciate the tasty food options available here. Even a simple sandwich is prepared with careful attention and the friendly service completes the nice experience of sitting for a relaxing meal break. Very worth visiting.

title: Excellent food every time
comment: Amazing service, the sommelier is great at giving a helping hand when choosing the wine. Really well thought out menu and excellent food

title: Simply Stunning
comment: I booked this as a treat for my wife for Christmas. She's an aspiring chef herself and as big fans of Masterchef etc I thought we should give this whole Michelin star dining a go. We were not disappointed. The whole experience from when we arrived was perfect. We had a drink and our canapés in the bar before making our way to the intimate dining room. We decided to accompany the meal with the 'flight of wines' and this too did not disappoint. A particular highlight for us was the sherry to go with langoustine tea. Sounds odd but works perfectly!! The pigeon, venison and pork etc were out of this world, so too were the cheeses. Tiny dots of truffle honey hit the spot for us!! The staff were amazing and attentive without being intrusive. An incredible dining experience!

title: Utterly amazing on all levels - superb!
comment: The service is incredible, the staff wonderful......and then there's the food! An out of this world experience, from start to finish......stand out and magnificent  Credit to the chefs prep team and all the front of house staff We will be back .............

title: Excellent all round
comment: Living locally we had visited the hotel on several occasions however never eaten in The Tudor Room, with the recent addition of a Michelin star, we decided to change that.   The knowledge, friendliness and attentive service from the Restaurant staff and Sommelier was excellent and the standard of food spoke for itself as you can see from the photos. Portions were a decent size and we certainly did not leave hungry. The food and service were impeccable and we would definitely recommend and will return in the Spring or when the menu changes.

title: Another memorable experience
comment: This is our third visit and each time as memorable as the first. Every course is outstanding, the service is first class and the staff are extremely professional, but also friendly. The very knowledgeable sommelier is also on hand to help you with your wine choices. Cannot wait to return!

title: Totally deserves five stars!
comment: Fabulous lunch with beautiful dishes served throughout, wonderful staff and superb wine. Steve always makes the experience totally perfect every time we visit. If I were to be really picky I would say that the waitress who initially seated us and talked us through the menu shouldn't be leaning, picking her nails or playing with her hair in customer view. Other than that tiny point it was absolutely amazing and will soon be repeated... I cant wait!

title: Dinner with wines
comment: Amazing food, accompanied by an amazing selection of stunningly selected wines.  Staff are friendly and helpful. The ambiance and decor is warm and welcoming as it transports your mind back in time.

title: Great meal and good value
comment: Really enjoyed the meal we had here. Started with a drink in the bar and the staff left us unrushed and actually brought us out menus and our initial canapés to have there. Tasting menu was great including some tasty amuse bouche and we utilized the help of the sommelier who matched us up some great wine recommendations by the glass to go with certain courses. Ended with coffee which they offered to serve us out I the lounge in front of the fire. Very good evening.

title: Great to have it back
comment: A real pleasure to have the Tudor rooms back and now it has a deserved Michelin star. Douglas Balish produces superb food which is just perfect in its simplicity. We loved it and whilst it is not a chef thing you would be silly to miss out on the cheese board. Steve is a knowledgeable somelier with ability and not pomp. Fanny looked after us perfectly and the one thing this experience offers, apart from superb surroundings, is perfect staff. Experience and professionalism balanced with friendliness. We do a lot of the 'top' restaurants but none of them offer the relaxed feel the Tudor rooms and it's staff do.

title: Yummy breakfast
comment: Went for breakfast a couple of days ago, really nice setting, breakfast was lovely and staff very friendly.

title: No thanks
comment: Yes some of the food is nice. But we asked for a slice of cake but it was stale must have been in fridge for ages.

title: Varsha J
comment: It was my 3rd visit to the restaurant with my friend who was already a VIP customer to this restaurant for years. Food on the whole was amazing and did not let me down once again. Atmosphere has a cosy Feeling and staffs were very attentive. Best Indian in Chingford for sure and rare to eat amazing Indian food with lots of flavour. The tandooris are highly recommended as well as the curries. I wish they could fo home delivery to Redbridge and I also suggested. Hope the owner/management will consider in future. Thanks for the great service and it’s 5 star for me.

title: GREAT GREAT GREAT FOSTERS
comment: Amazing. From being greeted at the little entrance door, pre dinner cocktails, canapés', amuse bouche, starter, main, pre dessert and amazing dessert. I could not fault anything. Absolutely worth the £65 per head for the dinner and i can't wait to go again. It's a small menu and no vegetarian options offered but sure they would be available if you ask. I don't often give 5 stars but this is worth it

title: Nice Lunch
comment: Enjoyed a nice lunch consisting of scrambled egg on sourdough toast with mushrooms and baked beans with a Black Americano. Food was served promptly, hot and very tasty. Service was also prompt and polite. Overall another nice experience at one of my favourite places. Looking forward to returning here again soon

title: Birthday Dinner!
comment: Took my wife here for her birthday. We've eaten in the Estate Grill Restaurant many times, but never the Tudor Room, so I thought we'd try it on her special occasion. Wasn't disappointed! Exquisite food and first class service in the small Tudor Room, which is elegantly furnished in a traditional style - original beams and tapestries from when the building was Henry the VIII's hunting lodge - magnificent! They even brought out a birthday surprise for my wife - well done Great Fosters! It only has 24 covers, so book early to avoid disappointment. Oh, and prepare your taste buds for a real experience.

title: Marvellous!
comment: Having arrived at the beautiful Great fosters hotel where we were greeted and tended to by impeccably mannered staff, we took our seats and ordered our food and found every single mouthful was absolutely and perfectly delicious. I chose the wine flight option where each glass of wine chosen, by the very expert wine director, was beyond compare, that just elevated this already sublime fine dining experience to simply out of this world !

title: Immaculate
comment: Arrived late and a bit flustered as I had got lost en route and we were immediately put utterly at ease by very welcoming staff. This place is really something to write home about. You sink into seating of immense comfort and I enjoyed everything from beginning to end. The setting is stunning, the young staff beautifully attentive, the pace of serving perfect. As for the food it was awesome. Such flavours, such exquisite presentation and there was a sense of generosity with it. Every course was a delight.  I do so look forward to returning. Well done!

title: Wonderful food experience in a cosy dining room
comment: We went there for my husband's birthday and we loved it. The dining room is cosy and inviting. The food was beautiful. The menu has 3 main courses with lots of extras added - amuse bouche, in between course small tasters. At £58 it is amazing value when considering the quality of the food and the service. In fact it is under priced compared to many restaurants in the area! The scallop starter was cooked perfectly, the langoustine tea had beautiful flavours. I chose venison, my husband took the pork and we both throughly enjoyed the courses. Cheese board and souffle for dessert were also right up there. Also worth mentioning is the sommelier. He was incredibly knowledgeable and recommended beautifully matching wines at affordable prices. He was also very kind to give us a complimentary glass of dessert wine to best suit our last course. Tudor room turned out to be a great find!

title: worth a journey
comment: We reserved a table for lunch having booked a weekend break at Great Fosters I an only repeat what has already been said, atmosphere, food and service impeccable. We will definitely return (and recommend), it's certainly worth a journey even without staying in the hotel Thoroughly enjoyable, a real treat

title: New year eve dinner
comment: A beautiful meal in a magnificent hotel can't fault it, the hotel is rated the best dinning in Surrey and this is true

title: New Year's Eve tasting menu dinner: almost flawless
comment: My partner and I decided to stay at Great Fosters the night before his flight from Heathrow on New Year's Day and we wanted to celebrate NYE with a special dinner on our last night together for a while. There were two NYE options at Great Fosters - a black tie dinner-dance, or a quieter option in the Tudor Room with more courses. Being naturally ungainly with insatiable appetites, we went for the latter option, and I'm so glad we did. The waiting staff were discreet, polite, incredibly knowledgeable about the food and trained to absolute perfection - which goes for all the staff at Great Fosters, incidentally. A special mention must go to our sommelier, whose jaunty moustache was the perfect foil to his amazing, astute wine pairings for each course and thoughtful explanations for each pairing.  A selection of delightful little canapés wetted our whistles perfectly alongside champagne. We started with an oyster each, with a topping of something tangy, green and frozen (sorry, I can't remember exactly what it was). This was the only low point of the dinner. We both love oysters and were keenly anticipating this first course. Unfortunately the oysters were served in their shells, which in turn were on a picturesque be of cool stones. The combination of this and their frozen topping meant that the oysters themselves were frozen and tasted more like an oyster sorbet with an unforgettably bizarre texture. My partner found this starter absolutely vile but I could still taste the oyster and was indifferent towards it. The subsequent courses instantly restored our faith in the Tudor Room - all were utterly fabulous. Highlights included the most perfectly cooked langoustines, an unforgettable chicken consomme and a beautifully cooked venison course. As I mentioned above, the wines were chosen with great panache and complemented the food perfectly. We finished with petit fours in the hotel's beautiful drawing room in front of an open fire. The perfect New Year's Eve culinary extravaganza (oyster notwithstanding). We will definitely return.

title: EXCEPTIONAL intimate fine dining experience
comment: I’d heard quite a few years ago that the restaurant at Great Fosters has been progressively gaining a reputation as a bastion of food innovation. And I don't doubt that for a bit. For those that area searching for a fantastic fine dining culinary experience, look no further than The Tudor Room! This fine dining (now Michelin starred) restaurant is located in Great Fosters Hotel, just outside Egham. My latest visit was in December 2016 and I am already looking to book for the next dining experience! The restaurant seats a small amount of diners and allows its guests an intimate experience in a beautifully decorated room. My husband and I opted for the flight of wine option – we were not disappointed. It was an absolute pleasure to be served excellently chosen pairing wines by the wonderful Steve the Sommelier (I believe he’s the Head Director of wine at Great Fosters). His choices of grape and detailed explanations of the tasting notes to be observed whilst enjoying each course was brilliantly delivered and not too ‘over the top’.  The tasting dinner menu started with canapés and was followed by an artichoke amuse bouche. We knew that the menu would be excellent even at this stage as the colours and form of presentation even on these first two tasting experiences were phenomenal. For the starter I opted for the scallops with broccoli with truffle and hazelnut. The tastes were amazing and the presentation also made the dish especially appealing. The following course of langoustine tea was beautifully fragrant. I opted for pork belly with piccalilli for the main course and ended the dining experience after a cucumber, line and pineapple palate cleanser with a selection of cheeses which came with the most delectable truffle honey. The service throughout was extremely attentive without being too intrusive. Perfect for our special romantic meal!  At the end of the sitting I was pleasantly full and could not have consumed anything else. However, the flavours and textures of the entire tasting menu was so excellent I thought it would be a complete injustice not to take advantage of the final optional course offered – I caved in and decided to have the petits fours and coffee. In order to properly relax we were invited to enjoy the coffee and petits fours in the sitting room on the large oh too comfortable sofa. What an amazing experience – totally unrivalled.  Though I would love to be selfish and keep the existence of the Tudor Room to myself, Head Chef Douglas Balish’s tremendous work is too good for me to keep quiet. I’m absolutely certain that a table at the Tudor Room will quickly become (if not already) the hottest reservation within a seriously significant mile radius!!

title: Outstanding
comment: Impeccable staff, glorious location, perfect choice of wines to compliment each, out of this world, plate of heavenly food.  I think it's safe to say we loved it !

title: 40 minutes there 190 back but worth it
comment: The building is beautiful and I wish we had had time to explore the gardens, but the food was just wonderful. When every element of each dish tastes so good you just want to return and the sommelier needs a particular mention. I really don't want a snooty superior individual and full marks for our lovely sommelier for being the complete opposite. We were extremely unfortunate in hitting a bad day on the M25 but this restaurant was absolutely worth it. It was the type of menu when I could have said give me anything and it would have been wonderful and it fully deserves its Michelin star. My wine buff husband pronounced the wine list good and reasonably priced and overall the whole place had a lovely relaxed feel about it. Can't wait to return.

title: Superb you will not be disappointed
comment: The food once again was superb especially the pigeon and venison. The staff as always friendly and professional. The wine that steve suggested to go with the venison was excellent. I cannot recommend highly enough.

title: You won't be disappointed!! Simply amazing!
comment: Second time at the Tudor Room and wow, it takes my breath away each time. The service is flawless and the food is incredible. A special mention to Steve, his wine knowledge is extensive and he matches the food perfectly. Will be returning!

title: Exceptionally good food
comment: Went for lunch at the Tudor room -having heard of the Michelin star. We were not disappointed. Fabulous tasty dishes - even for the vegetarian in our party. Everything fresh and well put together. Looking forward to dining there again. By way of note - wine recommendations were good too, and the service was polite and efficient. Great to be given the generous serving of petit fours to take home - a nice touch!

title: Merits more than one Michelin star -superb
comment: My party of six celebrated a milestone birthday at The Tudor Room. It was fantastic from beginning to reluctant end. The decor is just beautiful and the table linen and place settings set the scene for a very special dining experience. The gentle background music added to the perfect ambience of the restaurant. The menu offers a fascinating choice of intriguing dishes. They arrived perfectly timed and described by the professional and knowledgeable ladies who looked after us so attentively. The food itself was simply delicious and beautifully presented, melting in the mouth with the tastiest of complimentary flavours. An altogether delightful evening and a very special occasion.

title: Lovely meal at the Tudor Room
comment: Went to the Tudor Room for an anniversary meal and the food and service were fantastic. The setting is beautiful and we loved the recommendations from Steve the Sommelier. Food was delicious, the tasting menu had lots of nice touches and we were really pleased with our choices. Great option for a fine dining experience in Egham.

title: Fantastic lunch.
comment: We had a fantastic lunch here! The restaurant is small and cosy and maintains a relaxed feel. Service is good, with knowledgable staff. Food is fantastic! Everything we ate was brilliantly cooked. I had scallops to start, which were perfect. Not still raw...! Portions are also generous for a Michelin star restaurant. To finish we chose cheese. You can pick 5 from a choice of 10. As there were two of us this meant we had all ten! Whilst they were all lovely.. The cheese portions were very generous... Slight cheese overload. The ladies next to us had one cheese portion and one desert.. And shared. We will definitely go this route next time!

title: Impeccable Gastronomica
comment: We've been visiting the Great Fosters for the past 2-years since we moved to the local area - before the Michelin star awarded recently. The food, is without exception, exceptional; and this is no truer than the Tudor room experience. Already looking for an early 2017 reservation to help us overcome our expected seasonal blues!

title: Perfect Dining Experience
comment: From my experience dining in the Tudor Room is truly the perfect memorable experience to behold.  Every detail has been meticulously thought through from the atmosphere, decor, heating, music, tableware, timing, staff expert knowledge of wines and ingredients,service and most importantly food.  It's not just a meal, it's an experience. If I am honest I do not know the detail on how to qualify for a Michelin Star, however what I can say; my evening spent in the Tudor Room was exceptional and to be rewarded for such excellence only seems fitting.  Congratulations to Great Fosters on having such a great team to deliver a truly amazing meal and fine wine. Thank you.  I can't wait to return.

title: Fantastic Service .... Amazing Food
comment: Coming here is always a pleasure. Very friendly staff, always care for every need. The food matches very high standards. Highly recommend!

title: Great experience!
comment: I was very pleased to discover this restaurant. Finally we have a good quite fine dining in the area! Great staff and amazing food.

title: Unbelievable
comment: Great price, location and people!! Wide varied menu with all great tasting foods. I was taken back but the friendly environment with all staff members.. Service was simply second to none

title: 5 star
comment: Really enjoyed food and service. Staff are very friendly especially Khan ! Would definitely come again!  Best Indian locally.

title: An exceptional celebration venue.
comment: The dining experience was memorable, the food, service and ambience are a delight. It is an ideal venue for a celebration meal.

title: Wonderful Lunch
comment: Delicious food, beautifully prepared and served in a lovely setting. Steve the wine waiter was a particular joy.

title: Fabulous and relaxed
comment: Have been meaning to try this restaurant for over 4 years and yesterday was the day. I went for a posh girls lunch with 2 very close friends, one of whom is unwell, and the hotel made every effort to accommodate her without making her feel accommodated – I was so impressed and grateful for this. It is very obvious how The Tudor Room has come by its first Michelin star this year - everything was perfect; food quality, portion size, level of service, friendliness of staff (whilst being totally appropriate for the surroundings), intimacy and decor of the room. I had such a nice time and have booked my next visit already.

title: Wonderful Treat :)
comment: The Tudor Room is intimate with just over 20 covers and set in the beautiful grounds of the Great Fosters in Egham. The venue is full of that old English charm, whilst being impeccably maintained. You will love the log fires in winter and amazing grounds in summer. The Tudor Room was a beautiful discovery. The clever beetroot macaroon, a sweet and sour air bubble delighted our palate by its lightness and sight with its vibrant colour. One of our favourite was the Jerusalem artichoke with perfect balance of texture and flavours. The smoked eel & foie gras starter surprised us. First the crisp and fresh note of the frozen grape hits your senses, followed by the texture of the eel and smokiness slowly replacing the cool flavours. Finally, just at the end the richness and velvety foie gras takes its rightful place on that stunning dish.  We could go on and on, through Pigeon, Venison, souffles and English cheeses, and you know what? Go and check it for yourself, because if you love food, you are in for a treat.

title: Thoroughly Enjoyable
comment: Very good food, excellent sommelier. I'm usually quite good at finding flaws when dining out but this was faultless. 10/10

title: We can see why ts got its first Michelin *
comment: Four of eat here on a Saturday night to celebrate a special birthday. As the title says it deserves its star. Service was excellent as was the food and for a nice tough they made a special effort for the birthday. It was a very well done tasting menu and with wine well over £100 a head but excellent so well done

title: Fine Dining as it should be!
comment: A wonderful dining experience in a intimate setting. Great service from friendly helpful staff, and most importantly, sumptuous food served with great attention to detail.

title: All round fantastic evening
comment: Superb restaurant in a beautiful hotel, amazing food, fantastic wine and wonderful staff. All in all we had the best evening. Go to the Tudor Room @ Great Fosters, you will love it!

title: Superb venue and a great meal
comment: This is a magnificent venue and the meal and service was there to match. From the greeting coming in to the meal and the Sommelier this was a great experience which we will repeat

title: 5 Stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
comment: We have visited and eaten at Great Fosters for 14 years now for the wonderful gardens, charming Tudor characteristics and the warm welcoming atmosphere. However, the cherry on top is the recent Tudor Room dinning experience we've just had.  We normally eat in the Brassiere and have rented the Garden Room for a recent Birthday celebration and been quite happy with the food and drink. The Tudor Room was a very different kettle of fish! The Jerusalem artichoke teaser was a real surprise and not something I'd usually order. Followed closely by the Scallops which were melt in the mouth. The Venison was good, not quite hung long enough but still enjoyable. Bringing up the rear was the amazing cheese board which was a real treat with the choice of ten to tempt the pallet although quite full at the time. My wife ordered soufflé which looked and tasted amazing as a stole a spoon just to be sure.  Special mention is reserved for Steve the Sommelier. Honest, knowledgable and knows his way around a wine list, put your trust in his hands and you won't be disappointed. All together a great night with attentive well trained servers, excellent food and a good wine to wash it all down with. Well worth the the star!

title: Great week for the Tudor Room
comment: Booked a lunch for two on Friday the day before. Warm welcome with drinks by the fire. Fabulous food - smoked eel and fois gras combo and truffle honey with cheese were the showstoppers. Friendly staff and no stuffiness. Douglas and the team well deserve their first Michelin star! Perfect start to the weekend....

title: Well deserved one Michelin Star
comment: The whole experience from arrival to departure was excellent. A member of staff seeing me park up, kindly escorted me to The Tudor Room. The pescatarian tasting menu (customised specifically for me) was flawless. The dining room too creates a beautiful setting.

title: Great Michelin Star food with excellent value & service
comment: It is clear why The Tudor Room has recently been awarded a Michelin Star. The menu is well thought through, generous in the additional courses and each is delicious. The chocolate course is a masterpiece of flavours! We went on our anniversary, and this was our first visit for 20 years, it will not be that long before we return again!

title: Cheeky Friday lunch
comment: Superb food, service and venue Best lunch in a longtime  Very good value - - waiting staff friendly and efficient

title: Special birthday lunch for a seriously foodie friend!
comment: Simply perfect all round - service, attention, presentation, quality of food - just delightful. This will be a regular destination for us from now on

title: Venue, service and food - all fabulous
comment: Visited for my 35th birthday with my boyfriend. The service from arrival to departure is warm but professional, attentive but not over familiar - which is perfect for a romantic night out. The tasting menu was fabulous and I enjoyed every dish; perfect quantity and the flavours were all delicious. My boyfriend has pigeon then venison as his choices and really enjoyed both. The wine flight was great value and the Sommelier Steve was great; patient with his explanation, and accommodating a change when I wanted to be very "faux-pas" and have red wine with my seafood course.... Highly recommend. No it's not cheap, but I think it was worth every penny for the quality.

title: Delightful
comment: Beautiful environment for a relaxing afternoon tea. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit and not rushed at all.

title: Astonishing exquisite food
comment: The beautiful exterior of the Elizabethan hunting lodge with its tall magnolia trees gives way through a small arched doorway to a welcoming fire in the wooden entrance hall. The food is exquisite with beautifully cooked venison, light and perfectly risen papaya and mango soufflé and culinary surprises such as a mushroom the size of a peppercorn, sauces served from a glass teapot for a fishy amuse bouche and liquid beetroot encased in a 'nibble'. Delicious wines come at a price but the main meal at £58 pounds is the best food I have ever eaten. Staff are helpful, friendly and knowledgeable.

title: Fantastic evening.
comment: A wonderful evening at The Tudor Room Great Fosters. Amazing food and wine served by knowledgeable, passionate professionals. We will definitely return.

title: Great food, friendly service 10/10
comment: The staff at the spice station were attentive, friendly and complimenting.  The food was of high quality, prompt and tasty.  Will definitely be coming back. Highly recommend!

title: Amazing experience.
comment: We were staying the hotel, and eating in a Michelin star restaurant for the first time made the whole stay an even more wonderful experience. Every course was delicious, especially the scallops! we went for the flight of wine as well, this make it a bit pricy but made the food even more enjoyable! Would recommend this to anyone who loves their food. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the service was great, especially the sommelier, was very informative about all our wines! Worth every Penny!

title: Lovely place!
comment: Lovely service staff are friendly and make you feel comfortable and make sure your satisfied! Would highly recommend

title: Birthday dinner
comment: Amazing food, excellent service, and superb wine. The sommelier was very personable! And it was nice to arrive a little early to get a view of the grounds before dining.

title: Sophisticated menu
comment: The well thought out menu was much enhanced by the knowledge and help from the sommelier. The wine pairings added much to an already excellent meal.

title: Birthday dinner.
comment: Beautiful evening started with champagne on the terrace. Excellent food, stunningly visual presentation. Great help from the Somemelier pairing the wines with the food. Very relaxed atmosphere. Service was faultless. Should have a higher award.

title: Anniversary dinner
comment: The quality, taste and ingenuity of the food, the setting and the brilliant staff made the Tudor Room at Great Fosters a truly lovely place for us to celebrate our anniversary. It was perfect!!

title: Perfect Anniversary Dinner
comment: Arrived a little early and enjoyed a stroll round the stunning hotel grounds - immaculately maintained and well worth seeing. Dinner itself was outstanding in every respect; surroundings, ambience, service and food were all superb, and combined to make the meal feel really special and indulgent. And the sommelier's very helpful recommendations added the final touch. We had last dined here five years ago, but will be sure not to leave it so long until our next visit.

title: Wonderful Fine Dining
comment: Set in a sympathetically restored Tudor lodge this intimate fine dining restaurant really is top notch. From the moment of arrival to the final petit four one is treated to a gastronomic master class.  There was no Michelin star when I visited but surely one cannot be too far away.

title: Great dinner - can only recommend highly
comment: My wife and myself enjoyed a wonderful evening in the Tudor Room. The room is very charming. The staff provides excellent discreet and friendly service throughout the evening. The sommelier was not pretentious, very friendly and recommending a wine that went perfectly with the menu. And the food was clearly amongst the best we ever enjoyed. We can only recommend this location for a romantic dinner. We hope you have a similar, outstanding experience as we had.

title: Fine Dining and Excellent Service
comment: Having attended the Tudor Room a few times in the past, it was once more a delight to make an overdue return. The cuisine this time was, if anything, better than we remembered from previous visits and the chef is to be commended for the complex layering of flavours in each of the six courses. The sommelier was helpful, warm and engaging, together with the Maitre d' and the staff, the service was professional yet relaxed and welcoming.

title: Delighted to be the first !
comment: My wife and I visited Great Fosters on 5th October for an anniversary celebration and we were absolutely delighted to be the first to experience the wonders from the Tudor Room kitchen, following the award of a Michelin star just two days earlier.  The ambience of the intimate Tudor Room was complimented by a superb dining experience.  The welcome received from the moment you arrive at Great Fosters sets the scene for things to come! Cocktails in front of a roaring fire, friendly, attentive and professional staff and a meal that was truly exceptional.  The attention to detail on every plate presented and the flavours achieved .... well, just made us smile .... simply delicious from beginning to end.  Such wonderful food by Head Chef Douglas Balish and team was complimented further by charming and efficient staff who were attentive but discreet. As always, it was good to see Sommelier Stephen Farrell again - his quick wit always brings a smile and the wine suggested was a perfect match.  We would like to thank MD Richard Young and his team for making our anniversary celebration so perfect.  Would highly recommend this gastronomic delight; look forward to visiting again soon.

title: Always a delight!
comment: A very special and unique restaurant within the hotel. We occasionally treat ourselves to a fabulous meal and an overnight stay. Chef Douglas Balish always produces the most wonderful meals, which are crafted with passion. He has great team. Excellent food, excellent location, excellent service!

title: Luxury at its best
comment: Perfect for a special occasion, gourmet food over five courses with friendly attentive service. Part of a Great Fosters overnight stay. This is a very special venue taking one back to earlier times when service was the criteria . Lovely old fashioned room but with every modern facility. Breakfast to die for.

title: Absolutely fabulous!
comment: A delicious meal with staff that went out of their way to make sure our experience was wonderful. My husband is coeliac and the restaurant ensured that his meal was just as delicious as mine. We will definitely return!

title: Unbelievable Food!
comment: Very well crafted menu & obvious passion for making truly memorable culinary experiences. Perfectly prepared as well!

title: Delicious food in wonderful surroundings.
comment: We enjoyed every mouthful of our lovely meal which was matched with excellent service throughout. We hope to return in the future to be spoilt again!

title: Oh My God !!!!!!!!!
comment: This was a special dining experience. Everything was wonderful - to the point where you would be so overcome by the incredible flavours you shout WOW out loud. Every course was great. The food and wine service was second to none. Best meal we have ever enjoyed.

title: Excellent dinner at Great Fosters
comment: We had dinner at Great Fosters and had a really excellent experience. The gardens are really lovely and house is very impressive, it's a great place to sit with a pre-dinner cocktail, take in the surroundings and enjoy your amuse-bouche. We walked along the Lime Avenue to the grass ampitheatre, this is a very pleasant area and you can then look back at the house from there. Dinner was excellent, we both had the crab and then beef fillet. There were numerous other small courses before and after these which complemented the meal and the ambiance of the Tudor Room. Service was excellent too. To finish I had the cheese board which was really good and my partner had the strawberries. We then retired to the lounge where we had our coffee & fresh mint tea and petit fours. You could really get used to this!! It was a birthday treat for me and a very memorable one. We highly recommend dining here and will certainly return. Well done Great Fosters!

title: Beautiful food, intimate surroundings and good service
comment: My partner and I were away for a romantic weekend and as he enjoys the finer things in life I wanted to take him to the best restaurant I could find around the area. Well we certainly achieved that! As a vegetarian I called up and requested a separate menu which was prepared perfectly and I even had a choice for starter and main and dessert. The aperitif and pallet cleansers were presented beautifully and the cheese board was out of this world! We shared a bottle of Rhone Valley Gigondas and had coffee all in £250. For a treat and a really great time I would recommend!

title: EXCELLENT MEAL AND SERVICE
comment: Always wanted to dine there, wasn't disappointed, excellent food and tremendous service. The staff couldn't do enough and were first class. Cosy environment, all in all, first class,

title: Anniversary Dinner
comment: Outstanding food, service and ambiance. Loved every bite! Service was impeccable. This dinner made for an extraordinary celebratory dinner with my husband of 32 years! Thank You to the chef and Great Fosters staff!

title: Wow! Why Im a Spice station regular
comment: Wow! Im a Spice station regular - but what with lockdown its been a while. Tonight reminded me why they are simply the best- juicy, tasty quality chicken and properly prepared sauces with fresh herbs, spices and peppers - each sauce for our jalfrezi and Korai was delicious and delicately spiced. Thank you Shah and to your top team of chefs

title: Excellent Anniversary Dinner
comment: My husband and I were treated to an anniversary dinner at Great Fosters and were both very impressed.  On arrival we had drinks on the terrace overlooking the beautiful tranquil gardens and then made our way to the intimate Tudor dining room.  Our meal, all courses (and there were a lot of them!) were all excellent in presentation, quality and flavour and all staff were very helpful and efficient. The Sommelier was particularly knowledgable and helpful in choosing beautiful wine to go with our food. We look forward to returning to Great Fosters and thank you for such an enjoyable and memorable anniversary dinner!

title: Probably the worst coffee in Chingford
comment: stopped for a "flat white" on the way back from a walk - wish I hadnt have bothered - I think they forgot to put the coffee in!!

title: Fantastic food and great atmosphere
comment: Fantastic food and great atmosphere would definitely come back again. All the staff were helpful and follows all COVID hygiene rules

title: Good food but quiet and too cool by the window
comment: We went in October last year. The food was very good but the table was very cool next to the window. We should have asked to move but why put us there as there were only 3 couples in all night. All in all ok but not brilliant. We'll try again not in autumn or winter.

title: Lunch Tudor room
comment: Revisited this hotel with a wealth of history and character. Experienced exemplary food and service in an atmospheric dining room. A walk after lunch in the well maintained gardens rounded off our very satisfying visit. Looking forward to our next visit.

title: Perfect in every respect
comment: Food and service excellent without being intrusive. Ambience and setting lovely, though a little too quiet.

title: My father's 89th birthday
comment: Wonderful service, comfortable surroundings, amazing food - one of the best all-round restaurant experiences I have had. Congratulations to all the team for giving my family a memorable occasion !

title: Dinner in the Tudor Room
comment: We loved it! Superb service in a posh restaurant but no one looking down their noses at us. We thought the food was excellent, loved the beetroot "macaroon" which was one of three delicious canapes - yes, we were served canapes even before the amuse-bouche. Nice touch. The sunflower seed bread (home baked) was stupendous and they weren't mean, offered more without us asking. Lovely beef, great strawberry pud. We will certainly be back - and we are real fuss-pots. Highly recommended

title: professionnal visit
comment: very nice room the tudor room , we arrive with a glass of bollinger the mise en bouche very nice , then the meal to follow , great !!!, the foie gras and eel very delicat , to follow the langoustine with tea sauce wonderfull , ten the pork very tender , well cook , i took the chesse selection with the wine pairing , a great moment , to finish coffee and mignardise in the salon very confortable , a great moment and very pleasant service , and félicitations to the wine waiter for the selection of wines , and felicitations to the chef for this great moment of pleasure

title: Wonderful food and excellent service
comment: What a wonderful experience; from the moment we arrive to the moment we left we were well looked after. The food and wine was some of the best we have ever tasted and it is now top of list, so when I get asked to recommend a restaurant this will be it.

title: OMG!
comment: Go! You will not be disappointed.. We have had the pleasure of eating at some of the most exquisite restaurants in the world. I thought the Bazzar in L.A. was hard to beat as it's one of our favourite eat out experiences. The Tudor Room is at as good as if not a tad better! The amazing wonderful restaurant makes the Fat Duck taste like a Wimpy!! It's not a bit up itself, as some of these types of restaurants can be. It's cosy, relaxed, warm, friendly, attentive without getting on your nerves, and the food is to die for. Love it, love it, love. : )

title: Lunchtime visit in May
comment: The Tudor Room is a lovely sized room - not too big but equally, not squashed together. I would imagine this room is particularly lovely in the winter. We had the set lunch menu which we thought was excellent value for money and of a high quality - my scallops were plentiful and perfectly cooked. We could not fault the food or service. We had pre-lunch drinks and tea on the terrace outside which was a suntrap, flanked by the wisteria.

title: Tudor Restaurant
comment: One of the very best culinary experiences. Each course created with immense skill and awareness of flavour and unique combinations: the tender scallops and a main course of succulent Irish beef were both combined with delicious wine chosen for us by the expert sommelier. The atmosphere and service were also exceptional. We experienced something very special thanks to a highly talented team.

title: Amazing evening
comment: Small cozy room, keeping the level of noise to a minimum. Perfect service from all the staff. Food was delicious, a great experience for eyes and palate. Wonderful wine list with very helpful and friendly sommelier. Pricy but worth it!

title: Fine dining at its best
comment: Apart from Dinner in London this was the best dining experience so far this year. Only for special occasions because it'll set you back c.£ 140 pp with drinks, it was just excellent. The addition of surprise titbit dishes between courses added to the experience enormously. The wines were sublime with a wine connoisseur called Stephen who really knows his wines. A hidden Jem in an an country house near Staines - get there at least once in your life!

title: A dinner we will talk about for years to come
comment: We splashed out for our Silver wedding anniversary for a stay in one of the signature rooms at Great Fosters -- and booked into The Tudor Room for dinner, not really knowing what to expect. Long story short, we were blown away by every aspect of this dining experience. The waiting staff were kind, knowledgable, and exceptionally helpful, explaining each dish as it arrived and answering our questions -- some of them naive, some of them technical and probing about ingredients and culinary techniques. The wine waiter was a delight to talk with, and guided us to a bottle that suited both us and the food to a tee. The art of being a good waiter is often underplayed. There is a very subtle relational balance to be struck. Attentive, but not overbearing. Knowledgable, but not overweening. Relaxed and friendly, but efficient. The Tudor rooms staff were all of these things, and made the experience all the better. The room itself is beautiful and we felt "the hand of history on our shoulders" as we sat and ate in a space that has provided dinner to countless generations of aristocracy. And since it's conversion to a hotel, has graced the likes of Douglas Fairbanks Junior, and a rowdy crowd of Golden age Hollywood A listers. (The room we slept in was once occupied by Charlie Chaplin). But we were there for the food. And what a delight that was. We are addicted to MasterChef, and so the style of cuisine is very familiar to us. Each of the dishes presented as a work of art. Each component on the plate with its own back story. Each element combining to express a gustatory experience for the nose and mouth. This is food where nutrition is not the driving creative force. The chef, Douglas Balish, is on record as saying that his driving aim is to make diner's in his restaurant happy. Thank you Douglas. You achieved your aim with these two happy revellers. It's a cliche to say that "the food is the real star" -- and a falsehood. Dining like this is about a celebration of life, people, creative skills, the gift of variety and the foods we have available, our own bodies for the sensations they deliver to us as we eat. This whole experience was turbo-charged by the setting and the staff. Thank you.

title: Lunchtime experience
comment: I have had lunch in the Tudor room a few times and everyone has been special. This time my daughter joined us and absolutely loved it. She tried food she would never have eaten before. The staff were extremely helpful, and each dish described perfectly. We finished with coffee in the garden, but it is a shame that they have changed the petit fours as you cannot replace chocolate with jellies.

title: An amazing dinner experience
comment: This restaurant is in a unique hotel in a building from 1515. Great service, fantastic food and wine. Make sure you don't miss a walk in the gardens.

title: Excellent food an service in a lovely intimate setting
comment: The Tudor Room is a small, beautifully decorated restaurant in the wonderful Great Fosters. The menu has limited choices, no doubt because of the size of the restaurant, but we were very pleased with what is on offer. Also, the restaurant calls ahead of your visit to check if you have any food allergies. The service is friendly and attentive without being intrusive. We particularly liked the very knowledgeable sommelier, Steve. I'd highly recommend it for a special evening.

title: Affordable Excellence
