comment: Our first lunch in The Tudor Room was a wonderful experience. Such fresh, vibrant food and intense flavours with every mouthful.....the hors d'oeuvre, amuse bouche, starters, main course and dessert, not forgetting the petit fours! The presentation of food was a work of art. The waiting staff and sommelier were very knowledgeable, and attentive without being intrusive. I should just mention that being gluten free did not mean I missed out on any of the courses, or flavours! Overall an incredible experience which we wish to repeat very soon.

title: Anniversary dinner
comment: My wife and I ate here last night to celebrate our 31st wedding anniversary. We arrived a few minutes early and were shown into the Tudor Room having waited a minute or two in the reception area. The room is very historic and has ancient tapestries and mirrors adorning the walls. The waitress offered us water and the menu and then brought along the canapes, including a delicious beetroot mini-macaroon and two cheesy varieties. The beetroot "jam" was stunning. The wine waiter (Steven) offered us the wine list and we ordered a Rioja Crianza, however, Steven returned with a better Reserva which he was able to offer us at the same price and which was a perfect accompaniment to our meal. The choices for each course were limited (just 3 of each), but spot on, I was torn between them. My wife chose the Scallop for her starter and I the Pigeon. The Pigeon was really VERY good, perfectly cooked (pink) and a great flavour. I think this must rank as one of their best dishes. My wife chose the beef for her main and I went for the Turbot. My turbot was lovely, but my wife's beef (which I believe had been cooked sous vide?) was stunning and competed with the Pigeon for best dish of the night. On reflection, I wish I had ordered it, it tasted so good! The other option was Pork belly which I would also loved to have tried. The waitress served us bread and butters, including a flavoured one (did I hear her say Bovril? It tasted very bacon like to me!), and we enjoyed more bread with the main course. Several other amuse bouche were served between courses, including a Langoustine Tea (delicious delicate flavours of Thailand) and a pre-dessert which comprised tiny nibs of almost frozen apple, with a creamy topping and a crunchy cucumber layer topped by a granita, the ideal course for such a warm summer evening. My wife chose Strawberries and cream for sweet and I went for the selection of 5 cheeses. You get to pick from a list of perhaps 10 or 12, and I went for the stronger cheeses towards the bottom of the list including a couple of blue cheeses. These are served with some unusual flavoured and varying textured crackers and some other accompaniments, including a very pungent (use sparingly!) truffle honey, some candied pecans, an apple puree and a fig jam which went lovely with the cheddars. We didn't bother with tea or coffee and petit fours, but we enjoyed every minute of the meal and the service by the waitresses and Steven (the wine waiter) was exceptional! We shall certainly return and perhaps experience some of the other restaurants in Great Fosters?

title: Excellent service and ambience!
comment: Visited The Tudor Room on Easter Saturday evening to celebrate my husband and son's birthdays. Excellent variety for choice of courses which we thoroughly enjoyed. The surroundings of the hotel and The Tudor Room were olde worldly and relaxing. Special thanks to Steve the sommelier for pairing our wines! We can thoroughly recommend the restaurant and hope to hear they get a well deserved Michelin Star soon!

title: In a word.....Perfect!
comment: This was my first visit to The Tudor Room and I was blown away by the whole experience. The staff were so welcoming and friendly on arrival and we were overwhelmed when shown into the restaurant - what a beautiful room. The canapes were delicious and included a pink beetroot macaroon! Next was a Bloody Mary and broad bean amuse-bouche which was one of the best I have ever tasted. I choose the scallop starter followed by the beef fillet and finished off with a rhubarb and ginger dessert all of which were amazing, not just to taste but in presentation....almost too pretty to eat! My lunch guest had the cheese - a choice of 5 from a fabulous selection served on slate with truffled honey and fig chutney.  I must also mention the tall gentleman who served our wines (Stephen?). His knowledge of the subject shone through and he recommended having wine by the glass to complement our chosen dishes. Next time we will make sure we are not driving and treat ourselves to the Flight of Wines available with each course!!  I almost forgot to mention the petit fours with coffee....they arrived in a lidded wooden box which was left on our table after being explained to us - the orange and almond cluster and the coconut macaroon were my personal favourites...if I was forced to choose.  All in all a wonderful experience - lovely atmosphere, attentive and friendly staff and fabulous food. We will be back!

title: Husbands birthday dinner - a real treat
comment: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to The Tudor Room this weekend. The food was fab and the service impeccable. My only issue was some of the portion sizes were a little small I.e the main and the dessert was probably half of what I'm used to. But loved it!

title: Standards have dropped
comment: We could say we are regulars have eating at the Tudor room 6/7 times and have seen 3 head chefs, food is nice, unfortunately the service just is not good enough. if they really want a Michelin star they need to sort the front of house staff out and improve customer service, our head waiteress acted as if she didn't want to be there. From the moment we arrived at the bar, we ordered two glasses of premium rose champagne and notice the barman pour the leftover champagne from a open bottle and of course intending to top it up from a fresh bottle, I quickly pointed it out that the already poured leftover was flat. Overall we found the service very cold and it seemed the hotel was making cutbacks on staff, sharing the one wine waiter between the 2 restaurants. Taking the dirty plates out of the restaurant to the main kitchen to be cleaned. The restaurant lacked that friendly personal service you get at other well run restaurants, they just seemed please when we asked for the bill, not even a chocolate offered at the end of the meal. We won't be returning here again

title: Fantastic restaurant.
comment: Loved our experience at the Tudor room. The food is sublime. The restaurant is very intimate. The wait staff are perfectly delightful. The sommelier is extremely knowledgable and also has a magnificent moustache to boot!  Every single plate of food was executed to perfection and I would like to thank the chef and his/her team for a wonderful evening of indulgence.  We will be returning …

title: Dinner
comment: My husband and I had dinner in The Tudor Room on Saturday to celebrate our birthday and we were as knocked out by the food, wine, service and ambiance as we always are. This is our fourth visit and it only gets better. We are keen foodies and have eaten at many Michelin starred restaurants and the Tudor room is certainly as good as some of them. A not to be missed treat that has become our new favourite. Well done to Chef and all the staff. Bob & Eve Budge

title: Surrey's "Hidden Gem"
comment: Having visited with friends recently, I felt compelled to express my views on this "hidden gem" of a restaurant. Whilst there appears to be a great deal of clamour for this restaurant scooping Michelin Star accolades this year, it really has to be tasted to be believed! The first impression is one of stepping back in time when you enter this Tudor building, but once past the grand entrance there is a more modern cocktail bar, with an extensive gin selection to wet the appetite! Good friendly service from the young lady (Beth?) in the bar, led to a delicious selection of canapés whilst we were offered the menus and an explanation of what was to come... We were then invited through to the restaurant by Jenny, the restaurant manager, to a very impressive and intimate dining room. The service was professional, yet friendly and not overbearing. Steve the Sommelier was unique in his approach to his wine flight recommendations. A touch of humour with a vast amount of knowledge was a breathe of fresh air and led to some interesting yet perfectly balanced combinations. The food was the star of the show! Douglas Balish, the head chef, impressed with every course we consumed. Everything from the amuse bouche to the petit fours was executed to perfection. I had the scallops to start, beef for main course and strawberry dessert, all delightful but special praise has to be reserved for the langoustine tea, wow! The flavours were sublime and this could be the "signature dish" of the Tudor Room, as there simply was nothing we could fault. The petit fours were fantastic and exceeded expectation. My friends thoroughly enjoyed their meals and were as impressed as I. I look forward to visiting again and dare say a Michelin Star is a very realistic achievement come September, when compared to other London Michelin restaurants we have visited in the past. Well done! criticism comes quickly, praise is harder to earn, we will be back!

title: Dinner booking in Tudor Restuarant
comment: The whole experience from the start to the finish was extremely enjoyable. The staff in both the bar and the dining area could not have done more to make our evening better. The food was presented to a very standard and tasted wonderful. Thanks Great Fosters. We will definitely be coming back in the near future.

title: Great Anniversary Celebration
comment: Booking our wedding anniversary was easy enough and they even assisted with delivering flowers for my wife to the table! We were well looked after from the moment we arrived. The dinner was excellent and the knowledge of the wines to go with the food was outstanding. A great evening and we will be back.

title: In my top 3 best meals ever
comment: Everything about the meal and wine flight was perfection.. incredible mixtures of textures and flavours - absolutely delicious. Summed up by a french businessman at another table overheard declaring to a colleague that he was reconsidering all preconceptions of british food - and he hadn't even got to the main course! Wonderful service too - an absolute treat.

title: Romantic Evening Out
comment: Beautiful setting within the Great Fosters establishment on the outskirts of Egham. Discreet private dining area for approximately 12 guests - he food as exemplary and the Sommelier's knowledge was extensive as well as realistic in terms of identifying wines and drinks to accompany the meal

title: Outstanding Meal
comment: Dined here with a group of friends. Outstanding food and service, can't recommend it highly enough. Having dined in several Michelin starred restaurants I think this is easily as good as any I have been to. Several members of our party had food allergies and intolerances and all were catered for which was particularly impressive. Looking forward to returning!

title: Great breakfast!
comment: We were lucky to have breakfast served in the Tudor room on a recent stay at Great Fosters. It felt very intimate, relaxed and cosy. There is a massive mirror to one end o the room and the other end were Windows on to the drive at the front of the house. We had a table for two by the fireplace. The selection of food for breakfast was excellent and very well presented. Fresh fruit, cereals, cold meat etc and then there was hot food to order. Very enjoyable and a nice way to end our stay.

title: Perfection
comment: Always enjoy coming here, lovely set menu with very perfect dishes. Superlative langustine tea was very impressive. Interesting wines with each course not over keen on some of the choice would of been nice to offer a few good French wines rather than mostly new world. Will return again

title: The Tudor Room, why has this restaurant not got a Michelin star
comment: Having eaten here on a few occasions before, this restaurant has reached new heights of excellence. From the outstanding amuse bouche, through to the final mouthful, the whole meal was excellent. However, three courses of the set menu were completely stellar and would grace any Michelin starred restaurant: A first course of Anjou squab pigeon, superbly cooked, moist and well defined flavour with a surprise farcie under the leg. The Langoustine in fish tea, with chilli and lemon grass and the chocolate and mango dessert, all complex plates of food with every ingredient earning its place to complete the balance of the dish. Coupled with interesting and knowledgeable wines service and friendly waiting staff who were very patient with our animated table of eight people, it is mystery as to why the Tudor Room has not got a star.

title: Fine dining at its best
comment: We had lunch with best friends in the Tudor room at Great Fosters last Friday. The atmosphere in the intimate restaurant was wonderful and gave an excellent background to what can only be described as a splendid meal. The presentation of the food was exquisite and served to enhance the delicious flavours and textures of the food and wine that we were served. Steve the sommelier was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful with wine selections and these complemented the food choices perfectly. It was a real treat meeting Dougie the chef after the meal, this rounded off the lunch perfectly. It certainly won't be long before this restaurant becomes Michelin starred, it really does deserve to be.

title: Outstanding cuisine and service
comment: Had a marvellous lunch last week in the Tudor Room at Great Fosters. A group of 8 of us all thoroughly enjoyed a variety of food choices and everone raved about the quality. Personally the cured mackerel and langoustine tea were highlights and I also loved an innovative side of bovril butter! All accompanied by delicious customised wine choices from Steve the sommelier, and the usual attentive service from the lovely Great Fosters staff. Highly recommended!

title: Lunch
comment: 6 of us had lunch on Friday 13th, every aspect was simply perfect. The staff are excellent, the Sommelier has an encyclopedic knowledge of wines, as well as a feel for matching with food. The star has to be the Chef, his imagination, vision and skill is beyond compare and we all agreed that his food was as good, if not better than anything we had ever eaten. Michelin stars surely beckon!

title: Calling back memories from four years ago.
comment: It has become a family tradition to celebrate important dates at Great Fosters. Our Golden Wedding Anniversary was held in the Tudor Room, so we had booked our 54th Anniversary this year in our favourite Restaurant again. We had actually tried to book a table there a few times without success. This time I was lucky to get a table for our special day. It did us justice. The seven course meal was exceptional and delicious. We could not resist the home made bread and found the various amuse bouches quite interesting and different. The service was efficient and friendly and all the staff who attended us made us welcome and congratulated us on our Anniversary.

title: Nice dining and superior sommelier!
comment: We were lucky enough to be taken here for a treat by good friends. The menu provided a lovely variety and I was extremely impressed with the Sommelier's ability to match each of our chosen courses with the perfect glass of wine.  There were some lovely surprises here like the canapes (which must be consumed in one bite - note to self!); the selection of butters to go with the freshly baked bread and the small jars and condiments that came with the cheese selection.  Definitely worth another visit - even better if you can be taken as someone else's guest.

title: Birthday treat
comment: Took the husband for dinner to Great Fosters as a birthday treat. The service was exceptional and the food delicious. Could not fault the experience. Particular favourite of mine was the langoustine tea and the boxster cheese.

title: Delightful
comment: Really nice restaurant small as it is with maybe only 20 covers it offers some nice cooking. Tasting menu with a wine flight on our visit we liked most of the wines

title: Simply stunning
comment: Huge thanks to everyone in the Tudor Room for a truly memorable dinner last night. The service is so friendly and the food is remarkable.  The cured mackerel stands out as a highlight - delicate flavours beautifully balanced. And the accompanying wine selections were perfect. Looking forward to my next visit.

title: Amazing experience
comment: Visited the Tudor room with friends. It is an amazing dining experience from the warm welcome . The food was stunning and good choice of wine list.We will be back

title: Wonderful experience
comment: Having booked this meal as a birthday treat, we were delighted from start to finish, with almoet every aspect of our experience. So much did we enjoy it we popped back the following day for a hot chocolate and a look around the grounds!  Set in a charming, and fascinating venue, we were immediately impressed by the way we were greeted. Professional, friendly and also down to earth, we found that all of the staff were a pleasure to speak to. In particular the host who had just started working in the last week went out his way to make us feel welcome, as did the sommelier. Often in such a fine venue there can be pomposity, or a feeling that the restaurant belittles the guests. Particularly those for whom a visit is a treat, and who don't have the luxury of bulging wallets! In this case the service was really friendly, informative and a credit to the venue.  The restaurant itself is very intimate. At first I was a little nervous that it may be too so, as we could certainly hear every word of the diners next to us. In the event this relaxed, and it was not an issue, but was one minor consideration. When eating I. Such decadent surroundings it is hard to really find fault however! The food was sublime, each course inventive and flavoursome, and just the right amount of food. From lovely canapés at the start, bovril butter and warm home made bread, and a bizarre but flavoursome langoustine tea, there were some real surprises. The main course of seabass was a real triumph, and a perfectly sized portion.  This really was a great experience and delivered at the level it hoped. Apart from the slight worry on the intimacy I had two minor points; both of which were inconsequential, but for am impartial review I include. The first point was the orange juice served whilst we waited at the bar came from a carton. I would have expected a default freshly squeezed version at such a venue, and such a price. It was a minor quibble in the wider scheme of things, but one I feel the venue should consider. The second point was confusion over a "free glass" of champagne. The Sommelier was truly excellent, a real pleasure to talk to, and we had thought he offered us a free glass of champagne as it was brought over without us believing there to have been any prior dialogue. I am sure that this was either a misunderstanding on our behalf, or an error on the bill, and I didn't wish to raise it for causing a scene at the end of a wonderful evening. We were both s bit confused why it had been charged for however, and certainly wouldn't have accepted the champagne had we known it would cost. That said it tasted lovely and again didn't detract from a really lovely experience.  I hope to return soon and wholeheartedly recommend this place to anyone.

title: Perfect in almost every way
comment: We celebrated a birthday here, and were curious to see if Great Fosters lived up to its reputation, both generally and on TA. Arriving in the dark as we did on a dank November evening, the first impression of the beautifully floodlit building is that you are entering a very special place. And indeed you are as you proceed through the tiny door, head bent low, and emerge into a magnificent hall with blazing a fire. Looking slightly over-awed by the opulence of our surroundings, we were soon reassured by the approach of a charming gentlemen who ushered us to the bar for a pre-dinner drink. We were then taken to the Tudor Room itself which is charming and intimate: there are only 26 covers. I was slightly disappointed that the menu was different from that shown on the website, but we soon found enough items to enjoy. The cuisine is modern and trendy with what might at first seem to be strange combinations: sea bass combined with chicken. But of course the chef knows what he's doing and it was really delicious. The rest of the meal was equally good, and the service perfect.  All in all it was a thoroughly delightful evening, made more so by the charming staff who served us and also explained the history of the place. So intrigued were we that we returned next day to have a look around in the daylight and explore the extensive grounds. I certainly look forward to eating again at Great Foster and can whole-hardheartedly recommend it. Two slight negatives: my pre-dinner drink in the bar was not up to the standard I would expect from such a high class establishment. I had expected that fresh orange juice would have been de rigueur ,instead of which I got something that tasted as though it had come from a cardboard carton in the "Tesco value" range!  Similarly with the hot chocolate I had when I returned the next day: this was very nondescript, tasting as though it was made from a packet with a bit of hot water. I speak as I find, so I both praise and criticize where I feel it is appropriate to do so. These two negatives are only minor points, and did not detract from my overall enjoyment. However, they could so easily be rectified. Food for thought for the Management!

title: It is impossible to over praise this exceptional venue
comment: We had dinner last night in this superb restaurant. The menu we had was a series of superb dishes that were beautifully presented exceptionally cooked and flavours of tremendous variety and quality. The staff are polite and helpful and do their jobs with distinction Special kudos to the Sommelier who offered such helpful guidance and introduced us to two stunning wines. Well worth a visit.

title: Superb
comment: This is a wonderful place to dine, service is excellent, food exquisite, I cannot fault this place okay so it's a bit expensive but so what it's well worth it.

title: FABULOUS
comment: Fabulous in every way. The food was sublime and we chose the wine flight. The evening was made by Steve the Sommelier, he was the perfect host with great knowledge matching the wines not only to the courses but also to our particular tastes. Thank you so much can wait to return!!!

title: Sumptuous
comment: We ate in the Tudor room 6 months ago and thought it was excellent then but our more recent experience has topped that! Everything, from the quality and inventiveness of the dishes and the attention to detail to the inspired wine choices (thank you Stephen) and the level of service was first class. It was both luxurious and also relaxed - an exquisite meal in wonderful surroundings.

title: Friendly fine dining made me smile.
comment: Sometimes its nice to have a treat. Knock off work on Thursday, book a great room, organise the kids, grab the wife and spend a few days to recoup, recharge, spend some time just being together. Sometimes in this situation the food doesn't matter. A bowl of great pasta, a bowl of soup with some fresh crusty bread is enough. Occasionally its nice to dress for dinner, watch your wife as she slips on that new dress and gets on her heels.  This is the perfect restaurant for the evening. The setting is elegant yet welcoming. There is a formality to the room but this is tempered by the friendly, down to earth, genuine staff.  The chef here is excellent and runs a very good kitchen. There is technique and skill in every dish. Presentation in intelligent and attractive. Everything is thought through and executed with fine precision. Great flavour and lovely consistency.  The sommelier here is a treasure. He is the main focus for me in this restaurant. He is both accessible and characterful, with a good breath of knowledge and style.  A half bottle of burgundy for her and wines by the glass for me, were perfectly judged and interesting.  A very fine restaurant, run by a very fine team, serving very fine food and drink. Add a very lovely partner and you end up with a very fine evening. .

title: Outstanding venue
comment: Booked a family meal here for our Golden Wedding Anniversary and we were not disappointed. There were canapes and cocktails in the bar followed by a superb meal in the restaurant. Each dish was a work of art with incredible flavour and served by knowledgeable and helpful staff.The Sommelier is quite a character and guided us to amazing wines.If it's a cold or windy evening I would suggest you request a seat away from the window which in true Elizabethan style is very drafty. Don't know why we haven't eaten here before but it is now on our list of places to revisit.

title: Delicious dinner with a friend
comment: The food was delicious, scallops and soft shell crab then succulent grilled lamb, perfect! The staff are very friendly and helpful.

title: Food and service was excellent,
comment: Food and service was excellent, recommend to anyone who fancy a good bit of grub and a couple of nice tasty cobras.  only down side is their music selection....

title: Local Treasure
comment: Consistency is a key Awesome Thai quality. The restaurant tends always to deliver on service, ambience and of course amazing food. We had duck curry and beef in oyster sauce, both of which were very good. But there are no bad opinion s on this menu. Moreover, diners get good value for money, at about £35/person including service, both in terms of food and wine. There is always chilled Singha available and the complimentary pre-starters are a nice touch. Clientele fairly local but non-Barnes patrons are definitely on the up.

title: The best takeaway we've had in years
comment: We had the most wonderful meal delivered to my elderly parents house in Barnes last week for six family members. I preordered, asking it to be delivered at 7.15pm. They arrived on the dot. The meal had so many extras and freebies and was utterly delicious. Also lots of fab leftovers we've all enjoyed since. Thank you Awesome Thai. Fantastic service. Phenomenal food. We were amazed what good value it was too.

title: Wonderful restaurant in intimate room
comment: see hotel review - this is a wonderful gem, food beautifully presented and cooked, superb service. Our only 'complaint' is that the wine flight (matching wines to each course) had very generous servings

title: Anniversary
comment: Eating at The Tudor Room is a wonderful experience and one we enjoyed on Friday evening for a wedding anniversary celebration. It must be taken as read that the food is fantastic, the tastes the chef creates are a real treat. Wonderful food is only part of the story. The staff are what what pushes the event into a truly memorable experience. The sommelier is helpful and knowledgable. The waiting staff are knowledgable about the food and are genuinely interested in your dining experience.  The actual dining room is warm and inviting. It's a wonderful mix between cosy and formal. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants something just a little bit special.

title: Delightful change.
comment: This had only just reopened the last time we stayed there so we have only breakfasted there once. The food was from the same kitchen therefore it was of the usual excellent standard, the only thing that changed was the ambiance, it was relaxed and seemed appropriate for the setting.

title: A superior dining experience for a special occasion
comment: Had a birthday dinner at the Tudor Room. It was simply wonderful in every way and could not be bettered. As well as top-notch food exquisitely presented, all the staff really care about the quality of the guests' experience and this attitude is consistent among all staff. They did a brilliant job of satisfying a complex set of dietary requirements, with style and good grace at all times. Special thanks to chef Douglas and sommelier Steve for their utmost professionalism and expertise. The venue too is stunning (and huge): a vast Tudor mansion with grand gravel drive, formal gardens and lake (ideal for a summer pre-dinner drink) and several rooms to sit and relax after a meal. Was a pity to leave after this amazing experience!

title: One of the best meals I have eaten
comment: Food was superb. Many courses with wonderful blend of flavours. To show how good it was, one of the courses included brie ice-cream and figs (I do not like either of these) but blended together I really enjoyed the course and this surprised me.

title: Perfect blend of inventiveness with tradition
comment: I had the good fortune of securing a reservation for the Tutor Room. It was like eating in a palace with the most exquisite food which was a perfect blend of inventiveness with tradition. And this was my third time of working with the sommelier, Stephen, who never disappoints. At the risk of sounding too over the top, I have to say that I every time I am at Great Fosters, I pinch myself. It is magical.

title: A memorable evening and taste sensation
comment: We were made to feel welcome in very pleasant surroundings. The service was exemplary with knowledgeable and friendly staff. We were entertained at each course and all (pre-advised gluten-free) dietary requirements were met. Comprehensive wine list and do try the Recioto della Valpolicella dessert wine, perfect with blue cheese. If you are looking for a thoroughly enjoyable evening, look no further.

title: Anniversary Meal
comment: Intimate room and excellent service. Simon the Sommelier was fab (had the most intriguing moustache!) I had scallop to start then the pork. Hubby had Grouse & Beef. He's allergic to fish & nuts so they gave him an amended menu to choose from. All the other mini palate cleansers & amuse-bouche were delicious.  All in all an excellent meal, will definitely come back!

title: Incredible food impeccable service
comment: A wonderful dining experience from the warm welcome, sensational cooking, knowledgeable and friendly sommelier. It couldn't have been bettered. A real spoiling treat. Thank you Great Fosters. We will be back

title: I have lived in Barnes now
comment: I have lived in Barnes now almost a year. I have to say that I am so glad we have awesome thai in Barnes. whenever I go there the staffs are very welcoming. The food is absolutely delicious. I used to live in New York and have been trying to find the taste that I experienced in NY. This is it! no further. I love it. Thank you so much being in Barnes.

title: Great By Name.....
comment: Superb in reality! A magnificent setting, polite, attentive, knowledgeable but unobtrusive staff, fabulous food and an extensive wine list that I am sure contains something to delight all palettes. The evening started by us remarking admiringly at the wood panelled reception area, which is acessed by a distinctive small wooden entrance door, but took a worrying turn shortly after when my partner slipped and fell in the bar area. However, the quick thinking of the staff averted a potential serious knee injury by providing an ice pack, a glass of champagne & a Cosmopolitan cocktail, which combined to ease the pain! The dining area is intimate (only 24 covers) but surprisingly unpretentious, especially when the near-Michelin star quality of the food is taken into account. We ended the evening by having one last drink in the aforementioned reception / lobby area.  Surrey & Hampshire are blessed with more than their fair share of these sort of places, but Great Fosters is right up there with the best of them.

title: It was our first time visiting
comment: It was our first time visiting our local Thai place and it’s didn’t disappoint. We started with a few started and 2 main dishes. It’s simply good service, food, atmosphere and staff. We were served by Yai and he was very attentive with us. Needles to say we had a good experience and will be returning. Take a looks at out photos for the delicious choices we had. BTW, it’s out first dine in since to lock down has eased and they are very well prepared to ensure that their customers are safe. They have shields between each table and all of their staff where PPE to be safe.

title: Best Thai Food take out
comment: This is the only thai takeaway my family and I order from. After trying other thai food restaurants locally for take out & being eastern asian, we have never been disappointed. Food is authentic, reasonable priced and tasty. Great customer service too. One day my family. & I will dine here. Highly recommended. Evans Family

title: Best local Thai by far
comment: Great service and fantastic food The soft shell crab melts in the mouth and the beef salad is outstanding, I ordered the fresh prawn rolls after the restaurant offered complimentary and Sally who was our hostess and fantastic service manager did a fantastic job, we will be visiting this Thai restaurant again for both it’s great hospitality, quality of service and food - very very impressed and they definitely live up to their name ‘Awesome’

title: Out of lockdown into excellent Thai food
comment: Awesome Thai worked hard during lockdown to deliver excellent Thai food to Barnes residents and those living in surrounding suburbs. My wife and I booked ourselves into the freshly re-opened restaurant last Saturday evening at short notice and were given an excellent table as well as a premium 8.30pm time slot. Complimentary starters were a nice touch as ever and very tasty. Starters and main course both excellent. Strongly recommend the duck curry. With Singha beers and a bottle of wine overall bill was very reasonable at £65 for two. A few anti-Covid measures but all done with safety and style in mind. Tables are separated by clear Perspex sheets, which in no way felt intrusive or destructive the lively atmosphere of this stylish, local Thai restaurant. Keep up the good work Awesome Thai - it’s great to have you fully open again!

title: Amazing food.
comment: Wonderful atmosphere and incredible food. The service was good and we even met the chef - had to congratulate him on the quality of our dinner.

title: A wonderful restaurant experience
comment: Food was fabulous as was the service. The 'flight of wines' appears expensive but was well worth the price and the interraction with the sommelier was a highlight of our stay.

title: By far the most superior place to eat in the area
comment: We are absolutely blessed to have a hotel and restaurant of this quality and stature in the area. The service and presentation is fantastic and the food?... Well I can't tell you how good it is. I've eaten here several times and although it's expensive it is by far and away excellent value if only for the experience. The taster menu along with a flight of wine is a must.

title: Really special birthday evening
comment: I booked The Tudor Room for my wife's birthday, being new to the area, I went straight to trip advisor and simply booked because it is listed as no1 restaurant in Egham. It did not disappoint! We started with cocktails on the terrace, aided by a beautiful summer evening, but the grounds are stunning and the non alcoholic cocktail menu (and execution) made my pregnant wife feel like she was not missing out. We were served canapés and olives while we perused the menu. I'd mentioned it was her birthday when booking, but didn't expect that every staff member we came across would wish her happy birthday. A really nice touch. Dinner in the Tudor Room was fantastic. The plates of food were really elegant and extremely tasty. My Pork main was the highlight, but the little dishes in between courses, were great too. Finishing with a 'choose your own' style cheese board, was also good. My only criticism...the crackers with the cheese were a little uninspiring. The staff were excellent, all too often in 5 star hotels and restaurants of this quality, it can feel like the staff are a little too well mannered and polished...not human enough. But here, while extremely polite, the staff still have personality and are 'normal'. Special mentions to the restaurant manager and the sommelier for making us feel very welcome and valued. It was the perfect special treat for my wife's birthday!

title: A star is around the corner
comment: What can I say. Not posted on trip advisor for sometime however my visit to the tudor rooms is worth coming out of retirement for. A skilled and well thought out considered tasting menu crafted out of a kitchen no bigger than a domestic two bed house. Applaud the two man team whom did the job of a whole brigade in turning out stunning  food worthy of, in my opinion 1 star at least. Service and sommelier knew their stuff and struck a great balance of great service and humour. Great evening topped off by the chef Dougie Balish making an appearance to thanks us for our custom. Honest guys...this place will rival any one of two star eaterie experience you may have enjoyed to date. Must go.

title: Good food but stiff environment
comment: We tried the four course menu (58 pounds per person plus service and drinks).  Whilst the food is enjoyable, the room is small and atmosphere is kind of a killer when you feel that everyone can hear your conversation.

title: Valentines Night OMG
comment: I must start by saying this was one of my all time best nights out ever. The staff were totally amazing and even remembered us from when we had our wedding there last year, the food was out of this world I would recommend this to anybody who wants a special night out, and if you can stay there the night as well it would finish off your evening perfectly.

title: The best, you must visit
comment: I booked a table at the Tudor Room for our 5th anniversary.  The whole experience from walking in to leaving was fantastic. The staff were friendly, attentive, and knowledgable. Great Fosters itself is an amazing venue, the gardens looked lovely - we want to return and stay.  When I booked it some weeks ago, they causally asked if it was for anything, I just happened to say it was for a anniversary. The Tudor Room must be close to a Michelin star, we loved every course, each course was amazing, the presentation, balanced, and the favours were all perfection. It was faultless, and when I mean faultless I mean totally faultless.  When we retired to the bar to open cards and our present, we were followed with chocolates and the staff to congratulate us on our anniversary. Nice touch, and we did not expect it.  We decided against the wine flight, and instead had two half bottles, well priced and complimented the whole meal.  Having eaten in Maze, Dinner, Nobu - Great Fosters is right up there.

title: Superb six course dinner
comment: We went yesterday to try out the six course tasting menu with flights of wine ahead of it's opening in April. Of course you can't fault the location - steeped in history and a joy to see in all it's glory.  The food was cooked to perfection. Presentation was stunning and the menu was perfectly balanced. Stephen matched the Champagne and wine beautifully with some interesting choices. The service was first class and we were made to feel welcome and relaxed in the grand surroundings. Make sure you book as it'll only be open three nights a week and I'm sure once people have tried it, there'll be a long waiting list!!

title: Absolutely magical meal, heading for a star!
comment: If you haven’t visited before, Great Fosters is a gorgeous 16th century hunting lodge set within acres of beautiful grounds. Although I have dined here a couple of times before within the Estate Grill (slightly more casual, although still with the same Great Fosters prestige), which I have always enjoyed, I decided to treat myself and my boyfriend to dinner in The Tudor Room, as it has recently reopened under a new chef. With only 24 covers, I was confident that the attention to detail and flavours were going to be impeccable, as this is what Great Fosters is renowned for, but the standards on show far surpassed any of my expectations. The menu is a four-course sample menu, which comes with a selection of starter, main and dessert accompanied by two additional ‘sandwich’ courses and canapés to begin. We also chose to have the accompanying wine flight – why the hell not! We started with a deconstructed appetiser of ‘tzatziki’ – yogurt powder with cucumber/mint gel served perfectly ‘half and half’. You wouldn’t think you could make something as simple as this so interesting, yet the two halves combined together with such a fresh flavour which really demonstrated the different and new ‘future’ direction the meal was heading in – simple yet refined. With this course we were affectionately informed by the sommelier that ‘to be honest, nothing really pairs with yogurt’ as we were poured a glass of champagne – no complaints here!  I opted for the Cornish crab to start – a beautiful, if not unusual combination of crab along with a light, vibrant sweetcorn broth, basil and broccoli. My boyfriend went for the fois gras which included flavours of smoked duck, coffee, hazelnut and orange – a challenging combination, but each flavour stood out yet blended together in perfect harmony. The second course, Langoustine tea, is knock out.  You could smell the aroma of the Asian style broth as you glanced around the room, everyone waiting in anticipation and excitement for theirs to be served. When it arrives, it’s as pretty as a picture, a bright, soft, peach langoustine tail, perched elegantly amongst micro herbs and a beautiful purple flower on top. It really looks too good to eat. The Asian broth is then poured from glass teapot over the top for the flavours to infuse together – completely Alice in Wonderland - the flavour is subtle enough not to overpower the fish, but the back tone of lemongrass and ginger is present enough to provide that addictive, salty umami flavour you get with Asian cuisine. This needs to be the hotel’s trademark dish. Next up I went for the Turbot with asparagus, macaroni and wild garlic. The fish was cooked to absolute perfection. I felt there could have been some more sauce present, and perhaps the macaroni might have been better substituted for a softer tortellini or filled pasta, but the dish was beautifully clean – what a fish course should be – let the produce speak for itself. This dish was surprisingly accompanied by a red wine, which you wouldn’t expect to work, but I was super impressed and loved the surprise that this brought with it, particularly as you could hear other tables in the restaurant also discussing their delight and surprise with the sommelier. The boyfriend went for the aged fillet of beef with bone marrow, wild mushrooms and truffle for his main. A marriage of all the best things. Again, the aroma of the truffle filled the room upon arrival, and I must admit I was a little jealous as it brought true nostalgia of a visit to Tuscany last year for my mum’s birthday. The beef was cooked beautifully bloody and the truffle rested elegantly on top of the marrow in the bone – truly stunning. Next up was the pre-dessert – another jaw dropper.  Really simple flavours of green apple and sesame, and nothing else. It reminded me of eating sesame snaps as a young child, and again the flavour was crisp and clean and a perfect palette cleanser before dessert. A few words of warning for you here however that this course is accompanied by a shot of Calvados; killer. Finally we went for dessert. Well, I say we, I was far too full at this point (and to be perfectly honest, probably still recovering from the Calvados), but the better half went for the strawberries with yogurt, mint, almond and orange blossom. Now, I don’t do desserts, but I pretty much devoured most of his, which must mean it was pretty darn good. We then retreated to one of the lounges for a much-required espresso, where we were presented with probably the best ‘Pandora’s box’ of petit fours I have ever seen. Each one was lovingly decorated, and the perfect finish to an incredible evening. I must also mention the service here, which was, impeccable, to the point where I could hear one table asking their waitress to attend their wedding! All in all, I would strongly recommend a visit to The Tudor Room as soon as you can, as it’s likely to be fully booked once the Michelin inspectors have been. For more reviews please visit www.greedyginger.com

title: Amazing
comment: I booked a night at the hotel for myself and my husband and upgraded our meal as part of our package, so glad I did the Tudor room was amazing the food was out of world. The staff were brilliant I couldn't fault any thing about meal or service we will be back!!

title: Sensational Supper
comment: Recently ate at The Tudor Room and the whole experience was wonderful. We were the first diners to arrive, and for a short time had the undivided attention of our waitress and the sommelier, so had a good laugh with them. Great recommendations from both about the dishes and the wines, and my husband especially enjoyed his 'flight of wine' where a different wine accompanied each course. Every course exceeded our expectations and the Tudor setting is truly stunning. I would thoroughly recommend this restaurant, and suspect it won't be long before they gain their first Michelin star.

title: Excellent food in a wonderful location
comment: As you enter the grounds of Great Fosters and see the 16th century hunting lodge at the top of the long drive you immediately realise that you are coming somewhere special and feel priveliged to be able to eat in a working Tudor grand house. The food and service at Great Fosters has not always been great - it has taken ten years for my wife and I to return after a memorable (for all the wrong reasons) evening at the hotel. It was therefore with some trepidation that we entered the hotel. We had been tempted back by the announcement of the new head chef, Douglas Balish, arriving and based on his predigree felt it was worth the risk. We had pre-dinner drinks in the cocktail bar, a bright, airy space with great views over the manicured gardens. As we were eating in The Tudor Room the first of the amuse bouches were served with our drinks - wonderful pastry packages filled with cheese and taramasalata on small blinis.  We were then shown into the Tudor Room. A relatively small room enlarged by an enormous mirror on the wall opposite the windows looking out onto the gardens. With its deep red walls, a large tapestry hanging on one and the decorated wooden beams overhead the right mix between medieval and contemporary has been hit. There are only twenty four covers each night that the restaurant is open. The tables are far enough part for privacy and the seats are comfortable. The tables are quite wide so there is a distance between yourself and your companion. There is a £58 fixed priced menu and no a la carte. There is an option of a 'flight of wines' for an additional £65 where the sommelier gives you a glass of a different wine for each course. We did not take that option. A word about the style of food that Douglas prepares for you. All the food that is served, including the amuse bouches, are light in flavour, beautifully presented and not excessive in size. A chef that serves a similar style of food would be Jason Atherton. While there is a fixed price menu there is a good choice of starters, mains and desserts. We were surprised when we were told that the pre-starter would be tzatzicki having only seen it on holiday always the same way as a cold cucumber dish in a white sauce. When the dish arrived with the finely cut green and the separate finely cut white which you mixed togther it was a very pleasant and refreshing surprise. My wife and I chose the crab for our starters and this was immaculately presented with the crab meat topped with crab jelly, a small piece of sweetcorn and a sweetcorn consomme. Wonderfully light and tasty. The next course was a langoustine tea which was a langoustine served with fresh flowers with the langoustine tea. This was light and with strong hints of asia. My wife had the turbot with pasta and I had the beef served with the most miniscule but wonderful range of mushrooms. Both were delightful. A mango and lime amuse bouche followed. For dessert my wife chose the cheese. You are offered to pick five cheeses from a range of seven. All of the cheeses are British and cover the range of styles. The cheese was served with truffle honey and pickle. The desserts are listed by their main ingredient - chocolate, strawberry, cheese, etc. I chose the strawberry which was served with mint, a wonderful sweet crisp with yoghurt underneath. I saw the chocolate dessert being served to another guest and that looked really good too. Tea and petit fours followed (an additional £6.50) and we took ours by the wood fire in the main hall. It was a perfect end to a wonderful gourmet evening. The service throughout the evening was friendly and very efficient. All the staff knew what they were doing and knew the food well. I would highly recommend this restaurant for a very special evening and would suggest going before Douglas Balish gets his well deserved Michelin star and the not unreasonable price goes up.

title: In a word - Superb!
comment: We ate in the Tudor Room at Great Fosters last Saturday and had a wonderful dining experience. The menu is innovative and the dishes beautifully presented as well as delicious. All courses and wines are announced by the waiters as they are served. On this occasion we decided to take the offer of a flight of wines with our meal and it only enhanced the experience. The wines Steve (our Sommelier) chose were absolutely superb and complimented the dishes perfectly. I do not think it will be long before Great Fosters earns the Michelin Star it is aiming for and would encourage anyone thinking of trying the Tudor Room to do so now, before it becomes so well known it's impossible to get a booking.

title: Enjoyable evening
comment: We have visited great fosters before and always enjoyed it. This time we were showed to the bar, the table we were given wasn't very nice which was a bit of a shame, we were sat right in the middle of the room and felt a bit on show.  Our table for dinner wasn't until 7 so we ordered a bottle of wine. The waiter didn't offer me to taste the wine before hand, he just poured the glasses and took the bottle back behind the bar. Luckily we liked it! We also had to ask for nibbles as usually they are always served with drinks. This was brought once asked. Our wine wasn't topped up, we had to ask for more, and we were brought 2 glasses of Pinot! We had to inform the waiter that our actual wine was behind the bar. Just a little less attentive than we usually get here. Once 7 came we were showed to our table. The Tudor room itself is stunning, intimate but light, comfortable chairs with beautiful art on the wall and a lovely fireplace. Our waitress was lovely, funny and friendly and always helpful. The food I can't really fault... I had crab and my partner had fois gras, both amazing and really fresh. For main I had pork and my partner had beef, it was so succulent and tasty! The little courses in between were a great touch.  We had NZ Sauvignon with the meal and a glass of champagne which was just delightful.  Dessert was a chocolate hazelnut type mousse, was lovely but not amazing. The cheese was really varied, I didn't like one of them but it was nice to have a change and sample ones I haven't before. The only slight criticism was the crackers, they were plain and boring! The truffle honey was so powerful... You only need a tiny amount!  When the bill came they charged us for 2 bottles of wine, but this was quickly rectified!  Other than that we really enjoyed our evening here. The food really is special and the ambience and atmosphere is also. A real treat.

title: A little gem!
comment: Its fantastic! Food sublime, service impeccable, location fabulous! If you like gin & tonic - they have a wonderful array of gins which are well worth trying before dinner. The food was sublime. We also chose the wine flight which was spot on! The sommelier, Stephen, certainly knows his wines. The service by all staff was very warm and friendly and nothing was too much bother. We had a fabulous evening - the grounds/gardens are well worth a visit as the location is beautiful. The building is of historical significance - Great Fosters - 15th century. Beautifully and tastefully restored. A beautiful luxury hotel. If you have something to celebrate - well recommended!!

title: Great experience
comment: I picked Tudor Room for our anniversary dinner knowing it's been re-launched and has a new chef.  Service has been really good, both pre- and during dinner. Waiting staff was always there but not obtrusive, friendly but very tactful.  Similar story with sommelier - confident, to the point, charming persona (loved the mustache!). Good choice of red wines at all price points.  Food - I give an overall 4.5 stars only because the main (beef) was slightly too salty for my taste. Overall all six courses were excellent, few really fresh ideas - especially the pre-dessert, which I think was the most memorable! Overall we feel this was a great value for money. I recommend getting there early for afternoon drinks and spend some time in the gardens.

title: Superb!
comment: We cannot recommend this restaurant enough, Michelin star standard food accompanied by fantastic service. The flight of matched wines were superb. Thank you for such a wonderful evening. We will be back.

title: Service fit for a royal!
comment: The intimate atmosphere, elegant and friendly service and excellent food made the special. The dining room only seats about 20 people and we know why. That's so they can give each table the best service possible.

title: Fabulous Food and Great Service
comment: The Tudor Room only seats 24 covers so is very intimate. A high staff to customer ratio ensures excellent service and the wine waiter is brilliant - with a magnificent moustache. Atmosphere of whole place is very 'Tudor' and most enjoyable, although it is a very busy venue for weddings, parties, etc., so it can be a little crowded/noisy. Gardens are lovely for a stroll if the weather is right. Drinks and wines are very expensive hence 4-start rating for value.

title: Luncheon in the Tudor Room
comment: My wife and I booked for luncheon in the Tudor Room on Friday 4th July and were certainly not disappointed. The food was absolutely superb and beautifully presented-the mango/coconut 'poached egg' just exquisite-and the wine suggested by Alper Sahin -the dining room's manager-complimented our meal perfectly. The staff were friendly, attentive and professional and the elegant surroundings made this a truly superb dining experience. We completed our visit by walking around the beautiful gardens and we will most certainly be returning very soon. We have visited the restaurants at Great Fosters several times in the last 18 months and found the standard of service and food consistently of the highest quality.

title: Almost perfect
comment: Three of us had a delicious lunch at the Tudor Room last week. This was our second visit. As before, presentation was exquisite, and service was delightful. We chose different things from the set menu, all terrific, especially the lamb dish. My pollock was also outstanding. But we all had the same dessert, a sort of deconstructed Peach Melba. Whilst it looked great, there was something in one of the accompaniments (which seemed to be like a strip of panna cotta) which left a weird and lingering aftertaste, wish I had asked what this was. However that is a minor point. One thing to mention, the seats against the wall are too low for the height of the tables, we had to ask for extra cushions, again. But don't let that put you off!

title: Superb!
comment: The Tudor Room is undoubtedly one of the best restaurants I have experienced - and that includes a number of Michelin starred establishments. The ambience, service and food are all of the highest standard but the mood is relaxed and not at all stuffy.  My partner and I visited on a Wednesday evening and opted for the 8 course taster menu, which commenced with a perfectly chilled glass of excellent champagne and a variety of canapés. Every course was a delight and there were some interesting and unusual ingredient and flavour combinations. The chef's background as an artist ensured that presentation was faultless and we took a moment to admire each dish before tasting. Portion sizes were well-judged and the wine recommended by the sommelier was a perfect match and surprisingly affordable. We finished the meal with an espresso and a jasmine tea followed by a stroll around the delightful grounds. If you like fine dining then you won't be disappointed and I highly recommend a visit before word gets out and waiting lists become too long!

title: Excellent lunch for the price
comment: We opted for the £29.50 menu du jour - for the price, this was an excellent lunch. Just three choices per course, but all imaginative (eg octopus and watermelon as a starter, and John Dory with oyster panna cotta as a main course) - and a great selection of English cheeses as one of the dessert options. Breads and butters, and an amuse and a pre-dessert, are all part of the prix fixe. A decent wine list and a very friendly reception from Alper Sahin, the maître d', matched the splendid surroundings of the sixteenth century Great Fosters hotel. We'll be back!

title: Superb
comment: Yet again another great meal at The Tudor Room for me and my wife. Great staff, and amazing food. Will yet again be returning.

title: Perfect for that special occasion
comment: If you're looking for that special night out, this is an excellent place to pamper yourself. Visited last week (Wednesday, 10th September) and had a wonderful evening. Started with a pre-dinner drink outside in the wonderful gardens and beautiful surroundings. Staff very attentive and helpful. We were shown to our table in the Tudor Room, which was a small and intimate room.  The al a carte menu offered some wonderful choices and when each course was delivered to us, the staff reminded us of our selection in a most informative and professional manner. Inbetween courses we were presented with some wonderful tasting appetisers. The quality and presentation of all dishes were excellent. I could not fault anything from the level of service, the dishes and attention to detail by all.  Whilst this hotel and restaurant is not cheap, you do get what you pay for and it is perfect for that special occasion.

title: Superb
comment: I'd like to echo what many people have said. This restaurant deserves a Michelin Star. The food is beautifully prepared and the service is faultless. I can't wait to go back soon.

title: Another creative menu from Head Chef Nik Chappell
comment: This is the second time we have eaten here and the second time we have been thoroughly impressed. The Tudor Room is a hidden gem that deserves more notoriety not to mention the Michelin star that they are working towards. We had the 8 course tasting menu for £75 a head. As well as the 8 courses, you receive 4 amuse bouches/canapés each (all excellent with a variety of ideas going on) and 4 types of freshly baked bread with 3 different kinds of butter.  What you get here is a full and indulgent dining experience. Head chef, Nik Chappell really is a genius. He has created all of these original dishes himself and although we really enjoyed the food the first time we visited, he has surpassed himself with the new September menu. Of particular note were the crab, foie gras and venison dishes (the later served with a chocolate sauce that really, really worked!) and both the pre-dessert (light, simple and clever) and dessert were amazing. The first time I went, I said the foie gras dish was one of the best I have ever tasted anywhere, this time I said the same of the venison. If you love fine dining, you will love the innovative and delicious offerings of this kitchen. But go hungry and don't fill up on bread!!! Thank you again to the kitchen and front of house team for a memorable dining experience. Of note: the sous chef is masterchef professionals semi finalist, David Gonzalez. Front of house maître de, is formerly of 2 Michelin star, Latymer at Pennnyhill Park, Mr Mahmood (sorry if I have spelt your name incorrectly) who is excellent and welcoming.

title: A Dream
comment: Had lunch and dinner so many times but also fantastic afternoon tea  Top quality and service  If you want Top English food this is the place to go!

title: Close to Michelin standards
comment: This has been one of the great restaurants in the area. I was very sad when they gave notice of its closure but have been informed that the hotel intends to open it once a month for a "fine dining experience". Well worth making enquiries for great food and service

title: Exceptional!
comment: My wife and I visited yesterday evening for the 8 course taster menu, and it was exceptional! We have been to a lot of Michelin star restaurants, as well as several chasing a star but The Tudor room is by far the best we have experienced. The setting of the hotel is stunning, the service was flawless, and the taster menu was perfectly balanced. All 8 courses were truly amazing, and the wine selection was impressive. We shall definitely be returning.

title: Prepare to be pampered!
comment: Great eight course tasting menu - but expensive wine list. Staff on the ball and treat you like Royalty.

title: Great food, fabulous service
comment: We had a lovely time - mostly as a result of the excellent warm and professional service. Overall I think the price was good - £200 including wine, service and the 8 course set menu- so for us a special treat! My only comment would be that I informed the Tudor Rooms in advance that my boyfriend couldn't eat fish thinking that he would be given an alternative dish and he was given the same dishes but without the fish. As the fish was the centre piece of two of the courses I did wonder if there could have been more thought. Still an excellent meal though and the deserts were incredible!

title: Fantastic food and service
comment: Let's get this over with - by anyone's measure, meals here are expensive. Very expensive. The 8 course taster menu we ordered was £75 each. And the flight of wines adds £55 each. So, what can you expect? Fantastic food. The quality and innovation are top notch. They change items on the menu frequently, and in fact a dish that was new that evening was our favourite. The taster menu gives the chef opportunity to present individual flavours, as well as combinations the are carefully crafted. And the flight of wine gives the sommelier chance to shine, matching each course. We started in the garden with a fruit juice blend as an aperitif. Then some hors d'oeuvres before moving inside. The bread was 4 small hand baked loaves of different flavours with some butter and some seaweed butter accompaniment. The service was excellent. It is a deliberately small dining room, and well served by very professional staff. They have obviously eaten the food they are serving, because they are happy to discuss it with you. We had some quite in-depth conversations about the food and the wine. Thoroughly recommended for that special occasion.

title: Outstanding food and service
comment: We love staying at Great Fosters and have previously enjoyed dining in the main restaurant the Oak Room, which has now become the Estate Grill. The Tudor Room restaurant also opened in April 2013 and this was our first dining experience there. It now makes any visit to this excellent hotel just perfect and we're already looking forwards to our next visit. The food and service are exceptional and the small, intimate dining room could not be bettered. We enjoyed every course of the tasting menu. The whole experience was absolutely wonderful.

title: 8 course tasting menu
comment: Had a wonderful evening thanks to Travelzoo starting with a glass of Bollinger followed by an 8 course tasting menu and all for £99 for 2 people. Excellent venue and service. The Tudor room is small and intimate, the staff were absolutely fantastic, extremely knowledgeable and without doubt the best service I have ever experienced.

title: Great and amazing experience
comment: The service was exceptionally good and the food was as good as any Chef renowned restaurant. Thank you for a wonderful night.

title: Well done modern English
comment: A wonderful example of the complete overhaul of British cuisine. Not your standard fare, but beautifully presented modern English food. Too many courses to count, some bite size, some larger portions, handsomely plated. Professional staff. Our salute to the chef!  Michael F

title: Amazing tasting menu at Great Fosters
comment: Had the most amazing meal in one of the smartest venues. It was our first visit to Great Fosters and from the moment we arrived we were greeted by really friendly but professional staff who showed us around the venue. After exploring the beautiful grounds, we had champagne and canapes in the cocktail bar before our wonderful meal in the Tudor Room, which is a really intimate restaurant. The staff were very professional, knowledgeable, friendly, yet discreet. The different courses were beautifully presented and tasted divine. Alper and his team were brilliant, we also sent our heartfelt compliments to the chefs on such a special menu. We will definitely return to Great Fosters and look forward with pleasure to our next visit to the Tudor Room and also have plans to visit the Estate Grill restaurant. returning

title: Deserves a Michelin star
comment: Perfect place to celebrate a birthday. After a walk in the gardens, we drank champagne outside and then had the tasting menu. Fabulous inspirational food with decent servings and beautifully presented. Great wine list…and you can stay the night as well!

title: Enjoyable
comment: This is our second time. We came last year when they had a different chef and really enjoyed the meal so much, we decided to try it again, and this time we stayed overnight so we could enjoy the wine flight. After enquiring about the tasted wines we decided just to buy a bottle of Meursault and then select some red wines by the glass. There were some issues about the wine service that we were not happy about. The food overall was good, the only real issues was the balance, scallop dish was excellent and served with a little braised pigs cheek, a couple courses later they served a delicious beef dish served with a braised beef shin, (two braised meats a bit too much.) for a tasted menu. Excellent cheese with truffles and a lovey crisp crumpet was perfect with the cheese. unfortunately we found the whole evening rushed, each course was served quickly, by the time the main course had come we still had a full glass of our white wine in front of us. The food is going in the direction of a Michelin star, though the service would need a little improvement.

title: Lovely birthday treat
comment: We visited the Tudor room restaurant last night for the 8 course taster menu. All courses were superb, our particular favourite being the mango and coconut 'egg' - amazing! Chef and all of the Tudor room team were impeccable, I would have no hesitation in thoroughly recommending them for a special evening out

title: FABULOUS RESTAURANT!
comment: Great upscale food in an extraordinary 6th century setting. The service was impeccable and the chef amazing.

title: Superb
comment: My daughter had recently read an excellent review of the restaurant in the Stella magazine of the Sunday Telegraph. (23rd March) Subsequently she booked a table for the four of our family to celebrate her Birthday. Alper Sahin, the restaurant manager was waiting for us in the reception and he escorted us through to the restaurant. We chose the three course lunch (£39 per person) which included an amuse bouche and a pre dessert. The food was beautifully presented, inventive with perfectly balanced flavours. Alper and all the team were friendly, interested, attentive and professional. I would not hesitate to recommend the restaurant.

title: Celebration Dinner
comment: We visited The Tudor Room at Great Fosters for a 40th Wedding Anniversary celebration. The evening started off with cocktails in the bar, followed by the 8 Course Taster menu. Each course was superbly presented (a real feast for the eyes!), and all had impressive flavours.  The staff were attentive and friendly, the Sommelier was extremely knowledgeable and our choices proved to be perfect! The atmosphere was relaxing, and we were made extremely welcome. We thoroughly recommend this venue, for any special occasion.

title: Awesome Dinner
comment: My wife and I had the Taster Menu in the Tudor Room and all we can say is AMAZING!! From the moment we arrived and greeted in reception to the moment we departed the staff were more than friendly and professional. Compliments go to the Chef for an outstanding Taster Menu, the flavours and textures were to die for. Would definitely recommend to friends and family.

title: Anniversary Dinner
comment: The service and food were OUTSTANDING. The staff was completely attentive. It is a very cozy room, only seat about 20 people. I recommend the table in front of the fire place.

title: A wonderful setting to relax, dine and enjoy the atmosphere.
comment: A truly wonderful setting packed with atmosphere. On arrival the staff made my party feel welcome and relaxed. Almost like coming home. The grounds are magnificent. The perfect place to enjoy a pre dinner drink. Although due to the chill in the air we chose the warmth of the real fire in the lounge. Our meal , the 8 course taster, was sublime. The quality was excellent which was matched by the service, wine selection and pace. A wonderful treat and am already planning my return.

title: First class
comment: My wife and I wanted to celebrate our tenth wedding anniversary in style, and I can safely say that our meal in the Tudor Room exceeded our dreams. We opted for the 8-course Taster Menu, with a different wine (chosen by the sommelier) accompanying six of the courses, and the whole experience was simply superb. Rarely have we enjoyed a meal so much, with service being every bit as good as the food was delicious. First class in every respect.

title: A truely awsome meal
comment: I went there on a Tuesday evening to celebrate an Anniversary, we both had the 8 course taster menu and was not disappointed, the food was AMAZING. Right from the moment we arrived to the minute we left we were treated like special guests the staff were attentive and very knowledgeable about the food, each course was sheer delight presentation and taste was out of this world I would go as far as saying the best I have ever tasted. I will certainly be going back for another visit. My compliments to the Chef for creating something very special.

title: AMAZING ITALIAN HIDDEN GEM OF TEDDINGTON
comment: Hidden gem of Teddington ! Food is absolutely UNREAL, lovely Italian restaurant, amazing staff. Highly recommend. Genuinely best pasta I’ve had in years.

title: Great Food and very good value
comment: lovely outdoor eating area with great atmosphere and very friendly service. visited with my grandma and they had a great gluten free and vegan for her.

title: Fantastic place
comment: We came here for lunch with friends our children and the food was delicious and absolutely perfect. The portions for the children was very generous and filling. The service was excellent.  Thank you.

title: excellent lunch
comment: I took clients to Great Fosters for a business lunch and it surpassed anything we expected. We had the tasting menu which was sublime, accompanied by a perfectly chilled glass of Bollinger. From the moment we arrived nothing was too much trouble and the service was superb. The room is impressive, yet cosy and warm. Could not complain about anything!

title: Excellent Lunch
comment: Had not visited since it was "The Oak Room", The Tudor Room seems better. Had the 3 course lunch, with two extra amuses-bouches, and everything was delightful. Service was excellent, and could only be faulted when we were asked in mid-conversation if we were enjoying the food. Not a problem, as the staff seemed so genuinely keen to know our thoughts, probably for feedback to the new chef, Nick Chappell.  Ambience is delightful, perhaps a little "twee"? Only two choices on each of the 3-course menu, but so difficult to choose! The three of us left very happy. I was just a bit disappointed with my dessert.......hot chocolate tart was cold, but it blended so well with the coconut sorbet...though seemed too creamy to be a sorbet!  My main course was bass with curried mussels and lentils.....really great! Some people may find this too spicy, but I certainly did not....just perfect! Will certainly go again, but with only 24 covers, booking is essential, hope to try the evening tasting menu soon. Could complain about the car park, but surely this is partially due to the recent floods, took ages to park, not the fault of Great Fosters. Also, reception at the main desk (when you could find it) was somewhat lacking in finesse, and we were kept waiting for a short while, but all forgotten once inside the beautiful Tudor Room. Maitre D was outstanding!

title: the most delicious food
comment: we arrived in the pouring rain to a warm welcome it is a stunningly beautiful hotel with roaring fires.the Turkish maître d was friendly and engaging.the waiting staff were lovely too.the 6 course taster menu we had was set but it was great to try new and exciting tastes you wouldn't normally choose.all the courses were carefully placed on the plate with precision and executed superbly,the flavours all worked well, the fois gras delicious.the mackerel and beetroot,the guineafowl ,all fantastic.the dessert with rhubarb and ginger cake and white chocolate really was rich and had lovely flavors all working together well,the petit fours looked fabulous with a happy birthday on the plate for my sister in laws birthday ,a lovely touch from the chef.i cannot rave enough about the food truly devine. the room was an intimate dining area but we loved it.not ideal for a buzzy lunch if that's what u are after.thank you for a dining experience to remember.

title: Absolutely perfect!
comment: It was our first visit to the Tudor room, and based on the reception and service we received, we shall certainly frequent this establishment again! Alper did a sterling job of working with my requirements to make my partner's 'k.surprise' birthday a very special occasion indeed. From the outset, Alper and his team were very amenable, professional and focused on providing the highest levels of service. The location is impressive and the food exquisite. I would say that the Tudor Room, exalted by the magnificent company I was blessed with that evening, did make this the best dining experience I have had thusfar.

title: Gastronomic Gorgeousness
comment: I took my husband here for our anniversary and had the tasting menu with the flight of wines. The wine pairing really was fantastic. Be prepared, it is expensive but it is a real experience and the service from Alper was second to none. It's also a beautiful room to dine in. A very special evening.

title: Repeated excellence
comment: This was our third recent visit to the new fine dining restaurant at Great Fosters - The Tudor Room - previously the larger Oak Room. Each visit has been excellent and it's extremely comforting to have somewhere you can rely on in this day and age. The ratings below are a consistent reflection of our repeated experiences. Service, atmosphere and the quality of food are all truly excellent. Other reviews will attest to our experiences, but there are a few additional comments which are relevant to the standards The Tudor Room strives to set / meet. i) The capacity if the dining room is limited to a maximum of 24 covers so service is always relaxed, well paced, discrete and attentive. There appears to be no attempt to 'turn tables over' so we have never felt pressured to rush our meal. ii) We enjoyed an eight course tasting menu produced by The Tudor Room's new chef, Nik Chappell - formerly Head Chef at the L'Ortolan. There were some new and interesting twists to a number of dishes that were definitely different to the previous meals we've had there. Looks positive for the future and it's good that Great Fosters are looking to keep things "fresh". iii) The most pleasing thing about our last visit was that we booked a table on Valentine's Day which is notorious for being 'exploited' by many restaurants to cram as many people as possible into the dining room and usually two sittings. Not true for The Tudor Room - there were only 14 covers for the evening and no second sittings. Granted one paid a premium price for the evening but it was worth the extra which included an eight course menu, a glass of champagne and a rose for the ladies with standards of service, atmosphere and attentiveness as high as ever. It's great to have a quality restaurant providing a reliable and excellent dining experience. We'll definitely be back!

title: Heavenly taster menu in a beautiful room
comment: I dined at The Tudor Room with my husband and the entire experience from booking, arrival and being seated was first class. We arrived 45 minutes early to take advantage of the sunny weather and walk in the lovely gardens (late spring or summer would be amazing). We then had a glass of champagne in one of the relaxing lounges with a fireside seat. We were then collected by a member of the Tudor Room team to take us to our table. The restaurant setting is intimate and cosy and you have enough space around you to talk with your fellow diners without being overheard. The food was perfectly presented, great variety of tastes and enough to feel satisfied but not overly full. Alpert Sahin the manager was super and helped me with my wine selection to complement a superb meal and dessert. The entire team were friendly and attentive and will have a lasting memory. I highly recommend this dining experience.

title: Aiming for the stars...
comment: Great Fosters had for many years provided a beautiful historical venue with distinctly average food. Thankfully that has changed dramatically, thanks to the last two head chefs who have brought great cooking with a modern and refined touch. The lunch tasting menu in the Tudor Room was well balanced, deeply flavoured and beautifully cooked and presented. One of the party didn't eat meat; this was no problem and replacement dishes were provided without fuss. Service was impeccable. If a Michelin star is the target, you are getting there, in my opinion.....

title: Very pleasing
comment: Very pleased with the tasting lunch. Lovely staff - very helpful and friendly. Would love to come back in the warmer weather to enjoy the gardens

title: Continuing high standards
