comment: Our second visit to this excellent restaurant, the first time was for lunch and I was driving as Sue had dislocated her shoulder, this time Sue was driving so I decided on the wine flight along with the tasting menu. The rooms remains cosy and not crowded, we could talk to the adjacent table and did a couple of times but not so close as we were listening into their conversation. The highlight last time was the bread but this time the food. Very good pert ion control with some very inventive dished well presented and well cooked. The standouts were the rabbit and the beef for very different reasons. The rabbit and foie gras balloting, verjus, with raisin and pistachio was smooth, full of flavour, but subtle in the flavour and texture combinations available on the plate. The Sirlion, smoked shin of beef with onion, turnip and liquorice was the complete opposite, one wonders where the chefs come up with these combinations and how they get it so right. Beef and liquorice is not a combination that springs easily to the mind and having overcome that hurdle getting the right flavour of beef is critical. This is a plate that stands up and smacks you in the mouth, strong strong flavours that simple work. Not that this should be considered to be denigrating to the other dishes the cheese dish is an absolute gem, Truffled Tamworth, a delightful pan fired crumpet, finished with honey and quince, simple a delight. The Seared scallop, pine braised pig cheek with apple suffered only that it was between the rabbit and the beef, the cheek was cooked to perfection. And the wine flight you ask, brilliant, not stinting on the portions matching extremely well to the dishes and again with a few German discoveries including a Riesling that was truly astonishing. The service was excellent from the moment we walked or should I say dodged through the front door to the tea and coffee that saw us back out the door. Again go there now the first of the stars cannot be far away and then getting a table will become an issue.

title: A new discovery
comment: I picked up one of the two for one deals that are around and Sue and I booked, originally for a week ago but then we had to rebook due to a dental visit. The ambiance of the room is brilliant, its a small room but the tables are sensibly placed, the service was excellent friendly and efficient without falling into the trap of being overly familiar. The food is very good not quite to the top just yet but I would suggest you go now because the Michelin stars cannot be too far away, some inventive dishes, we had the tasting menu but enough to show a talented chef working with really good ingredients and producing some very accomplished cooking indeed. The scallops with Pak Choi and Thai flavoured noodles were a revelation, a dish that could easily have gone wrong was sensational. a great change from the tendency to put pork or foie gras against the scallop, this was fresh and the Thai noodle excellently seasoned and spiced. The venison I was nervous about having had a sensational venison dish at Latymer recently, this was a very different take that worked really well as here the dish worked as a whole with the vegetable flavours balancing really well against the ham and venison and the wild rice finishing the meat really eel as did the bitter chocolate and jumper sauce adding a brilliant note, but this dish bought my only moan, the portion control was a little tight on the meat, but as it is a tasting menu understandable. The desert was excellent as were all the courses, presentation was excellent and seasoning spot on all the way. The star was the bread, three breads that I could have just sat and eaten all day, innovative and really well and freshly baked. Do not wait to go here as once the secret gets out you will have lost put on the chance to see a really good restaurant develop.

title: Perfection
comment: Ambiance in Tudor room is second to none (including attractive aroma from log fire); service is immaculate; we had lunch tasting menu and every course was a total delight. Better and cheaper than other tasting menus we have had in some top London restaurants. Faultless.

title: Best experience ever...Well Done!
comment: I've been at this amazing restaurant with my partner one week ago, the Hotel itself is one of the most beautiful places i've ever seen. The entrance is astonishing with a huge fireplace and a lovely desk; in this occasion when we entered there was a beautiful bride and groom taking pictures, and I can't imagine a better place to take picture of your wedding. ..anyway lets get to the restaurant;  A gentleman escorted us to the Tudor Room, a cosy room with around 6 tables dressed very elegant.  The service staff took our coats to another room and we sat at our table, a very big table with one comfy chair on one side and a small sofa on the other where my partner sat and loved it. The service staff were very organised and professionals but still very friendly making us feel comfortable and cared. The manager came to take our drinks order and he advised a bottle of wine to go with our menu, which complimented it very well. We opted for the 8 courses tasting menu but if you count the canapes and petit four is 10 !!! The canapes arrived on a wooden board/tray with dry ice underneath making a great effect, there was a selection of canapes; beetroot mousse, tempura prawns, seaweed and others all with very intense flavours and different texture, as a start to the dinner they were of a very high standard. The bread was accompanied by a little plate with salted butter and salt crystals with a quenelle of beef dripping butter, and let me tell you, I have never tasted something so good in my life, my partner and I were fighting over it lol. The breads also all homemade was spectacular.  From our amuse bouche to the coffee those were some of the dishes we had:  -Cannelloni of Pig`s Ear and Chorizo   root vegetables, Cornish scallop and tomato fondue -Loin of Fallow Deer   artichoke barigoule, butternut squash, braised red cabbage,   juniper and bitter chocolate sauce -Selection of European cheese,   wafers, digestives, white truffle honey  -Spiced Plum Soufflé   Tahitian vanilla ice cream and Plum sauce  -Asian Forest. All the dishes were executed to perfection and not only the presentation was perfect but the flavours, texture and combination were amazing.  The cheese selection had 12 different kind of cheese going from the mildest to the strongest served with the most beautiful/tasty/light digestive biscuits. And a little pot with honey and truffle just made the all dish unforgettable.  The service was also excellent everyone had a perfect knowledge of the products and always had time to have a little chat/feedback after each course, that made us fell vary cared. I would call this more an experience rather than just a dinner, and a very good one. Well done to the team and keep up the good work.  I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

title: Fantastic
comment: We have just had the marvellous experience of the tasting menu at the Tudor Room at Great Fosters, a beautiful Hotel in Egham, Surrey. The service from the moment we arrived to leaving was immaculate - non-intrusive, discreet, extremely knowledgeable and helpful when needed. The tasting menu was fabulous - every course was exquisite, beautifully balanced flavours, beautifully presented. each course was a taste delight in itself. The ambience of the dining room and the warm Boleyn room where we had pre-lunch drinks was lovely. Attention to detail was fabulous even to the extent of placing a cushion behind my back when seated. thoroughly recommended - will go again and again and again .......

title: Absolutely wonderful
comment: I'm not sure where to start with this. The first problem is that I can only score up to five on the review. If I could give it six (Sublime), I would. The food, the service and the surroundings were simply wonderful. Great Fosters itself, is a beautiful tudor country house. It looked incredibly atmospheric on a foggy, freezing December day. The Tudor Room restaurant is a small restaurant, very much in keeping with the historic setting. The room is dominated by a wonderful stone fireplace. The service from Alper, the restaurant manager, and his staff was excellent. Discreet, but always around when needed. We had the six course tasting menu and, after dithering over the wine, chose to have the wine flight, with Alper choosing the wines for each course. Alper made a point of describing each wine and the reason for the pairing. Each of the wines was perfectly judged. A couple (a gewurtzraminer with the wood pigeon and the Maury vin doux with the cheese course) weren't wines that I would even have considered and both were delicious and complemented the food beautifully. All of the food courses were outstanding, from the amuse bouche of tiny croquettes (one each of salmon, fois gras and cheese) to the treacle tart and creme brulee ice cream (saved from being overly sweet by the sprinkling of pickled raisins and raised to a peak of wonderfulness with the glass of Tokaji that accompanied it).  Two of the dishes, though, were some of the best things that I've ever tasted. The seared and smoked wood pigeon, fois gras and duck confit medallions with a quince comsomme left me pretty much speechless. It looked like a little piece of perfection on the plate and tasted better. This was followed by seared scallop with a thai theme. It took a few moments for my taste buds to adjust from the sweetness of the quince comsomme to the spice of the scallops and noodles, but once they had, it was delicious. Somehow, Shane Hughes managed to turn the bok choi from the limp green thing that it is when I try and cook with it into a beautifully crisp counterpart to the softness of the noodles and scallops. Then came the next course that had me lost for words - a Jacob's ladder short rib of beef, somehow extracted from the bone in an intricate piece of butchery, with sweetbread, a watercress puree, mushrooms and purple sprouting broccoli. It was so very rich and, well, beefy. It was at this point that the fresh baked bread came into its own as we tried so very hard to scrape every last mouthful of flavour from the plate. Not very elegant, but hey ho. The cheeses were beautiful, arranged from mild to strong (the last two being roquefort and stinking bishop) and accompanied by thin, crisp wafers and small balls of digestive biscuit, plus a gorgeous truffle honey. The vin doux was a wonderful alternative to port with the cheese. Oh, and then there were espressos and petits fours to finish. A nice touch was that the petits fours came on a slate board with "Happy Birthday" for my wife piped onto it. All in all I can't speak highly enough of the restaurant, I can only recommend that you go soon before it gets its Michelin star and becomes much more difficult to book.

title: An experience not to be missed
comment: We were a party of four on a Friday evening, we had high expectation based upon recommendations and reviews and we were not disappointed. The Great Fosters is a beautiful building and inside is just as lovely, the Tudor Room itself is smart and well-appointed but still manages to feel relaxed and warm. We all went for the eight course Tasting Menu along with the Flight of wines, an absolute treat and highly recommended. I would find it difficult to find a better place to eat for this type of menu and establishment, and there are a few contenders within half an hour of here. What made the evening for us besides the wonderful food was the staff. Alper and his staff were so welcoming and attentive without being a little over the top as you get in some places in this category. The Tudor Room at The Great Fosters is not a budget dining experience, but it does give you value. For a special meal or celebration you will not go wrong here.

title: Total Bliss
comment: I booked a tasting menu lunch for my husbands' birthday - fingers crossed! I had no need to worry - from the second we stepped through the door, the staff were amazing, the restaurant ambiance was super and the Christmas floral décor was a sight to behold.The food was truly fantastic and they really treated us like royalty. The staff in the restaurant knew everything about every course, and the sommelier was even more knowledgeable, managing to 'wean' my husband off one of his favourite wines and get him to try something else. Nothing was too much trouble but the crown has to go to the food. Considering this was a deal through a website, you may have expected something 'lesser' than normal - but if anything it was more! Every course without exception was delicious and beautifully cooked, I think the word perfection would under-rate what we savoured. The chefs and the waiting staff deserve a huge pat on the back - I have not had better food in so called Michelin star restaurants, and certainly not better service. Fantastic Great Fosters - it certainly deserves the word 'Great' in front of the name. Beautiful amuse bouche, wonderful shot of pea and truffle soup, wood pigeon, sea bass oriental style - and more courses - I cannot speak highly enough of this venue. Thank you for making my husbands birthday so special. We will undoubtedly be returning - the sooner the better!

title: Worse lunch in ages
comment: Limited menu - 2 choices each course, unbalanced and salty. Well presented but chef trying to be clever and it doesn't work. No vegetarian options and choices are repetitive. Staff stuck in process and lack flexibility, Idid not want yo serve a dish without sauce, argued with us then said 'you started it' . Very irritating, kept calling me 'my lady' and ingratiating at times. Female waitress was much better. Amuse buches interfered with pallet rather than enhancing menu choices. Very expensive and service charge added without prior notice.

title: Great evening stunning tasting menu but the chilli powder lingered on.
comment: With immaculate service and great ambience it soon became clear that the chef had a leaning towards powders rather than foams. Excellent meal with a stunning forest floor pudding. All in all a very enjoyable experienc but a little less chilli next time would be welcome.

title: Sublime dining experience
comment: We had held our wedding reception at Great Fosters 6 years ago and had originally made a tradition of returning to celebrate our anniversary in subsequent years. Following a less than exceptional experience in the former Oak Room, we suspended the tradition for a couple of years, but decided to push the boat out this year and booked into the hotel for a night and into the Tudor Room for dinner. This was one of life's better decisions. The hotel had already brought two complimentary glasses of champagne to our room on our arrival, and after dressing for dinner we carried them with us to the foyer where we were met by Alper, the restaurant manager. A more affable and courteous maître d' would be difficult to find. He was a model of discretion and sincerity - a man who clearly took his work very seriously, and his responsibilities to his guests even more so. Throughout the evening he appeared at just the right moments, with the right advice and genuine interest in ensuring that we had the most perfect evening. We decided to go with the a la carte menu, and Alper again gently guided our wine choice, elegantly nudging us away from a Chateau Cantemerle (too young) to an excellent Chateau La Tour de By. He was keen that we should also taste an Argentinian Malbec, which was very smooth and full-flavoured, but we stuck with the Bordeaux which was much dryer by comparison, but well-suited to the mix of hare, beef and duck which comprised my starter and main-course and my wife's main. On his recommendation she took an excellent Riesling to accompany her mackerel starter. The three other waiting staff were equally discreet, but clearly equally intent on ensuring our enjoyment of a very beautifully crafted dining experience. They served three types of wonderful, freshly-baked bread which was more than adequate to see us through the meal - no skimping here, either on quality or quantity. I cannot remember tasting hare before, and was blown over by the meat, being both superbly tender, delicately structured but robust in flavour. It was accompanied by just the right quantity and intensity of sauce. The beef and my wife's pot roasted duck were equally memorable - she described hers as 'perfect'.  Dessert was a tale of two cities: my wife took the green forest dessert, which was a magnificent, eclectic but delicately balanced collection of different flavours and consistencies. I, however, plumped for the much heartier and intense pineapple and star anise tarte tatin, with bayleaf ice-cream and piquant toffee sauce. The combination rendered the whole wonderfully, but not overly sweet. We ventured into unknown territory with Alper's choice of dessert wine - very tough to find a single wine to complement such wildly different dishes - but he chose for us a lighter, cleaner, less overly syrupy wine which was more refreshing than a typical example.  The meal sadly had to end, but was concluded with coffee and petit-fours which at this stage proved close to sinking us; our man again came to the rescue, discreetly packing the beautiful little creations into a box for us to take away. I am frankly baffled by the confused and confusing description that the previous reviewer has left. It bears such a stark contrast to our experience (and that of all other reviewers), both in terms of culinary as well as service standards, that it begs a number of questions. I hope she is prepared to give the restaurant another chance - perhaps for dinner, where the ambience really comes into its own. With 33 excellent reviews and 3 very good, her poor review is a rather sad outlier.

title: Lovely hidden restaurant!
comment: Maurizio welcomed us and was kind, friendly and patient especially as we had noisy children, sorry! He was good to them, and always attentive. The food was amazing, the seafood starter was very tasty and fresh. The pizza was great and I had the best lasagne I've ever eaten, much tastier than the pizza express ones!!! This will be my new regular if and when I am able to eat out again. Will definitely return. The atmosphere was warm and friendly, a real hidden gem!

title: amazing food and service
comment: We dined here last weekend in the covered area outside as we were looking for a COVID compliant place to eat with friends. It did not disappoint, had great food and would highly recommend the Fettuccine Funghi Selvatici e Speck. The service was attentive, friendly and added to a great dining experience. Would recommend and will be returning

title: Absolutely Amazing
comment: Went to dinner here with my husband as we were staying at The Great Fosters. The atmosphere is so romantic and beautiful, and the service exceeded our expectations. We had the tasting menu which was an eight course meal. It was the best meal I have ever had! The food was beautifully served and the taste was perfect! Definitely a must when visiting!!!!

title: New and great!
comment: We have been a Dining Member at Great Fosters for several years but recently their Oak Room has been developed into a Garden Brassiere and fine dining can be found in The Tudor Room. Set in this unique and beautiful Tudor building near Virginia Water in Surrey this new addition to the Hotel is well worth the highest praise. The food was really delicious and the service very attentive. We were a party of four and we were all full of admiration for the creation of this new fine dining venue: I would think about 24 covers at the maximum. Good wine list available. Ticking the boxes for the review the outdoor seating relates to lunchtime for the brasserie.

title: Brilliant food, venue and coffee!
comment: My girlfriend and I ate here last Saturday. The venue (Great Fosters Hotel) was lovely. A grand building with an authentic, traditional feel to it as you walk though the small doorway into the grand reception room. From here we were taken to our seats. A small, cozy room with only 6 or so tables of varying sizes, but, importantly, we didn't feel like everyone was listening to our conversation! We had the 4 course set menu (£65pp) which had a good selection of options, although we ended up having nearer 8 courses due to the extra chef treats. All of them were delicious and you could really see the effort the chef and team put into them. There was only one sitting so we were not rushed and ate in our own time. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly. Halfway through I saw the chef poke his head out to see if everything was ok and, I assume, his customers were enjoying themselves and the food (which they were!) It's always nice to know the chef cares! Sure, the meal is comparatively expensive to your posh restaurant in town, but for what you get, it is certainly value for money! I plan to go back for sure - best restaurant I have been to! At the end of the meal ask for a coffee. They used what looked like a chemistry set to brew the coffee on your table and it is quite a spectacle. The taste certainly lived up to the build up too! Whilst having my coffee, towards the end of the night, the chef came out to chat and get feedback on the meal which was a really nice touch. Considering they only opened up this year they have really hit the ground running!

title: Perfection on a plate
comment: Though I would love to be selfish and keep The Tudor Room all to myself, the work of Chef Shane Hughes is too good to stay hidden for long. There’s no doubt a table at The Tudor Room will quickly become the hottest reservation in town.  The decor allows the simplistic beauty of the food to really shine, though beauty isn’t the only thing bringing folks to The Tudor Room. The restaurant buzzed with excited energy and was comfortably full with seemingly satisfied patrons.  I for one shall be returning to celebrate my Anniversary.

title: Good food and sevice
comment: We were a table of six eating at The Tudor Room and can say that we all enjoyed our experience including our daughter who is 7 months pregnant, the staff were very helpful with adjusting her menu. The service was excellent and staff friendly.

title: Fantastic experience
comment: We had a fabulous time in this restaurant! It was lovely evening.  We had the full taster menu 7 or so courses. Every one of the courses was beautifully presented & delivered to the table with finesse & a great explanation of each dish. The staff were attentive & fun without being intrusive out our special evening  Each course built on the last and was absolutely beautiful both in terms of presentation & taste. It was great to share such a lovely experience with a partner. It really is a place to come with a loved one.  The price? Well it's not cheap but worth every penny. Great value.

title: Superb food
comment: We had the taster menu and thoroughly enjoyed every course. Very high quality cooking and beautifully presented in a very atmospheric setting. The service was excellent too. Great experience all round.

title: Simply excellent
comment: Went to the Tudor Room for various birthday celebrations and had the tasting menu. Quite simply one of the best meals ever on account of quality of food, perfect service (informative and there when needed but otherwise unobtrusive) and ambience. The room is fairly simple but seems right somehow. Thought the pork ballotine and souffle were superb. Well done chef and staff.

title: limited menu
comment: We have eaten here twice in the last six weeks. Beautiful ambience, fine dining and excellent service. However the first time we dined there was a choice of a la carte or a tasting menu but last night only a tasting menu was available which you could choose from. Very restricted which is a real shame. We were also overcharged for the tasting menu (£75 pp) instead of the £60 quoted for picking from the limited choice. Not spotted until we got home. Bit disappointed but have not been put off and we will probably try the Estate Grill next time for more choice.

title: Outstanding experience, must be seen
comment: Me and my girlfriend dined here a while ago, I just thought I should write this now to say how good this restaurant really is... The greeting and service is really top notch, it's warm and welcoming without being stuffy, wine pairings and suggestions were all well received. The food we ate was absolutely brilliant, taste, presentation, imagination... All rolled into 1 perfect small menu. We recommend you try this restaurant before it's fully booked all the time

title: Outstanding
comment: The Tudor Room at Great Fosters has been receiving some great reviews of late and so we had to try this restuarant, and I can concur that this experience is nothing short of 5 star. I had been fairly underwhelmed by my last few michelin star outings but The Tudor Room has restored my faith in fine dining. The setting is lovely being in the historic Great Fosters Hotel and even with a very small dinign room, the ambience seemed to bubble away nicely. The food was incredible (raspeberry souffle was one of the best deserts ever experienced), excellently presented and summarised by the knoweldgeable front of house staff. The first michelin star must be very close by and I look forward to returning to this, my new favourtie restauruant in England.

title: Very good
comment: Over the years I have eating in most of the starred London restaurants I recently read about the Tudor room and was really happy to discover that we only live about 10 min away from what is as good as some of those named starred london restaurants. We went for the 8 course tasting menu, most of the courses were excellent. Canapés delightful, very good foie gras dish and really great beef dish. I shall return.

title: finest dining
comment: Great Fosters Tudor Room fielded the best 8 course tasting menu we've ever eaten. Intense flavours, surprising combinations made our wedding anniversary experience unforgettable. Shane Hughes, the Head Chef, came round for his much deserved accolade. The wine pairings were delightful, with some surprises like an Italian Red served ice cold and a Hungarian Tokay white with dessert.  We were married at Great Fosters many years ago but the place retains a timeless excellence and the staff are very friendly and attentive. It's highly recommended.

title: Must be one of the top restaurants in the country right now
comment: Arrived and greeted at the door in a polite and professional way as always. Sat outside in the garden and enjoyed 2 lovely glasses of champagne. We then had the 7 course tasting menu with flawless service and perfectly matched wines. Measures were very good and the food, wines, and service were flawless!

title: Culinary Excellence
comment: Having eating in many top restaurants in London I can only applaud Head Chef Shane Hughes and his team for bringing world class food to Egham. The 6 course tasting lunch he served today was outstanding in every way, the fact that he stretched it to 8 courses by trying out future courses on us was both a surprise and a bonus. The quality of service matched the food in every way, perfectly balanced so as not to be intrusive and suitably friendly. The staff even picked up on it being a late birthday celebration for the in-laws and brought us a 9th course! That Michelin star cannot be too far away.

title: Amazing
comment: Loved the room, the light catches the ornate glass window during sunset. The staff were brilliant, the restaurant manager fantastically attentive. Make sure you try the coffee

title: Move over Mr Ramsay, there's a new man in town!
comment: We are still remembering our faultless anniversary lunch on Friday. The food was a revelation. Every plate put in front of us was wonderful, with something different and with flavour matches that were out of this world. The staff were attentive and knowledgeable which enhanced the experience greatly. Not the cheapest meal we have had but worth every penny. We loved it so much we have booked to go back next week. Can't wait!

title: A truly super anniversary dinner
comment: Our 20th wedding Anniversary, at the same hotel where we got married, was a gastronomic delight. The relatively new Tudor Room restaurant really pulled out all the stops to deliver a wonderful 8 course tasting menu. The service by the restaurant four man team was truly excellent without being overpowering. The food was fantastic, and don't be frightened by some of the descriptions, you can rest assured it has been cooked to perfection. Our meal included an amuse bouche of parsnip and fennel soup was followed by a trio of smoked wood pigeon, foie gras and confit duck. To follow that the surprise of the evening, a cannelloni of Pigs Ear and Chorizo - simply divine! A wonderful fillet of salmon followed and then a beautiful loin of fallow dear which has been roasted and was served with a bitter chocolate sauce. OMG! Then we had the selection of 10 French cheeses a wonderful spiced plum soufflé and the restaurants highly unusual, but very tasty Asian Forest desert. The wine list was extensive, but the sommelier picked a delightful Gevey - Chambertin to accompany the food, an excellent choice. Overall a wonderful experience, a gastronomic adventure through fine food.

title: Fantastic food and service
comment: I took my girlfriend for lunch at The Tudor Room beginning of September for a birthday celebration. We have enjoyed eating out in various restaurants of this standard for quite a while and have wanted to try here since it opened earlier this year. The whole experience from the moment we were greeted to the petit fours at the end was just fantastic. The food was beautifully presented and had real depth of flavour. The Head Chef Shane Hughes matches classically based dishes with an Asian twist to create mind blowing flavour combinations. The standout dishes for me were the Scallops with tomato fondue and the 'Asian Forest' dessert which the main components resembled two small mushrooms. My partner, being a vegetarian was impressed with the variety and effort put into the vegetarian dishes on offer. The service was efficient, discreet and matched the delivery of the food. Overall, an unforgettable experience with some serious cooking. Will that Michelin star follow soon.... I think so!

title: Tastetastic!
comment: Four of us went for dinner and had the tasting menu - simply tastetastic! The food was excellent. The staff were superb, attentive, knowledgable but didn't fuss around. All round fabulous evening.

title: Wonderful Food and Service
comment: I went for an outside Covid friendly lunch meal with 5 of my friends to celebrate my birthday. Not only was the outside area well protected from the elements and well heated but the tables were spaced out and all the waiters wore masks appropriately. The food was delicious and the pudding was fab, especially when they brought mine out with a candle in and sang a personal happy birthday. Would definitely recommend.

title: Great arancini; great service
comment: We were visitors to Teddington and chose the Dolce Vita because Tripadvisor said it was #1 of 52 restaurants thereabouts. We were not disappointed. I am a great fan of arancini and La Dolce Vita’s were superb. I followed this up with a wonderful mixed seafood spaghetti. Also impressive was the performance of Luca, who, single-handedly maintained an efficient service in a room where all the tables were taken, all the while dealing with the constant demand for takeaway meals. He allowed me to try out my Italian on him and made the occupants of each table feel that they were the most interesting and amusing people in the room.

title: Wedding anniversary dinner.
comment: My wife and I had a night at Great Fosters to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary and ate in the Tudor Room that night. I can honestly say the tasting menu (for both food and wine) was as good as anywhere I've ever eaten. The service was outstanding and the sommelier Steve was superb in his wine choices and descriptions. 10 out of 10.

title: excellent - birthday party
comment: this weekend we celebrated a friend's 60th at this restaurant. we had not been before and make a booking because it was one of the few places where, as a group of five, we could celebrate outdoors, under cover. The food was excellent - good selection of ingredients and dishes and good prices too. Friendly and welcoming staff, we did not feel rushed and could linger after lunch. It was a really gloomy day but the patio area is really great - comfortable and well set up. We look forward to returning after confinement.

title: Best Pizza in Teddington!
comment: Not only are you welcomed by a friendly and warm team, the food is delicious! A firm local favourite with some delicious hand made pizza!

title: Wonderful Dining Experience...
comment: The recently opened Tudor Room at Great Fosters is just wonderful!  Very intimate, with superb service and delicious food. Every detail from the beautiful cutlery and tableware, comfortable seats and décor has obviously been meticulously thought out.  Very attentive staff, who know their product. The team led by the Restaurant Manager Mr.Alper were not overbearing or intrusive, but just the perfect balance keeping the service first class.  (Mahmoud, Madalena and Charlene)  Interesting menu, with the best quality ingredients and great combinations.  The brioche in the bread basket was melt in the mouth and even the pre desert was so delicious. . (Limoncello with chilli - gorgeous!) Had a divine rice pudding .... Loved all the different plates used to compliment the different choices, all very individual, and was waiting to see how the next course would be presented - very stylish.  Great to experience dining of this calibre without having to travel into central London.  Do try it, great for an intimate dinner, and great with friends too. We are planning our next visit and looking forward to it.

title: Good night out - excellent value for the money.
comment: My friends and I had a great night in the Tudor Room Restaurant, and even though the restaurant was busy we had excellent service throughout the meal. Very friendly and proffessional team work. The food was of a very high quality and standard.  Will definitely be going back again and certainly will recommend to my friends and family.

title: Exquisite dining experience in sumptuous historic setting
comment: It has been an amazing week - dinner on Tuesday for a very close friend's birthday and a small group of five on Thursday - and both occasions in the newly appointed fine dining experience at Great Fosters Hotel, The Tudor Room. I think it is exciting to be dining where King Henry V111 would have eaten - Great Fosters was intended to be a hunting lodge for him - with the modern twist of delicious and beautifully presented food - from the unexpected extras (Pre starters - melt in the mouth and tease the taste buds). The service was paced just right to have a most enjoyable dining experience with some surprising tastes - I think that it ticks all the boxes for a sensational evening! Alper Saphin, restaurant manager - pure class - you have a

title: NOT just dinner, an EXPERIENCE!!
comment: Close friends, good conversation, great food, intimate and personal and the restaurant team were the icing on the cake!! A place where I would be honoured to return to time and time again. With a group or even on my own...the feeling of a genuine "welcome" is like coming home!!! I am looking forward to booking a long stay at Great Fosters!!

title: Great Easter Sunday Lunch
comment: You can't go wrong with a visit to Greatfosters, it is a place rich in history with the low doors, creaking stairway and the general feeling you get that this place is indeed, very old! Henry VIII made a wise choice when he used this as a hunting lodge! I recently took the family along and enjoyed an excellent buffet lunch on Easter Sunday in the Tithe Barn, a wonderful setting for such an occasion. Good food, good service and a great atmosphere with a Frank Sinatra impersonator entertaining the diners with a catalogue of his songs and very good he was too!

title: A Fabulous Experience
comment: We had a wonderful meal at the Tudor Room. The service was amazing attentive, but not intrusive. The food was stunning with wonderful flavours that worked so well. The menu was very well thought out and it was obvious that the chef was very talented. From the moment we sat down we were presented with the most wonderful food. The sommelier was very knowledgable and was keen to advise us on what wines would suit the food. It was a most pleasurable experience, wonderful setting, amazing food what more could you want ? Well done Great Fosters a great success.

title: a wonderful lunch
comment: This is a new restaurant in very old surroundings. The room is small and intimate with a lovely decor. While the restaurant has only been open a couple of months the lunch experience provided is clearly the result of years of successful learning, from the excellent food through to the attentive and friendly service from each of the front of house staff. We went for the 6 course tasting menu which was £40 a head. Typically on special occasions such as today we may look at a tasting menu out of interest, but rarely take the leap in to the extended menu given the cost (particularly in many London restaurants) versus a good looking set lunch. At £12 more than the set lunch and having enjoyed a journey through many different courses and perfectly seasoned dishes we can report we feel the lunch was very good value. Each course delivered excellent food and combinations of ingredients that balanced perfectly. From the carrot and ginger amuse bouche, through to the Jacob's ladder and sirloin main course, to the delightful raspberry souffle that rounded off a very satisfying fine dining event. We highly recommend this. In addition we suggest in the historic setting of Great Fosters hotel make sure you take the time, before or after your meal, to have a look around the beautiful gardens.

title: A very special place
comment: We were fortunate to live in the UK for two years and Great Fosters quickly became a favorite destination for our family and guests. The venue is stunning and a place you can enjoy rain or shine. The new Tudor Room is a wonderful compliment to their offerings. We were greeted outside as we arrived and immediately felt special and pampered. That experience followed us the entire evening from the stylish setting, wonderfully attentive service, to the excellent and innovative food selection. I would highly recommend the wine flight that accompanies the meal but be sure to have a cab at the ready for your trip home. Or better yet, stay the night.

title: Exceptional food, a true hidden gem
comment: The quality of the food at this place is fantastic. True authentic Indian cuisine, tucked away in the middle of St Mary Cray. This is the place to go if you have a craving for Indian food. My goto takeaway in the area, and probably one of the best Indian restaurants in London I've eaten from.

title: Delivery
comment: Ordered a takeaway to be delivered last Saturday for the first time from Orpington Citi Kitchen and all I can say is ‘DELICIOUS’. Really impressed with the quality of the food and great service. Will definitely be back for more.

title: good
comment: Never been there but because of them i passed my history class by including them in a travel brocure so 10/10 for me

title: Simply outstanding!!!
comment: The Tunbridge Wells PRE ORDER Collection/Delivery service on (Mobile - 07405720593) is first class!! It is very difficult to get authentic indian food in the West Kent area, I have had this several times and it is up there with 5* indian hotel food!

title: This place really is something
comment: This place really is something special. We’ve ordered twice from here now both times different choices but both times the food was just excellent. The chicken melts in your mouth. The lamb kebab for starters is unbelievably good. Delivery is quick too. Cannot recommend this place enough.

title: Absolutely amazing
comment: Such good tasty food and lovely customer service over the phone, so glad I found this on trip advisor otherwise I never would have found such an amazing Indian

title: Authentic Indian food
comment: We are no novices to Indian dining. With Covid, we've had to swap restaurant trips for home deliveries instead. I've ordered twice from this place, and I can say it comes closest to the flavours we find back home. Even the kids love the gravies and the naan from here. We'll be returning for more.

title: Outstanding!!!!
comment: We ordered a takeaway for delivery for the first time last night after reading outstanding reviews and I am so glad we decided to try somewhere different from the delivery to the quality of the food was absolutely outstanding and we will be making this our regular takeaway from now on and can’t wait for lockdown to be over so we can go to the restaurant.

title: Delicious authentic food
comment: Offers tasty fusion food that comes in big portions and served by friendly staff. Ordered from here often and never been left disappointed.  Vishal

title: Online order
comment: Really tasty and yummy. Chat items and side dishes are very nice. Loved to order and try new dishes.

title: Five Star. Don’t waste time, just go! Super food, atmosphere and service!!
comment: Been to WT multiple times and it never disappoints, great food, fair value for money and simply brilliant staff/service. Fantastic menu and atmosphere any day of the week - the best breakfast/brunch/dinner cafe in west London.

title: Tiny nice cafe
comment: It is a very nice place for a cafe, but for a restaurant it's s bit tiny. Apart from this, the food was excellent and the staff competent and nice.

title: Fantastic local spot
comment: We’re so lucky to have this place on our doorstep. Great coffee and food, with really friendly staff all the time

title: Perfect for Brunch
comment: We didn’t book, which was a mistake, but in the end only had to wait 10 minutes for a table. Great brunch menu whether you are carnivore, pescatarian, veggie or vegan. Some of the best coffee we have had outside Italy. Helpful friendly multi-cultural staff, well presented and well cooked food. No fuss, no pretention, we were in and out of there in 30 minutes, very happy. But a good place to linger over the papers too.

title: seriously the best breakfast in London 😍
comment: we were staying in a air bnb near the restaurant and went there two times for breakfast! can only recommend it - it was freaking delicious and the staff was so super nice! a must if you are nearby

title: Well done
comment: Good food and even better people. Must see this place and the options of different dishes with mixture of right ingredients to go with it

title: Back With Excellent New Burgers
comment: I went with my daughter to re-visit the cafe after the shut-down. They are super organised with spacing and hygiene, yet the place still has it's relaxed & friendly atmosphere. We sat outside under the climbing plants that have grown well during the lockdown: it's a lovely little place to eat. We tried the new burgers: pulled beef and quinoa. I'd never had a quinoa burger before and this one worked very well. They were both great, served with crunchy sweet potato chips. My daughter and I are super careful about distancing, masks, etc so we haven't been out to eat much since lockdown, but we felt very comfortable and safe here.

title: A real hidden gem!
comment: A real hidden gem! We were very satisfied with our whole experience at Wild Thyme. The service was fantastic, Andrea looked after us well and is that rare server who knows when to come to you and impart her knowledge and also knows when to just let you get on with eating the delicious food. And about the food, fantastic! Really fresh and well executed dishes. We had a new dish, duck with duck fat cooked potato and a sweet and nicely sour cherry and cranberry sauce. Which was just divine and we highly recommend. The cafe evidently takes social distancing very seriously and we felt very safe there. Overall I can’t recommend this place enough, you really should check it out!!

title: My new favourite breakfast place
comment: What a great discovery. Cute place in an unlikely location off the Uxbridge Road near Shepherd’s Bush. Interesting and wide breakfast selection from “full English” though smashed avocado to Turkish, vegan +++. All delicious and great value. Staff brilliant. Friendly and welcoming even though it was packed. Go. You won’t be sorry.

title: Beautiful cafe, with amazing brunch
comment: Beautiful cafe, with amazing brunch menu & really lovely outside space. I felt welcomed & safe throughout my visit. The service was fantastic & the food was brilliant. Can’t wait to go back.

title: Oh dear
comment: Broccoli and Cauliflower  BBQed with body heat or the cooks breath.Terrible . Chaat Papdi   I felt as if the papdi had had a bit of naughty rumpy pumpy with moth balls! what’s there in a chaat ?colloquially it means to lick .Signifying that the preparation is so good you lick it ,around here you will only do it if you suffer from hereditary dysgeusia and are on a study cohort that is working to find a cure for it  Papadom platter  Served with a hair , the hair was either from a head ( wasn’t my bonce for sure, here they are very short and Gray) or a face ( wasn’t mine either, your truly is clean shaven ,on the face ! ) why I say with some degree of certainty about its anatomical antecedents because it wasn’t curly, either ways it wasn’t on the menu so I wasn’t expecting it and I didn’t bring it up as I do not work for Alpecin . The Chairs The chairs have towel rings at the back. Why ? 5 The Waiting Staff Attentive ,welcoming, pleasant .  Overall here I quote the late AA Gill: "This is a restaurant constructed to attract everybody, but will please nobody. It wants to be popular to make money, but without effort or enthusiasm. It is the collective wit of layers of management and consultants, who no doubt all together understand a great deal about catering but plainly very little about hospitality"

title: Highly recommended
comment: Love that place! Amazing food. Friendly and very attentive staff. Visited couple of times. Can't wait to pop in for lunch nest time.

title: Our favourite place for brunch and breakfast
comment: We've been here twice now and each time the service was warm and efficient, the food came out fast, and the breakfast /brunch selection was perfect. The "Wild Thyme Breakfast" (Full english with a middle eastern twist i think?) is fab! Also, the Eggs Benedict options are great - we had Pulled Beef / Brisket with ours! lovely  There's a very homely feel here and the owner clearly cares about his customers, his premises and his staff. HIGH FIVE

title: Great brunch
comment: We arrived at 11am and only had to wait a short time for a table. The service was excellent and the food delicious. Both the avocado toast and wild thyme breakfast were very well received, the hash browns are amazing. Would recommend to anyone.

title: Excellent Brunch
comment: Had an excellent full breakfast and flat white on Saturday with some of my family. Lucky to get the last table, well looked after my the staff. Food worth the wait, top notch.

title: Stunning
comment: This is a quirky little place with a nice atmosphere and feel to it. Perfect for brunch, served quickly and efficiently, and didn't have to wait long for the food, which was outstanding with lots of flavour. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and will highly recommended.

title: Great!
comment: The place is beautiful, the food is delicious and the staff is friendly. A wonderful place to have breakfast with family or friends.

title: Nice venue ,
comment: I was there for dinner I previously visited and I had the best lunch ever vegan burger sooo yummy !!!  Then I came back for dinner which wasn’t very nice we ordered 5 dishes to share and they where all abit naff the risotto was horrible the prawns where the best but £8 for 4 prawns ???  Coffee is always nice there , Id go for lunch but wouldn’t return for dinner ,

title: What a wonderful cafe.
comment: I was there for an early supper shortly before Christmas. Expected cafe food but not so. the most delicious dishes of all kinds. Really superb cooking and dishes. I just long to go back for supper and would love to try their breakfast and lunch.

title: We visited this cafe as a
comment: We visited this cafe as a party of five. We had booked and were greeted by name. Once seated we had the menu explained to us. That might seem a little strange but this venue produces food in small portions (larger than tapas) which encourages one to browse and share. They were able to accommodate my need for gluten free options, which in no way impinged upon the quality of the delicious food on offer. We were introduced to some Transylvanian wines which were surprisingly good and proved an excellent compliment to the eight or so dishes we ordered. Everything is cooked to order and dishes arrive in a steady flow - don’t expect rapid delivery. An interesting concept which could see a growth in the “bistro” market.

title: Fantastic
comment: Delicious food, generous portions and helpful staff. The cafe is clean, nicely decorated and has an outdoor area. I would highly recommend this cafe

title: Came across Wild Thyme by
comment: Came across Wild Thyme by chance when in Shepherds Bush and had a lovely meal. Staff were very attentive and couldn’t have been more helpful. Food was delicious - way beyond any kind of standard chicken burger and the thyme potatoes were gorgeous. Will definitely be back.

title: Delightful and quiet spot
comment: Delightful and quiet spot near Shepherd’s Bush, we chose it from the strongly positive reviews on several listings. It earned every one of the five point rating. Clean, attractive and smelling of good things in the kitchen, we were warmly welcomed. Seated at a remote table with a view of the garden patio. Small but sturdy wine list, but they aspire to expand it. We ordered four dishes —. Cauliflower (roasted and served with seasoned turnip mash, roasted eggplant with cherry tomatoes and fresh dill — it was to die for. Also ordered hummus with sauted lamb and fresh pine nut, and the poached salmon on avocado mousse tinged with wasabi. All were excellent. Finished dinner with their goats’ milk cheese cake laced with figs sitting atop linseed crackers with homey and tangerine gel. Lots of great concepts, well executed with exceptional service. Can’t wait to return.

title: Great food and perfect location!
comment: The food is amazing! In the summer the gardens are lovely to relax and drink a wine. And i loved the location.

title: Delicious food and lovely service
comment: Been here a few times, for brunch and dinner, and every time we have had a fantastic time. The food is delicious (especially the chocolate fondant!) and they are always very willing to cater for our gluten free needs -- especially as one of us is coeliac. Lovely service, very friendly staff, and always a great atmosphere, would highly recommend!

title: Best British cuisine
comment: I discovered and visited this amazing place last week having the best veggi breakfast in my life. Super attentive service and fantastic atmosphere. I will come back
Great staff and amazing food! Will return to London and WILL visit again! Had the French toast and hands down, the best I’ve ever had!

title: Tasteful and Tasty
comment: This was the first time at Wild Thyme for me. My husband and I were visiting London and were meeting with a friend. This popped up in my search for good veg/vegan places. It looked interesting, so I decided to go there. I was not disappointed at all. The young man at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful. He explained how the restaurant worked and recommended some items. The food was excellent and presented beautifully. Service was great. All in all, a lovely experience. I would definitely go there multiple times when I return to London. Be warned that it's a tiny little place, but super charming with great food and service!

title: Delicious brunch
comment: I found about this place by accident and I'm so happy I did. Somehow I felt really at peace when I was there. They have perfect food options for everyone. Vegan friendly.

title: Perfect
comment: We go to Wild Thyme regularly and they are always perfect, incredibly fast service, fresh, great food, lovely interiors (and garden) and lovelier people! Can't recommend it enough!

title: no way no 7 resto in london
comment: perfectly adequate breakfast but definitely nothing to write home about. I had the English breakfast. Everything was of good quality but I would not rate it as exceptional in any way

title: Worthy of previous reviews
comment: We came because of the TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed  . We were staying at Hammersmith and due to the closure of Ravenscourt Park after the firework displays we had to work hard to find this place. We were not disappointed, every detail was perfect from the freshly squeezed juice to the sourdoughs toast.

title: Loyal customer for nearly three years! Never disappoints!
comment: My partner and I've been going to this cafe for nearly three years (since we moved to Shepherds Bush). The food is amazing, menu is diverse (so you never get sick of it), and the staff is very involved and friendly. We love the owners - they're always so attentive and really care about the service and quality of food. Make sure you book in advance or go in for food at a later time because it will be incredibly busy!! The food is so worth the wait though.  Food - The breakfasts are so good - they offer a meaty one, a veggie one, and a vegan one along with many other classics. It's not greasy like your typical English breakfasts... it feels healthy and so reasonably priced.  Coffee - Definitely go for the iced lattes in the summer (thanks Nick!) or a big fat cappuccino.  If you're wondering whether to go to this one of the other cafe just around the corner called Proud Marys, please please please, go to Wild & Thyme one. You'll leave the restaurant feeling so happy and content. They're so passionate about this restaurant and you can really feel how much love goes into their food and service.  We will be going back for food for as long as they stay open :)

title: Poor service for such a highly rated café
comment: Was here for brunch and the food was absolutely atrocious. Eggs were cold! Everything was cold! Even the hot drinks were luke warm which at this point makes drinking them unbearable when they should be drank got. No remorse from anyone and slow service. Overpriced hipster cafe They even had the guts to force a service charge. Recommend never coming again

title: Nice place
comment: After reading the reviews we decided to give a try Very nice food, I would improve the gluten free options.overwall beautiful experience

title: Great restaurant
comment: Just off the Uxbridge Road this family run restaurant is one of Londons lesser known attractions. Great food , great host and hostess , and a great ambience. Well worth a trip but book in advance, it has got very busy.

title: Okay
comment: We came because of the TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed . We were staying at wild thyme as much as we can

title: Amazing little place
comment: The food was amazing and the staff is extremely accommodating. I went with two small children and we had a great time. Definitely visiting again.

title: Favourite Brunch place
comment: We love our Wild Thyme, been coming here for an year now and never disappointed. Staff is friendly, food is great, always consistent never had a bad meal even when busy, definitely 5 out of 5, sometimes even 6 out of 5!

title: Great little spot
comment: The coffee was really good  The food was made with very fresh good quality ingredients  The service was excellent  Would recommend!

title: Incredible food and fantastic service.
comment: Believe the hype. This place is a hidden gem that delivers on food, drinks and service. My girlfriend stopped in for brunch and left very happy.

title: Excellent food and service
comment: Excellent food and service, plenty of choice and everything was cooked lovely. Attentive staff who ensured you were well looked after.

title: Delicious food, great service
comment: Delicious food, great service and a very fresh and bright restaurant. Can really recommend it. A bit of a walk to get therefrom the tube, but worth it.

title: Brunch/dinner London
comment: Came for breakfast today based on reviews and it didn't disappoint - both on food and friendly service. Booked on line the night before to guarantee a table as we'd planned to go to the V&A before heading out to the shops. The location was perfect for our plan and we parked for free right outside on a Sunday. Will definitely try for dinner next time we're down this way.

title: WILD THYME BREAKFAST
comment: Delicious food, good location and comparable prices. The food smelled and looked SO GOOD! Wild Thyme Breakfast was the best.

title: Outstanding!!
comment: This place takes humble food and elevates it to new heights! The full breakfast was outstanding; perfectly cooked, and the chilli beans were an amazing taste sensation. And to top it all off the service was perfect. I highly recommend this place!!

title: Best in the Bush
comment: Great food? Check! Lovely atmosphere? Check check! Passionate owners? Check, check, check! You owe it to yourself to give Wild Thyme a go - you won't regret it.

title: Great Name, Great Place
comment: This place is off the main high street, but well worth seeking out. We were greeted with a warm welcome on arrival. We advised the owner my husband was coeliac & he was happy to explain the safe options. The food was well cooked and a healthy portion, lovely coffee too. A lovely warm atmosphere, friendly, Caring owner. Great variety & choice. Would highly recommend taking a detour to this place.

title: Awesome visit
comment: A genuine warm and friendly welcome was just the start of a very pleasant visit to Wild Thyme. The service could not be faulted...and both the tradition and vegan breakfast were cooked to perfection and presented delightfully. Very good coffee too. Well worth a detour to this little haven

title: Great food
comment: Great food,service,and price. Best cafe in west London ,go for the breakfast,and chocolate fondant afterwards. Absolutely delicious

title: Quirky twist on breakfast
comment: Excellent food and service at breakfast. Spicy beans and sour bread served with quality sausage and bacon.

title: Excellent Food at a Reasonable Price
comment: This is a hidden gem in London. Off the beaten path. Cafe is small but food is outstanding. I had the fish cakes with a poached egg. Highly recommend!

title: Very nice
comment: Had a great meal here. Will be back again and if you are local I would reccomend for you to check out. Good food

title: A hidden gem
comment: If you are in the area, then make sure you visit. I had the duck and it was to die for! Also, be sure to have a dessert given that all 6 of ours were incredible!

title: great experience
comment: great restaurant great food in London. I am expecting to come back again with friends for dinner. total recommend.

title: What a wonderful time!
comment: The food was amazing. The food was freshly made and very well made. My husband got the French toast, which I stole a piece of, it was delicious! It was just sweet enough without being overly sweet. Then I had the avocado toast. It was fantastic. The fresh avocados, the poached eggs, and I got a side of bacon.  To top it all off, the restaurant owner was great as well. He was really nice and made us feel at home. He was willing to chat with us about our trip, where we were from, etc. This place is 5 stars for very good reasons. I definitely recommend it.

title: Excellent brunch
comment: Visited once and we had one of the best brunch in a while. The food was delicious and the service impeccable.

title: What a Gem
comment: We came for brunch - delicious - definitely deserves all the positive reviews and top rating on TA! We will definitely return.

title: Excellent place to have breakfast with Family
comment: We had an excellent breakfast - place is kid friendly and the staff very nice - highly recommend !!!

title: Perfect place to eat if you
comment: Perfect place to eat if you are looking for good food and relaxing atmosphere with your family and friends

title: Pleasantly surprised
comment: I came across the TripAdvisor reviews of this restaurant then decided to try it... Just had the best brunch of my life!! Thanks

title: Good food
comment: Very nice place .and very friendly people. Very good food also.I will come again sure. I like your restaurant

title: Fall in love!
comment: I came on Saturday for a brunch with my husband, attentive staff. Best brunch I've had and a lovely atmosphere. Definitely recommend it!

title: Great food lovely quaint place to eat
comment: Took my husband for a birthday brunch on Monday 09.09.19. The place was very clean, nice sized menu but not lots of choices but enough (sometimes larger menu's too much to choose from and then the food is not that great). We had the veggie and normal breakfast which was very nice indeed and almost felt the quality was locally sourced but if not then v good ingredients! We had a bottle of wine, the 2 breakfasts and sweet potato fries which were hot and crispy for a change. Thanks to the chef and the staff it was a lovely brunch £44 with service charge many thanks we will be back for lunch and evening meal real soon - nice place for birthday or special occasion and a little outside front garden/courtyard for when weather is good

title: My local favourite
comment: Nothing can beat a weekend with brunch at Wild Thyme, or dinner, or just a pastry with coffee. This is my absolute local favourite place to go alone or with friends, lovely set up & service, super friendly and consistently good.

title: Delicious experience- excellent!
comment: My husband and I thought this was our best resto yet in London. It is a very cute space in a neighbourhood, nicely laid out. The service was friendly and professional. The food was really delicious. I am really very picky, and it’s been a long time that I’ve found a resto that made me completely fulfilled at the end.  We ordered the foie gras, which was so good. The tempura shrimps were in delicious crisp pockets, which we then requested a second order. And the Faberge egg dish is literally to die for. Cannot imagine the technical ability required to fry a poached egg and still have a soft beautiful yolk remaining...brilliant with a wow sauce. I absolutely recommend this resto, and the chef, for being so clever in the kitchen. Awesome resto, one that you should try.

title: what a little Shepherds Bush treasure
comment: You would not walk past this place as it is off the beaten track down a side road off a 'non-gentrified' part of The Bush (mid Uxbridge road). There are some solid boozers and some great cafes of various ethnic cooking in this area but this bistro cum cafe cum modern British cooking restaurant is a find and a treat. the technical cooking is genuinely impressive a kind of poached then fried in bread crumbs egg dish in a pecorino sauce was a delight - as there were two of us and the plates are the current 'sharing' variety, we had to order another. A small plate of crispy belly pork with smooth mash was also on point and was some bavette served on kebab sticks. they were all nicely garnished with various mini veggies. i think their secret is a relatively small menu that can be handled in the small, open kitchen. the wine list is also small and fun. A bottle of an excellent Monastrell blend for 32 quid (I think) was dangerous at 14.5% as I found out to my cost the next day (yes, we had two)

title: Excellent as always
comment: still the best place to eat in the area for both breakfast and dinner, friendly staff. consistent good food and all around great atmosphere. this place needs to be moved up in the ranks

title: Amazing menu, good and service
comment: Love love love his place! Been a few times lately and it’s consistently great. Staff are awesome too

title: The best secret restaurant in Shepherd's Bush!!
comment: I live close to Wild Thyme and have been going there since it opened. Lucia and her husband have created a lovely restaurant with a beautiful atmosphere both inside and on the smal outdoor patio. The food is creative and consistently stunning focused on inventive Mediterranean small plates. Can't recommend highly enough, our favorite spot in the neighborhood by miles! Will keep going back regularly.

title: Excellent!
comment: A really lovely place! Excellent food, quick service and accommodating! Great local place and couldn’t recommend more!

title: Everything is great
comment: Food service is great. They cant do enough for you. My child wanted extra things and they arrived. She can be fussy at time. A bit of a princess. Thanks

title: What a charming place!
comment: My husband, sister and I are just finishing off dinner at the Wild Thyme cafe right now, and we’ve had such a lovely meal that I felt compelled to post a review right away.  The food was excellent and the service was charming. The food portions were good and I would particularly recommend the pork belly, the smoky aubergine, and the chocolate fondant. We’re visiting the area at the moment and will definitely come again.

title: They must be doing something right......
comment: .......if a tiny and awkwardly shaped, out of the way , half bench style restaurant can be ranked no 6 out of 19,100 restaurants in London by TripAdvisor recommendations. They ( that is the Romanian wife and husband team and their talented chefs) are indeed doing it right. The small plate menu is created with ideas from Turkey, China Italy and Lebanon , but all made their own. But that is not the main attraction, which brings us, who are lucky to be its near neighbours, back so often The secret ingredient of the Wild Thyme is the enthusiastic charm of the place inspired by little Lucia at the helm. Sometimes I just go in for a drink or to read my book, knowing that I will always be happier when I leave than when I go in.

title: Delicious food, lovely staff!
comment: This place is slightly off the beaten path but well worth the trip. We had the tapas menu on a Saturday night, sitting out on the patio. Every dish was delicious from the foie gras and pork belly to the baba and wild soul. The wine selection is unusual but beautifully chosen. The staff (owners?) were helpful and friendly and we would love to go back.

title: Gem in West London
comment: A little gem in West London, faultless. Exceptional food at sensible prices, wonderful staff front of and back of house, great ambiance. Can’t wait to try their evening menu. Best birthday treat rounded off with a beautiful birthday plate and fab chocolate and raspberry dessert thank you!!

title: A Truly Fantastic 5 Star Cafe
comment: Stopped off here one morning with my brother for some breakfast and wow what a find. Very friendly and efficient service. The food is super fresh and tasty. Best Full English Ever the spicy beans are a nice touch and great value at £9.50. The same goes for the veggie breakfast. If you’re in West London check it out. Finally I must say the Music (we’re both Musicians) they played was excellent.

title: Very cozy corner
comment: My first time today. It has a familiar/nice environment.  I had the vegan breakfast, was quite nice.  Their hash browns are more of a kind of fried potato puree, not the conventional ones, quite tasty tho. Not sure if they have vegan dessert. Coffee is excellent.

title: You won't regret it
comment: Let me tell you, everything was great! Food, staff, location...just amazing! The implication of staff is obvious, they are very passionate about delivering the best service. Would recommend!

title: Sunday Brunch with friends
comment: I have come for brunch, with friends, in this place several times now in the past few months. From day one we received a very warm welcome and a professional costumer service. We had the chance, once, to chat with the chef itself who came to discuss about the plates and how he cooks everything (one of my friends is a chef, so they could have gone on and on forever). The food is always of a very good quality and nicely served. I generally order a full English breakfast which is always filling and amazing tasty. As drink I often order an orange juice which always have fresh orange pieces inside and I never had to wait longer than five minutes even when the place was full. I highly raccomend everybody to take some time on your Sunday and go and try this amazing brunch.

title: Cute cafe
comment: Came friday afternoon with a friend for lunch, 1st impressions was what a loverly smell, this cafe has a very cosy feel with all the cushions on the seats, we was greeted pretty quickly and seated to our table, we both had avocado on toast which was loverly. overall nice experience.

title: Amazing Gem
comment: On a family trip to London, we came across the TripAdvisor reviews of this restaurant, and decided to try it, even though it is a bit out of the way. My recommendation: do not miss it! Fabulous food, amazing service and great ambience! The menu is all small to medium sized dishes, and the super helpful server who is also the owner guided us - so we ordered eight different small dishes that we shared, and they were so fabulous that we ordered two more of the ones we enjoyed most; the tuna steak salad and the pork belly. Desserts were also excellent, particularly the chocolate fondant and the fabulous wild thyme ice cream and meringue. Highly recommended - We will definitely come again!

title: Very very good
comment: The food od Hood, the decor is Nice , and the service od very fast and frendly All the time.  Def Will come back

title: Best place ever
comment: We have been there for breakfast/brunch few times. The service cannot be better and its really dog friendly. Food is awesome, best ingredients, great variety, nice taste and quick service. Its the best cafe/restaurant ever.

title: West London gem
comment: I love this place. Cozy, nicely decorated, great service. It was already my favourite spot for brunch until I found put their tapas dinner which is exceptional!

title: Excellent fusion tapas
comment: An intimate, welcoming, cafe come restaurant. We had a great night that made us feel we were a long way from the Uxbridge Road (it's about 40m away). We sat on a compact but beautifully secluded terrace. The diverse tapas menu is maybe a little disjointed but the food is excellently prepared. The Faberge Egg is wonderful as long as you like a cheesy sauce, and I definitley do! The breakfast and brunch menus look amazing, we'll be back, for sure.

title: Gem
comment: We were in London for emergency hospital treatment, so a visit to this superb restaurant was very welcome. We booked on Tuesday evening and enjoyed several tapas style dishes, which were prepared and cooked on demand. Its a nicely decorated small restaurant with lovely ambience. Service was very prompt. Highly recommended.

title: Dinner with my daughter
comment: Living in Milton Keynes means we don’t have much access to independent restaurants and on our special day out, I wanted to finish off somewhere that as going to surprise me. Trip Advisor told me this one would fit the bill and I was not disappointed. What a delightful find. The beautifully descriptive menu gave us plenty to choose from: the deliciously smoky aubergines, the smooth hummus and lamb, the crunchy tempura prawns and the mind-blowing seafood curry were a delight.  Luckily we managed to squeeze in dessert: the chocolate fondant oozed with raspberry as well as chocolate and the baba was fluffy and well soaked. One thing is for sure - I’ll definitely be back.

title: Amazing location for couples
comment: One of the best places for couple dinner. Well decorated and nice location. Had dinner with fiance and enjoyed food. The quality and taste of food is amazing.

title: Very average
comment: Small portions and very expensive food for what it is. Service is annoying as they keep coming to your table asking you to order more. Food is quite spicy even though we told them to keep the spices down. Drinks are also very overpriced - £11 for a small gin and tonic where the same thing is sold in other restaurants for no more than £6-8. Quite old environment as well. Reception staff fairly rude and very unaccommodating when we asked for a small birthday candle to be put on one of their desserts. The kulfi is the standard pot kulfis that you can get from any shop. Definitely would not be going again and avoid if you can!

title: Great breakfast - gem in shepherds bush
comment: Had weekend breakfast, very happy with the food quality, staff service and food options. Staff were very warm and went the extra mile to ensure all is well. I thought they were Portuguese at first but they are a mixture of Mediterranean and Middle Eastern. Give Shakshouka a try: cheese, vegetables, poached eggs with lots of spices.

title: Tantalising tapas!
comment: Having been here for brunch a few times (exceedingly good) we decided to try their evening menu. Although it’s billed as Tapas, the portions are quite generous. We had the tuna steak salad, pork belly and foie gras. All three were stunning. I usually post pictures, but unfortunately they were so good it was too late for photos! We also shared a pudding which was excellent in the main but a little too sweet for me. That aside, they have Pinot Noir by the glass, excellent coffee and knowledgeable, discrete yet attentive service. Top marks.

title: Lovely little restaurant
comment: The food was very tasty and prepared in a appealing way. Make sure you book a table as the place is small but cosy.

title: Brilliant restaurant
comment: We arrived late after a theatre show and the kitchen was closing but they INSISTED we go there and they'd feed us. We were the only people left but were treated like royalty. Service brilliant, wine lovely, and food impeccable. Cannot recommend Wild Thyme (and it's ever changing menu) enough.

title: Worth the walk
comment: We were staying near Shepherds Bush tube station but decided to walk (about a mile) because of the great reviews. It was worth it! Both the veggie and regular breakfasts were great and the staff were friendly. There a nice atmosphere too. The orange juice was squeezed as we watched and the coffee was first class. Lovely place, worth the walk.

title: A Culinary Shangri La in Shepherd's Bush
comment: This is a real hidden gem of a cafe and restaurant just off of the beaten track of Uxbridge Road in W12, some of the best food, ambiance, and service you will find in West London. The menu is simple but very delicious and the establishment oozes a feeling of coziness and relaxed atmosphere. If you are ever in the area I'd highly recommend giving it a try.

title: Lovely food and service
comment: The vegetarian breakfast was amazing. Cosy, relaxed atmosphere. Friendly service, would recommend this restaurant.

title: Amazing food, service and atmosphare
comment: Frankly, it's just a small Caffè on side rode. But with amazing chef, staff, owners and atmosphare.. everything is perfect. Portions are big and satisfying, caffee is delicious and nicely prepared, staff is friendly. There is garden with flowers, bar with homemade cakes and basicaly everything u need to feel happy.

title: Best Place in London
comment: Best place I have been in London. The food is just amazing From breakfast to dinner. Good quality of products for very good prices. Very friendly staff. I recommend 100%.

title: Amazing place
comment: I really love this place, I always try to come when I can. The food is very tasty and good looking :)

title: Hidden Gem
comment: This is probably one of the top restaurants on my list to pay a visit to while in London.  Chef Roberto is so good at fusion dishes and could always bring surprises to the customers (in the good way of course). You are able to easily find local, Italian, French, Mediterranean, South-east Asian, Indian, Japanese, Chinese and etc cuisines here. He modifies menu occasionally to bring seasonal ingredients to the table as well. It couldn’t be wrong to have a pleasant meal at a restaurant which recommended by both the neighbors and travelers.

title: Great Breakfast
comment: Staying at the Dorsett in Shepard’s Bush and a disappointing dinner prompted me to look elsewhere for breakfast.  A ten minute walk but well worth it!  Quiet restaurant with quaint indoor & outdoor seating ideal for breakfast, I had poached eggs on sourdough, really fresh eggs and perfectly soft.  Perfect start to my day and will definitely be back!

title: My favourite!
comment: I have been coming to the wild thyme for decent few months now, and whether to pick up my coffee on a daily basis, have lunch or dinner- I have never been disappointed. Coffee is consistently good, same as the food. Love the dinner menu btw! Big shout out to Lucia, Nick and Robi- positive, on the top of their game, and always making my mornings better :)

title: 40th birthday meal
comment: Great venue, food was incredible and service was outstanding. Will definitely be returning. My wife and family had a great time.

title: For Foodies, London W12's little gem. Just go both for exceptional Breakfasts and selected evenings Fusion Tapas.
comment: A Breakfast venue until recently they have now started opening in the evenings from Tuesday to Saturday when they offer a Fusion Tapas Menu. The result is food of the highest quality. Special Prawns Tempura is as good as any anywhere including Michelin starred venues (£9.50) which we started with. Fresh king Prawns done in light sage batter that came with a dip of Mirin, Ginger, Soya and Yuzu lime dip. Stunning. Followed by Sea Bream Ceviche (£10.00) which was the only slightly discordant note (and it was slight) as the lime marinated fish came with a passion fruit glaze that dominated the subtle taste of the bream. The Beef Bavette (£7.50) was again outstanding served as it was on generous skewers of tender beef Bavette on a bed of grilled Turkish chilli and spring onion, smoked cherry tomatoes and roasted garlic (barely noticed) scattered with a lemon flavoured sprinkling of sumac. Delightful.  The Crispy Pork Belly and creamy mash dish (£8.00) again hit all the foodie right notes. Suckling pork belly yes i repeat Suckling , served with creamy mash potato with cider braised red cabbage and cranberries and pecan nuts toasted in maple syrup and balsamic vinegar.Again worth the trip on its own. Very generous portions.  Chef Roberto Albanese is a discovery so go and experience his work. Great service, Family run. accompanied by a Romanian pinot noir form Transylvania which was simple and refined (£20.90).

title: Amazing breakfast
comment: Amazing breakfast. Recommend this place highly. Me and my partner think it’s the best breakfast we’ve ever had. Staff were very accommodating. Thank you again

title: A delightful oasis near Shepherds Bush
