comment: Lovely setting, tasty and unusual menu, friendly service. Will definitely return.  Only negative was a 12.5% service charge automatically added - I would far rather tip of my own volition, which I would have been very willing to do.

title: Amazing!
comment: I've been there few times and every time I'm more than happy. Amazing food, amazing atmosphere. Very cool!

title: Amazing Vibes !!!
comment: Definitely the right place for a great (Thyme) Amazing presentation of the dishes and meticulous selection of ingredients. I really enjoyed the vegan options ,I had the Pumpkin and Tangerine Risotto that I truly recommend... We'll be back, thank you for your super friendly service ❤

title: Soul food unique gem
comment: Cooking is an art, they say, but too many times nowadays you are left we a beautiful artistic picture to show and that's it. It's much more difficult to breath a soul in the food you prepare and this place certainly has both, art and soul.  It's a rather unique place where the chef presents fresh delicious food that clearly shows attention and sensibility, at the same time remaining down to hearth and true.  A real little treasure to experience.  Just go and try it, you won't be disappointed

title: Great Experience, both Dinner & Brunch!
comment: Came back for brunch after visiting this place for dinner months ago. Really good service and atmosphere! Great food too, fresh and well prepared ingredients with the Chef's special touch. The chicken burger was amazing, richly stuffed and still keeping a delicate balance with flavours.

title: Amazing food, lovely atmosphere
comment: I ate an ex tempore dinner here on a Saturday evening. Already the atmosphere, with friendly staff and subtle jazz music, was welcoming - but the food was exceptionally good. I had the aubergine salad and pork belly, both dishes so good they almost brought a tear to my eye. Pinot noir red wine by glass worth its price. Hidden gem in Shepherd's Bush, warmly recommend.

title: Local Gem
comment: Wild Thyme has quickly become a locals favorite! It's a great place for breakfast, brunch or dinner (they offer amazing tapas to share) and I love sitting in their garden on sunny days! Turkish eggs for breakfast is must-have! The restaurant team is great and they all make you feel like home!

title: Thank you!
comment: I have been coming to Madhu's Heathrow from Ireland every July for 5 years now to celebrate a loved one's birthday. They have never failed to impress and this year - 2020 - was no different. Amazing, tasty food. Wonderful ambience. Efficient, warm, courteous service. A MASSIVE thank you to Vinod, Claudio and all of the team for delivering a consistently super service over the years. I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough.

title: Reservation made online not available after phoning Madhu's
comment: I made a reservation at Madhu's in Heathrow for 9 people for 24th August. The reservation was made on 20th August using Madhu's website which goes through Quandoo. I had not received an email to confirm the reservation. After phoning them today, they said that their restaurant was fully booked for that day and all other days. They said that I should phone them to make the reservation but this was not stated on their website. I just used the Reserve Now link to make the booking. Do not even bother going to this restaurant as the service is absolutely appalling. Their reservation system is crap.

title: Really excellent food!
comment: Really excellent food!  On an overnight stay at a nearby hotel we gave this a try. The food was excellent. The portions look small but were actually a really good size. Not the cheapest but much better than some options near the airport. Our 7 year old usually picks at a bit of chicken but ate over half an adult portion of fairly mild chicken curry!  The service was good too and they had all the necessary precautions right now.

title: Amazing gem of a restaurant
comment: We love this restaurant for dinner. The food is sublime and it’s a favourite with our whole family. The couple that run it are charming and the attention to detail is amazing. I would recommend the Bavette and the Octopus as must try. Tapas based dishes - and the cost is very reasonable. I can not recommend it highly enough and worth a journey into Shepherds Bush

title: Delicious
comment: Excellent service and perfect food! Can’t wait to visit again. Tucked away from the main road, this wonderful restaurants offers up yummy brunch and exquisite dinners

title: Taste sensation
comment: We had a fantastic meal with some outstanding dishes - ceviche, octopus and seafood curry were highlights. Found room for pudding and were equally impressed by both. Lovely, relaxed service - would urge anyone to give Wild Thyme a go as definitely a treat.

title: Reliably Excellent
comment: It''s a lovely vibe: relaxed, friendly, beautiful decor, regular artists' exhibits on the walls. Coffee is great and there is always a really good cake. Food is creative, traditional dishes with an unusual twist, and very good. My dog knows the way there, I go so often.

title: Best brunch ..... maybe ever!
comment: This little place was recommended to me recently and what a brilliant find it was! The veggie & vegan breakfasts are both beautiful. Plenty of fresh, varied food and beautifully presented. The ambiance is very relaxed and what really sets it apart from its local brunch competition is the lovely, attentive service. We will definitely be becoming regulars at this perfect little local spot!

title: Excellent food, good service and great value.
comment: Superb new addition to the area with a relaxed and friendly vibe. Shepherds Bush has been crying out for decent brunch type places so it's nice to see a place like this opening up. Will definitely be going back.

title: Lovely brunch on the weekend
comment: Lovely, attentive staff. Best brunch I've had and a lovely atmosphere.  Would definitely recommend to those in the Shepherds Bush area or further afield!

title: Delightful, delicious place
comment: Had dinner there with friends on Saturday night and it was really lovely. Charming couple running the place and cooking delicious, interesting food made with real care. A proper low key treat. Excellent wine at very good prices. Cannot recommend highly enough

title: I DON'T UNDERSTAND HOW THIS PLACE IS NOT BUSIER
comment: This is the most excellent little restaurant tucked off the Uxbridge Road. I really don't understand how it is not heaving every night of the week! The food is absolutely delicious and I would say fairly reasonably priced too. I have been for brunch and dinner a number of times and both were delicious! Staff very friendly too! Highly recommended!

title: Really good Indian!!!
comment: Came here with the family a couple of weeks ago and had a really good time. The dishes are a little different from your average Indian and my wife and kids were craving Chicken Tikka Masala. It is not on the menu but they did it...and with breast meat for them! My daughter said it is possibly the best Chicken Tikka Masala she's ever had!!!  Would definitely go back.

title: I can't stop eating here
comment: this place is unique and you wont find a place like this anywhere. staff are friendly and the place is very clean

title: A lovely place for dinner
comment: What a great little restaurant in a quiet location just off the Uxbridge Road. Delicious food, very friendly and helpful service. We both had smoked aubergine salad with perfect tomatoes, then I had a crispy egg with lovely runny yoke when I cut into it, served with a pecorino sauce, and my friend had seafood curry which she said was very good. We shared a dessert of Italian meringue, ginger crumb and thyme icecream and both had fresh mint tea. Everything beautifully presented, very high quality and the bill including service came to £45! Highly recommended.

title: An excellent service with
comment: An excellent service with delicious food I would recommend to all those who love desi food in great atmosphere served by a friendly staff.

title: Meaty place
comment: Great place for dinner for meat lovers!!! Do take a bit more time as the food is freshly cooked on spot.

title: Tawa experience
comment: Firstly, great chapli kebabs, food on the tawa tasted fresh and flavoursome...naans were thin and hot, and service was good... Only thing I would say is that the tawa for 2 people could have larger proportions of the various items on the tawa...

title: Superb - well worth a visit
comment: An excellent restaurant for dinner. The food is sublime and it’s a favourite with our whole family. The couple that run it are charming and the attention to detail is superb. I would recommend the Bavette and the Octopus as must try. Tapas based dishes and the cost is very reasonable. I can not recommend it highly enough - well worth a journey into Shepherds Bush.

title: Perfect Eggs & Delicious Coffee!!
comment: Spotlessly clean, well presented premises and food, really welcoming and polite.  Perfect eggs and bacon on sourdough.  Delicious latte.  Will be back.

title: Great night, yummy food, excellent wine
comment: Food - tasty and beautifully presented Calurasi Pinot noir - delicious Service - Charming Heartily recommend!

title: Fab food fab service
comment: Wild Thyme restaurant in Shepherd’s Bush is a fabulous and relatively new edition to the area and one that must be visited! Opened back in 2017, the lovely Lucia and Alex run this beautiful, colourful, romantic and atmospheric restaurant just off the main road. You get a real and genuine welcome and feel thoroughly looked after during your visit. Attention to detail is everywhere, from the quality of their service right down to the little features throughout the restaurant, and of course in their incredible food. Recently Lucia and Alex opened the restaurant for dinner in addition to the much sought after breakfast and brunch that they already offer. This was a perfect opportunity for us to come down and see what all the fuss was about! The beautiful menu is sleek, sophisticated and creative. With 15 small plates to choose from, you know this place is all about quality over quantity. The suggested number of plates for one person is three so we chose the following six dishes: Baby Squid Salad (Pan fried baby squid and edamame beans, tossed with lemon gel, chili and parsley and topped with grated pecorino cheese and cress £9.00) Polenta Buttons (Button shaped bites of Polenta, widely flooded with creamy Blue Cheese sauce. Crunchy roasted hazelnuts and chives £6.50) Grilled Beef Bavette (Skewers of ever tender beef Bavette on a bed of grilled Turkish chilli and spring onion. Smoked cherry tomatoes and roasted garlic scattered with lemony sprinkles or sumac £7.50) Special Prawns Tempura (King prawns in a special sage tempura. Mirin, ginger soya and Yuzu lime dip. Chilli, spring onion and coriander top £9.50) Cured Beef Fillet (Thinly sliced cured beef with nutty crumbs of Amaretti Biscuit. An array of home-pickled mushroom with truffle oil as a finish touch £9.00) Poor Dressed Like Rich – Story of An Egg (Soft poached egg in a cloud of rich potato béchamel. Sautéed wild mushroom and bacon with truffle oil £6.50) Wild Thyme Restaurant in Shepherd's Bush Wild Thyme Restaurant in Shepherd's Bush Every single dish was incredibly presented with the most intricate of detail.The Polenta buttons were bsolutely beautiful to look at and tasted just as good too. The creamy blue cheese that oozed out of this little golden buttons was a dream! The baby squid was fantastic and the dip so thick which made it a perfect combination. The cured beef was outstanding and was so deliciously creamy. We loved the nutty addition of the Amaretti biscuits and mushroom and the truffle oil topped it off perfectly – it was absolutely divine! Poor Dressed Like Rich was also one of my all-time favourites. It was a real hearty dish and the creaminess of the truffle oil with the potato and egg was an absolute treat. We chose two out of the three desserts to try and they were absolute heaven! The Chocolate Fondant (a volcanic chocolate and raspberry fusion with vanilla ice cream £5.50) was complete perfection and beautifully presented with slightly crispy chocolate on the outside and heaven on the inside. The subtle raspberry flavours enabled this dish to not be too rich and the ice cream was a great addition. The Poached Pear (Spiced poached pear in saffron, Greek yoghurt, mixed seeds and berries £5.00) was gorgeous to look at and went so well with the Greek yoghurt. It was an enjoyable and relatively healthy dessert! We were absolutely gutted that this perfect restaurant isn’t closer to home! If you have tried their breakfast or brunch then dinner is not to be missed. This gem of a restaurant in Shepherd’s Bush was great value for the quality of the food and the service was amazing.

title: Great place to eat - vegan friendly
comment: We have been using this cafe most mornings for the last fortnight and always receive a warm welcome and the coffee is the best - good and hot. I am vegan and they are very accommodating. They are also open for dinner but I would book to make sure you get in. This is indeed a special place.

title: Most delicious home made healthy food
comment: The food here is totally different to the average restaurant. Something as simple as hash browns tasted gourmet. Really great wholesome organic flavours with great service and a warm atmosphere. Can not wait to return

title: Fantastic plave
comment: Had lunch here on Saturday - great place for ambience, service and food. My burger was excellent and my wife said her veggie burger was the best she’s ever had!

title: Best cafe in Shepherds Bush
comment: Great lunch time menu & great service, as a group of guys we have never had any below par food. Excellent

title: A welcome new option for dinner in W12
comment: Wild Thyme has been open for a while now but until recently it was a breakfast and lunch only venue. However luckily for us it’s recently extended to evening meals with a completely different menu.  The cuisine style is mid size share plates, but some are so good you may have trouble sharing. I lost count but there seemed to be roughly a dozen dishes to choose from. Not sectioned into starters or mains all the same size. The options covered vegetarian, meat and fish. Octopus was memorable as was the beef carpaccio with truffle oil and tiny mushrooms. The fish was fried in a light batter and served in a mini deep fry pan. Other highlights were a superbly seasoned Aubergine dish and a variation on a Greek salad. It’s a good place to go with a few friends so it’s easy to order everything and double up on something that’s too popular. Think up market Mezze with a twist.  We ate on a mid-week night shortly after opening, so not so busy. Fortunately this gave us time to chat to the couple running the business. She is front of house and he is the chief, both Romanian which accounted for the some of the wines on the list hailing from there. They built it all up from scratch and it’s clearly a labour of love.  There were three deserts. All home made,all delicious. If you only have one pick the chocolate.  Highly recommend and we shall return often.

title: Talented chef, great menu, sensible prices
comment: Wild Thyme has been the go-to cafe for an excellent all-day breakfast since it opened, so it's a wonderful idea to serve food in the evening too. The tapas menu is extensive, interesting and unusual; there's definitely something for everyone.  Cured beef was most favorite, swiftly followed by cod fritters. Smoked Aubergine salad was excellent and the Greek dakos salad wonderfully refreshing. Short drinks list delivers a good choice - and the service is DELIGHTFUL. Wild Thyme really is an stunning setup - there are lots more dishes to try, so I'll be back soon.

title: Perfect
comment: Great place for a Sunday brunch, great staff and good food. For the tea, they use Damann Frères my favourite brand. I recommend it

title: Food and service superb
comment: Every dish I have ordered including drinks is served impeccably and tastes delicious. Quality food at fair prices in clean friendly quiet surroundings

title: Excellent, Friendly, Casual Dinner
comment: I went this evening with my daughter. The menu is tapas-style, with a lot of unusual and creative dishes. We had six dishes, all of which were all outstanding. We had bright orange Aperol sprtizers, followed by a Romanian wine, which was lovely. A beautiful venue to spend a summer evening. The service is charming and relaxed, but attentive. Definitely going back.

title: Loved it!
comment: Unexpectedly lovely place in this area. Being local, I was desperate to find something nearby as beautiful in interior and superb in taste as this place. I would totally recommend breakfast and brunch there. As they are now opened for dinner, I would love to try it one day.

title: Excellent food and service, what a hidden Gem!
comment: Myself and a group of 5 friends absolutely loved brunch here today. We had a variety of their breakfasts (vegetarian, eggs Florentine, and their version of the full English) the food was exceptional. The home made hash brows were delicious and everything came in good time and with lovely service. Friendly service, great coffee and dog friendly.. we will definitely be going back again.  Additionally although we didn’t order one, we noticed they also do vegan breakfasts - which looked great!

title: Wonderful!
comment: I went with friends to Wild Thyme last night for dinner. I have been with my toddler many times for breakfast and it has always been lovely but dinner was another level! The menu is made up of tapas style dishes with a middle eastern theme. We chose the lamb and hummus which was so delicious we immediately ordered a second portion. I am Lebanese so don't do well with mock-Middle Eastern food, however, this did not disappoint and was 5-star quality and very authentic. The octopus and the calamari were similarly yummy and had beautiful smoky flavours. The aubergine salad with croutons and pomegranate was beautifully fresh as was the salmon. The wine list although small is good and we opted for the Pinot Grigio rose, which was so tasty we quickly ordered a second! All in all a wonderful experience and I am hoping to book the whole place for my 40th in December so I can share this brilliant find with all my friends! :)

title: Lovely place to work
comment: Nice place, friendly staff, lovely decor. Generally a great place to work in the afternoon. Definitely would visit again.

title: You can never go wrong with herbs ...
comment: We happened upon this little spot with our London friend and really enjoyed our lunch. You can’t not like this place for the cute interior, the wonderful staff and the yummy food and drink. Try it!

title: Great place, Cody, excellent food and service
comment: Great discovery, original dishes. Product quality is top and value proposition unbeatable. Cody place, unpretentious. Much better than any gastrpub in the area. Fantastic tapas dishes: ceviche, octopus, bavette...

title: excellent
comment: I have been meaning to write a review about this place for a while now, I have been for breakfast very often and for dinner once. my honest opinion, this is the best breakfast place in the area. Service is very good and staff are friendly, food is on point, very consistent and delicious.  Every egg is perfect every time. as far as dinner goes the food is jazy and interesting, I didn't like the octopus with parmesan but that's my personal taste. the rest of the dinner from the aperitivo to dessert and coffee was excellent. This is a small place run by two very hard working individuals that care about their customers and it shows. bravi!

title: Marvelous people and food
comment: This is a place to fall in love with. Most wonderfull staff, food is lovely and beautifully presented. Just a little marvel

title: Beautiful breakfast lovely friendly atmosphere
comment: I went to Wild Thyme for brunch with family on a Saturday a few weeks ago. lovely warm atmosphere, the service was excellent, the food was delicious and very reasonably priced. I had avocado on gluten free bread with poached eggs (the best gluten free bread I've had and perfectly poached eggs) all really fresh and beautifully presented. It is the perfect spot to go for lunch with friends or family but I also noticed there was a few people sitting with laptops who seemed to be working. Great spot for that too. Lovely food and coffee with a warm friendly atmosphere in a great location.

title: Fantastic Breakfast!
comment: We just had an amazing breakfast, the freshly squeezed ginger, carrot and apple was beautiful. Spicy Beans on my veggie breakfast are delicious. Will be going back with my daughter to have waffles. We can’t wait until the beginning of May when they open for dinner, we will definitely be the first in the door!

title: Friendly local cafe/restaurant with fresh homemade food and juices.
comment: Friendly owner-managed cafe/restaurant with small menu featuring quality ingredients and Sunday lunch and about to offer evening dinner service in the near future. Delicious food prepared by real food enthusiasts. Home made cakes and desserts are exquisite.

title: Lovely warm friendly place
comment: I go there often. It is a very prettily decorated place. Lovely food served by very warm and friendly people.

title: Just what the neighbourhood needed
comment: This place has made living in the area SO much more pleasant.   The owners have managed to get just right all the different elements that are essential to make a place like this work. And it feels good to be there.  Food: excellent - great menu of healthy, tasty food, well prepared - avocado, halloumi, roasted tomatoes, etc as well as traditional brunch Great coffee; limited but good selection of cakes and pastries;  Atmosphere: elegant but homely - like the food, it's been given a lot of quiet care, but not trying too hard Service: lovely - friendly, thoughtful, altogether a pleasure.

title: Best english breakfast ever!
comment: We've been to the Wild Thyme last week and enjoyed the best english breakfast ever! The wild thyme breakfast was delicious, sofisticated, fresh ingredients perfectly balanced in the plate. The service was good, lovely people. Definetly recomend to anybody who's passing Sheppard's Bush Market

title: Lovely lunch!
comment: My baked egg with red peppers and chorizo was sublime, so was my friend’s fish cake, so many things I wanted to try on the menu so I will be back! Great staff, good atmosphere and high standards so another visit ASAP is an absolute must I feel.

title: Outstanding restaurant/cafe
comment: We go there regularly as it is an absolute pleasure to have such an outstanding restaurant/cafe on our doorstep. It has lifted the whole Uxbridge Road area. Superb breakfast and brunch with fabulous tapas dining in the evenings - Tuesday to Saturdays. Lucia and Alex with the help of Nick and a outstanding chef are doing a first class job. Bravo! A visit is essential.

title: Brilliant Tapas, brilliant place
comment: This is a small restaurant off the Uxbridge Road in Shepherds Bush and it has just opened for dinner. The menu is wonderful and varied with delicious food and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. They can also deal with gluten free/vegan - without sacrificing any taste. The ambience is lovely too - overall a great experience!

title: The absolute best!
comment: We’ve been to Wild Thyme quite a few times since it opened and it just gets better and better! The veggie and vegan breakfasts are incredible. Fresh, tasty and plenty of it.  The evening plates are really good too. We had a selection of small plates one evening and every one of them was lovely.  I can’t rate this place highly enough.

title: Nice place for food
comment: One of the best in the area. Food and service was amazing, highly recommend their Chapli kebab. Cant wait to come back again.

title: I've walked wanting to go to Peshawar, and not just for the food
comment: Speechless, the food was beyond anything I've ever tasted, complete authenticity delivered to a high standard.  The people here make you feel like a welcome guest in their homes, they are so loving and friendly, I will reccomend to anyone.

title: Charming undiscovered gem of a place.
comment: Tucked away off Uxbridge road, not far from Shepherd's Bush Market, is this charming restaurant. I have been twice for lunch with friends. It offers quality home cooked food tastefully presented, and the service is very friendly. I highly recommend it.

title: AMAZING AUTHENTIC PESHWARI FOOD
comment: Oh my god. As a regular visitor of pakistani restaurants around the west london area. I AM SO IMPRESSED with Taste of Peshawar.  First of all, the menu is simple - Which is a good thing. We had peshwari chicken, peshwari lamb and saag aloo for mains. Which were absolutely excellent - perfectly spiced and clearly freshly made.  The naan was literally some of the freshest naan I've had in a long time. To finish we had peshwari milk tea, which again was clearly cooked freshly for us and was wonderful end to a beautiful meal. I can't wait to visit again!

title: Shepherds Bush's secret gem
comment: Modest surroundings does not deter from a small and simple menu with surprisingly tasty, well cooked and original fare. Most welcoming and friendly atmosphere in this light and airy room which sports it own charming garden area with seating for sun seeking (weather permitting) or die hard smokers. Babies, dogs and computer hacks are often in attendance and good coffee is available as well as alcohol. Coffee shop with cocktails? What more can one ask for!

title: A perfect addition to the neighbourhood
comment: We had seen the adverts for this new off-the-main road place and finally decided to try it this week.. We were not disappointed... This is a really welcome addition to Shepherd's Bush!  Friendly owners (husband and wife) with an excellent menu and attentive staff in a newly renovated restaurant and garden. The poached eggs were perfectly cooked and served on delicious mashed avocado and sourdough bread, and there was also, a good selection of juices.  I hear they are going to do dinners too... This is soon going to become our favourite local eaterie!

title: Hidden Gem!
comment: This cafe is a lovely hidden gem! Located in Shepherds Bush, nestled away from the busy main road.  Great atmosphere and vibes. Staff were very friendly and provided good service.  The food was really good! Could not recommend enough, especially being so reasonably priced. Two main meals for under £20. I was very impressed.  I will definitely be returning and bringing friends with me to share in this amazing brunch/lunch spot.

title: really nice
comment: Lovely people, good food. A bit on the expensive side but amazingly tasty and the staff couldn't have been nicer

title: Lovely local restaurant
comment: The current owners are making a success of a site that has seen a number of poorly executed eateries The place is nice and bright inside, there is a very, homely feel about it As you walk in there are lovely cakes on dispaly The menu is a simple brunch menu A bit pricey but plenty to choose from We had the fish cake and the humus The fishcake came with a perfect poached egg, a bowl of home made tartare sauce and a small salad The fishcake was very tasty and the egg had a runny yolk - great. The tartare sauce was good as well My friend's humus had the home made look about it and it was a large helping and it came with a bowl of toasted bread. He enjoyed it greatly We also had a fresh orange juice and a carrot and apple juice and then coffees to finish with I noted meals others were eating and reckon I will be back to try them out We had a very pleasant time, enjoyed the food and the atmosphere a great local restaurant

title: A little treasure in the neighbourhood
comment: I was introduced to this charming and cosy cafe during my two week stay in London. The food is excellent and well priced. Dinner is available on Friday and Saturday nights. Suffice to say, I was at the cafe every other day for coffee, a light lunch and once for dinner.  Highlights: for breakfast- Eggs Benedict, homemade pancakes and homemade carrot cake. For dinner - prawn linguine, a chacuterie board (option for meat chacuterie, cheese or mixed), sliced beef with salad. There is a small selection of excellent wines to choose from as well. I love supporting independent businesses and this lovely establishment is run by the wonderful Lucia and Alec, with Chef Roberto helming the kitchen. If you are in the Shepherds Bush area, this cafe is worth the visit.

title: Charming place and service
comment: I have been here for brunch many times. It's lovely, cosy and charming. Service is very sweet and friendly. Food menu is just what you want. It's great to finally have such a great place near us.

title: Beautiful brunches, lunches and service
comment: I’m lucky enough to live just up the road from this little gem. The owners (Alex and Lucia I believe) are really friendly and welcoming, the food is exceptional with everything made fresh to order and the atmosphere in general is very chilled. My girlfriend and I are here regularly but only recently tried the Sunday Roast, which really was awesome. All in all I couldn’t recommend it enough. One thing I would say is to try and book ahead for weekend visits as they can get particularly busy.

title: Lovely food, great service and friendly
comment: I've been twice now- great food and service on both visits. They were very welcoming to children too. An amazing ice coffee and fresh baked goods.

title: Delicious and Delightful all-day cafe
comment: Breakfast is the best meal of the day! Certainly it is here in the sunny garden of this newly opened café in W12. It's hard to chose between the different types of eggs benedict, pancakes, avocado on brioche or just go for the Wild Thyme breakfast and wait to be surprised by what the chef decides to use today. If it's carbs you're after, there are wonderful homemade cakes, focaccia or croissants all day long. Everything can be accompanied by excellent coffee. On Sundays, the chef does a couple of roasts - my beef was perfectly pink and I had loads of vegetables too. A drinks license will be coming soon, I believe. Delightful service - and great food. Wild Thyme is a fabulous new addition to the Uxbridge Road.

title: New chilled cafe, welcome addition to Bush
comment: Beautiful, bright and clean cafe. Friendly and attentive staff. Fresh, simple and delicious food, good price. Great for Sunday lunch, brunch etc. Kid friendly.

title: Charming cafe, charming people
comment: Great addition to Shepherds Bush. Beautiful decor, good food, helpful and friendly staff. It works. Try it.

title: Super cafe
comment: Absolutely fantastic addition to the neighbourhood. Delicious food, generous portions and great staff. The cafe is clean, nicely decorated and has an outdoor area. I would highly recommend visiting.

title: Best brunch in town
comment: Fantastic food, great menu, very friendly service, lovely decor, and great coffee! We come pretty much every weekend for our fix. Highly recommended, you won't be disappointed

title: Outstanding Independent Cafe
comment: This is everything you could wish for in an independent neighbourhood cafe: beautiful decor, chilled music that doesn't dominate, friendly staff, great coffee, super food (variety of breakfasts, brunches & lunch - very high quality ingredients), laptop-friendly, child-friendly, fresh flowers on the tables ..... It has a perfectly maintained little garden and outside area to sit in the sun. It's small and tucked away in a side street off Uxbridge Road: Thorpebank Road. It's worth a trip if you aren't local. I'm lucky to be local, so I'm now a regular ....

title: Amazing Food & Great Owners
comment: Absolute Gem on the next road from us! It's hard to find that unique non chain ambience of a local business that will excel! Owners are so lovely which makes the experience! Food is amazing with a chef that truly cares off what the customer think! Love love love.  Best in the bush!  GO VISIT!

title: Didn't want to leave!
comment: Absolutely quaint local restaurant with one of the most inviting vibes I've come across. The staff were all super friendly and sociable and the general atmosphere was really relaxed which sets a nice mood and everyone that comes in at ease... almost like visiting an old friend in a cosy house during the colder months of the year. The food was divine and the coffees were perfect honestly if we didn't have so many errands to run we would've stayed enjoying the place and the staff's company until around the time they shut. We'll definitely be coming back as it's a stones throw away from us to make matters worse and we still haven't tried the rest of the enticing menu! Keep on doing what you're doing we really enjoyed it, so thank you!

title: Amazing brunch in a cosy atmosphere
comment: I realised that this place was open only a couple of weeks ago, so I decided to take my wife for brunch the following weekend. Upon arrival it was quite busy, but we managed to get a table for the two of us. The service was very welcoming, attentive and prompt. We went for the Wild Thyme Breakfast which was outstanding due to its appropriate size, but specially due to the quality of the food. The spiced beans, the potatoes, the salad, the bacon, the sausage, the scrambled eggs... Everything was delicious and cooked to perfection. The coffee was also amazing. And the service was fantastic. They gave us tap water and were topping up our glasses whenever they saw them empty. Wild Thyme is a great addition to the neighbourhood and we are going to become regular customers. It is worth it!

title: Totally unexpected pleasure!
comment: "I've had a leaflet through the door, let's go to a new place for brunch" didn't exactly thrill me ... but it should have done! Wild Thyme is a delight to have found - serves (from our one trip - so far - there) quite the best eggs Florentine I have ever eaten - and that really IS saying a lot, I'm an addict! My companion's fish cake with a poached egg (beautifully cooked) on top and with what he described as "the tastiest salad I have eaten out for a very long time" was eaten enthusiastically. We'll certainly return. The cakes etc on display looked mouthwatering - we should have taken something to eat whilst watching the Six Nations on TV, but we were too full!

title: Taste of peshwari Wembley
comment: Went for a meal today with my family! Food was amazing and staff were very friendly too! Reasonably priced.... Definately recommend!

title: Amazing taste, Real taste of Takhat Bahi Chapli kebab
comment: Exactly same taste you can get in Takhat bahi chapli kebab.... Best in the uk Recommend to all family and friends  Thanks to taste of Peshawar

title: Lovely new cafe
comment: Lovely simple menu.  Friendly and quick service.  Perfect location close to both the station and bus stops. The decor has a very welcome vibe.  The food was full of flavour. We ordered two "big breakfasts" at £9 per dish.  The coffees and juice was perfect.  £29 total for two breakfasts  2 coffees and one juice

title: One of the best restaurants in London
comment: We always get the tawa for 2 people (£15 each) when we are extremely hunger, and it always delivers. If you like mild tasty North Indian food and the best kebabs, you will love this place. It's a owner run restaurant and hence why the customer service is excellent at this price point. Worth the trip out of London!

title: Lucky Surbiton
comment: I love the French Table the quality of the cooking and service are excellent. Great value for money with a wine list with a good choice at sensible prices. My wife and I went for lunch to celebrate my retirement and it lived up to my high expectations. Go to restaurant for a celebration. Very COVID aware without being intrusive.

title: Reliable, consistent 'old school' cooking.
comment: Dinner on a very busy Wednesday evening which was good to see during this difficult time for restaurants generally. The food is 'old school', nothing too fancy, generous portions and good ingredients handled well. My beef was excellent with lovely earthy seasonal flavours and my partner's pork rich and tender. Good value for money and a welcome step up from everywhere else in Kingston and Surbiton.

title: TFT "Take Away"
comment: As we are in lockdown we tried the French Table tasting menu at home, which you collect from the restaurant. it was first class, 6 courses all with easy to follow instructions, it was delicious, great value and good sized portions.

title: Excellent "take-away"
comment: "Take-away" doesn't really describe TFT's eat-at-home tasting menu, as some of the dishes need to be finished off in the oven at home - and the experience of eating it is vastly superior to that of the average take-away. Somehow Eric and his team have managed to reproduce the excellence of their cuisine in one's own home - and the meal was a great lifter of our spirits during lockdown. The skilful mix of ingredients made every dish flavoursome and satisfying. Portions are as small as one would expect in a tasting menu, but we added a cheese platter (one between two) and by the time we had eaten that and the rich chocolate dessert we were replete - and decided to save the complimentary petit fours for another day. And all at a price that was very good value for the quality on offer

title: Amazing at home experience!
comment: Amazing at home experience! We had the 5 course tasting menu and it came beautifully packaged and easy to re heat and amazing flavours. The crab roll was the best course in my opinion!  Just as good as the in restaurant experience and we hope they continue to do at home options once Lockdown is over as we didn’t have to get a babysitter! Thank you!

title: Consummate style, elegant quality
comment: We nipped to The French Table for lunch when Lockdown 2 ended in early December, and what a reassuringly well-crafted meal we had! Surbiton is lucky to have this house of culinary excellence, and the quality shines out. The Christmas menu (£38, three courses) included a gem of a starter; the 'marmite' of smoked haddock and Cornish mussels in a creamy saffron sauce, topped with a pastry dome. The flavours, the combination... a sumptuous dish. My companion went for the terrine of duck, ham hock, foie gras and 101 other things. Also excellent (although I was definitely the winner with the haddock). Remarkably, a woman at the table next to us called the waiter over and said she didn't like the taste of her marmite. But when the waiter apologised and reached forward to take it away, she told him to leave it, as her husband would eat it. So she got a replacement starter, while hubby had two. The word 'cheek' sprung to mind. The terrine came with its own toast, and with the French Table noted for its artisan, home-baked bread selection, there was choice in that department too. For mains, my bride chose the lamb, while I had the guinea fowl. That was a draw; both first class arrangements of flavour, exquisitely presented. The guinea fowl was positively architectural; a small housing estate of flavours on the plate, with a little lake of powerful, intense reduced gravy. We had wine by the glass, as it was lunchtime. My French red (a 14.5% oompher of a Rasteau - 2016) was very good indeed. Things were nearly spoilt when It's Looking A Lot Like Christmas suddenly came over the speakers - a brief Poundland moment in this 'Harrods' food hall. But the Kings College choir then came to the rescue. The cheese selection is wonderful, and accompanied by advice to go clockwise round the plate from an agreed starting point, so the power builds. The Aussie tawny port worked well to disentangle the flavours.  Is it really worth an £8 supplement? Well, if you're already paying £38, I suppose it doesn't make too much difference, but it still seems a curious addition. That said, the Camembert was rich, the Beaufort from near Areches in the mountains a lovely even, smooth cheese, and the Epoisses orange-tinged creaminess spot-on. With service and coffees, you're hard-pressed to keep lunch below 100 a head, but this was worth saving up for; an antidote to, and reward for, lockdown strictures. The odd mystery remains. Why serve sugar for the coffee in the kind of sachets you get in motorway service stations, when you could serve arty lumps in a bowl? But I've no hesitation in giving The French Table five full stars. This is cooking at, or close to, the finest it gets. A glorious lunch.

title: Best "take-away" I have ever had
comment: On a normal year it is often challenging to find someone to celebrate my birthday which falls just before Christmas. With London being in tier 3 and then tier 4 this task was not made any easier. The French Table has a solution though. A takeaway the like of which I had not seen before. Forget those uber eats and deliveroos the French Table's offering is in another galaxy. The food tasted devine, the attention to detail with the menu and the presentation was excellent. It is a Michelin star restaurant afterall! What's more, the preperation at home was next to nothing! If you have a special occassion coming up this is a very very good way to celebrate it and also a good way to support a local institution.

title: La Perfection!!!
comment: A must do. Dinner only, closed Sunday’s.  Wonderful atmosphere and French family owned and operated. La Perfection!!!

title: My birthday restaurant booking was saved by a take-out tasting menu
comment: I was so looking forward to revisiting The French Table restaurant for my birthday. Unfortunately, due to lockdown, it has closed. However, they have a tasting menu take-out.  What a delight! We had 6 carefully crafted dishes each with simple instructions regarding heating etc. The food was so delicious and memorable for all the right reasons. Included was a birthday message and a candle to personalize the occasion. The standard of the food was as high as our experience of visiting the restaurant. Thank you so much for making a special day despite the challenging times for all concerned. Lisa & Paul Mackay

title: The French Table has managed
comment: The French Table has managed to devise a way of enjoying a takeaway meal that is almost as perfect as their in house cuisine, bar the lack of service. We had the tasting menu for two which comes with detailed but simple instructions on how to heat and serve, clearly labelled and all very quick and simple. Each course was as delicious as the last and lost none of its flavours for being a takeaway. An amazing treat until we can once again enjoy their wonderful restaurant. Extremely good value for £40 a head. Thank you, we’ve already booked again!

title: Michelin starred delight
comment: Superb food in a beautiful room, wine is available by the glass so you can have the right match for what you’re eating. This was our second visit but won’t be our last.

title: Perfect for a special night out
comment: I’ve been here a couple of times now (pre and post lockdown) and it by far my favourite place for a special meal, be that anniversary, celebratory or just at a great evening with friends... The atmosphere is intimate but relaxed and the staff are friendly with great suggestions and insight into the dishes they serve and wine to accompany them, but also unobtrusive.. Menu wise can the name suggests the food is modern french, elegantly presented and seasonally varied, all of which is simply delicious... Last time we went we had the tasting menu with paired wines (£90 per head), which was excellent a fun experience and highly recommend....

title: Had an amazing Sunday lunch
comment: Had an amazing Sunday lunch with my wife. Sensational food - delicious and very well presented. The service was relaxed but attentive and all staff were very friendly. Will definitely go back.

title: 7 star service, 7 star food
comment: Visited with family for Sunday lunch. What a wonderful restaurant this is. Beautiful ambience, outstanding service, amazing food and wine. Also good value for money. A small comprehensive menu of top-quality choices. Food presentation is stunning, and the food matches up to its looks. Support local businesses like this and treat yourself at the same time. I cannot over recommend.

title: 33rd Wedding Anniversary Dinner
comment: Helpful attentive service made to feel very special. Menus written with our names and the occasion at the top. As always the food was superb, the wine delightful. If you want to celebrate, be romantic or just have a special memorable meal then this is the place to be.

title: Amazing as always!
comment: TFT has always been our go to place for special occasions, long after moving away from the area to have our family.  At the start of the pandemic we wrote a bucket list of things we wanted to do afterwards to celebrate my husband’s birthday and to bring our 2 boys (10 & 8) for the first time. Little did we know we’d still be in the middle of the pandemic now but TFT did not disappoint despite the extra restrictions.  The food, as always, was phenomenal and the service fantastic - we were made to feel so welcome and the kids loved their adapted meals - best chicken and fish ever apparently! My husband was given a personalised menu for his birthday, a lovely touch, and received a candle and ice cream with his name in chocolate at the end. The owner even invited our boys to come and see the kitchen, such an amazing, special gesture which they loved, and the free delicious bread to take home afterwards was the icing on the cake! So pleased to see this place is still thriving and hasn’t changed a bit following our first visit over 15 years ago. We can’t wait to return!

title: Consistently great!
comment: We hadn't been to this restaurant for at least a year but it was every bit as good as ever. Lovely taster menu and really enthusiastic staff who explain everything about each dish you get. I was very impressed by the Covid procedures put into place. Our temperatures were taken before entering the restaurant and the tables were spaced well. I was really worried that it would suffer during the lockdown but it's up and running again thank goodness!

title: Superb Food, Staff and Ambience
comment: My final birthday meal of my birthday week with 5 of us at this fantastic restaurant - treated by our lovely daughter, her boyfriend and our son. Donata greeted us at the door and took our temperatures (reassuring in these strange times!). She’s expecting a baby boy in November so good luck for that - I told her boys were exhausting but very worth it! A lovely round table sparkling with cutlery and glasses - very pretty. We were served a little ravioli as an amuse-bouche, in addition to the five-course tasting menu, which was very tasty. We stuck with red wine throughout the meal - a very drinkable Mas de Vigneron. Bread was absolutely delicious and we asked for more, mainly the chorizo one. Next course was tuna - I’ve never eaten it so rare but it was absolutely delicious, melt-in-the-mouth, and the avocado/watermelon salsa was a tasty surprise. Then the most beautiful work of art - a terrine of rabbit and ham hock with the most delicious tarragon jelly and plum chutney and the pistachios in the terrine were a fantastic nutty surprise along with the delicious walnut toast. Absolutely delicious. Cod to follow with a gorgeous chorizo crust, cooked to perfection with a smooth cauliflower purée and lovely rainbow chard - couldn’t fault it. Venison was next with a lovely granola of cranberry and nuts, beautiful pommes Anna and a yum celeriac purée - the juniper berry jus brought it all together so wonderfully. Not sure where the blueberry sorbet came, with a light crumble, could’ve been before the venison - delicious and extra again to the five courses (made seven courses in all!) The chocolate soufflé was a triumph with a beautiful little ball of vanilla parfait within a chocolate shell. This was just so very good - superb quality ingredients, cooked to absolute perfection and some quite different combinations which were both surprising and delicious!!!! Combined with my lovely family, I was just in heaven - the perfect meal. Estelle our waitress, and Donata also, looked after us so attentively but unobtrusively. This place is fantastic!! Can’t praise it highly enough - thank you chefs, just superb and just can’t wait to come back for another tasting menu!!! Apologies for only two pictures - I was having such a very good time I couldn’t bear to stop and take pictures - a very good excuse to go back but I did get a snap of the terrine which I think was my absolute favourite course.

title: Anniversary meal
comment: We have been visiting The French Table for several years but only recently started enjoying their wonderful tasting menu (with accompanying wines chosen by Sarah). On our most recent visit we celebrated our 28th Anniversary. Having a personalised menu was a lovely touch and we were beautifully looked after by the wonderful Judith who is always friendly and welcoming. The five-course menu was absulutely delicious and we were never made to feel rushed as we enjoyed each delicious course. During lockdown we discussed what would really cheer us up as we were not planning to go away this year. We decided a monthly lunch at TFT would be the perfect replacement for any holiday and it looks as though we were right!

title: Lunch
comment: Lovely lunch of salmon quiche and pear tart. The service was rather cold. In these difficult times a welcoming smile and friendly face are so important.

title: Superb lunch yet again !
comment: Just the most delicious lunch, the food and service never fails to impress us. The Covid protocols are handled discreetly but efficiently. Thank you all at The French Table, we hope to see you again soon.

title: An excellent lunch
comment: Lovely dining room. Quiet but not isolating even with few diners at lunch. Pleasant, unfussy, but very well timed professional service. Helpful with wine selection. Set lunch menu limited choice but excellent quality including superb starter of wild brill with leeks. Monkfish and venison (portion a little small for the larger appetite) mains both very good. Chocolate (sort of delice) dessert perhaps the best we have had anywhere - chocolate with perfect richness and perfect smoothness inside, with raspberries also inside. Perhaps coffee could be included - a bit pricey as an extra, although very good, and with petit fours. Pity the max table size is 6, but can understand why in an intimate space.

title: always a good time
comment: a regular visit for me as I just love it here, food is always top notch and the service never fails me

title: Back and as good as ever!
comment: We have eaten here for over a decade and did so just before lock down forced its closure. We were back last week and Eric and Sarah have lost none of their verve. the food is superb with a well priced wine list and champagne that is always exceptional. Thee service is friendly and efficient. We all ordered differently and there was nothing but cooking to celebrate from fish to meat to duck. We ate upstairs for the first time in the formally private room which has been opened to give more space - a rather more intimate experience but the evening lost nothing for not being in the main restaurant. It is almost the only restaurant worth travelling to out of London for an evening - a short walk from the station. We will no doubt be back and it is wonderful that TFT is open again.

title: Lucky to have this restaurant on my doorstep
comment: I’ve been to The French Table three times now and it seems to get better every time I go! The owners are lovely, the food is sensational and the ambience is spot on. Personally, I prefer to sit downstairs but that’s just my opinion. I honestly can’t recommend this restaurant enough and can’t believe it’s just a 5 minute walk from my house - please take the time to support a local business like The French Table - you won’t regret it. I have attached a few photos from our wonderful meal from 7 August.

title: Great to be back
comment: This has always been our favourite restaurant and our first visit back for many months was, once again a fantastic experience. The food is faultless, the service warm, helpful but unobtrusive and the dining room is a beautiful environment in which to relax. The team are clearly working incredibly hard in these tricky times, and all the amendments to meet the new guidelines were reassuring and did nothing to detract from our exceptional experience. It was great to be back! Thank you!

title: Wish we had come earlier
comment: Have wanted to come here for a number of years but always have gone to la Barbe in Reigate, which has sadly closed. It was lovely from start to finish Welcoming staff, hand sanitiser and temperature taken but subtly so that you did not feeluncomfortable and then the food. What can you say all of it delightful, great waitress, Offerred tap water and then bottled! Non alcoholic cocktail for my husband as he had to drive, delicious G and T for me great followed by a truly lovely meal.Excellent bottle of Brouilly Will be back as soon as we can

title: outstanding
comment: We first ate in The Frech Table nearly 20 years ago. It was excellent then; it is quite outstanding now. We have not often eaten better food in Michelin Rosestted places

title: Anniversary
comment: Always absolutely brilliant. Attentive service, wonderful food. Would highly recommend. Can't wait to get there again since reopening .

title: Got the takeaway tasting menu
comment: It was excellent - particularly the desert which will probably motivate me to try their bakery too at some point.

title: SUPERBE!⁹
comment: How does one sum up the superb? The French language, I learn, has far fewer words than its English equivalent. How better, then, to articulate that sense of satisfaction than in the words of one of the four friends who joined me to celebrate my momentous birthday: "It was an amazing day, everything, service, food, ambience" (Jean-Marie, French, obvs!, with thirty years in catering). It was important to me, as the host, that my guests could not find anything to fault and you did not let me down. Thank you for taking the time to make my special day even more so!

title: Absolutely fantastic lunch
comment: Absolutely fantastic lunch at The French Table. Incredible food - we both had the beef which was just perfect - and the service was exceptional. We loved it so much that we booked a table for December there and then!

title: Outstanding tasting menu lunch
comment: Charming staff, excellent service, tasteful decor, and the food is the star attraction. Five course tasting menu lunch was remarkably good value and the wonderful breads, duck terrine, fish, lamb and then chocolate souffle were all delicious. Worth travelling to.

title: Celebration Dinner
comment: Lovely a la carte meal. Good attentive service. Knowledgable and friendly staff. Ambience is nice. Unexpected in a slightly off pitch location

title: Heat at home, do it, amazing
comment: We ordered the pork and beef from the heat at home menu. Easy pick up, clear instructions and brilliant results almost as good as restaurant and certainly a great treat in these times. If you want a special meal go for it, very little effort for a truly special meal. Above and beyond are the only words to describe.

title: Always a delight to eat at The French Table ....
comment: My husband and I have eaten here a few times and it never disappoints. Authentic French cuisine and lively atmosphere.Seating area downstairs can be very noisy if the restaurant is busy due to the low ceilings, so opt for table upstairs if you want to be able to chat with your guests!

title: Excellent all round.
comment: First time visiting this restaurant. My wife had been previously and loved it. The staff were brilliant and we were met at the door and had our temperature taken, which automatically made it more relaxing once inside. The food was incredible, and full of amazing flavours. Our waitress couldn't do enough for us. I wouldn't hesitate to return here.

title: Fabulous belated anniversary meal
comment: Having to cancel our booking as lockdown came, we had a long wait for our meal. Well worth it. Fabulous, tasty and well presented food. Lovely, friendly service. The staff go the extra mile to make your evening special

title: Excellent belated birthday lunch !
comment: It was great to return to this our favourite restaurant after the lockdown was eased. The welcome, the food and the service were all perfect, thank you see you soon.

title: Open again and in great form. Go!
comment: I have been a regular at TFT for some years. They have survived lockdown and are once again in cracking form. Great value set menus at lunchtime and an evolving a la carte menu in the evenings from a husband & wife team who run a settled and happy professional staff. Everything that is good about a local restaurant and the opposite of the chain restaurants that blight this land but charge similar money. Long may they prosper.

title: A-MA-ZING!
comment: From the very moment we arrived, we received the highest of services - the type of bread we were eating was described, we were seduced with an amuse-bouche, and then they turned it up a notch. We skipped the starters and jumped right into the mains. Mum and Dad had the guinea fowl, my brother the steak and I had the pork, three ways. OMG as the kids of today say - I think - this was quite simply one of the best restaurant meals I've ever had in the UK. The pork was cooked to perfection, the accompanying sauces complemented the dish rather than simply decorated it. My father's guinea fowl was succulent and the girolles and their sauce were to die for. Each mouthful offered a new sensation and, when you hear people talking about food 'dancing on your tongue', this menu gave a full ballet recital! The strawberry mille-feuille followed up with a strong modern tap number - punchy, crispy, sharp. I nicked some of my brother's blackcurrant gel, and considered ordering another of those for myself. We were constantly looked after by the staff, but didn't feel crowded or pressured. Social Distancing guidelines prevented me from hugging all of the staff on the way out. I wish I'd been able to leave a larger tip. 5 stars all the way!

title: Amazing food
comment: We have eaten here twice in the last 3 weeks. The food was absolutely delicious and beautifully presented. Adjustments were made very easily to accommodate a Gluten allergy. The number of tables has been significantly reduced allowing plenty of room. We were temperature checked on arrival and advised of hand sanitiser. We felt safety was prioritised and in fact we preferred to pour our own wine so the whole experience was fabulous.

title: Really great but courses all came too quick
comment: Lovely food, lovely ambience, would definitely come again. Only criticism is everything came too quickly.

title: Superb Saturday Lunch
comment: Went for Saturday lunch. I have an allergy to cream and they catered to me providing sensible alternatives, I did not once feel short changed or that my dish was incomplete. The wild seabass with leek, ginger and caviar was incredible, the venison and beetroot delicious. The chocolate dessert with blood orange sorbet also amazing. My girlfriend is vegetarian and often disappointed in restaurants by bland and similar offerings. She was as pleased as me and blown away by some of the dishes especially the hen of the woods mushroom. Highly recommended.

title: Amazing! Last Friday we Celebrated
comment: Amazing! Last Friday we Celebrated my partners birthday and it was lovely! The selection of breads, the wine, and the food was outstanding! Perfect service!looking forward to go back

title: Brilliant Belated Birthday
comment: Superb meal. This was the first Friday we could get near his birthday (early Feb!!!) We had the tasting menu plus wine flight. Plus a bottle of water. All in £210.  Excellent.  Amouse bouche - delicious Crab starter - sublime Duck - exquisite Hale - superb ( tiny bit too salty for me but ok for hubby)  Beef - divine A palate cleanser mmmmm Chocolate soufflé - to die for! All the wine pairings were interesting and well explained.  Such a great evening.  Thank you

title: Very, very special.
comment: We celebrated our son's birthday and it was a perfect evening. We had the tasting menu which was fantastic. The restaurant went to extra effort to customise the menu with my son's name and his dessert plate was decorated. Kind touches to make the evening memorable.

title: Once again a favourite
comment: Once again a favourite of ours. Just had a lunch for two people to celebrate. Great food, great ambience and the service is second to none. Wouldn’t want to go anywhere else.

title: Relaxing lunch
comment: Very enjoyable lunchtime experience. The pleasant staff were very attentive and welcoming. It was notable that they took great care to seat the customers, all of whom were in groups of two, at a discrete distance from other tables. Nice set lunch for a reasonable price with a decent choice including hake, lamb and calves liver for mains. Well priced wine list and carafes available.

title: Hidden Gem
comment: Excellent local restaurant with west end style. The tasting menu is to be experienced. The wine list is impressive.

title: Birthday Lunch
comment: Four of us had lunch here the other day. Our first time here but heard a lot of good things about the restaurant. All in all, a very pleasant experience, with charming staff and lovely food. The prices are not too expensive for the quality of food that they serve. I suppose one could say that portions are a little on the small side, but they were perfect for us, especially at lunch time. One small minus point was that the table next to us was especially noisy, this meant that at times it was difficult for us to hear each other. I think that they were totally oblivious to the amount of noise they were creating.Sadly very selfish of them and totally unnecessary.

title: My son and daughter in law treated me to lunch.
comment: We had a lovely 3 course lunch at the restaurant. The food was excellent for the set lunch and plenty of choice. The staff were extremely attentive. We had unlimited homemade bread. The staff  had even decorated my desert plate with the words “Thank you Mum”

title: A charming restaurant
comment: I attended a group lunch just before Christmas - upstairs in the private room of this charming restaurant . The food was very good . Wines were provided by the organisers of the group and a modest corkage charge levied for the privilege . I didn't know of this restaurant beforehand but enjoyed the food very much and will be back for further visits .

title: Fantastic Christmas set lunch menu
comment: The French Table is my favourite restaurant and we were again not disappointed. Came for the 3 course Christmas set lunch and it was absolutely delicious. The staff were fantastic as usual. Can’t wait to come back again soon. Would highly recommend.

title: First Class
comment: Nothing bad to say about this place. The food is exquisite, the service is excellent, a lovely ambience in the room. If you're thinking of somewhere to eat quality food, try here. Keep up the good work.

title: Lovely birthday lunch
comment: It was our first visit to the French table and we were not disappointed having read the good reviews. Staff were lovely and helped make my birthday meal more enjoyable. Food was delicious and beautifully presented. The 3 course lunch meal was worth the money.

title: Anniversary lunch
comment: Visited for our friends anniversary lunch. We were upstairs in the dining room. We had a champagne reception and a 3 course meal. The food was of exceptional quality and so tasty. The staff were very helpful as always. Always our local restaurant of choice for special occasions!

title: We ate here on Saturday lunch.
comment: We ate here on Saturday lunch. The restaurant was buzzing by 1pm with every table filled. The service from beginning to end was excellent. Friendly but not too fussy. Where the French table and it’s neighbouring cafe excel is the quality of food. Their homemade breads are sublime. 4 choices to choose from in the restaurant. The food is delicious. We both chose the tempura prawn special and lamb. I struggle to describe all the different accompaniments. There is detail in these dishes which complement each other perfectly. I love to eat a meal out that I would not be able to make at home.  The desserts were the same. My brûlée came with a plum sorbet, red wine jelly and a couple of other details! My husbands ginger bread and butter pudding had a pear cream and was light and delicious.  A really enjoyable lunch, thankyou. We shall definitely be returning.

title: A charming jewel serving really good food
comment: Everything about this place is a sign of how a restaurant should be run: delightful decor, attentive professional staff and good food . A selection of freshly cooked bread , 4 varities , whilst perusing the menu. we chose the fixed 3 course table d'hote and a 250 ml carafe Corbieres blanc. I had semi made up my mind when I was informed of the specials and went for the Prawn Tempura and Venison Wellington both of which lived up to expectations as did the fruit tartlet. £45 a head inc tip excellent value!!

title: As good as it gets
comment: It is a pleasure to be able to review this restaurant for a second time. The food is superb, as is the service - at least as good as the most vaunted eateries of London. Eric, the head chef and his wife, Sarah as front of house run an exemplary restaurant. My twins celebrated their 21st there this evening - babes in arms when this place first opened - and here we are, all these later, packed on a Tuesday evening and with good reason.

title: Husbands 40th
comment: Amazing quality food with extra special touches of birthday name on menu and confetti .. really special lunch . The service was faultless

title: Wonderful Everything. Fabulous Always.
comment: Our favourite restaurant. Last year we started coming here for the lunchtime tasting menu & can't wait to re-book every time Eric & Sarah change the menu. Absolutely fabulous french food with exciting & beautifully created tastes & ingredients...thank you Eric. The very lovely Sarah & all of her front of house team are just delightful.  I am dribbling at the thought of the March tasting menu as I type.

title: Nice Local
comment: One of the finest French in Surrey. Amazing setting with the finest food and service I have had outside of London.  It was to celebrate our engagement. The whole place is stylish. The waiting staff were informative, attentive and knowledgeable. No detail was left out. The food was beautifully presented, delicious. The wine choices are extensive and were fully explained to us. Definitely a must for a super special occasion- dress code- we dressed smartly and elegantly, although there were guests there in jeans as well. Highly recommended.

title: Again, a fabulous lunch
comment: Our annual treat of birthday lunch with longstanding friends is made more special by this amazing restaurant. Everything is done with charm, style and courtesy, from the reservation process, to being remembered, to the awesome menu, atmosphere and of course the food itself. The wine list is extensive, with some unusual wines, and many are available by the glass or carafe, which is a lovely option. The lunch menu has four options for each course, but there were specials too, the tempura prawns starter was sublime. And the chocolate souffle well worth the 20 minute cooking time. Lunch here is so special, my only regret is not living in Surbiton!! TFT would be a very regular outing if so!

title: This is actually a five star restaurant devalued by poor service today
comment: Eaten and enjoyed the Tudor Room since it’s first inception.  However today the experience was somewhat spoiled for my guest by a rather indifferent service. The young lady was superb but the two guys were just unaware. It was impossible to attract their attention as they were either looking out the window or at notes or something. The normal experience of reading the room was only carried out by the lady. Oddly we had just sat down and a chef placed food in front of us. We had not been offered an aperitif or asked if we wanted a drink. We actually wondered if they had delivered someone else’s meal by mistake. Water was not topped up until we deliberately spoke loud enough about the lack of attention so that the lady attending to the next table took charge and organised the other two. We had to ask for the service to slow down as it was becoming difficult for my guest to enjoy it. A sad introduction to someone when it has always been superb before. Too much work covered by the lady because the other two men just weren’t professional. It improved a little towards the end. If I had been asked to add a gratuity I would have refused for the first time in my life but it was already included and I didn’t want an embarrassment in front of my friend. We will go again because the food demands it. I just hope they realise they are meant to be providing an experience as well.

title: Excellent.
comment: We came for the tasting menu for my 30th birthday and it was outstanding. The service was excellent, staff couldn’t do enough for us - our water was topped up, we were offered drinks and the chefs described each course as they delivered it.  The food itself was exceptional - I particularly enjoyed the parsnip dish and the venison. I also asked a question about an ingredient (I was curious as I couldn’t quite place it) and although the lady wasn’t sure, she went away and promptly came back to inform us. All in all an excellent experience - I would certainly return.

title: The most fantastic dinning experience
comment: Definitely the place for a great dinning experience. The Tudor dinning room is the ideal place for any special occasion. The staff were very friendly and attentive with each course being brought to the table by one of the chefs who described what you were about to eat and if you wanted any further information. The 7 course sampler menu was the most fantastic dinning experience with flavours bursting in your mouth. Dietary changes were achieved without any problems or fuss nothing was too much. A definite to return on another day.

title: Perfect lunch for my wife’s 60th
comment: Perfect lunch for my wife’s 60th Birthday. Food was very tasty, served by very attentive waiters and chefs(a nice touch). Advertised as 4 courses, but with extra courses this was amazing value at £45 including coffee and petit fours. Another nice touch was a signed menu as a “ birthday card”.

title: Le Meilleur
comment: Quite simply the best in the area.  Beautiful food, artfully prepared and served with elan.  The 3 course £45 menu has something for everyone. I could have picked at random from the 5 or so options per course and been happy every time.  Four of us chose differently from scallops to lobster pasta to foie gras, then hake, pork two ways, pink lamb and high marks all round.  The bread is really good too.  For sweet the special for the day Lemon Posset was sinfully naughty, almost as bad as the chocolate soufflé on the taster menu at the next table.  The service is excellent and the wine list really does offer good value at modest prices through to high end if you are feeling flush.  Terrific.

title: Fabulous!
comment: My husband and I visited last night and had the seven course tasting menu which was excellent. We also had the wine flight with different wines matched to each course which all worked perfectly.  We loved the fact that a chef from the kitchen came out to explain what each plate of food was, something that we have not experienced elsewhere. All of the staff were incredibly friendly, courteous and well informed, they could not have done more for us.  The meal was a birthday gift from friends and everyone knew that we were there to celebrate a birthday, from Casper the barman to the chefs who brought the food out.  The previous review under the name of Jim Kirkwood is a false account set up in my husband’s name, the review is completely false and we are taking steps to have it removed.  We had the most amazing evening and we cannot recommend it enough.

title: Saturday Lunch an Amazing Delight
comment: The French table is in a word Amazing. From the reception you receive as you walk through the door where they seem genuinely delighted to see you to the amazing selection on offer. We opted for the house special starter and main. Tempura haddock and prawn followed by Ox Cheek and fillet of Irish beef with some of the most amazing purple carrots. The tempura starter was light and beautifully tasty, the Ox cheek and fillet was simply melt in the mouth with amazing flavours and presentation.

title: Best brunch in Kingston
comment: We stopped in here to have brunch and were delighted with the poached eggs with Salmon. We sat in the terrace. We will definitely be back soon for lunch or dinner. Nice cocktails as well!

title: Lunch for six friends
comment: The French Table never disappoints. We booked lunch for six and were given a round table beautifully set. Despite the restaurant being packed the service was impeccable. The set menu was excellent with something for everyone and good value for money. We had the house red wine which was very pleasant. Would thoroughly recommend although you need to book well in advance.

title: Always suberb
comment: We have been going to The French Table for many years. It never fails to surprise and delight us and our guests. You have to book early, but always a lovely experience.

title: Delicious
comment: Amazing food, must go! If you don’t your missing out on delicious inexpensive food and great craftsmanship.

title: Sublime, yet again !
comment: We lunched here recently to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The welcome was warm, the menu was personalized , the service was impeccable and the food was sublime, as it always is. We can't find fault with any aspect of this our favourite local restaurant. Looking forward to our next visit. Thank you.

title: Excellent festive lunch
comment: Been a few times now and these guys never let you down. Food is creative and extremely well cooked and presented. We had the venison and guinea fowl main courses - both great. Cheeseboard is a tour de force. Service is superb. And all excellent value for money. London fine dining at suburban prices.  Excellent restaurant!

title: Always a treat
comment: As always good food, wine and ambience. It was good to experience mid week and still see how popular this restaurant is. Look forward to our next visit..

title: Superb
comment: A special celebration and a very special meal. We went for the tasting menu. All courses were excellent. Well balanced and well paced. The service and ambience were wonderful. Highly recommend. Thanks for a great evening.

title: casual lunch following wife's hair-do
comment: We usually lunch here about once a quarter when my wife comes to her favourite hairdresser nearby on Maple Road. The meal is always very good and the price not unreasonably high. The service is always efficient and very friendly. The restaurant was full, even though it was a Thursday. We booked ahead, so managed tto have a taable.

title: Excellent
comment: This was our third visit here, each time having been for a special occasion eg birthday. They really help make the meal special with personalised menus and little birthday motifs scattered on the table. It was the first time for our family to eat there and they really enjoyed too.

title: Superb
comment: Birthday lunch booked last minute, it was a set menu with a great selection, hard to choose as everything sounded delicious, we loved our food, amazing taste and high quality, portions were a good size and the service impeccable. Cannot wait to return to this local gem!

title: never been disapointed
comment: always excellent, loads of variety, recommend booking as gets very busy I have not been for dinner only lunch which I love

title: Another triumph!
comment: We have been here many times now. Consistently a great place for food, wine and service! Last night we had the nicest bit of beef we have ever eaten...with RACLETTE MASH ... Absolutely divine! I hope this place is there forever and we look forward to many more meals there in the years to come!

title: Top class
comment: We were fortunate to be invited to a friend's special birthday in the restaurants private area. The menu was superb and the food was delicious. The staff were very friendly and attentive. One of the best restaurants we have visited.

title: Amazing
comment: We had the three course lunch menu and the food was amazing. Accompanying the food were some great wines. Service was excellent and I would recommend anyone who wants a fantastic meal to visit this restaurant.

title: A very tasty birthday treat
comment: We enjoyed the 5 course tasting menu with wine pairing on Saturday lunchtime. The food was very very good as you'd expect from a high-end restaurant and as each course was served the staff gave us a comprehensive description. The wine pairing was equally good. The waiting staff were extemely attentive and made sure that we enjoyed every aspect of our lunch. There were groups and couples and there was a young child in one group. The tasting menu was £32 / head without wine or £55 with the wine pairing. For food of this quality, the prices are really pretty good. If you enjoy good food, great service and authentic French restaurant atmosphere then I'd recommend TFT

title: Gorgeous restaurant
comment: Thanks to my lovely friends treating me to a wonderful night at your restaurant..everything was just fantastic..we had the tasting menu and everything was truly delicious.. lovely professional kind staff..just perfect.. thank you.

title: Top class
comment: We are lucky to have this gem so close Wine pairing menu..too class food,flavours and presentation outstanding..ditto service,ambiance and quality of wine pairing.Vakue for money I'd say,London quality local prices .Will return...And made my birthday special...thanks again

title: Miss
comment: Me and a few friends visited, we got told the waiting time was around 20 minutes, this was a complete lie as we waited over an hour! When we finally got in the service was awful, the shisha took almost an hour to come and wasn't the correct flavours! After speaking with the manager he did not seem to care at all and was very rude and obnoxious! We will not be visiting here again!

title: Service
comment: Been before a few times , always had some issues but had to put it up today. Well for starters nobody to greet or sit u down have to stand there like n idiot then servers don’t even know if we been served then ordered frozen blueberry and was given something else. Asked to change and probably changed the foil n brought it back good came without full set of cutlery orders cook dint come had to ask after 10 minutes of food being delivered.
