Servers are busy either talking to women or among themselves which ain’t professional. Dint want to pay for shisha yet paid. Same happened on previous visit.

title: Okay but really rushy
comment: This is my local, so I’ve been here a few times in the past and it’s always been the closest to a really decent Indian meal and a nice chill place. However recently I’ve noticed how quick they are to rush you out. We booked a table and although we were a bit late the food took ages and they were trying to rush us out. I feel they shouldn’t over book and allow customers to take there time (or get more tables).

title: Bland food when ordered curries extra spicy
comment: Just visited the restaurant this evening for a meal with my family.  Was fairly quiet and no one was being rushed.  Had made a booking so got seated fairly promptly.  For our mains me and my wife asked for our curries to be made extra extra spicy. The waiter said that he would bring extra green chillies on the side rather then making the curry extra extra spicy like we requested to which we said no and asked for the curry to have extra chillies in it instead; he agreed to have it made this way. Were our curries extra extra spicy? No, not at all. Maybe they were for the chef but my Paneer Butter Masala tasted sweet more like a Butter Chicken and my wife Paneer dish was was also very mild. Very disappointed with the food today and glad that I don't come here on a regular basis as there are far better places elsewhere. Also not once did anyone come to ask if the food (starters and mains) were fine but did ask me, only when passing by, whether I wanted another beer.  I'll probably get the same copy and pasted reply from the manager apologising and telling me that they would love to see me again next time.  No thanks, you don't run that great a place.

title: French, family run. Cosy and friendly.
comment: Feels like your local French bistro.... Busy, crowded, friendly "family-style" service. Decent noise levels. Very good, friendly service. Nice fresh menu. Good food. Nice wine list even though fairly small. Superb breads which can be bought separately from their attached bakery. Parking on local streets is possible but not easy!

title: amazing France food
comment: Best food and value..honest real food! Staff is fantastic.. Come to this restaurant for years and never disappointed..

title: Very very good, never disappoints !
comment: We eat here 3 or 4 times a year and it never disappoints. The welcome, the food and the service are spot on, what a truly special place. Every dish is a treat for your taste buds, absolutely delicious. Thank you, we'll be back soon !

title: A delicious, reasonably priced meal in Suburbiton!
comment: A lot of the reviews have, perhaps fairly, mentioned that the set dinner can get pricy with the addition of booze and coffee. If you want the same standard of food for much less, go for lunch! Had lunch here last week. £25 for 2 courses, £28 for 3. I had crispy goats cheese in a watermelon consomme which was delicious (if a little soggy by the time I'd finished it). For main there was a very generous portion of chicken in a madeira sauce with crispy skin and mash on the side. Sublime. I was so full I only had space for petit fours but the dessert menu had a couple of classics (I would have gone for the white choc mousse if I had room). Restaurant itself is very well put together. They squeeze a good few tables in but it doesn't feel too cramped. Design is simple, bright and breeze with a semi-open kitchen. Service really was excellent. Very attentive and not shy on the homemade bread which is always a bonus. We were happy to be warned that a 20 person birthday party was about to arrive and that we should hurry up and order before them. It's the kind of place you come with a partner, your parents or that aunty you haven't seen in a while. Just on the side of classy without being pretentious.

title: a special birthday celebration!
comment: We enjoyed a truly dellicious lunch here. Everything was perfect, wine, food, ambience, atmosphere and service. I would highly reccommend this restaurant but defintiely make a reservation!

title: Birthday dinner
comment: We visited for a celebration birthday dinner and the 7 of us had the tasting menu plus the wine pairings. The French Table excelled itself. the food was delicious, the wines spot on both different and ideal for the food and the service was immaculate. We were made to feel very welcome and had a great evening. What a great place to celebrate. Thank you to all involved.

title: Excellent
comment: We tried for a long time to get a table at The French Table and it was well worth the wait! The food, wine, and service was all fantastic. The flavors are wonderful and great attention to detail. A must in Surrey!

title: Excellent English wine dinner
comment: Occasionally they have a dinner which features various wines from their list, this one was Hush Heath English wines from Kent. There were 5 courses with matching wines. Jennifer from Hush Heath introduced each wine and gave some background on the vineyard, all wines were lovely especially the Pinot Noir. The food was first class, full of flavour. Service was also excellent, smooth and friendly. Sarah and her husband Eric (the chef) do an outstanding job.  Their other menus are also excellent. Well worth a visit.

title: Fabulous lunch
comment: We had lunch today at The French Table. The service, the food the ambiance was all amazing. It’s a must if you are celebrating a special occasion. A little pricey but worth every penny.

title: Great Atmosphere
comment: I went with my wife. Great atmosphere. Lovely people. Great food and service. We enjoyed it very much. Pleny of parking. Security in place.

title: Missed opportunity
comment: My wife has her hair done in Maple Road, Surbiton and we usually have lunch at the French Table. Unfortunately we did not book early enough ( we tried a fortnight ago, but apparently, TFT is so popular you need to book six weeks in advance!) Lesson for next time.

title: A fantastic Saturday night
comment: Had dinner as 3 couples in this lovely restaurant on a Saturday evening. The reception and service we received was very professional but friendly. The menu was £45 for 3 courses, the selection of dishes was really good. Every dish that was served to the table was just fantastic, we all said how good the food was...... thank you for a great night.

title: It's very good...need to book
comment: Fabulous food, great attentive service. The ambiance and decor make it a very grown up setting. We loved it but have been unable to get booked in since our last visit as you seem to need to give more than a few days notice. Close to Surbiton station and Surbiton is well served by buses so able to make the most of their excellent wine list.

title: The French Table restaurant Surbiton - Excellent
comment: Booked lunch celebrating a Birthday and warmly welcomed and shown to a nice table. Started with a glass of red Pinot Noir ( German - not to our taste as we prefer a fruitier wine) and an aperitif spritz ( really lovely and refreshing) and a bottle of mineral water. Ordered the special shrimp tempura ( nice) followed by the lamb and special beef steak - both excellent and delicious with side carrots and accompaniments. The French Table bread selection alone is worth visiting the restaurant. Also ordered a half bottle of red Fleurie Beaujolais to enhance our time here.  Finished off with a strawberry biscuit and ice cream and espresso- all good. Staff and owner Mme. Guignard impeccably nice. Total bill including 10% sc came to £120.  We’ll be back !

title: Great restaurant.. need to book!
comment: Celebrating a birthday, it was a last minute booking. The food is excellent, the wine also very good and the service was also excellent. Attentive staff but not intrusive, regularly filling water and keeping an eye on the wine levels. Expensive but not extreme, but in my mind well worth it. I'll go back again given half a chance

title: "Excellent!" - Second-hand review of my parent's anniversary experience
comment: As hinted in the title, this is a review of a booking I made for my parent's wedding anniversary while they were here in UK late-July. The French Table staff were incredibly kind and professional, going over and above 'good service' to make their experience extra special with personalised menus and desserts plated with a special message each. They loved it! They thoroughly enjoyed the wine-matched tasting menu over the lunch service and would highly recommend it to others. I'm booked in for next week and can't wait!

title: Very good Wagyu dish
comment: It is very small cozy restaurant but with very good experienced chefs. Very well minced wagyu dish with amazing deserts.

title: Too much of a good thing
comment: The food at this restaurant is fabulous! However, because you have no choice but to have a three course set menu at a fixed price you pay for more than some people can eat. The dinner menu at £45 without wine sounds reasonable value but by the time wine and coffee are included the evening will costs around £75 a head so this is definitely a special occasion venue for most people. All that said, I had the most sublime starter of scallops with a chorizo crust followed by an incredibly rich Cornish lamb dish which was simply too much. Dessert was lovely but under normal circumstances I wouldn’t order it. The service was excellent and the staff friendly so I would go again ......but I would like to be able to order, and pay for, just two courses.

title: Wonderful meal and excellent service
comment: We splashed out on the tasting menu for an anniversary celebration and were not disappointed. Excellent quality, beautifully chosen food and wine and super service from the efficient and attentive staff. We liked the atmosphere too - busy and they do fit many tables in but it did not feel cramped. Well worth a visit.

title: Mismanagement at its best !
comment: Booked 3 weeks in advance for a special occasion via opentable.Managenent decided to cancel DJ on that weekend and changed our booking time to accommodate more tables. Spoke to manager and he said they will give us the table at originally booked time slot. Next day staff call me again to say it won't be possible as they are too busy ! Left a message that I spoke to Eric Manager and he never called back. They blame it on the owners and the customers are getting affected. Pity the place that has a great potential.Customer service skills and restaurant management to poor !!! You have missed me forever guys !

title: Brillent service received from Margaret!!
comment: So we came here as a family to celebrate our mums birthday and from start to finish we had a wonderful hostess "Margaret" who looked after us all the way through the end! She was a brilliant hostess and always made sure if we needed anything. She was friendly, talkative and very bubbly person to along with. All the other staff were amazing too however top Mark's goes to Margaret as she was our hostess and never failed to disappoint us!! Well Done Margaret!!

title: Cool relaxed lunch on the hottest day of the year
comment: Enjoyed the tasting menu with the accompanying wines in this local gem of a restaurant. This menu offers very good value at £55 for five courses with wine. The Cornish hake with squid ink tagliolini is really delicious as is the Cornish lamb with smoked spatzle - both being deeply savoury and well seasoned. Loved the wine choices - all worked well with their dishes. The overall menu in terms of portion size and balance is very well judged and we left feeling that we had dined well without being 'overfaced'. The service is relaxed, friendly and efficient which always adds to a memorable dining experience. A lovely lunch and looking forward to a return visit.

title: Tasting menu lunch
comment: We celebrated my husband's birthday today enjoying a seriously good tasting menu. The restaurant was buzzing yet the service was outstanding and not rushed. Would recommend a visit without hesitation.

title: Wonderful, even under pressure on a busy saturday night, book well ahead.
comment: We know how hard it is to get a table here, particularly at weekends, so we were delighted to bring two guests for a return visit at their request. We feel the food is comparable to our favourite 1 and 2 star restaurants and we like the intimacy and friendliness of this lovely local gem, top class food without pretentiousness. The food is refined and the prix fixe menu has plenty of choice. The wine list is very tempting and the house wines by the glass affordable and well chosen. If you want a tasting menu I highly recommend it.

title: Lunch taster menu with wine pairing
comment: This place is for you and the special people in your life! Lunch taster menu is excellent value for fine dining.

title: Consistent quality food
comment: Excellent value lunch menu which offers exquisite fine dining options. Easily one of the best restaurants in the UK

title: One of the best in the West
comment: Great quality food that special enough to qualify as a luxury treat but great value enough to be somewhere you could visit regularly. The lunch tasting menu is great value at just over £30 and some of the course would put starred London restaurants to shame at over twice the price. Markups on wine are very fair too and the list is definitely interesting and biased to the affordable end of things. Been a few times and will no doubt go again.

title: Birthday dinner
comment: Came to the french table to celebrate a birthday. When we arrived it was very busy but we were seated promptly. As they were aware that we were celebrating a birthday they made a menu especially for the table with the birthday girl’s name heading it. The food arrived in good time and was very nice. I had ordered the lobster to start and the stone bass for main. Both of which I really enjoyed. I also made room for the white chocolate mousse for dessert.

title: Birthday celebration
comment: It’s always such a treat coming to TFT. We had the taster menu with wine. The food and service was excellent as always. Although we had to book well in advance for our Saturday slot, it was definitely worth the wait!

title: Excellent taster menu
comment: Went to TFT yesterday for Saturday lunch and opted for taster menu with paired wines. Had heard several good reports and based on my visit these are totally justified. Excellent service, competitively priced and great atmosphere. Strongly recommended and will definitely visit again

title: Great decor and food
comment: Food was fantastic, went for lunch everything we ordered seemed fresh and was very tasty. Only thing I would say is the waiters need to be a bit more on the ball as it was not that busy but had to keep waving to get attention.

title: Good not great
comment: I had dinner last night with colleagues.  The food was nice but but one dish (plaice starter) was a little bland. Also my mistake but I saw oyster and thought lovely, bun it was a mouse... why kill such a nice thing? The lamb I had second was different and tasted good. Everything was cooked well. I have eaten there a few times now and think it a good safe option. Everyone else at the table seemed to enjoy their food so I would go again.

title: Great place for a party
comment: We had a great afternoon with family celebrating a significant birthday. The organisation pre event was thorough and accommodating, Zoe was great. The staff were very attentive, thoughtful, patient and friendly. The food was extremely good. Everyone had a great experience. Thank you

title: Superb meal and excellent service
comment: I went with a friend for a girls lunch, we had exceptionally friendly and efficient service the restaurant was full but that never caused a problem. The food was outstanding. i look forward to returning.

title: Lovely lunch tasting menu
comment: I had been trying to get in here for dinner for a while but not trying far enough in advance. This shows it is very popular. We were taken as a present by friends for lunch so my quest was achieved. A small restaurant hence no doubt the difficulty getting in added to the quality of the food and good service.  There is no particular parking, it being on a semi main road but there are roads off nearby where we found a space without much difficulty. I think there is also parking along the road itself.  We had a glass of Champagne to start and then onto the tasting menu with matching wines. The food is extremely good from the choice of breads to the great dessert. The wines were all interesting with the description given each time. Service is good and friendly. This is a top class ‘local’ restaurant and well worth our 20 minute drive too. I am not surprised it is so booked up. Reservations essential.

title: Fantastic Birthday Lunch
comment: We had a wonderful birthday lunch, the tasting menu was superb with five courses and an amuse bouche. A great selection of wines and a matched wine flight as well. Lovely service from a well trained team, with a personalised menu, no wonder this restaurant is so popular ! Highly recommended.

title: Farewell lunch
comment: This was a total revelation, we had a farewell lunch for a colleague and they even headed up the menu with a personal message. The set menu was fantastic and great value for money. The Maitre D was just brilliant and we had limited time so they were very attentive, everyone in our party commented that every course was superb.

title: FANTASTIQUE!!!
comment: Was taken here for my Birthday & I must say, the food, the wine & the service was fantastique!! Would highly recommend for a special occasion with a special person.

title: Great
comment: Amazing, the best food in the area. I highly recommend eating here as a real treat. Lovely bread and butter

title: Great Customer Service!
comment: It was my first visit and i must say that their customer service was soo good.  Food tastes really good and Their deserts are besttt in the town.

title: Excellent shisha lounge as usual
comment: Love visiting the shisha lounge at Tamara- great professional staff, always smartly dressed, lovely garden area and great shishas. food is always spot on as are the tunes!

title: Simply lovely
comment: We have known this lovely restaurant for years having first eaten here when it first opened so many years ago. It was very good then and it is even better now based on our latest visit.  The food is brilliant, the front of house team led by the vivacious Sarah is impeccable, and the ambience spot on. It is not cheap but not outrageous given the quality of everything.  This is one of my favourite restaurants and the fact it is local makes it even better. If I could I would eat here every week . The only downside is that you must book and it can be sometimes difficult to get a booking at short notice since it is unsurprisingly very popular. But plan ahead and try it out .  Unequivocally recommended

title: Re-visit was not disappointing
comment: Our first date night since having our child. The French Table did not let us down. Atmosphere and service as alway was great. I had the partridge to start and the venison wellington for main. Both fantastic and on request they happily swapped the sauce for the partridge.

title: Lunch
comment: It was all gorgeous! Lovely afternoon ambience with beautifully presented plates of finely prepared food. Our little group of three chose from the munch menu which had 4 choices per course. We had the artichoke veloute x2 and salmon to start, both dishes being delivered promptly after ordering but without being to quick to the table so that we didn’t have time to chat or order wine. These starters were superbly tasty and really well seasoned.  For our main course we tried the lamb and hake x2. Again these were beautifully prepared and delicious. The line nut pureé that accompanied the lamb was a particular favourite flavour of mine.  Desserts were equally as interesting and artistic in their construction as the previous courses and were just as good to eat. We chose the blood orange tart, the apple tart and the the chocolate fondant. Gorgeous! The staff were very warm, attentive and could not be faulted. This restaurant is a major recommendation from us all. Thanks

title: Excellent lunch
comment: We cannot attend my cousin’s son’s wedding so took him & his fiancé here for lunch. Excellent food, great service, reasonable price (for such a treat) & knowledgeable staff - a great experience & we will definitely return

title: Great cheese and wine tasting
comment: I've eaten at the French Table regularly for years but this is the first event I've been to. A great, fun evening hosted by Sarah started with a glass of fizz and 5 cheeses and matching wines. All were great. The Explorateur, ile-de-France and it's companion were excellent and I only can type that because we had the useful little card with details of the wine and cheese. Will look out for the next one!

title: Excellent as always
comment: I celebrated my birthday here with my wife, what a treat, we can't fault this lovely restaurant, the welcome, the service and the wonderfully creative food are faultless. We can't wait for our next visit. Thank you.

title: Fabulous Food & Wonderful service
comment: A fantastic meal in this family run restaurant in the 'Maple Village' area of Surbiton. Such a pleasure we are going again this week to celebrate my son's birthday. If you like good food, beautifully presented with a certain je ne sais quois, then you will be happy here!

title: Reliably Good
comment: I really enjoy this restaurant for its consistently great food and wine. The atmosphere is relaxed and friendly, the staff are knowledgeable and professional. I can’t fault it. Try the tasting menu

title: Amazing!
comment: Amazing place to eat. Fantastic service. The restaurant was very clean, the staff was very friendly and the food was delicious. Love to visit this place again. A Big thank you to Douglas who made our day unforgettable. I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for a good time!

title: Simply brilliant
comment: Firstly this was my 3rd visit here but not for around 2 years. It was as good if not better than I remember.  The set menu, £45 for a 3 course dinner, had some wonderful dishes to choose from. I started with stuffed plaice which was light, delicate but full of flavour. My wife’s quail was usually good.  For the mains I had a trio of pork which again was cooked to perfection. My wife had the stone bass with lentils which I have to say was even better than mine! Our friend had the lamb. Again just perfect.  We finished with a chocolate soufflé. Wow. I’m not into desserts but this was amazing.  One of our party is a vegetarian by religion, and also has a dairy intolerance. All her food was very well handled and was extremely tasty. It was all accompanied by a lovely selection of breads.   The wine we had was by the carafe, but was excellent. Well priced and superbly presented.   The service at TFT is second to none. Just perfect.   I thought for what we had that it was good value especially for dinner. It was packed all evening. I’ve been to many 1* Michelin restaurants which aren’t a patch on this place. Well done.

title: Excellent food
comment: We had a fantastic birthday evening at the French Table. The food was excellent as was the variety on the menu and the management tried very hard to cater to my dietary needs. We did however think that the wine list was overly expensive, the service a little too oppressive and attentive and we could have done with more than one piece of the delicious bread! We felt a little pressed and rushed on what should have been a calm, relaxed evening. Aside form this, a great night.

title: Champions league night
comment: Went for a meal with friends prior to kick off for Liverpool v Tottenham. The football was kicking off at 8pm so we were sat down around 6:30 at a decent sized table for 5 in full view of a large TV lol. The food was decent, we ordered some veggie starters and some veggie chow mein noodles which were actually quite tasty, the portions sizes could’ve been slightly larger though. The service was decent and friendly so couldn’t complain. We then finished our food and moved towards the DJ booth to meet other friends and watch the game, midway we ordered some deserts and got drinks, the waiter who brought the deserts didn’t know which cake was what so that confused everyone and we had to swap our plates around which was not ideal! Above all the evening was pleasant and enjoyable the food was decent and tasted nice and was enjoyable, could’ve been slightly spicier for our liking! The football was amazing as Liverpool won and I would return, the prices are slightly dear as you can get similar food for a better price but the interior decoration was enjoyable.

title: Awful Service
comment: What a place we choose , modern looking restaurant but awful and poorest service. Staff not bothered , food ok nothing exciting, we had to ask for cutlery twice after soup was served. Waiter served soup but no spoon, called waiter req spoon he sends another waiter who came with Tea spoon. Told him need soup spoon came back with long ice cream spoon for falooda. Thus 10-12 minutes gone. Not proper cutlery and crockery for starters. They were not bothered , at one stage decided to leave but had children with us so had to stay for food. In between requester Water 10 minutes no one came. had to walk to Bar counter to request water , again no one came , called Manager he was not interested. Finally finished dinner just for sake of eating and requested bill. We were over charged of few items. Again spoke to manager , no apology  Toilets were clean but doors broken , DIY repair job done , above all NO LOCKING SYSTEM  I would NOT RECOMMEND this place to any one

title: Lunch at TFT
comment: As usual the food was superb, inventive and beautifully presented. Had to wait a little bit but the end result was worth it. It has never let me down. The hose wine was acceptable.

title: The Finest in SW London
comment: My wife and I are privileged to have dined at The French Table many times over the years. Each time the food is consistently excellent using seasonal produce to create modern dishes with contemporary flair and attention. The staff are impeccable as always and the ambience is suitably calm with an air of expectation. As a chef of 30 years it's always a delight to dine at The French Table with family and friends and enjoy beautiful food cooked to perfection.

title: Excellent!
comment: We had a date night there last week for our anniversary. The food was outstanding and the staff attentive and competent. They even wrote happy anniversary on our dessert plate. Thank you to the staff and chefs for a wonderful meal.

title: Surbiton gem
comment: We had a tasting menu + wine paring and our lunch couldn’t be better! Tasing menu was delicious and wines were very good! I definitely recommend this restaurant for lunch or dinner!

title: Delicious Birthday Dinner
comment: A smallish intimate restaurant that serves amazingly tasty French inspired food.  Service is impeccable. A great choice of wines is also on offer. I advise booking, its very popular!

title: Consistently excellent!
comment: I’ve been to the French Table several times but due to it’s popularity its almost impossible to get a table at short notice. However, a couple of weeks before Christmas I managed to strike lucky! As before the service and food were outstanding and my partner who hadn’t eaten there before absolutely adored it! Cant wait to visit again!

title: Superb food & service
comment: We went on a Saturday evening to celebrate our wedding anniversary, they had decorated the table with heart confetti and even put our names and a happy anniversary messages on our menus & on our dessert plates. Service was excellent, attentive and friendly, I’m a ceoliac and the gluten free bread was amazing and they were very knowledgeable about gluten free and pretty much every dish could be adapted to make it so. The food was superb, the bavette for main was heavenly. We sat upstairs which I actually preferred (have had lunch downstairs before) it has a more intimate atmosphere and the tables are more spread out. Throughly enjoyable experience, excellent in every way & will most certainly be back.

title: Great hang out spot
comment: Azouz was great!!!! Always made sure our hookah (shisha) was great ❤️❤️❤️❤️ And food was amazing! Come hungry!

title: Special
comment: My partner and I went to The French Table for Valentines Day dinner. It was a fixed-price (£65 per person) set menu offering a wide choice of dishes. The food was truly excellent and beautifully presented. The service was warm, friendly and efficient without being intrusive. The only slight negative was that the romantic atmosphere of the night was at times challenged by loud shouting coming from the kitchen.

title: Restaurant visit - Hygiene issue
comment: Came here for dinner, found that the quality of food is very average and over priced.... The restaurant manager is not helpful and very rude. I would avoid this place for food.

title: Excellent food experience and amazing friendly staff
comment: Excellent eating experience.. from walking in the door and being greeted by staff (NIKITA) seated and drink order taken, was maybe few minutes. Meal was served hot and excellent Indian taste felt like home. Server (Nikita) was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely come bck and highly recommend this restaurant

title: A Very Happy Birthday
comment: We celebrated my birthday with a lunch, this place never fails to be anything but superb. We felt so well looked after, the food remains dimly great. A wonderful lunchtime experience.

title: Delivers each time...
comment: a complete experience of the highest standards. Superbe food and unpretentious service. We will be back

title: Birthday lunch
comment: My husband had his 60th Birthday lunch at the french tlable. Absolutely fantastic. Table was decorated with little 60th decorations and had special menus printed as well. Food amazing and service was superb. Can’t wait to go back.

title: Second time they’ve given cold food then microwaved it
comment: Food has gone so down hill. You lost a very valuable customers microwaved my chips. Got the food after again same thing cold. Food and service terrible.

title: Special Birthday meal
comment: It was our first visit to the French Table as a treat from friends for our joint birthday. We opted for the taster menu which gave us the opportunity to try a range of dishes which we otherwise might not have chosen. Each course was exquisitely presented and beautifully cooked with great attention paid to every ingredient. Despite the restaurant being busy, the service throughout was first rate. I would recommend the French Table to anyone wanting a special evening.

title: Amazing service by Mustafa
comment: Amazing service by Mustafa, hospitable and welcoming. Top quality shisha and food! Definitely recommend

title: Poor service
comment: We booked this lounge for leaving do of colleague. They are unable to Cope , take forever to bring food . We booked and paid deposit for 13 people and were given a table for 9 and had to squeeze in. Absolutely terrible service . Drinks took forever to come . Not worth the money.

title: Excellent customer service
comment: Came Tamara lounge with a group of mates and a guy named Mustafa took care of us, normally I don't write reviews but I was so blown away by the customer service specially Mustafa's I had to give him credit. Definitely recommend this place for the Shisha, food and. The service.

title: very very good
comment: we went for my bday this week the service was excellent, the food was delicious - I would highly recommend this restaurant.. its on par with the likes of chez Bruce

title: Greasy greasy greasy...
comment: Have have eaten here a few times and recommended it to my friends. Not living in west London anymore I did a 90mile round trip last night, what a wasted journey. The food was awful so greasy my stomach couldn’t take it and got sick in there! The vegetarian platter was nothing but fried tasteless stodge. No point even discussing it with the rude staff. When I’ve been before the old manager from Madhus was there, never any problems with food or service, not sure if it was his influence or what but last night was terrible. The bill was not far off £100, feel robbed. Wouldn’t go again and certainly won’t be recommending unfortunately.

title: Nice meal
comment: We went for lunch with Christmas menu . Food was nice , service and staff was good and helpful. Nice wine too .

title: Fabulous - the food and the staff!
comment: We visited here for a birthday meal and it could not have been better. We arrived a little early but were welcomed with a smile and seated at our table, our coats having been hung up for us. We were shown the menu, which was lovely, and the Tasting Menu, plus the evening ‘specials’. We decided on the Tasting Menu with paired wines at £85 per head and it was a great choice - see photo. The customer service was second to none, and in addition to what was on the menu we had a choice of four beautiful home made breads fresh out of the oven, an appetiser and a gorgeous elderflower sorbet after the fish course, to cleanse our palates. The 5 different wines which we had were lovely and we finished with coffee. Then my husband was presented with an ice cream with a candle in it and Happy Birthday piped in chocolate on the plate - see photo. A lovely touch! Such a nice evening. Thank you, French Table!

title: Lovely restuarant
comment: I took my wife here for her birthday. I had told them on booking the reason for our visit and when we arrived the table was set for her birthday with menus with her name printed on them. The food was exceptional. Its not cheapest of restaurants but well worth a visit

title: Incredible and Consistent
comment: This was my fourth visit here and my fiancé and I came for the Sunday lunch as a Christmas treat. The service is always fantastic and the food is just delicious. Excellent value for £35.00 for three courses and the food was exquisite. Always a great choice of starters, mains and puddings. Great to have such a fantastic restaurant right on our doorstop. My other half said the ginger bread & butter pudding was the best desert he’d ever had! Don’t hesitate in booking here, you won’t be disappointed.

title: Good shisha and best food
comment: I had a very good experience at Tamara lounge with my mates it was big time and I’d like to thank the staff, Sami and his mates.

title: Nothing special
comment: Ordered food to take away as the place is normally quite busy especially in the evenings, feels like more of a bar than a restaurant. The food was pretty good but I think it's very over priced. I have had far better curries and paid a lot less for them - staff and service are what lets it down. No welcome or smile or even thanks for the business just take your money and give you your food without even a hello? Wouldn't bother going back as I would prefer to give my money to someone who appreciates it. 2 stars given just because the food wasn't bad, just not great.

title: Nice atmosphere
comment: Nice atmosphere and was very appreciative of the heating. Staff were lovely and food was good. Nice for a chilled night out

title: Arrogant & Awful Service
comment: This place would have been great for its shisha if the service had been nice. We we were welcomed with a forceful manner to show ID and then told to follow. Little did we know we ended up at a table crammed next to other people, when it was clear to see many other spaces were available. It was a Monday night, not exactly the busiest night.  Soon as we sat down we were asked to order without even looking at the menu, it was all just very strange and aggressive.  We ordered our Shisha which arrived in good time, but we also asked for drinks that we had asked for 3 times, it took 20 minutes after the shisha arrived to receive our drinks which in the end we discovered was added to our bill 4 times! We had that sorted fortunately and taken off the bill, but it showed their lack of interest.  Last but not least, they have these heaters above all seating areas. If you have never been in a sauna, Tamara Lounge will give you a great experience of how a sauna feels. It as if I was directly under the sun during a cold -1 winter night (now you understand why I’m complaining about the delayed drinks) - in the end we left because it was just too hot, and we didn’t bother asking them to fix the heating, they were just ignorant and unapproachable.  Overall this isn’t the best place to go enjoy a social night with Shisha in London. There are many other places worthy of spending your money at for a balance of good Shisha and food, and most of all a comfortable and welcoming service.

title: Delicious food, fantastic vibe
comment: Travelled all the way from the Essex/suffolk coast to meet friends and was blown away by how amazing this place is. Living out in the 'sticks' we don't have anything remotely close to this! The food was incredible, literally melted in your mouth and the Shisha just made the experience even more chilled!  They have totally nailed it here and it really was a great night. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars was because the food was quiet slow. We arrived at 6.30 and left at 10pm.....thank you Tamara lounge for giving us 'country folk' a great night.

title: Discrimination against none smokers
comment: Spent £200 on food and drinks, went next door for drinks and Shisha as 2 out of 4 of us wanted Shisha. However they discriminating against people who do not want Shisha but are happy to pay for cocktails and socialise with friends. You have to have Shisha, that is discriminatory and wrong. Absolute discgrace, staff then have a attitude about it and the manager had an attitude. Spoilt a good night.

title: Poor service and attitude
comment: Served a warm beer and when asked to be replace, didn’t come back for 15mins as they put the same beer in ice to chill Asked for water and brought 1 glass with a jug of water between 4 people Purchased a bottle of Gin and the asked for Lime and Cucumber - both dry and discoloured  Ordered a salad with starters and it was the worst salad every, discoloured lettuce and a few chopped onions Nan was very nice, Sheek kabbab very nice, Mogo Chips also really nice Chilli and garlic fish very average, prawns over cooked Went to Shisha lounge, had to wait 20mins while they seated friends of staff first rather than seating people in order of que Attitude of staff was poor They don’t care because they are busy, hence poor attitude and poor service

title: Fabulous lunch
comment: We are regulars at this our favourite restaurant, we cannot fault the welcome, the service and the amazing food. Everything about it is amazing. Thank you for a great culinary experience.

title: Excellent restaurant
comment: Our first visit to The French Table and it certainly won't be the last. The food was wonderful. Staff were polite and helpful. Very busy, lunchtime.

title: What a wonderful dinner
comment: We celebrated our wedding anniversary by eating here. We haven't been since many years ago when it was called something different but was just as good. The service was efficient & friendly - they had asked if it was for something special when we booked, so we had little silver confetti hearts on the table and a personally addressed menu. But better still was the lovely meal we ate. I had the special lobster salad, husband had the foie gras then we both had the venison wellington - all delicious and beautifully presented. For dessert, which we don't usually manage, I had the fabulous cherry souffle - amazing - I've never had anything as good as that before. Husband went off menu asking for vanilla ice cream - no problem. The wines were good. We love Cahors wine and it was good to see it on their list. What a lovely evening. Thank you!  Despite the fairly high prices here the place was understandably packed. Worth every penny. We'll be back.

title: Fantastic meal
comment: Completely delicious food and wine. Ate from the a la carte menu; fois gras, venison wellington and cherry soufflé for pudding. The best meal we have had in ages and great service as well. Thank you.

title: Amazing shots
comment: Came on Thursday night went on the bar ask for shots and Karim made amazing shot never had before and from the menu had zombi

title: Tasty Indian Food
comment: The food was very tasty, the service quick and efficient and atmosphere busy. Parking can be bit of an issue but otherwise an wonderful dining experience.

title: Great service
comment: Great service provided by Mustafa , great shisha and atomosphere, provided friendly service. Had a great chat with mustafa would definitely come here again to see him

title: Disrespectful staff
comment: staff is absolutely disgraceful, near to closing time they forced us to exit, they took our shisha pipes from us and they were adamant for us to get up and leave. Never have I ever witnessed such bad customer service from a shisha lounge. Furthermore, the managers behaviour towards us was very rude and rash. I won’t be visiting again and I would advise to not go ever

title: Sam
comment: Another good experience at Tamara Lounge. Brilliant service from Sam! Food was amazing too. This is definitely my regular spot now.

title: D Merrick
comment: This is a massive ZERO !!!Disgusting service in fact none given! Food was cold and orders were wrong. Informed the staff of our problems early in in the evening but they didn’t care. Asked to see the manager about the disgusting service who didn’t apologise once! RUDE INDIVIDUALS and I would never return. Over priced and up to 30 mins wait if you want a drink. They had the the nerve to add service charge on! Which obviously wasn’t paid and we only paid what we thought we should for such a disgraceful meal. Toilets were so dirty.

title: New years meal
comment: So we booked a table for 6.30pm and arrived on time we were super excited and happy as it was new years eve.  We ordered our starters, mains and drinks as usual. However they brought all the food all at once. We asked why the mains came at the same time as the starters and they said your table is booked for a 2 hour slot and it's new years. (The restaurant was more than half empty bear in mind) By the time we ate the starters, mains went cold, naan breads were frozen cold and gone hard and crispy. We requested a new batch of 3 naans but they charged us twice for the naans 6 in total which was ridiculous and cheeky.  We requested them to re-heat our mains and however they seemed annoyed however we still had plenty of time reserved for our table to eat and we were polite and grateful they reheated it.  My partner was about to eat his biryani and he found a knot of black hair with strands hanging deep inside the dish when he put the fork in it. It was vile and disgusting. Is there no infection control or hygiene? Do your chefs not cover their heads?  There was No apologies and the waiter looked at my partners head examining if he had put it in his own food or not which was an insult. My partner decided not to order another one and just ate what we had left as he was put off completely  Food taste was super mild and mediocre. Mixed grill was cooked well just tasted bit bland.  We requested some chutney as they didn't bother to give us them initially with two sharing platters between 4 of us and they gave us tiny little chutney to share.  Overall, an underwhelming experience, but good company.

title: Fantastic food and great service
comment: Love this place. Great French food, relaxed atmosphere and good value. The service is always very good and the little touches like remembering your last visit, etc are simple but effective.

title: Fabulous !
comment: We visited The French Table for the first time in October for a birthday and we thought it was fabulous ! We had the best food we have eaten in a long time. The service was top notch, food was incredible and ambience was great. Utterly recommend !

title: Shisha is very good
comment: This place is really good to chill out! The shush is very good and the staff are very friendly. Specially sami, he is always smiling and is very pleasant. They treat their staff here like family.

title: Good food but very poor customer service
comment: As the title says - the food was good (but expensive) however the customer service was very poor. Our server, Antonio, never cracked a smile and failed to get us the bill despite politely asking for it several times. Keep in mind, the restaurant was empty. He looked incredibly displeased to be serving us. Just about everyone in the restaurant looked like they were going to kill you. I'm not sure if that was because they were hoping we'd finish soon as the restaurant was privately booked from 7pm onwards. But then why let us in? I can assure you were nothing but polite and respectful. Once we'd eaten we waited at the very least 20 minutes to receive the bill and it wasn't even Antonio who'd given it to us. It was Eric who was polite, sweet and apologetic about the treatment we'd received. I have only given the service and overall rating 2 stars because of Eric. Thank you Eric! :)
